You must be strong enough to stand such a strong smell!<page>This taste is too ripe! It burned out! The smell of happiness and suffering! If you're enjoying an intense taste, you might also see these visions. do you see the vision?<page>Toast to the stew! For your bugs, yes. We share our vision. yes! yes! We are going through!

original_en_text: Ahhh! Ahhh-ohhhh! The smell again! Stronger, stronger now! But still young yet! Listen to your sisters, little one, and grow! Oh, grow!
original_zh_text: 啊啊！啊——噢！气息再现！浓烈！但仍稚嫩！聆听你的姐妹之声，小家伙，生长吧！啊，生长！
translated_text: あっ! あっ!あっ! あっ!また臭い!より強く、より強く!しかし、まだ若い!姉妹の話を聞いて、小さな男、成長しなさい!『 Grow!
secondary_translated_text: ah! ah! ah! ah! Smells again! Stronger, stronger! But still young! Listen to the sisters, little man, grow up! "Grow!

original_en_text: Oh... mmm. Do they hurt you also, the visions? The stink? Nasty, horrible fruits. The pain!<page>Enough berries. We need no more. For you though, my one and only friend. My beloved. A reward!<page>Your amulet. Let me... transfuse. Yes. Your amulet’s tears will flow stronger still!
original_zh_text: 噢……嗯。幻象可有伤你？腐臭味？是秽果，可憎。痛楚！<page>莓果已足够，无需更多。但为你，我唯一挚友。馈赠！<page>你的护符。让我……灌注。嗯，护符的眼泪将更加汹涌！
translated_text: ああ...。え~~。このビジョンも傷つけましたか？嫌な臭い？不快で恐ろしい果実。痛いですね!<page>ベリーは十分です。これ以上は必要ないしかし、あなたのために、私の唯一の友人。親愛なるご褒美!<page>君のお守りだLet me..。輸血はい、あなたのお守りはもっと涙を流すでしょう!
secondary_translated_text: ah... ah ~! did you hurt this vision too? unpleasant smell? Unpleasant and terrifying fruit. It hurts!<page>Berry is enough. No more is needed but for you, my only friend. Dear Reward!<page>I'm your protector. Let me... Blood transfusion yes, your protector will shed more tears!

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! So precious! And perhaps now, we have enough. Enough, enough! For our work often begins, but never ends!
original_zh_text: 嗯，珍果！如此珍稀！或许……已足够。足够，够了！大业常启，但无终时！
translated_text: そして、貴重な果実!とても貴重です!もう十分かもしれませんもういい!もういい!私たちの仕事はしばしば始まりますが、決して終わりません!
secondary_translated_text: And the precious fruit! They are so precious! Maybe that's enough, that's enough! that's enough! Our work often begins, but it is never finished!

original_en_text: Ah, hello again! What a blessing to see a familiar face on this treacherous climb.<hpage>Greetings, sir. I see you have begun your pilgrimage, or else set out for your own sake. Either way, I am glad to see you here unharmed.<page>Not quite unharmed... I’ve suffered my share of scrapes and burns. That’s just the nature of the journey, I suppose.<page>But I’ve seen so much! Great metal structures and vast scorched fields! The grandeur of it all is humbling indeed, even for one like me who was so humble to begin with.<page>I’ll rest here just a little longer before resuming my climb.
original_zh_text: 啊，又见面了！能在这险途中看到熟面孔，感谢圣堡庇佑。<hpage>幸会，先生。见你安然无恙，无论为了朝圣，抑或是为了自己，我都感到欣慰。<page>倒也不是安然无恙。多少有些小伤，攀登之路上难免擦碰。<page>但这一路真是大开眼界！巨型造物、焦黑旷野，宏伟又令人敬畏！<page>我打算休息片刻就继续攀登。
translated_text: ああ、また会った!この危険な登山で見覚えのある顔を見ることは本当に幸運でした。<hpage>こんにちは、ムッシュー、あなたが巡礼に出発したか、自分で出発したのを見ました。いずれにせよ、無事でよかったです。<page>完全に無傷ではない。あざや火傷もしました。これが旅の本質だと思います。<page>でもこんなにたくさん見ました!巨大な金属構造と広大な焦土!最初から謙虚だった私のような人間にとっても、このすべての壮大さは本当に謙虚です。<page>ここで少し休んで、登り続けます。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, we met again! " I was really lucky to see some familiar faces on this dangerous climb.<hpage>Hello, monsieur, I saw you set out on a pilgrimage, or you set out yourself. Either way, I'm glad you were safe.<page>It is not completely uninjured. I also got bruises and burns. I think this is the essence of the journey.<page>But I've seen so many! Huge metal structures and vast clay! Even for a human being like me who was humble from the beginning, all this grandeur is truly humble.<page>I'll rest a bit here and continue climbing.

original_en_text: Mmm! Mmm! This is them, the precious, promised fruits!<page>Drop them in, there they go, and now at last we can begin!
original_zh_text: 嗯嗯！嗯嗯！就是它们，许诺的珍果！<page>投入其中，终于……可以开始！
translated_text: え~ん!え~ん!これが彼らの約束の成就です。<page>それらを入れて、そして今、私たちはついに始められます!
secondary_translated_text: yeah! yeah! This is the fulfillment of their promise.<page>Put them in, and now, we can finally get started!

original_en_text: Just a piece of something greater, but finely crafted. You should take it with you, traveller, for luck.
original_zh_text: 虽然只剩残片，却很精巧。带上吧旅者，图个吉利。
translated_text: ただの素晴らしいものですがよく作られています旅行者は幸運を得るためにそれを持って行くべきです。
secondary_translated_text: It's just a wonderful thing but it's well made. Travelers should take it with them to get lucky.

original_en_text: Farewell, little pilgrim. May your shell harden the path for others to tread.
original_zh_text: 安息吧，小朝圣者。愿你的甲壳为后来者铺路。
translated_text: さよなら、小さな巡礼者。あなたの体が他人のための道を開く。
secondary_translated_text: Farewell, little pilgrim. Your body paves the way for others.

original_en_text: Times like this, all we can do is put our heads down and try to rebuild.
original_zh_text: 这种时候，除了埋头重建还能干啥？
translated_text: このような時にできることは、頭を下げて再建することだけです。
secondary_translated_text: All we can do in times like this is to bow our heads and rebuild.

original_en_text: <page>Mmmm! Is it time? Our lands shake their sorrow! For the new beat, yes? Demanding! For a new rhythm...<hpage>These quakes you feel, they are not your land’s sadness, they are its collapse, one bound to happen if their source cannot be quelled.<page>What? No, no no... the beat... It is the beat our land wishes! Calls for it! Needs one new!
original_zh_text: <page>嗯嗯！！时候到了？？大地震颤，哀鸣！是为新的搏动？……如此迫切！为新的韵律……<hpage>你感知的震颤并非大地哀鸣，而是其崩解前兆。若源头不稳，终将倾覆。<page>什么？不，不不……那搏动……是大地所求！大地呼唤！亟需换新！
translated_text: <page>え~ん!時間ですか？私たちの国は悲しみを揺さぶる!新しいリズムですよね。非常にリクエスト!新しいリズムのために。<hpage>あなたが感じる地震は、あなたの土地の悲しみではなく、その崩壊であり、その根源が沈静化しなければ、必ず起こるでしょう。<page>何だ？いいえ、いいえ、いいえ。失敗です。これは私たちの国の希望の声です!それを呼び出す!新しい必要がある!
secondary_translated_text: <page>yeah! is it time? Our country shakes with grief! A new rhythm, isn't it? Very Requested! For a new rhythm.<hpage>The earthquake you feel is not the sorrow of your land, but its collapse, and if its roots do not subside, it is bound to happen.<page>what's that? No, no, no, no. It is a failure. This is a voice of hope for our country! Call it out! I need a new one!

original_en_text: Head quick for that vein of bells, and find my uncle hidden there. If anyone’s able to point you to a cure for that thing twisting within your shell, it’ll be him.
original_zh_text: 速速前往钟脉，寻我叔父踪迹。要说有谁能解你甲壳内的扭曲之物，非他莫属。
translated_text: 私たちは鐘の鼓動に素早く近づき、叔父が隠れていました。身体の歪みの治療法を示すことができる人がいるとすれば、それは彼です。
secondary_translated_text: We quickly approached the beating of the bell, and my uncle was hiding. If there is one person who can show you a cure for the distortion of the body, it is him.

original_en_text: Mmm! Mmm. Who are you, little you? Not a wish granter. For you haven’t enough fruits. Three we need, three I need! Find them, find them!
original_zh_text: 嗯嗯！嗯。你是谁，小小你？不是授愿者。苔莓不够。要三颗，我要三颗！去找，快去找！
translated_text: え~ん!え~~。あなたは誰ですか、小さなあなた？願望の成就ではない。果物が足りないからです。3つ必要です! 3つ必要です!見つけて、見つけて!
secondary_translated_text: yeah! ah ~! Who are you, little you? It is not the fulfillment of a desire. Because there is not enough fruit. We need three! I need three! Find it, find it!

original_en_text: Ah! Here she is, safe after all! I was worried your battle with that enormous beast had left you badly wounded.<page>Shames me to have left you in danger there, missy, but I’m no warrior, and my tools ain’t no match for a creature like that.<hpage>It is well that you kept yourself safe. This settlement needs a fixer now, not a warrior.<page>Heh, maybe that’s true. Times like these all we can do is put our heads down and try to rebuild.
original_zh_text: 啊！你还活着！我还担心你和那头巨兽搏斗会受重伤。<page>让你独自涉险真是惭愧，但我不是战士，工具也对付不了那种怪物。<hpage>你保全自身是对的。这里需要的是维修师，不是战士。<page>嘿，或许吧。这种时候，埋头干活才是正理。
translated_text: あっ! あっ!彼女はここにいて、安全です!あなたは獣との戦いで重傷を負った。<page>“お嬢さん、あなたを危険にさらすのは恥ずかしいですが、私は兵士ではありませんし、私の道具はこの生き物に対抗しません。<hpage>自分の安全を確保して、それは素晴らしいことです。この解決策には戦士ではなく仲介者が必要です<page>ねえ、多分それは本当です。このような時にできることは、頭を下げて再建することだけです。
secondary_translated_text: ah! ah! She's here, she's safe! You were badly wounded in the battle with the beast.<page>"Miss, I'm ashamed to put you in danger, but I'm not a soldier, and my tools will not oppose this creature."<hpage>Ensuring your own safety, that's great. And this solution needs a mediator, not a warrior.<page>Hey, maybe that's true. All we can do in times like this is to bow our heads and rebuild.

original_en_text: Rest here with us, long as you like. Mightn’t be much time left, but at least we few won’t have to face that fate alone.
original_zh_text: 您想歇多久都行。虽然时日无多，但至少不必孤零零面对。
translated_text: ここで休みたい場合。時間は短いかもしれませんが、少なくとも私たちの何人かは一人でこの運命に直面する必要はありません。
secondary_translated_text: If you want to relax here. The time may be short, but at least some of us don't have to face this fate alone.

original_en_text: Ah! Glad I caught you for a moment, miss. You’ve done a fair service to this camp, given much more’n most.<page>I’d been thinkin’ on all your efforts, and set to making a little something to repay ‘em.<page>S’only a token, really! But I’ve put all me talent into it, much as I’ve got! Something to keep you company on the lonely roads above.<page>Hold onto it on your travels, and remember that you’re always welcome down here with us.
original_zh_text: 啊！可算遇着你了，小姐。您为这营地做的贡献比谁都多。<page>我琢磨着您的好意，做了个小玩意当回礼。<page>就是个信物！但我把看家本事都使上了！让它在孤独的旅途上陪您解个闷。<page>带着它上路吧，记得这里永远欢迎您。
translated_text: あっ! あっ!しばらくお会いできてよかったです、お嬢さん。あなた方はほとんどの人よりもこのキャンプに公平に仕えています。<page>私はあなたの努力のすべてを考え、見返りに何かをする準備ができています。<page>それはただのシンボルです、本当に!私は自分の才能をすべて注ぎ込み、できることをしました!孤独な道には何かがあります。<page>あなたの旅行中、あなたはいつでも歓迎されます。
secondary_translated_text: ah! ah! It was good to see you for a while, miss. You are serving this camp fairly than most of us.<page>I am ready to think of all your efforts and do something in return.<page>It's just a symbol, really! I poured all my talent and did what I could! There is something in the lonely path.<page>During your trip, you are always welcome.

original_en_text: <hpage>This camp seems in poor condition, good bug. With the lands around turning deadly, I’d worry for its safety.<page>Aye. We surely aren’t seeing its finest moment, but this place has been serving us passing bugs for as long as any can remember.<page>It’s faith, you see! All those pilgrims, now and past. Our devotion holds it together. The camp’ll remain, and provide, no matter the troubles.<page>
original_zh_text: <hpage>这处营地破败不堪，周遭又暗藏危险，我担忧其安危。<page>唉，确实不是鼎盛时候。但这里长久以来侍奉过往虫众，已不知过了多少年月。<page>是信仰维系着这片营地，明白吗？是古今朝圣者的虔心庇佑着这里。任外面灾厄横行，营地永存。
translated_text: <hpage>キャンプ場は悪く、バグは良いようです。周囲の土地が致命的になるにつれて、私はその安全が心配です。<page>確かに、私たちはまだその最高の瞬間を見ていませんが、誰かが覚えている限り、この場所は私たちに間違いを渡すサービスを提供しています。<page>それが信仰です。これらの巡礼者は、現在も過去も。私たちの献身は彼らを結びつける。どんなトラブルがあっても、キャンプはあなたを助けます。<page>
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>The campground is bad and the bugs seem good. As the surrounding land becomes lethal, I worry for its safety.<page>Sure, we haven't seen that best moment yet, but for as long as anyone remembers, this place offers us the service of passing on mistakes.<page>That is faith. These pilgrims, now and in the past. Our dedication brings them together. No matter what troubles you have, the camp will help you.<page>

original_en_text: <hpage>What ritual calls you all together, pilgrim?<page>Our brother, this poor wretch in my arms, has walked his last aching step. We gather here to sing him farewell, and to mourn our great loss.
original_zh_text: <hpage>诸位聚集在此举行什么仪式？<page>这位兄弟，我怀中的可怜虫，已走完最后一步。我们在此唱别，哀悼逝者。
translated_text: <hpage>巡礼者の皆さん、どんな儀式をしていますか？<page>私たちの兄弟、私の腕の中のかわいそうな男は、痛みの最後の一歩を踏み出しました。私たちはここに集まり、彼に別れを告げ、大きな損失を悼みました。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Dear pilgrims, what kind of ritual do you perform?<page>Our brother, the poor man in my arms, took his last step in pain. We have gathered here to bid him farewell and mourn his great loss.

original_en_text: If the veiled bugs have an interest in you, enough to brave the wastes beyond our borders, then you must be rather special, yes?<hpage>In my own lands, some may once have seen me so. In this place, with my strength sapped, I am just another traveller.<page>Ohho! A traveller, but still something more. I can see it now. Of course! That focus!<page>Did those veiled bugs realise who they snared? Perhaps it is they who should be worried, eh?
original_zh_text: 既然覆面者对你有兴趣，甚至不惜穿越边境荒原掳走你，你肯定不是什么等闲之辈吧？<hpage>在故土，或许曾有虫如此看待我。但在此地，力衰之躯只不过是一介旅者。<page>嚯嚯！旅者？不止如此。我可看得很清楚，这专注的眼神！<page>那些覆面虫知道自己网住了谁吗？该提心吊胆的怕是他们，对吧？
translated_text: もしベールバグがあなたに興味を持っていて国境を越える勇気があるならあなたは特別な存在に違いない<hpage>私の力が衰え、ただの旅人に過ぎない自分の国で、誰かが私を見たかもしれません。<page>ああ、叫んだ!旅行者、それ以上。今は見ているもちろんです!このフォーカス!<page>ベールをかぶった虫は誰を罠にかけたのか？心配するべきでしょうか？
secondary_translated_text: If the veil bugs are interested in you and have the courage to cross the border, you must be special.<hpage>Someone might have seen me in my own country, where my powers have waned, and I am but a traveler.<page>Oh, I screamed! Travelers, and more. Of course I'm watching it now! this focus!<page>who did the veiled bugs trap? should we be worried about it?

original_en_text: My wish. Oh my wish! I need fruits of the world, three little darlings. I need them! Does the kingdom not send you, little you, to grant my desire?
original_zh_text: 我的祈愿。啊我的祈愿！我要这世间的三枚果实，小宝贝果实。我需要！王国没派你，小小你，来满足我的渴求？
translated_text: 私の願い。ああ、私の願い!私は世界の果実、3人の赤ちゃんが必要です。彼らが必要だ!王国は私の願いを叶えるためにあなたを遣わしたのですか？
secondary_translated_text: My wishes. Oh, my wish! I need the fruit of the world, three babies. We need them! Did the kingdom send you to fulfill my wishes?

original_en_text: Ahh, awake at last! You should mind your strength, traveller. There’s no use wasting energy on an old nobody like me.<hpage>I see that now, madam. My welcome to your land has not been kind. I had reason to be wary.
original_zh_text: 啊哈！可算醒了！你该省省力气，旅者。在我这老骨头身上浪费气力可不值当。<hpage>现在我看清了，女士。但此地的待客之道可不友善。我保持警惕自有道理。
translated_text: ついに目覚めた!旅行者は自分の力に注意してください。私のような無名の人間にエネルギーを浪費するのは無駄です。<hpage>わかりました奥様。私はあなたの土地に来ました。警戒する理由があります。
secondary_translated_text: Wake up at last! Travelers should pay attention to their own strength. It's useless to waste energy on an unnamed person like me.<hpage>I understand, ma 'am. I have come to your land. We have reason to be wary.

original_en_text: Up with you! Up! I won’t have you dying on my floor!
original_zh_text: 给我起来！快起来！我可不想看你死在我的地板上！
translated_text: あなたと一緒!立ち上がれ!私はあなたを私の床で死なせません!
secondary_translated_text: With you! stand up! I will not let you die on my floor! "

original_en_text: <hpage>I am no pilgrim. I am Hornet, and I arrive in your land by no choice of my own.<hpage>I was brought to your kingdom by force, captured by strange bugs clad in veils.<page>Oho! How curious! The bugs of the Citadel, at the summit of our land. They veil themselves in service to their faith, or perhaps as slaves to something greater...<hpage>Then I shall seek their Citadel. If the veiled bugs would go to such lengths to bring me here, I intend to find out why.<page>Oho! Ferocious! Intimidating! Yours is no pilgrim’s spirit! You’ve the bearing of a hunter.<page>Welcome then, fierce traveller, to Pharloom! Our holy yet haunted land.<page>Before you depart, permit an old bug a brief warning. Best keep that weapon drawn.<page>Our kingdom is gripped by a curse. Its paths grow wild and dangerous, and though some still attempt the climb to the Citadel at its crest, none return to speak of what they see.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我名为大黄蜂。我并非朝圣者，也不是自愿来到这里。<hpage>是一群覆面怪虫将我绑来这里的。<page>嚯！稀奇！那是圣堡的虫子，盘踞在我们土地上头。他们覆面侍奉信仰，或者说……是更可怖之物的奴仆……<hpage>那我会找到圣堡。既然覆面者费心绑我来到这里，我一定会查清缘由。<page>嚯！够凶！这可不是朝圣者的脾性！你分明带着猎手的气魄。<page>那么欢迎你，剽悍的旅者，来到纺络！这个神圣却遭诅咒的国度。<page>启程前容老虫多句嘴，最好时刻握紧你的兵刃。<page>我们的王国正被诅咒啃噬。道路变得混乱凶险，山顶那座圣堡——尽管仍有勇者试图攀登，却无虫归来讲述见闻。
translated_text: <hpage>私は巡礼者ではない私はスズメバチであり、あなたの国に来るしかありません。<hpage>私はあなたの王国に強制的に連れて行かれ、ベールをかぶった奇妙な昆虫に捕らえられました。<page>おお!なんて好奇心旺盛!城の昆虫は私たちの土地の頂点にいます。彼らは信仰に奉仕するか、おそらくより大きな何かの奴隷です。<hpage>私は彼らの城を探した。これらの隠された間違いが私をここに導いたなら、私はその理由を見つけるつもりです。<page>おお!激しかった!脅威だ!あなたの霊は巡礼者の霊ではない。ハンターのようなものです。<page>だから、猛烈な旅行者、ファロへようこそ!神聖だが幽霊の国。<page>出発する前に、古いエラーについて簡単に警告してください。銃を抜いた方がいい。<page>私たちの王国は呪いに包まれた。その道は荒々しく危険になり、何人かはまだ城の頂上に登ろうとしたが、誰も見たことを話すために戻ってこなかった。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I'm not a pilgrim I'm a wasp, and I can only come to your country.<hpage>I was forcibly taken to your kingdom, and captured by a strange insect in a veil.<page>Oh, my God. How curious! The castle insects are on top of our land. They serve the faith, or perhaps they are slaves to something greater.<hpage>I searched for their castle. If these hidden mistakes have led me here, I'm going to find out why.<page>Oh, my God. It was intense! Threat! Your spirit is not the spirit of a pilgrim. It's like a hunter.<page>So, fierce traveler, welcome to Faro! A sacred but ghostly land.<page>Before you leave, please briefly warn about the old errors. You'd better pull your gun out.<page>Our kingdom has been enveloped in a curse. The path became rough and dangerous, and some still tried to climb to the top of the castle, but no one came back to tell what they had seen.

original_en_text: So you’re another pilgrim then? Scuttled out of the darkness to climb the great path and bow at its gilded peak?
original_zh_text: 这么说你也是个朝圣者？从黑暗里钻出来就为攀那条路，去镀金尖顶上叩拜？
translated_text: あなたは巡礼者なの？暗闇の中を掘り、道を登り、金色の山々にお辞儀をする？
secondary_translated_text: you're a pilgrim? Dig in the darkness, climb the road, and bow to the golden mountains?

original_en_text: Well, look at that! You’ve gone and donated all those shell shards, just like I wished for! I can scarcely believe it!<page>Those shards are valuable, alright. Brilliant for crafting and fixing, very versatile.<page>More than that, though... it was a warm thing you did, the sort of kindness you don’t see much in this weary place.<hpage>Was this kindness? I must take care to learn of this land and claim what advantage I can from it. Answering requests like yours can often fit those ends.<page>Oh, it’s like that, is it? Well, even still, the help’s well appreciated, miss. Best of luck in your travels, and may every wish of yours be granted!
original_zh_text: 哎呀呀！你居然真捐了这么多甲壳碎片！跟我许的愿一模一样！简直不敢相信！<page>这些碎片用处可不少，又能造东西又能修修补补。<page>不过更重要的是……你做了件暖心事，这破地方可少见这种善举。<hpage>善意？我需要审慎了解这里，好为自己谋取利益。回应你的祈愿只是手段。<page>哦，原来如此？但帮忙总归是好的，小姐。祝旅途顺利，愿你所有愿望都能实现！
translated_text: それを見て!私が望むように、あなたはすべての貝殻を寄付しました!信じられない!<page>これらの作品は貴重ですね。生産とメンテナンスに最適で、幅広い用途に使用できます。<page>でもそれだけじゃないあなたがしていることは、この疲れた場所ではめったに見られない温かいものであり、親切なものです。<hpage>これは善意ですか？私はこの土地を知り、そこから得られる利点を得ることに注意を払わなければなりません。あなたのようなボランティアはしばしばこれらの目標を達成する。<page>ああそうだよね？それでも、あなたの助けに感謝しています、お嬢さん。良い旅とすべての願いが叶いますように!
secondary_translated_text: Look at it! As I wish, you donated all the shells! This is unbelievable!<page>These works are so precious. It is ideal for production and maintenance, and can be used in a wide range of applications.<page>But that's not all, what you're doing is a warm, kind thing you rarely find in this tired place.<hpage>Is this good faith? I must be careful to know this land and to get the advantages to be gained from it. Volunteers like you often accomplish these goals.<page>yeah, yeah? Still, I appreciate your help, little girl. Good journey and all wishes come true!

original_en_text: Oh, oh dear... what fearful events are sent to test we poor pilgrims! How could it be that our path to paradise is infested with such beasts?<page>To brave such a world... oh my. I’ll need more rosaries, that’s for certain. Please traveller, won’t you trade with me?
original_zh_text: 噢，圣堡啊……为何设置这等可怖灾厄考验可怜的朝圣者！通往乐土之路怎么会遍布恶兽？<page>要继续朝圣之路……唉，需要更多念珠。旅者，愿意交易吗？
translated_text: ああ、ああ、ハニー。哀れな巡礼者たちを試す恐ろしい出来事でしょう。天国への道はどうしてこんな獣でいっぱいになるのか。<page>世界に向かって勇敢に-ああ、私は確かにもっとロザリオが必要です。さあ、旅人よ、私と取引しないのか。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, yeah, honey. It would be a terrible event to test the poor pilgrims. How can the road to heaven be filled with such beasts?<page>Bravely towards the world - oh, I surely need more Rosaries. Now, traveler, will you not do business with me? "

original_en_text: You are my wish granter, yes? My wish! I need fruits of the world, three little darlings. I need them, so I wish!<page>You made the promise. A binding stronger than sin. Bring me the three Mossberries. Precious fruit! Grant my wish, and then the work begins!
original_zh_text: 你实现我的祈愿，对吧？我的祈愿！我要这世间的三枚果实，小宝贝果实。我需要，所以祈愿！<page>你应诺祈愿，比罪孽更牢固的契约。带给我三颗苔莓。珍果！应我祈愿，大业方启！
translated_text: あなたは私の願いの成就ですよね？私の願い!私は世界の果実、3人の赤ちゃんが必要です。私は彼らが欲しい、だから私は望む!<page>約束をした。罪よりも強い絆です。三つの苔をください。貴重な果実!願い事を叶えて、仕事が始まります!
secondary_translated_text: you're the fulfillment of my wishes, right? My wish! I need the fruit of the world, three babies. I want them, so I want them!<page>I made a promise. It is a bond stronger than sin. Please give me three moss. Precious fruit! Make your wish come true, and the work begins!

original_en_text: I’ve a long way to go, and much more to see. For now though, let’s just rest a little while, eh?
original_zh_text: 前面还有不少路要走，也有不少新鲜事物等着发现。但现在，不如一起休息一会吧。
translated_text: まだ長い道のりがあり、見るべきものがたくさんあります。でも今はちょっと休憩しましょうね。
secondary_translated_text: We still have a long way to go and a lot to see. But now we're going to take a break.

original_en_text: Times are hard, so fresh supplies are always welcome! Bugs arrive here with nothin’ and often leave without much more.
original_zh_text: 时局艰难，物资紧缺！虫子们来时两手空空，走时也带不走啥。
translated_text: 時代は厳しいので、いつでも新鮮なものを歓迎!このエラーは何もなく、それが去ったときにも何もない。
secondary_translated_text: Times are tough, so fresh things are always welcome! This error is nothing, and when it is gone, it is nothing.

original_en_text: Well now! Seems I’ve traded you the last of my supplies, so I’ve got no more excuses to linger down here.<page>I’ll soon be making my way up to the great Citadel. As holy as I am with rosaries, I’m sure my path will not be an arduous one...
original_zh_text: 哎呀！最后的存货都换予你了，这下没借口留下啦。<page>很快要上圣堡了。揣着这么多念珠，肯定能一路顺畅……
translated_text: よし!よし!最後の物資をあなたと交換したようだから、ここにいる言い訳はない。<page>すぐに大きな城に向かいます。私はロザリオに対して神聖であるが、私の道は困難ではないと確信している。
secondary_translated_text: okay! okay! There's no excuse here, because it's like I exchanged the last supplies with you.<page>We will soon head to the big castle. I am holy to the Rosary, but I am convinced that my path will not be difficult.

original_en_text: Bring more Mossberries here. Mmm. Yes, we will trade. Precious rosaries for fresh berries! Seek them wherever you see the green moss grow!
original_zh_text: 带更多苔莓来。嗯。用念珠换鲜果！青苔生长处都有踪迹！
translated_text: もっと苔を持ってきてえ~~。はい、私たちは取引します。新鮮なベリーの大切なロザリオ!緑の苔の成長を見ても、探してください!
secondary_translated_text: Bring me more moss, please. Yes, we will make a deal. Precious Rosary of Fresh Berries! Even if you see the growth of green moss, look for it!

original_en_text: You bear your blade well, hunter, and you’ve skill, no doubt, so I don’t mean any unkindness when I say you still seem a little frail.<hpage>I was a long time spent captive, bound by seals strange to me. My strength is diminished, but recoverable.<hpage>By the time I reach that Citadel, I’ll be ready to face what waits.
original_zh_text: 你执刃的姿态不错，猎手，本领想必了得。不过恕我直言，你看上去仍有些虚弱。<hpage>我遭囚禁多日，又被陌生封印束缚。气力虽然衰微，但尚可恢复。<hpage>等我抵达圣堡之时，自然会做好准备。
translated_text: ハンター、あなたは良い剣持ちで、間違いなくスキルを持っているので、あなたがまだ少し弱いように見えると言っても意味がありません。<hpage>私は長い間、奇妙なアザラシに縛られていました。力は衰えたが、回復することはできる。<hpage>城に着いたとき、私は何が起こるかの準備をしていた。
secondary_translated_text: Hunter, you're a good swordsman, and you definitely have some skills, so it doesn't make sense to say that you still seem a little weak.<hpage>For a long time, I was bound by a strange seal. His strength has waned, but he can recover.<hpage>When I arrived at the castle, I was preparing for what would happen.

original_en_text: Oh! Hunter, aren’t you in a sorry state? You’re all bound up, looking worse than when we first met!<hpage>My shell has become host to a cruel parasite. Though my natural strength keeps it from consuming me entirely, I’m much weakened by its presence.<page>Well, this just won’t do! Pharloom’s already in the snare of one fell curse, we can’t have another vying to leech what life remains.<page>Best you head quick over to that town of bells, at the core of our kingdom. I’ve an uncle hidden about there, an old hermit, and a horrid curmudgeon.<page>That hermit’s a hard one to befriend, but he holds some knowledge about this kingdom’s maladies. If anyone’s able to point you to a cure, it’ll be him.
original_zh_text: 哦！猎手，看你这副惨状。全身像被缠住，比初见时更狼狈了。<hpage>我受到险恶寄生体的侵蚀。虽凭借本源之力阻止了吞噬，仍被大幅削弱。<page>这怎么行！纺络已然陷于一道诅咒，怎能再让另一道来争夺残存的生机。<page>快去王国腹地的钟心镇，我在那有个隐居的叔父，就是脾气臭得很。<page>与他结交并不容易，但他了解不少病症。要说有谁能指点医治方法，非他莫属。
translated_text: おお!ハンター、悲しくないのか？あなたは縛られていて、私たちが最初に会った時よりも悪く見えます!<hpage>私の殻は残酷な寄生虫の宿主になりました。私の生まれつきの強さは完全に私を飲み込むことを妨げたが、その存在は私を弱くした。<page>それはうまくいかない!ファロは腐敗の呪いの罠にはまっており、残りの人生を他の男に競争させることはできません。<page>私たちの王国の中心にあるベルの町に急いでください。私には隠れている叔父、老人、そして不機嫌な恐ろしい男がいました。<page>隠者は友達を作るのは難しかったが、王国の病気については理解していた。誰かが治療法を教えてくれるなら、それは彼です。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, my God. aren't you sad, hunter? You're tied up, and you look worse than when we first met!<hpage>My shell has become a host of cruel parasites. My innate strength prevented me from completely engulfing me, but its presence made me weak.<page>It's not going to work! Faro is trapped by the curse of corruption, and she cannot let other men compete for the rest of her life.<page>Hurry up to the town of Bel, in the heart of our kingdom. I had a hidden uncle, an old man, and a grumpy, scary man.<page>The hermit was hard to make friends, but he understood the illness of the kingdom. If anyone can tell you the cure, it's him.

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! And... oh! Such fruit! Perfectly ripe! Perfectly fragrant! Perfectly round! Take what you have earned, much of much rosaries!
original_zh_text: 嗯，珍果！啊……极品！熟透！芬芳！浑圆！拿好，念珠多多，你当之无愧！
translated_text: そして、貴重な果実!そして...。おぉ!こんな果物!完全に調理!いい匂いだ!完璧なサークル!あなたが稼いだお金のほとんどを取りなさい!
secondary_translated_text: And the precious fruit! and then... oh! This fruit! Completely cooked! smells good! A perfect circle! Take most of the money you earned!

original_en_text: O-oh! Traveller! Won’t you stop and make trade with an old pilgrim? Surely something here will aid you in your great journey!
original_zh_text: 噢！旅者！来与我做笔交易？总有物件能在旅途中助你一臂之力！
translated_text: おお!旅行者たち!あなたは古い巡礼者と取引をするのをやめませんか？ここにあるものは間違いなくあなたの旅を助けるでしょう!
secondary_translated_text: Oh, my God. Travelers! Will you not stop making deals with the old pilgrims? What is here will definitely help your journey!

original_en_text: You keep the fruit for yourself? For greed? Strange choice! It will only weigh you down...
original_zh_text: 私藏果实？贪婪？奇怪选择！徒增负担……
translated_text: 果物は自分で食べますか？貪欲のため？不思議な選択!それはあなたを重く感じさせるだけです。
secondary_translated_text: Do you eat your own fruit? because of greed? Strange choice! It just makes you feel heavy.

original_en_text: Don’t go thinkin’ fear’s keepin’ me from my own pilgrimage! S’just there’s a lotta work still to do here and few bugs able to do it.
original_zh_text: 别以为我是怕了才不去朝圣！实在是这里活儿多帮手少。
translated_text: 恐怖が私の巡礼を妨げていると思わないでください!やるべきことはたくさんあり、間違いはほとんどありません。
secondary_translated_text: Do not think that fear is hindering my pilgrimage! " There's a lot to do, and there's very little to be done wrong.

original_en_text: Sing for our brother, who has died a devout death! All his pains and torments left behind, like the dust shrugged from a traveller’s shawl.
original_zh_text: 为兄弟而歌，他死得虔诚！所有苦痛皆抛却，如旅者抖落披肩尘埃。
translated_text: 死んだ兄弟のために歌え!彼のすべての痛みと苦難は、旅人のショールのほこりのように、彼の後ろに残されました。
secondary_translated_text: Sing for your dead brothers! " All his pains and hardships were left behind him, like the dust of a traveler's shawl.

original_en_text: Promised, then. A binding stronger than sin. Bring me the three Mossberries. Precious fruit! Grant my wish, and then the work begins!
original_zh_text: 祈愿已承，比罪孽更牢固的契约。带给我三颗苔莓。珍果！应我祈愿，大业方启！
translated_text: だからそうだ罪よりも強い絆です。三つの苔をください。貴重な果実!願い事を叶えて、仕事が始まります!
secondary_translated_text: It is a stronger bond than sin. Please give me three moss. Precious fruit! Make your wish come true, and the work begins!

original_en_text: Mm. Mmm! Who is it? An intruder! Terrible! To interrupt a humble druid as they work!<hpage>I meant no intrusion, druid. The sound of your laughter drew me to investigate.<hpage>This settlement is built around an old structure of the Weavers. Do you know of them? Do they inhabit this land still?<page>Mm? What settlement? What Weavers?! You speak nonsense!
original_zh_text: 嗯。嗯嗯！谁在那儿？入侵者！可恶！竟敢打扰德鲁伊修行！<hpage>无心冒犯，德鲁伊。你的笑声引我前来探查。<hpage>这聚落环绕古织者遗迹而建。你可知晓他们？是否仍居于此？<page>嗯？什么聚落？什么织者？！胡言乱语！
translated_text: え~~。え~ん!誰なの？侵入者!それは恐ろしい!謙虚なドルイド仕事を中断!<hpage>つまり、邪魔するつもりはない、ドルイド。あなたの笑いは私を調査に導いた。<hpage>この集落はウィーバー家の古い建物の周りに建設された。知ってるの？彼らはまだこの土地に住んでいるか。<page>え？えっ？和解って？何の織機？お前はナンセンスだ!
secondary_translated_text: ah ~! yeah! who are you? Intruder! That's terrible! Humble droid work interrupted!<hpage>I mean, I don't mean to interrupt you, droid. Your laughter led me to investigate.<hpage>This settlement was built around the old building of the Weaver House. do you know? Do they still live on this land?<page>what? what? reconciliation? what weaving machine? you're a nonsense!

original_en_text: <hpage>Madam, I return seeking power to aid the construction of a trap, at request of your sibling residing atop the Citadel.<page>Aye, hunter. So you managed to rouse the old fool. I’ve known it coming, felt it, and glad I am! <page>Rest’a my family spent far too long huddled and glum... or dead! Not me! I’d always been thinkin’ it a waste to just take what’s coming, when her up top wakes.<page>Better to fight for freedom or go out in a blaze, oh ho!
original_zh_text: <hpage>女士，我应你同胞之请归来，寻求助力建造陷阱——他正蛰伏圣堡之中。<page>啊，猎手。你果然说动了那老顽固。我早有预感，真是欣慰！<page>家族里其他虫要么缩着发愁……要么死了！我不一样！早就觉得坐等顶上那位苏醒是浪费生命。<page>宁可死也要争取自由，嚯嚯！
translated_text: <hpage>城の頂上に住むあなたの兄弟姉妹の要請により、私は罠の力を構築する助けを求めに戻りました。<page>そうだ、ハンター。そんなバカを目覚めさせてくれた。来るのは分かっていて、感じていて、嬉しいです!<page>私の家族はあまりにも長く一緒にいて、幸せではない。または死!私じゃない!彼女が目覚めた後に起こることを受け入れるのは無駄だと思っていました。<page>自由のために戦うか、火をつけるか。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>At the request of your brothers and sisters who live on the top of the castle, I have returned to seek help in building the power of the trap.<page>That is right, Hunter. I woke up such a fool. I know it's coming, I feel it, I'm glad!<page>My family has been together for too long and is not happy. Or die! not me! I thought it was futile to accept what would happen after she woke up.<page>Fight for freedom, or set fire to it.

original_en_text: Mmm, the precious fruit! Ah... but! This one is not so fresh. Rotten! Stench of death! A meagre amount of rosaries for you. As much as you deserve!
original_zh_text: 嗯，珍果！啊……但这颗不鲜。腐坏！死气熏天！只配少少念珠！
translated_text: そして、貴重な果実!あっ...。しかし!!これは新しいことではないRotten!死の匂い!あなたのための小さなロザリオあなたにふさわしいことをする!
secondary_translated_text: And the precious fruit! ah... But! This is nothing new, Rotten! Smell of death! A little rosary for you to do what you deserve!

translated_text: <hpage>ピルビーだ巡礼者の名前はピルビー。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Pilby. Pilgrim's name is Pilby.

original_en_text: Once this wishwall is up, bugs’ll be able to seek help from any able shell around. You could even try granting a couple of wishes yourself, missy!
original_zh_text: <page>等这祈愿墙立起来，大伙就能向能者求助了。小姐你说不定还能帮忙实现几个愿望呢！
translated_text: この願いの壁が築かれると、エラーは周囲のどんな有能な殻にも助けを求めることができます。あなたの願いを叶えることができます!
secondary_translated_text: Once this wall of wishes is built, the error can turn to any competent shell around for help. You can make your wish come true!

original_en_text: Rest here with me as long as you like. I’m not ready to leave yet, and a little company is always nice.
original_zh_text: 你想休息多久都可以。我尚未准备好启程，有个伴总是好的。
translated_text: 私と一緒にここで休むことができます。まだ行く準備ができていない。友達はいつも良いことです。
secondary_translated_text: You can rest here with me. " I'm not ready to go yet. Friends are always a good thing.

original_en_text: Down here, you can’t hear the cries of the pilgrims above, only the faintly ringing bells. I’ll stay and meditate a little longer, before I start my own pilgrimage...
original_zh_text: 在这儿听不见上头朝圣者的哭嚎，只有隐隐钟鸣。启程前我要多冥想会儿……
translated_text: ここでは、巡礼者の叫び声は聞こえず、かすかな鐘だけが聞こえます。私はしばらく滞在して瞑想し、それから私自身の巡礼の旅を始めるつもりです。
secondary_translated_text: Here, the screams of the pilgrims are not heard, only the faint bells. I'm going to stay and meditate for a while, and then start my own pilgrimage journey.

original_en_text: Farewell, brother Pilby. May your shell harden the path for others to tread.
original_zh_text: 永别了，小皮尔比。愿你的甲壳为后来者铺路。
translated_text: さようなら、兄弟ピルビー。あなたの体が他人のための道を開く。
secondary_translated_text: Farewell, brother Pilby. Your body paves the way for others.

translated_text: 野獣だ!野獣だ!恐るべき獣!
secondary_translated_text: The beast! The beast! Terrible beast!

original_en_text: ...Hm. Who here knows the name of this little pilgrim?
original_zh_text: ……嗯。在场有谁记得这虫的名字？
translated_text: ...この小さな巡礼者の名前を知っている人はいますか？
secondary_translated_text: ... Does anyone know the name of this little pilgrim?

original_en_text: Common stuff, shell shards, but very practical. I can use ‘em to patch almost anything up, and this camp’s always in need of some mending.
original_zh_text: 甲壳碎片虽然普通，但实用。我能拿它们修补大半东西，这营地可少不了修修补补。
translated_text: ありふれたもの、貝殻の破片ですが、非常に実用的です。ほとんど何でも修理できますが、このキャンプには必ず修理が必要です。
secondary_translated_text: It's a common thing, a shell fragment, but it's very practical. Almost anything can be repaired, but this camp must be repaired.

original_en_text: And another poor pilgrim lost, eh? Just the thought of it makes me weary. Better to put my head down and work ‘til the job’s done...
original_zh_text: 又没了个朝圣者？光想想就累得慌。还是干活吧……
translated_text: もう一人の巡礼者が行方不明になった。そんなことを考えるだけで疲れます。仕事が終わるまで頭を下げて作業するのが最善です。
secondary_translated_text: Another pilgrim has gone missing. I'm tired just thinking about that. It's best to work with your head down until you're done.

original_en_text: Hm? A fellow pilgrim, are you? About to start your great journey to the holy Citadel up top?<hpage>I am no pilgrim, sir, though it seems we will be travelling a similar path.<page>Not a pilgrim? Well, it makes no difference, I suppose. We all must walk the roads, up and up, though most of us will fall long before we see the grand gates.<page>If you’re wise, you’ll stop here and rest a while before heading out into that dangerous world...
original_zh_text: 嗯？你也是朝圣者？准备启程攀登圣堡了？<hpage>我并非朝圣者，先生，但前路或许相仿。<page>不是？也罢。众生皆须行路攀爬，但大多未睹圣门便殒命。<page>你若明智，启程前应该在此休整……
translated_text: え？えっ？あなたは巡礼者ですよね？聖都への素晴らしい旅の準備はできていますか？<hpage>私は巡礼者ではありませんが、私たちも同じような道を歩んでいるようです。<page>巡礼者ではないか？まあ、違いはないと思う。私たちは皆道を歩かなければならなかったが、私たちのほとんどは壮大な門を見る前に倒れた。<page>もし君が賢ければ、ここで立ち止まってしばらく休んで、その危険な世界へ向かうだろう。
secondary_translated_text: what? what? you're a pilgrim, aren't you? Are you ready for a great trip to the Holy City?<hpage>I am not a pilgrim, but it seems that we are on a similar path.<page>aren't you a pilgrim? Well, I don't think there's any difference. We all had to walk the road, but most of us fell before we could see the magnificent gate.<page>If you are wise, you will stop here, rest for a while, and head out to that dangerous world.

original_en_text: And for the parting, a gift. An amulet of we druids. Or me druid? No others, I think.<page>May it ease your sorrows, wish granter. May it cry for you when no tears are left!
original_zh_text: 临别赠礼。我们德鲁伊护符。或者，我的护符？似乎只剩我。<page>希望它能缓解你的哀伤，授愿者。眼泪干涸时，护符为你哭泣！
translated_text: お別れの前にもう一つプレゼントがあります。ドルイドのお守りです。それとも私はドルイド？他に誰もいないと思う。<page>祝福された者よ、あなたの悲しみを和らげてください。涙が残っていないときは、あなたのために泣かせてください。
secondary_translated_text: I have one more gift before we say goodbye. It's the Droid's amulet. Or am I a droid? I don't think there is anyone else.<page>O blessed one, ease your sorrow, and let it be with you. When there are no tears left, let them cry for you.

original_en_text: Mmm! Mmm! You carry a sweet, precious smell with you. A fruit! Will you trade it for rosaries?
original_zh_text: 嗯嗯！嗯！你身上的甜美气息。鲜果！用念珠交换？
translated_text: え~ん!え~ん!あなたは甘くて貴重な匂いを放つ。果物だ!ロザリオに変えてみませんか？
secondary_translated_text: yeah! yeah! You emit a sweet and precious smell. Fruit! why don't you change it to rosary?

original_en_text: <hpage>I wonder, little pilgrim. What calls you and your fellows up to the Citadel? If the way is dangerous, why take the journey at all?<page>Strange question to be asking of a pilgrim. Our holy land calls on us. To journey up is our greatest task. Who are we to refuse?<page>Guided by faith, we climb through flaming fields, across rolling moors, and up great gilded steps. All to reach that eternal, shining Citadel.<page>Once I’m good and ready, I’ll make the climb myself...
original_zh_text: <hpage>小朝圣者，我有些好奇。是什么召唤你前往圣堡？既然道途凶险，为何仍要涉险？<page>问朝圣者这话可真怪。圣堡召唤，攀登就是我等天职。怎么能违抗？<page>凭着信仰穿越火野，踏过灰沼，登上金阶。只为抵达永恒辉煌的圣堡。<page>待准备妥当，我就会启程……
translated_text: <hpage>私は知っている、小さな巡礼者。あなたとあなたの仲間は何をして城に来たのですか？道路が危険なら、なぜこの道を行くのか。<page>巡礼者への質問。聖地が呼んでいる。旅は私たちの最大の仕事です。誰を拒否する権利があるか。<page>信仰に導かれて、私たちは燃えるような野原を登り、うねりのある湿地を登り、雄大な金色の階段を登りました。すべては、永遠の輝く城に到達するためです。<page>準備ができたら、自分で登ります。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I know, little pilgrim. what did you and your companions do to come to the castle? If the road is dangerous, why go this way?<page>A question to the pilgrims. The Holy Land is calling. Traveling is our biggest job. Who has the right to refuse?<page>Guided by faith, we climbed up a fiery field, up a rolling marsh, and up a majestic golden staircase. All is to reach the eternal shining castle.<page>When you're ready, you'll climb it yourself.

original_en_text: Mmm. Mmm! The pain... my mind aches. Why? The berries, the nasty fruits. Oh the visions!<page>You, wish promiser. Wish granter. You brought me what I needed and stayed by my side. Companion through my ordeal. I could ask for nothing more.
original_zh_text: 嗯。嗯！痛楚……心如火灼。为什么？莓果，秽果。啊，那些幻象！<page>你，应诺者，授愿者。你实现我愿，伴我受难。我再无所求。
translated_text: え~~。え~ん!痛みは···心が痛い。なんで？ベリー、迷惑な果物。ああ、ビジョン!<page>希望の約束です。あなたは私に必要なものを与え、私のそばにいた。苦難を乗り越えてきた。これ以上は求められません。
secondary_translated_text: ah ~! yeah! The pain is... my heart hurts. why? Berries, an annoying fruit. Oh my vision!<page>It is a promise of hope. You gave me what I needed and you were by my side. He has overcome hardships. I cannot ask for more.

original_en_text: Ahhh! Ahhh-ohhhh! The smell is right! Like the others! But very young! Oh, voice of the woods! Oh, dance of the queen! Oh... oh! Beat harder, let us hear it! Oh! Ohhhhhhhh!
original_zh_text: 啊啊！啊——噢！气味对了！就像其他！但尚幼嫩！啊，林间之声！啊，女王之舞！啊……啊！搏动吧，让我聆听！啊！啊啊啊！
translated_text: あっ! あっ!あっ! あっ!味がいい!みんなと同じ!しかし、若い!“森の音!女王の踊り!ああ...。おぉ!聞こえるように押してください!おぉ!ああ、ハハ。
secondary_translated_text: ah! ah! ah! ah! It tastes good! Just like everyone else! But young! "Sound of the forest! The Queen's Dance! ah... oh! Push it so you can hear it! oh! Oh, ha ha.

original_en_text: Sing, brothers and sisters! Sing, and drown out this burdensome sorrow! Sing out the name of this poor pilgrim, whose journey had nary begun!
original_zh_text: 唱吧，兄弟姐妹！用歌声淹没这沉痛哀伤！为这未启程便陨落的朝圣者高歌！
translated_text: 歌え、兄弟姉妹!歌って、この悲しみに溺れさせよう!旅はまだ始まっていない貧しい巡礼者の名前を歌いなさい。
secondary_translated_text: Sing it, brothers and sisters! Let us sing and drown in this sorrow! Sing the name of the poor pilgrim whose journey has not yet begun.

original_en_text: Have you heard the talk of what waits just beyond this camp?<page>Brittle caverns of bone, the very base of Pharloom, filled with all manner of deadly creatures and jagged dangers.<page>It’s said ancient bugs once made their homes amidst it.<page>Who could believe! In such a hostile, unstable place! In all my time, I’ve never met a bug so brave.
original_zh_text: 你可曾听闻营地外的传闻？<page>骸骨脆岩构成纺络的基底，布满凶兽利齿。<page>据说古虫曾在此安家。<page>谁信啊！这种险恶之地！我这辈子没见过这么勇敢的虫。
translated_text: キャンプの外で待っているものを聞きましたか？<page>ファルムの底にある壊れやすい骨の穴は、致命的な生き物とギザギザの危険でいっぱいです。<page>古代の昆虫が生息していたとされる。<page>誰が信じるか!こんな不安定で不安定な場所で!こんなに勇敢な昆虫に出会ったことはない。
secondary_translated_text: have you heard what's waiting outside the camp?<page>The fragile bone holes at the bottom of the farm are full of deadly creatures and creeping dangers.<page>It is believed that ancient insects lived there.<page>Who will believe! " In such an unstable, unstable place! I have never met such a brave insect.

original_en_text: Sister, sister! What is that long, gleaming tooth you carry with you? Is it a weapon?<hpage>It is indeed, though you need not fear. I will not raise it against you. Its edge is meant for predators and other foes.<hpage>I strongly suggest you arm yourself similarly before your own journey begins.<page>Alas... for a pilgrim, that’s sin you speak of, sister.<page>We arm ourselves with prayer, garb ourselves in faith, and hope they prove enough to reach the Citadel’s glory. Such is our way...
original_zh_text: 姐妹！你带的闪亮长牙是武器吗？<hpage>正是，但无需惧怕。此刃只与掠食者与敌手相向。<hpage>强烈建议你启程前也备件武器。<page>唉……姐妹此言对朝圣者实属亵渎。我等以祷言为刃，以信仰为盾，唯此方能抵达圣堡。此乃吾辈之道……
translated_text: お姉ちゃん!お姉ちゃん!あなたが持っている輝く歯は何ですか？これは武器か？<hpage>それは真実ですが、恐れる必要はありません。私はあなたにそれを言わない。捕食者や他の敵に有利です。<hpage>旅に出る前に同様の方法で武装することを強くお勧めします。<page>ああ...。巡礼者にとって、それはあなたが罪と呼ぶものです。<page>私たちは祈りで武装し、信仰で身を包み、城の栄光に十分であることを願っています。それが私たちのやり方です
secondary_translated_text: sister! sister! What are the shiny teeth you have? is that a weapon?<hpage>It's true, but you don't have to be afraid. I will not tell you that. It is advantageous to predators and other enemies.<hpage>I strongly recommend arming yourself in a similar way before you go on a trip.<page>ah... For the pilgrim, that is what you call sin.<page>We may be armed with prayer, clothed with faith, and sufficient for the glory of the castle. That's how we do it.

original_en_text: Oh! Back again? The wishwall is up! Ready for all the poor souls who’ve been left behind down here.<page>In Pharloom, wishes are granted to those truly devout, or so they say. And there ain’t no harm in us dregs having wishes too.<page>Why, I even went and added a little wish of my own to the wishwall! Fair’s fair. I did build the thing. Seems like the kingdom should be granting my wish before anyone else’s.
original_zh_text: 哦！回来啦？祈愿墙完工了！就等底下这些可怜虫来许愿了。<page>纺络的愿望只赐给真正虔诚的虫，都这么说。但咱这些底层渣滓许个愿总不犯法吧？<page>嘿，我还在墙上偷偷加了自己的小愿望！公平嘛，墙是我造的，圣堡该先实现我的愿望才对。
translated_text: おぉ!また来た？願いの壁が上がった!ここにいる貧しい人々のために準備しなさい。<page>ファルでは、願いは本当に信心深い人や彼らが言うことに与えられます。私たちのクズが望むかどうか。<page>私は自分の小さな願いを願いの壁に追加しました!フェアはフェアです。私はこれをした。王国は私の願いを叶えてくれるようです。
secondary_translated_text: oh! you're back? The wall of wishes has risen! Prepare for the poor people here.<page>In the Fal, wishes are given to those who are truly devout and what they say. Whether or not our shit wants it.<page>I've added my own little wish to the wish wall! Fairness is fair. I have done this. The kingdom seems to grant my wishes.

original_en_text: <hpage>What’s this you’re building, sir? A sign of some kind?<page>Aye, aye. You’re a sharp bug! A wishwall. It’s past time this old camp had one. As the resident fixer, I’ve taken it upon myself to sort it out.<page>They’re a popular thing about Pharloom, wishwalls. Useful too. So many prayers left unanswered. Gives ‘em a place to go.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生这是在建造什么？某种标识？<page>啊，好眼力！这是祈愿墙。这老营地早该有一个。身为驻场维修师，自然该由我操办。<page>祈愿墙在纺络可流行了，很实用。那么多没回音的祈愿，总得有个归处。
translated_text: <hpage>何を作っているの？兆候は？<page>そうだ、お前は鋭い昆虫だ!願いの壁。この古いキャンプには1つあります。常駐修理業者として、私はこの問題を解決する責任を負います。<page>これらはPharloomの“Wishing Wall”からのヒット曲です。これも便利です。多くの祈りが答えられなかった。彼らに行く場所を与えなさい。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>what are you making? what are the signs?<page>Yes, you are a sharp insect! The wall of wishes. There's one in this old camp. As a resident repairman, I am responsible for solving this problem.<page>These are the hits from "Wishing Wall" by Pharloom. This is also convenient. Many prayers were not answered. Give them a place to go.

original_en_text: I must listen carefully... and pray with uninterrupted devotion. Only then will my faith be strong enough... to carry me upward...
original_zh_text: 必须专注聆听……虔心祷告。唯有如此，方能坚定信念，支撑我攀登……
translated_text: よく耳を傾けなければならない。中断しないように祈りなさい。そうして初めて、私の信仰は十分に強くなります。連れて行って
secondary_translated_text: You have to listen carefully. Pray that you will not be interrupted. Only then will my faith be strong enough. " take me.

original_en_text: S’not a surprise it’s you rallying us to action, hunter. You had the sense about you, a bug bringing change’n all.<page>Course you’re more than just a bug, aint’cha! More than Weaver. Guess it’d take someone like you for my family to dare hope at success.<page>Go and prove our trust now, won’t you? We’ve spent our lifetimes wishing for another path. With a bit of luck, you might grant it.
original_zh_text: 果然是你来召集我们行动，猎手。我初见便知你是变革者。<page>当然，你并非寻常虫类，也不止是织者。看来只有你这般存在，才让我族敢奢望成功。<page>现在就去证明你值得我们托付吧？我们毕生渴求踏上另一条道路。如果运气眷顾，你或许能成全我们。
translated_text: あなたが行動を起こすのは不思議ではない、ハンター。変化をもたらした過ちの感覚を自分自身に持っている。<page>もちろん、あなたはただの虫ではありませんよね。ウィーバーよりも。あなたのような人だけが、私の家族が成功を望むことができると思います。<page>今すぐ信頼を証明しましょうね。私たちは一生、別の道を望んでいます。運が良ければ達成できるかもしれません。
secondary_translated_text: No wonder you take action, Hunter. They have a sense of mistakes in themselves that brought about change.<page>Of course, you're not just a bug, are you? More than weaver. I think only people like you can wish my family any success, and I'm not sure if I can.<page>Let's prove our trust right now. All our lives, we want a different path. If you are lucky, you may be able to achieve it.

original_en_text: Well. Though this pilgrim’s name has been lost, still we sing.
original_zh_text: 罢了。虽名讳已失，歌声依旧。
translated_text: よし、よし。巡礼者の名前が消えても、私たちは歌い続けました。
secondary_translated_text: All right, all right. Even when the names of the pilgrims disappeared, we continued to sing.

original_en_text: Been hearing awful whispers in camp, about pilgrims driven mad by the hardships of the climb, crying out and attacking their fellows.<page>You’ve been out there. Tell me, is it really so?<hpage>You’ve heard it true, sir. On the roads, both pilgrims and beasts alike are consumed, driven to violence by a haunted thread, the source of which I have yet to discover.<page>Ah... I’d feared it was so. I won’t be able to trust a single face out on the path, then.<page>The risk of death was daunting enough, but the loneliness of such a journey, that seems almost too much to bear... Ah well. Just another test of our devotion, I suppose.
original_zh_text: 营地里常听到些可怖的流言，说攀登艰辛逼疯朝圣者，使其癫狂嚎叫，袭击同伴。<page>你是从外面来的。告诉我，真有这种事？<hpage>传言非虚，先生。路上朝圣者与野兽皆遭丝咒侵蚀，陷入狂暴，其源未明。<page>唉……果然。看来路上谁都不能信了。<page>死亡已经足够可怕，但独行的寂寞……简直难以承受……也罢，这是我等信仰必经的试炼。
translated_text: 巡礼者たちが登山の難しさに狂い、泣いて仲間を襲ったという恐ろしいささやきがキャンプから聞こえました。<page>あなたはそこにいた教えて、本当にそうなのか？<hpage>これは真実だと聞いたでしょう。途中、巡礼者や獣は幽霊の糸に飲み込まれ、暴力的な行動を強いられましたが、その起源はまだわかりませんでした。<page>あっ...。そうなったのかもしれない。私はこの道のどの顔も信じられません。<page>死の危険は十分に恐ろしいものですが、そのような旅の孤独はほとんど耐えられないように思えます...まあ、それは私たちの忠誠心のもう一つのテストに過ぎません。
secondary_translated_text: A terrifying whisper could be heard from the camp that pilgrims had gone mad at the difficulty of climbing the mountain, and had wept and attacked their companions.<page>you were there, tell me, are you really?<hpage>You may have heard that this is true. Along the way, pilgrims and beasts were swallowed up by ghostly threads, forcing them to engage in violent acts, but the origin of which was not yet known.<page>ah... Maybe that's what happened. I can't believe any faces on this road.<page>The danger of death is frightening enough, but the loneliness of such a journey seems almost unbearable... Well, it's just another test of our loyalty.

original_en_text: We pilgrims arm ourselves with prayer, garb ourselves in faith, and hope they prove enough to reach the Citadel’s glory. Such is our way...
original_zh_text: 朝圣者以祷言为刃，披信仰为甲，唯此方能抵达圣堡。此乃吾辈之道……
translated_text: 私たち巡礼者は祈りで武装し、信仰で身を包み、城の栄光に十分であることを願っています。それが私たちのやり方です
secondary_translated_text: We pilgrims, armed with prayer, clothed with faith, may we be sufficient for the glory of the castle. That's how we do it.

original_en_text: <hpage>What duty binds you to this old chapel, madam? The structure barely stands, and I see no signs of congregation.<page>Aye! Gone! The lot’o them, fled and hidden. But I’m not leaving till I’ve set this place right...<page>...It’s that Citadel above, you see. Even now, in Pharloom’s long decline, the simple bugs, they’re witless before it. Too grand. Too majestic. Too powerful.<page>This building’s state is a sad example of those who’d dare suggest another path...
original_zh_text: <hpage>女士，是何职责将你束缚在这破败教堂？此处梁柱倾颓，更无信众踪影。<page>唉！都散了！逃的逃藏的藏。但我要留下……直到把这儿整顿妥当……<page>……你瞧，都是上头圣堡造的孽。即便纺络衰败至此，愚昧虫众仍对其俯首。太宏伟，太威严，太强大。<page>这座建筑的惨状，正是胆敢另辟蹊径者的下场……
translated_text: <hpage>この古い教会に対するあなたの義務は何ですか？建物はほとんど立っておらず、集合の気配は見られなかった。<page>はい!はい!行くぞ!多くの者が逃げ出して隠れた。しかし、私はこの場所を修復するまで去りません。<page>...上の城を見てください。ファラムの長い衰退の過程で、今でも、これらの単純な間違いはそれ以前は愚かであった。これはすごいわとても壮大です。強すぎます。<page>建物の状態は、あえて別の道を提案する人々にとって悲しい例です。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>What is your duty to this old church? The buildings were barely standing, and there was no sign of a gathering.<page>yes! yes! we go! Many of them fled and hid. But I won't leave until I have this place repaired.<page>... Take a look at the castle above. In the course of pharam's long decline, even now, these simple mistakes were foolish before. This is amazingly grand. Too strong.<page>The state of the building is a sad example for those who dare to propose another path.

original_en_text: Eh? What fortune is this? Our wish answered, even in a moment so dark!<page>You’ve proved quite the saviour, miss, and you’ve certainly earned the appreciation of this whole sorry lot.<hpage>You are welcome, sir. For you few, I hope these supplies may aid.
original_zh_text: 哎呀！这什么好运？这么黑暗危险的时刻祈愿居然实现了。<page>您真是救星啊小姐，我们这群可怜虫都打心眼里感激您。<hpage>能帮上忙就好。希望这点补给对你们有用。
translated_text: え？えっ？この富は何ですか？この暗い時代にも、私たちの願いは叶いました!<page>ミス、あなたは救世主であることを証明し、確かに貧しい人々の賞賛を得ました。<hpage>ようこそ、先生。皆さんの多くのために、私はこれらの材料が役立つことを願う。
secondary_translated_text: what? what? what is this wealth? Even in these dark times, our wishes have been fulfilled!<page>Miss, you have proved to be the Savior, and indeed you have earned the praise of the poor.<hpage>Welcome to you, Doctor. For many of you, I hope these materials are helpful.

original_en_text: You, in the cloak... pray tread softly. I am meditating, gathering my faith... before my pilgrimage begins.<hpage>My steps are soft enough, madam. If I have disturbed you, it was not my intent.<page>Ahh... even your speech... far too loud. I can scarcely hear my thoughts. Please, be away...
original_zh_text: 穿披风那位……脚步放轻。我在冥想聚神……为朝圣做准备。<hpage>脚步够轻了，女士。若打扰了你实非本意。<page>唉……连说话声……都太吵。静不下心。请快离开……
translated_text: あなたはマントを着て軽く祈る。私は瞑想し、信仰を集めています。巡礼が始まる前に。<hpage>私の足はとても柔らかいです、女性。邪魔しても、それは私の意図ではない。<page>あっ...。あなたのスピーチも。騒音が多すぎて、自分の考えがほとんど聞こえません。出て行って
secondary_translated_text: You wear a mantle and pray lightly. I am meditating and gathering faith. Before the pilgrimage begins.<hpage>My feet are so soft, woman. Even if I interrupt, that's not my intention.<page>ah... Your speech too. There is so much noise that I can hardly hear my own thoughts. get out of there.

original_en_text: I see you’ve gone and opened up the great bone gate back there. And without even asking my permission! Feeling curious, were you?<hpage>There is a vast grave beyond. I’d assumed most bugs died climbing the path, but it seems many fell before their trek had barely commenced.<page>Aye! Lost their lives to beasts, or to luck turned rotten. Others were simply formed too frail.<page>At least those poor souls can rest together. Death and death and death, the eternal promise of our eternal kingdom. Eventually, it claims us all.
original_zh_text: 看来你擅自开了后头的巨大骨门，甚至问都不问我！不怕好奇害死虫？<hpage>门后是片巨冢。本以为众虫多是殒命在攀登途中，但似是有许多死于起步？<page>唉！有的死于猛兽，有的运气不好，也有天生孱弱的。<page>但至少这些可怜虫可以共眠。无止尽的死亡，永恒国度的永恒承诺，终将吞噬众生。
translated_text: そこに巨大な骨の扉を開けて去っていくのを見た。私の同意を求めない!好奇心旺盛ですよね。<hpage>遠くに巨大な墓があります。ほとんどの虫はこの道を登っている間に死んだと思っていましたが、ハイキングが始まる前に多くの虫が落ちたようです。<page>はい!はい!彼らの命は獣に奪われるか、運によって腐敗する。他人の形はとても脆い。<page>少なくとも貧しい魂は一緒に眠ることができる。死は私たちの永遠の王国の約束です。最終的には私たち全員の命を奪ってしまう。
secondary_translated_text: There I saw him open a huge bone door and go away. Don't ask for my consent! You're very curious, right?<hpage>There is a huge grave in the distance. I thought most of the bugs died while climbing this path, but it seems that many bugs fell before the hike began.<page>yes! yes! Their lives are either taken away by beasts or corrupted by fate. The form of others is very fragile.<page>At least the poor soul can sleep together. Death is the promise of our eternal kingdom. In the end, it will take all of our lives.

original_en_text: Hunter! I’m thinking it was you that cleared my basement?<hpage>On first arrival here, the nesting creatures didn’t take kindly to my passing.<page>Ohho. They’re cranky bugs, alright. And they made an awful mess down here with their hatching and breeding.<page>You’ve my many thanks for seeing them off!
original_zh_text: 猎手！地窖里的那些家伙是你清理的？<hpage>初到此地时，那些栖居者可不待见我路过。<page>哈哈，都是些坏脾气的虫子。他们孵卵繁衍把下面搞得一团糟。<page>多谢你赶走了它们！
translated_text: ハンター!私の地下室を掃除したのか？<hpage>私が最初にここに来たとき、巣を作った生き物は私の死にあまり感銘を受けませんでした。<page>ああ、ホー。彼らは厄介な虫です、OK。孵化と繁殖は混乱を引き起こした。<page>お見送りありがとうございました!
secondary_translated_text: hunter! did you clean my basement?<hpage>When I first came here, the creatures that made the nest were not very impressed with my death.<page>Oh, ho. They are annoying bugs, OK. The hatching and breeding caused confusion.<page>Thank you for sending me off! "

original_en_text: <hpage>The bugs of your land, I have watched them, climbing towards their absolution without the flicker of a thought to what it means.<page>Aye. But isn’t it always such for those snared to serve your higher caste?<page>Our mortal mob did once act some defiance, unawares maybe, but successful in part, goaded towards it by Weavers’ will’n all.<hpage>You speak of the Citadel? Its former function has failed, but I can still sense its purpose, some. It is church and cage both.<page>Aye. Devised by your ancestors that monstrosity, and their wicked, clever minds. A system, or a web they’d likely call it, a way to keep their mother sealed in slumber, and themselves free to lavish in their false rule.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我观察了这片土地的虫。他们一心爬向救赎，却不懂这意味着什么。<page>是啊，但被你们高等族群使唤的不都这样。<page>我们凡虫不是没反抗过。当年被织者忽悠着，居然还真成了点事。<hpage>你说圣堡？虽然荒废了，还是能感觉到它的用途：既是教堂又是牢笼。<page>是啊。你祖辈造的这怪物，用狡猾心思织成网，让母亲陷入沉眠，自己却在外面称王。
translated_text: <hpage>私はあなたの土地の虫が許しを求めるのを見ましたが、それが何を意味するのか分かりません。<page>でもそれはあなたの高いカーストに仕えるすべての人々がすることではないか？<page>私たちの凶悪犯は、おそらく無意識のうちに抵抗しましたが、ウィーバーの意志とすべての刺激によって、部分的に成功しました。<hpage>お城のことですか？以前の機能は失敗しましたが、まだ目的を感じることができます。それは教会であり、檻です。<page>そう、あなたの先祖はこれらの怪物と邪悪で知的な心を創造しました。彼らはそれをシステムやネットワークと呼ぶかもしれません母親を眠らせ間違ったルールの中で自由に過ごす方法です
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I've seen the worms of your land ask for forgiveness, but I don't know what that means.<page>but isn't that what all the people who serve your higher caste do?<page>Our thugs resisted, perhaps unconsciously, but, by the will of Weaver and all the stimulation, they succeeded in part.<hpage>you mean the castle? The previous function has failed, but you can still feel the purpose. It is a church, it is a cage.<page>So, your ancestors created these monsters and an evil and intelligent mind. They might call it a system or a network, a way of letting their mothers sleep and spending their free time in the wrong rules.

original_en_text: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work.<page>Ahh. Know you distort the order of things, Old One. It is a rare want of your caste to serve us mortal bugs.<hpage>I am not my kin, Maker. I have seen enough pain born of their dominion. As much as I may, I choose to stand apart.<page>If your blood allows it so... And my thanks still for the lacquer. Pharloom’s fresh faces will welcome its sheen.
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师，我从钟心镇送来漆料，够你用很久。<page>啊呀，古老者，这怎么合适。侍奉我们凡虫可不是你们族群的作风。<hpage>我和同族不一样。看够了他们统治下的苦难，自然不会同流合污。<page>不知您的同族会怎么想……但还是多谢漆料。纺络的新面孔会喜欢的。
translated_text: <hpage>メーカー、私はあなたの長期的な仕事のための塗料を提供するために、下のBurhartから出荷しました。<page>ああ、あなたは物事の秩序を歪めているのは知っている、老人。私たち人間の虫に仕えることは、あなたのカーストのまれな願望です。<hpage>私は親戚ではなく、創造主でもない。私は彼らの支配が引き起こした苦しみを十分に見た。そうかもしれませんが、私は去ることを選びます。<page>血が許す限り。絵を描くのが好き。ファロの新鮮な顔が光を浴びる。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Manufacturer, I have shipped from Burhart below to provide paint for your long term work.<page>Oh, I know you're distorting the order of things, old man. Serving the worms of us humans is a rare aspiration of your caste.<hpage>I am neither a relative nor a creator. I have seen enough of the suffering caused by their rule. It may be, but I choose to leave.<page>As long as the blood allows. He likes to paint. The fresh face of Faro is in the light.

original_en_text: Until cavern’s collapse, the masks must be made!
original_zh_text: 直到洞窟崩塌，雕刻都不能停！
translated_text: 洞窟が崩壊する前にマスクを作らなければ!
secondary_translated_text: We have to make a mask before the cave collapses!

original_en_text: Enough talk, Old One. My contract remains. I’ll work till caverns’ collapse.<hpage>Very well, Maker. If it is within my power to do so, I shall see your lands saved.
original_zh_text: 聊够了吧，古老者。契约还在，我要继续刻面甲，直到大地崩塌。<hpage>好吧，匠师。要是有办法，我会保护好这片土地。
translated_text: もういいよ、老人。私の契約はまだ有効です。私は洞窟が崩壊するまで働きます<hpage>よくやった、メーカー。もし私がそれをすることができれば、あなたの土地を救うことができます。
secondary_translated_text: Enough, old man. My contract is still in effect. I'll work until the cave collapses.<hpage>Well done, Maker. If I can do that, I can save your land. "

original_en_text: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it’s rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I’ve felt the stirrings of our monarch, even all the way out here, the tremors of her kin brought close.<page>You’re planning a confrontation with her then? The one atop? Our great, frayed god?<hpage>Our meeting seems inevitable, though first I seek the strength to ensure a favourable outcome.<page>Ha! As I’d have guessed! Your ancient kind aren’t told to abide one another peaceably.<page>Well, assuming you prevail, I’ll ask only that my labour may continue. No matter the state of these lands, you should well know the necessity of my service.
original_zh_text: 啊呀，古老者，你们这一族最清楚，不戴面甲交谈太失礼了。<hpage>我就是想和清醒的你聊聊，别见怪。<page>好吧。不过我倒是不奇怪你会来。连我这都能感觉到那位的躁动，想必就是因为你。<page>所以你打算要去她算账？找我们伟大却又衰败的女王？<hpage>迟早要见，但我得先积蓄力量。<page>哈！早猜到了！你们古族从来都是窝里斗。<page>要是你赢了，我只求能继续刻面甲。无论王国结局如何，我的活都不能停。
translated_text: ああ、老人、あなたのような人は、私を暴露するのは失礼だと知っているはずです。ベールが剥がれると、仕事は困難になります。<hpage>あなたが抗議するかもしれないが、メーカー、あなたの明確な声を聞きたい。<page>あなたがここにいるのはショックではない。私はここでも、彼女の親戚の震えが近くにあっても、私たちの君主の興奮を感じました。<page>彼女と戦うつもりなのか？上の人？偉大で疲れた神？<hpage>私たちの会合は避けられないように見えたが、私はまず好ましい結果を確保するために強さを求めた。<page>はぁ!私の推測通り!古代の人々は平和に生きるように言われなかった。<page>もしあなたが勝ったとしたら、私が求めるのは私の労働が続くことだけです。この土地の状態がどうであれ、あなたは私のサービスの必要性をよく知っているはずです。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, old man, a man like you should know that it would be impolite to expose me. When the veil is torn off, the work becomes difficult.<hpage>You may protest, but I want to hear your clear voice, the maker.<page>It's no shock that you're here. I felt the excitement of our monarch even here, even when the trembling of her relatives was nearby.<page>you're going to fight her? up there? a great and tired God?<hpage>Although our meeting seemed inevitable, I first sought strength to secure a favourable outcome.<page>yeah! As I guessed! The ancient people were not told to live in peace.<page>If I win, all I ask for is that my labor continue, and I will not be able to do so. Whatever the state of this land, you should be well aware of the need for my services.

original_en_text: Back again, Old One? The effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... those are plainly sensed. The fate for these caverns feels grim.<page>I’ll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch’s desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I’m not surprised! It’s always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
original_zh_text: 又来了古老者？我感觉到了你和苍白女王争斗……不过看来情况不太妙。<page>我猜事情变得复杂了？还是说你早料到会这样？<hpage>我给了她致命一击，可她临死挣扎要让整个王国陪葬。<page>哈！一点都不意外！你们古族争权夺利，我们小虫子活该被碾碎。<hpage>我想要自由，匠师。既为了我也为了你们。或许是有些天真，但这不是我要的结局。
translated_text: 戻ってきたのか、老人。あなたの影響力です青白い母と口論になるそれは明らかである。この洞窟の運命は厳しい。<page>物事はますます複雑になっていると思いますか？それとも期待される結果でしょうか。<hpage>私たちは会談で致命的な打撃を受けましたが、君主の死の絶望的な痛みは今や王国全体を脅かしています。<page>はぁ!驚いていない!いつもそうですよね？あなた方の古代の種は覇権を争っていますが、私たちの人間の昆虫は目に見えないほど押しつぶされています。<hpage>それが私が求める自由です、創造主。ナイーブかもしれませんが、私が望んだ運命ではありません。
secondary_translated_text: Are you back, old man? " It is obvious that your influence is pale and you will argue with your mother. The fate of this cave is severe.<page>do you think things are getting more complicated? Or is it the expected result?<hpage>We were struck with a fatal blow at the meeting, but the monarch's desperate pain of death now threatens the whole kingdom.<page>yeah! I'm not surprised! it's always the case, right? While your ancient species are vying for supremacy, our human insects are being crushed beyond sight.<hpage>That is the freedom I seek, Creator. It may be naive, but it is not the fate I wanted.

original_en_text: All deserve a face. A chance to be! Until I wither, for the faceless I shall provide.
original_zh_text: 所有生灵都该有张脸，有机会存在！只要我还没倒下，就会给无面者造脸。
translated_text: 誰にでも顔がある。チャンスだ!わたしは顔のない者を、わたしが死ぬまで養う。
secondary_translated_text: Everyone has a face. chance! I will feed the faceless until I die.

original_en_text: To exist, to die, a face is needed. It is the essential thing.
original_zh_text: 不论死活，都得有一张脸。这是根本。
translated_text: 生きて死ぬためには顔が必要です。それが一番大事なことです。
secondary_translated_text: You need a face to live and die. That is the most important thing.

original_en_text: <hpage>Maker, I bring a delivery from Bellhart below, lacquer for your long work. <page>Good! Good! To seal. To protect. May Pharloom’s fresh faces gleam bright.
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师，我从钟心镇送来漆料，够你用很久。<page>好！好！用来封存，用来保护。让纺络的新面孔闪闪发亮。
translated_text: <hpage>メーカー、私はあなたの長期的な仕事のための塗料を提供するために、下のBurhartから出荷しました。<page>よし!よし!保護のために封印。メイ·ファローの新しい顔が輝く。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Manufacturer, I have shipped from Burhart below to provide paint for your long term work.<page>okay! okay! Sealed for protection. May Farrow's new face is shining.

original_en_text: Take reward for service made, visitor! Gift for you, to spend or treasure!
original_zh_text: 收下报酬吧客人！要用掉还是收着都行！
translated_text: 観光客は提供されたサービスのために報酬を得る!あなたへの贈り物は使用または価値がある!
secondary_translated_text: Tourists will be rewarded for the services provided! A gift to you is either worth using or worth it!

original_en_text: A visitor! Grand you are. But you have already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
original_zh_text: 欢迎！尊贵的客人。可你已经有面甲了，已经有脸了。我的刻刀只为无面者服务。
translated_text: ビジター!あなたは素晴らしいですが、すでにマスクをしています。すでに顔があります。持っていない人のために彫刻しなければならない。
secondary_translated_text: Visitors! You are great, but you are already wearing a mask. I already have a face. You must sculpt for those who do not have it.

original_en_text: To work! To work! The masks must be carved.
original_zh_text: 雕刻！雕刻！必须继续雕刻面甲。
translated_text: 仕事に行け!仕事に行け!マスクは彫刻される。
secondary_translated_text: Get to work! Go to work! The mask is sculpted.

original_en_text: Did you treat with the creature upon the summit?<page>Your legged ancestors once found her company compelling, enough to build their chambers and their calling device at the height of this perilous peak.<hpage>I have paid my respects, and been granted her favour. Her down now fills my cloak, and does much to ward against the frost of these heights.<page>To pass something so precious... That’s a mighty gift you’ve been given. Seems she’s thrown her lot in with you.<page>I’d not have guessed her so opposed to our threaded monarch, but then she too must have sensed the wretched state of things, and the harsher change to come.
original_zh_text: 见过山顶上那位了吗？<page>你那些多足的先祖对她十分信服，甚至在这么险的山峰上修了屋子打造机器。<hpage>我去拜访过了，也受到了她的青睐，得了这身御寒的绒毛。<page>连这个都送你……真是下了血本。她把宝押在你身上了。<page>没想到她这么反对苍白之主，恐怕她也看出纺络情况不对，有大事要发生了。
translated_text: 山の上の生き物と交流したことはありますか？<page>あなたの足の祖先は、この危険な丘の上に部屋と電話装置を建設する彼女の会社に魅力を見つけました。<hpage>私は彼女に敬意を表し、彼女の好意を得た。彼女の羽毛は今私のマントを満たし、この高い霜に耐えるのに非常に役立った。<page>そんな貴重なものを届ける。それはあなたが得る強力な贈り物です。彼女はあなたに運命を与えたようです。<page>彼女が私たちのクソ君主にそんなに反対するとは思わなかったが、彼女も状況の悲惨さと差し迫ったより深刻な変化を感じたに違いない。
secondary_translated_text: Have you ever interacted with a creature on a mountain?<page>Your foot ancestors found attraction in her company to build a room and telephone equipment on this dangerous hill.<hpage>I respected her and won her favour. Her feathers now filled my mantle, and helped me greatly to endure this high frost.<page>Delivering something so precious. It is a powerful gift that you will receive. She seems to have given you her destiny.<page>I didn't expect her to be so opposed to our goddamn monarch, but she must have felt the misery of the situation and the imminent more serious change, too.

original_en_text: Ahh. Old One. Your kind should know it’s rude to expose me such. Unmasked, the task becomes heavy. <hpage>I had the desire to hear you lucid, Maker, though you may protest.<page>Aye. Well its no great shock to have you visit. I’ve felt, and heard, the effects of your... altercation with the pale mother... The fate for these caverns seems grim.<page>I’ll take it things have taken a turn more complicated? Or was this the aftermath anticipated all along?<hpage>In our meeting, a mortal blow was dealt, but the monarch’s desperate death throes now threaten to take this whole kingdom with her.<page>Ha! I’m not surprised! It’s always the way, aye? Your ancient kind, vying for dominion, and us mortal bugs squashed unseen underneath.<hpage>It was freedom I sought, Maker, for myself and for you mortal few. Naive perhaps, but this is not the fate I wished to come.
original_zh_text: 啊呀，古老者，你们这一族最清楚，不戴面甲交谈太失礼了。<hpage>我就是想和清醒的你聊聊，别见怪。<page>好吧。不过我倒是不奇怪你会来。我感觉到、听到了你和苍白女王争斗……不过看来情况不太妙。<page>我猜事情变得复杂了？还是说你早料到会这样？<hpage>我给了她致命一击，可她临死挣扎要让整个王国陪葬。<page>哈！一点都不意外！你们古族争权夺利，我们小虫子活该被碾碎。<hpage>我想要自由，匠师。既为了我也为了你们。或许是有些天真，但这不是我要的结局。
translated_text: ああ、古いもの。あなたのような人は、私を暴露するのは失礼だと知るべきです。ベールが剥がれると、仕事は困難になります。<hpage>あなたが抗議するかもしれないが、メーカー、あなたの明確な声を聞きたい。<page>あなたがここにいるのはショックではない。私はあなたの影響を感じ、聞く。蒼白な母との争い― ―これらの洞窟の運命は厳しいようだ。<page>物事はますます複雑になっていると思いますか？それとも期待される結果でしょうか。<hpage>私たちは会談で致命的な打撃を受けましたが、君主の死の絶望的な痛みは今や王国全体を脅かしています。<page>はぁ!驚いていない!いつもそうですよね？あなた方の古代の種は覇権を争っていますが、私たちの人間の昆虫は目に見えないほど押しつぶされています。<hpage>創造主よ、私はあなたとあなたのために自由を求めます。ナイーブかもしれませんが、私が望んだ運命ではありません。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, the old thing. A person like you should know that it would be impolite to expose me. When the veil is torn off, the work becomes difficult.<hpage>You may protest, but I want to hear your clear voice, the maker.<page>It's no shock that you're here. I feel and hear your influence. The struggle with the pale mother - - the fate of these caves seems to be severe.<page>do you think things are getting more complicated? Or is it the expected result?<hpage>We were struck with a fatal blow at the meeting, but the monarch's desperate pain of death now threatens the whole kingdom.<page>yeah! I'm not surprised! it's always the case, right? While your ancient species are vying for supremacy, our human insects are being crushed beyond sight.<hpage>Creator, I ask for freedom for you and for you. It may be naive, but it is not the fate I wanted.

original_en_text: Late! Late you are! And already a mask. Already a face. It is for those without that I must carve.
original_zh_text: 迟了！太迟了！你已经有面甲了，已经有脸了。我的刻刀只为无面者服务。
translated_text: 遅れたぞ!遅刻したぞ!すでにマスクをしている。すでに顔があります。持っていない人のために彫刻しなければならない。
secondary_translated_text: we're late! i'm late! He already has a mask. I already have a face. You must sculpt for those who do not have it.

original_en_text: Have some small reward for your troubles, Old One. It’s no small thing to deliver that sloshing stuff safe, ‘specially all the way up here.
original_zh_text: 古老者，请收下这点酬劳。抱着晃荡的漆罐爬这么高不容易。
translated_text: これは高齢者のための小さな報酬です。揺れたものの安全な輸送は、特にここでは小さなことではありません。
secondary_translated_text: This is a small reward for the elderly. The safe transportation of a shaken thing is no small thing, especially here.

original_en_text: A fine face, yours. Not of my work. Not of this kingdom’s craft. Not now at least.<page>But the deeper form. Distant relationship. Some form of Pharloom and our old, legged, stewards. <page>Now! To work. To work! The masks are needed.
original_zh_text: 你这张脸不错。不是我的手艺，也不是纺络的手艺。至少现在不是。<page>但更深处，有渊源。和古时候那些多足管事的一样。<page>好了！干活！干活！需要更多面甲！
translated_text: あなたの顔は美しい。俺の仕事じゃない王国の芸術ではない。少なくとも今は。<page>もっと深い形で。疎遠な関係。ファルと私たちの古い足の長い家政婦の一種。<page>今だ!仕事の時間だ!マスクが必要です。
secondary_translated_text: Your face is beautiful. it's not my job, it's not the art of the kingdom. At least for now.<page>In a deeper form. A distant relationship. A kind of long-legged housewife with our old Fal.<page>now! Time to work! You need a mask.

original_en_text: <hpage>You have the sight, Maker. Tell me what you see in me?<page>Your mask... It reads clear enough, Old One. Watcher, hunter, monarch even, though you may reject that station.<page>A complex visage, perhaps, yet still to my sight it looks unresolved.<hpage>If you see a transitional state, it is one I have accepted. My mask has remained defined through lifetimes uncounted.<page>Aye. Rigid I’m sure, but your kind rarely develop evenly, and the lifetime of bugs are poor measure for one like you.<page>Could be there’s more growth awaiting you yet...
original_zh_text: <hpage>匠师好眼力。在我身上看到什么了？<page>你的面甲……上面清清楚楚。守望者，猎手，甚至君主——就算你不认最后这个。<page>挺复杂的一张脸，但在我看来还没定型。<hpage>如果是过渡状态，那我早已接受。这面甲已陪我度过了不知多少辈子的时间。<page>是啊。不过你们古族生长发育不合常理，我们虫子的几辈子可没法衡量你的年纪。<page>说不定你还能再长大呢……
translated_text: <hpage>ビジョンがある、創造主。私の中に何が見えるの？<page>マスクがはっきり見えますね、老人。見張り人、狩人、王でさえ、あなたはその場所を拒否できますが。<page>それは複雑な顔かもしれませんが、私の意見ではまだ解決されていません。<hpage>変化を見るなら、それは私が受け入れた変化です。私のマスクは一生形を保っています<page>確かに硬いのですが、あなたのような人はめったに均等に発達しませんし、あなたのような人にとっては虫の寿命は最悪です。<page>まだまだ成長が待っているかもしれません。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I have a vision, Creator. what do you see in me?<page>You can see the mask clearly, old man. Even the watchman, the hunter, the king, you can refuse that place.<page>It may be a complicated face, but in my opinion it hasn't been solved yet.<hpage>If you look at the change, it's the change I've embraced. And my mask stays in shape for a lifetime.<page>It is hard indeed, but people like you are rarely evenly developed, and for people like you the life of a worm is the worst.<page>You may still be waiting for your growth.

original_en_text: Our world cries its end! But the masks must still be carved.
original_zh_text: 虽然世界在哀嚎！但面甲还得继续刻。
translated_text: 世界は終わった!マスクは彫刻が必要です。
secondary_translated_text: The world is finished! " The mask needs to be sculpted.

original_en_text: Enough talk, Old One. Mine is a calling that scant allows rest.<hpage>Very well, Maker. I shall take my leave.
original_zh_text: 聊够了吧，古老者。我的使命可不让休息。<hpage>好吧，匠师。告辞了。
translated_text: もういいよ、老人。私のキャリアはほとんど中断されなかった。<hpage>よくやった、メーカー。行くわよ
secondary_translated_text: Enough, old man. My career was almost uninterrupted.<hpage>Well done, Maker. I'm going.

original_en_text: To exist, a face is needed. It is the essential thing.
original_zh_text: 要存在，就得有张脸。这是根本。
translated_text: 生き残るためには顔が必要ですそれが最も重要なことです
secondary_translated_text: We need a face to survive, and that's the most important thing.

original_en_text: Clever Nuu must know them all!
translated_text: スマート·ニューは知るべき!
secondary_translated_text: Smart New should know!

original_en_text: Wings that beat, legs that crawl...
original_zh_text: 振翅的飞者，爬行的走兽……
translated_text: きらめく翼、這う脚。
secondary_translated_text: Shining wings, crawling legs.

original_en_text: In waters deep and caverns tall...
translated_text: 水深、穴の高さ
secondary_translated_text: Water depth, hole height

translated_text: 縮小して獲物を捕まえよう!
secondary_translated_text: Let's shrink and catch the prey!

translated_text: ...サービスを登る。
secondary_translated_text: ... Climb the service.

translated_text: 守護者の呼びかけ。
secondary_translated_text: Call of the Guardian.

translated_text: ハッチ!ハッチ!
secondary_translated_text: hatch! Hatch!

translated_text: 私の仕事を見て
secondary_translated_text: Look at my work.

translated_text: 聞いてください。いつも..。
secondary_translated_text: Please listen to me. I'm always...

translated_text: 横になって
secondary_translated_text: lay down.

translated_text: 誰も飢えません。
secondary_translated_text: No one is going hungry.

translated_text: この道を進みましょう。
secondary_translated_text: Let's go on this path.

translated_text: 世界の血が沸騰した
