original_en_text: Ho, traveller! With the lands outside fresh struck by fell events, it’s good to see someone still survivin’.<hpage>This new curse proves a threat even to my strengthened shell. For your own safety, barkeep, I strongly suggest you remain within your walls.<page>Aye, well, you’re welcome to do the same. Stay and wash the troubles away with a few bells of nectar... though, given the scale to them shakes, I’m thinkin’ it might take more’n just a few.
original_zh_text: 噢，旅行者！您没事吧？外头刚遭了灾，能见到还活着的虫子真让我宽心。<hpage>酒保先生，劝你最好待在屋内。这新的诅咒连我的甲壳都扛不住。<page>您说的对，您要乐意也可以留下。喝几盏蜜露压压惊……不过看这地动山摇的架势，怕得喝光我的存货才够压惊的。
translated_text: ああ、旅行者!外の土地は取り壊されたばかりで、生きている人を見るのは素晴らしい。<hpage>この新しい呪いは私の強化されたシェルを脅かす。あなた自身の安全のために、私は強くあなた自身の壁の中にとどまることをお勧めします。<page>はい、OK、それを歓迎します。残って、数発の甘露で悩みを洗い流すしかし、それらの振動の規模を考えると、もっと振動が必要かもしれないと思います。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, traveler! The land outside has just been demolished and it's great to see people alive.<hpage>This new curse threatens my enhanced shell. For your own safety, I strongly advise you to stay within your own walls.<page>Yes, OK, I welcome it. Remaining and washing away the troubles with a few bursts of sweat, however, given the scale of those vibrations, I think more vibrations may be needed.

original_en_text: Phew. You’re lookin’ a bit raw there, miss. I’m thinkin’ it’ll take more than my nectar to fix you up.<hpage>A parasite of your land has twisted itself into my shell. Its writhing is causing some discomfort.<hpage>If not for my unique constitution, I suspect it would have already consumed me entirely.<page>Well, don’t be bringing such dangerous things in here! Head to the top of the moors. There’s an old doctor up there hiding in her bell.<page>Her remedies are said to often hurt more’n they help, but given your state, I’d say it’s worth the risk.
original_zh_text: 嚯，您看着不太对劲啊，小姐。光靠我的蜜露，可治不了您这毛病。<hpage>我的甲壳里钻入了寄生物，它的蠕动使我不太舒服。<hpage>若不是体质特殊，我可能早被啃噬干净了。<page>啊，别把这种危险的玩意带到我这来！赶紧去沼泽的顶部，那里有一位老医生！她躲在一口钟里。<page>虽说她开的药往往比疾病本身的危害还大，但您这状况值得赌一把。
translated_text: ああ、あなたは少し原始的に見えます。私の甘露だけでは治せないと思います。<hpage>あなたの土地の寄生虫は私の殻にねじ込まれました。その歪みは不快感を引き起こした。<hpage>私の体質がなければ、私を完全に飲み込んでいたでしょう。<page>そんな危険なものを持ち込まないで!荒野の頂上へ。時計の中には老婆が隠れている。<page>彼女の治療法はしばしばより有害であると言われていますが、あなたの状況を考えると、リスクを取る価値があると思います。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, you look a bit primitive. I don't think my sweat alone can cure it.<hpage>The parasites of your land have been twisted into my shell. That distortion caused some discomfort.<hpage>If it weren't for my physique, they would have completely swallowed me up.<page>Don't bring anything so dangerous! To the top of the wilderness. Inside the clock is an old woman.<page>Her treatment is often said to be more harmful, but given your situation, I think it's worth the risk.

original_en_text: <hpage>Bartender, I’ve been tasked to acquire a nectar of significant age. Would you retain any such drink?<page>After the finer stuff, eh? Sure, I might have a few vessels left, but I can’t be selling ‘em cheap.<page>The shells in my cellar are the last left in Pharloom. Once they’re gone, no bug’ll ever taste such sweetness again.
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，我在找储存多年的蜜露。你这儿可有存货？<page>嘴巴越来越刁了，小姐？我这应该还剩几瓶，但价钱可不便宜。<page>我地窖里的存货可是纺络最后的陈酿。喝完之后，再也没有虫子能享受到此等蜜酿咯。
translated_text: <hpage>バーテンダー、私の仕事は成熟した蜜を得ることです。この飲み物は保存しますか？<page>より良いことを経験した後、えっ？もちろん、船はまだ残っているかもしれませんが、安く売ることはできません。<page>私の地下室の貝殻はファルに残っている最後のものです。一度消えたら、虫はもう甘い味を味わうことはない。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Bartender, my job is to get the honey ripe. Do you want to store this drink?<page>after experiencing something better, huh? Of course, the ship may still be left, but it cannot be sold cheaply.<page>The shell in my basement is the last thing left in the fal. Once they disappear, the insects no longer taste the sweet taste.

original_en_text: <hpage>Another time, perhaps. Among the few gifts of my birth, I find rare need for sustenance.<page>S’at so? Well the nectar’s always on tap if you find yourself feelin’ different.
original_zh_text: <hpage>改日吧。我这副躯壳生来特殊，少有饥渴之时。<page>这样吗？蜜露随时管够，想来一盏就招呼我一声。
translated_text: <hpage>次に、私が生まれながらに持っていた数少ない才能の中で、私は損益分岐を維持するためにほとんど必要としないことに気づきました。<page>そうですか？あなた自身が違うと感じたら、甘露はすぐに利用できます。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Secondly, I realized that of the few talents I was born with, I needed little to maintain a break-even.<page>is that right? If you yourself feel different, honey is readily available.

original_en_text: <page>Thinkin’ again on the Vintage Nectar?<page>My price might seem steep, but I assure you, the few finer bugs who passed used to pay a lot more.
original_zh_text: <page>还惦记着陈年蜜露？<page>别看我现在出的价高，之前路过的阔绰顾客给得更多呢！
translated_text: <page>またサミーを取り戻したいですか？<page>私のコストは高く見えるかもしれませんが、私はあなたに保証します、過去に行われたより良い間違いのいくつかは、より多くの報酬を得ました。
secondary_translated_text: <page>do you want to get sammy back?<page>My costs may seem high, but I assure you, some of the better mistakes made in the past have earned more rewards.

original_en_text: Any chance you’d reconsider dealing with my blasted craw problem? I’d offer fair reward for your efforts.
original_zh_text: 真不打算帮我收拾房顶上的麻烦？酬劳保证让您满意。
translated_text: 私の嫌な質問をもう一度考えてください。私はあなたの努力に公正な報酬を与えます。
secondary_translated_text: Please think again about my nasty question. I will reward you fairly for your efforts.

original_en_text: Traveller, I’m not wanting to impose, but I’ve a wish that one of your able sort could likely grant.<hpage>I’ve my own task to attend, good sir, but I’ll hear you out.<page>It’s those blasted craws atop here. My roof is fast becoming their cosy nest! Now they’ve grown so bold they’re starting to attack pilgrims as they pass.<hpage>Would you simply have them slain? If so, your sturdy shell seems more than up to that task?<page>If only it were so simple. Kill the ones above, and more just keep coming. It’s the warmth of this home you see. Draws ‘em right in.<page>I’m looking for a long-term solution. A scarecraw! I’ll build the biggest there’s ever been, so fearsome it’ll keep those craws away for good!
original_zh_text: 旅行者，本不该劳烦您，但有件事非得您这样的利落角色才能办。<hpage>虽然我还有自己的事要去做，但请说吧，先生。<page>您看到房顶上那群腐囊虫了吗？它们快把我这儿当成自己的窝了！最近胆子越来越肥，已经开始攻击过路的朝圣者了。<hpage>你是想直接把它们杀光？看你这身强健的躯壳，办这事应该不费劲吧？<page>要这么简单就好了。杀完一茬又来一茬，全怪我这酒馆太暖和，招虫子。<page>得想个一劳永逸的办法——扎个巨型稻草人！保准吓得它们再不敢靠近！
translated_text: 旅行者、私は他人に押し付けたくないが、私はあなたの能力のある人々がそれを達成することを望む願いがある。<hpage>私には自分の仕事がありますが、あなたの話を聞きます。<page>上のクソカニ。私の屋根はすぐに彼らの隠れ家になります!彼らは大胆になり、通り過ぎる巡礼者を攻撃し始めた。<hpage>単純に殺すのか？もしそうなら、あなたの頑丈なシェルはこのタスクに十分に見えるでしょうか？<page>それだけシンプルであればいいのに。上の者を殺せば、さらに多くの者が来る。この家の暖かさを見てください。直接引き付けます。<page>私は長期的な解決策を探している。かかし!私は今までに作られた最大のものを作ります。とても恐ろしいので、カニから永遠に離れてしまいます!
secondary_translated_text: Traveler, I don't want to force others, but I have a wish that you will be able to achieve it.<hpage>I have my own job, but I'll listen to you.<page>The fucking crabs above. My roof will soon be their hideout! " They became bold and began to attack passing pilgrims.<hpage>do you want to kill them? If so, does your rugged shell look good enough for this task?<page>I wish it were that simple. If you kill the one above, many more will come. Look at the warmth of this house. It attracts directly.<page>I'm looking for a long-term solution. Shake! I'm going to make the biggest thing ever made. It's so scary that I'll be away from the crab forever!

original_en_text: Tis a blessed bit of luck to find this place, eh, sister?<page>The climb’s proved harder than even my best guessin’, but there’s still some vigour left in these old limbs. Doubly so, now I have a belly full of nectar!
original_zh_text: 能找着这酒馆，真算撞大运了！<page>这段攀登比我预想的还要艰难，但我这副老甲壳里仍然残存着些许活力。如今，狠狠灌上几盏蜜露，更是精神倍增！
translated_text: この場所を見つけられてラッキーですよね、シスター。<page>思っていた以上に難しかったですが、古代の手足にはまだ活力が残っています。今、私の胃は蜜でいっぱいです!
secondary_translated_text: You're lucky to find this place, sister.<page>It was harder than I thought, but the ancient limbs still have their vitality. Now my stomach is full of honey! "

original_en_text: Care for a drink, traveller? My nectar’s got a kick that’ll warm your shell in these sodden climes.
original_zh_text: 旅行者，来盏蜜露暖暖身子？这地方湿气重，而我的蜜露最能驱寒。
translated_text: 飲み物はいかがですか、旅人。私の蜜は濡れた場所であなたを暖かく保ちます。
secondary_translated_text: How about a drink, traveler? My honey will keep you warm in a wet place.

original_en_text: Hoy... sister! I’m sat here all bent and bedraggled, but you look fresh as the day you was hatched!<page>How do you fare so well in these drenched and dangerous lands? Maybe you got a secret you could share?<hpage>None that would offer easy aid, good bug. Whatever luck or savvy brought you this far, may it continue on your journey.
original_zh_text: 嘿……小姐！我这破甲壳疼得我直不起腰，你的倒鲜亮得像是刚破卵而出！<page>在这种鬼地方你怎么保养的？有啥秘诀能透露不？<hpage>没有什么秘诀，在这种地方只能靠自己，无论靠的是运气还是智慧。
translated_text: ねえ、シスター!私は泥だらけでここに座っていますが、あなたは孵化した日と同じくらい新鮮に見えます!<page>この湿った危険な土壌でどうやってうまくやっていくのか？秘密があるかもしれません。<hpage>誰も簡単な助け、良い間違いを提供できません。どんな運や理解があなたをここに導いたとしても、それがあなたの旅を続けることを願っています。
secondary_translated_text: Hey, Sister! I'm sitting here muddy, but you look as fresh as the day you hatched! "<page>how do we do well in this wet, dangerous soil? Maybe they have a secret.<hpage>No one can offer easy help, a good mistake. Whatever luck or understanding has led you here, I hope it will continue your journey.

original_en_text: <hpage>For now, bartender, I cannot spare so many rosaries.<page>Suit yourself. Maybe you’d rather a pour of the cheap stuff? Give your shell a kick before you head out into our blighted lands.
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，眼下我拿不出这么多念珠。<page>没关系，那来盏便宜货？出发前给自己壮壮胆。
translated_text: <hpage>バーテンダー、私はそんなに多くのロザリオを取り出すことができません。<page>あなたは安いグラスを注ぎたいですか？被災地に行く前に、貝殻を脱いでください。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Bartender, I can't take out so many Rosaries.<page>Do you want to pour a cheap glass? Before going to the affected area, please remove the shell.

original_en_text: <hpage>My travels took me through a town beside your moors, in a vein of old bells. Its residents are bound upon a vicious thread.<page>Ahh. So Pharloom’s curse has strung’em tight. A frightful thing. Word’d long gone silent from over their way.<hpage>I suggest you pass warning to your patrons, bartender. If they’re travelling the bellside paths, best they give that place wide berth.<page>Aye. I’ll let’em know, traveller, though in these cursed times, does any safe path still exist?
original_zh_text: <hpage>我路过了一个位于古老钟脉里的小镇，就在这片沼泽旁边，那里的居民全被凶恶的丝线缠绕着。<page>啊……纺络的诅咒把那儿的虫子紧紧束缚，可怕得很。那镇上很久就没有音讯传出来过了。<hpage>酒保先生，我建议你提醒客人们，若是要走钟脉边的小道，务必离那地方远点。<page>没问题，旅行者。不过话说回来，如今这世道哪还有安全的路哟。
translated_text: <hpage>私の旅は、古代の鐘がぶら下がっている荒野の隣の町を通っていました。住民は邪悪な手がかりに縛られていた。<page>ああ、ファラムの呪いが彼らを強く結びつけたのだ。恐ろしいことだ。彼らのニュースは沈黙している。<hpage>あなたの顧客に警告することをお勧めしますバーテンダー。時計塔の横の道を進む場合は、その地域から離れた方が良いでしょう。<page>はい、私は彼らに知らせます、この呪われた時代にもかかわらず、旅行者はまだ安全な道があるか？
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>My journey was through a town next to the wilderness, where an ancient bell hung. The inhabitants were bound by an evil clue.<page>Oh, the curse of Pharaoh bound them so strongly. It's horrible. Their news has been silent.<hpage>I recommend you warn your customers, bartender. If you go along the road next to the clock tower, you'd better stay away from the area.<page>Yes, I inform them, despite these cursed times, is there still a safe path for travelers?

original_en_text: Best be visiting that doctor right quick, miss! She’s up there, at the top of the moors, over toward the bellvein.<page>Her methods might be suspect, but you’re lookin’ sorely in need of service.
original_zh_text: 小姐，您最好赶紧去看医生！就在沼泽顶部的钟脉附近。<page>虽然她的治疗方法很是邪乎，但您这身子骨可拖不起。
translated_text: 早く医者に診てもらった方がいい!彼女は荒野の頂上にいて、鐘の脈に向かって歩いていた。<page>彼女の方法に問題があるかもしれませんが、サービスが非常に必要です。
secondary_translated_text: You better see a doctor soon! " She was at the top of the wilderness, walking toward the pulse of the bell.<page>You may have a problem with her way, but she needs a service very much.

original_en_text: Might have taken me a beat to build the courage, but I can feel it, closer now... the Citadel calling me up.
original_zh_text: 我可能得多喝点才能鼓足勇气，继续上路了。但我能感觉到，圣堡离我更近了……它在顶上呼唤我呢。
translated_text: 勇気を出すにはビートが必要かもしれないが、今はもっと近くにいるのを感じている城が私を呼んでいる。
secondary_translated_text: It may take a beat to get the courage, but now the castle is calling me, which I feel closer to.

original_en_text: <hpage>Here is the Ragpelt, sir. I hope the amount is sufficient for your work.<page>Aye. This should be enough. Once I find a quiet moment, I’ll get straight to building that mighty scarecraw.<page>With a little luck, my roof should be clear of those pests when next you pass by. Thank you kindly, traveller!
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，这些是你要的破毛皮。希望足够帮你制作稻草人。<page>够了够了！等我腾出手就去扎稻草人。<page>运气好的话，待你下次路过时，房顶应该已经清静了。衷心感谢你，旅者！
translated_text: <hpage>こちらはラグフェルトです。あなたの仕事に十分なお金があることを願う。<page>はい、これで十分です。静かな瞬間を見つけたら、すぐにあの強大なかかしを作りに行きます。<page>運が良ければ、次に私の屋根を通り過ぎたときに害虫はいないでしょう。ありがとう、旅人さん!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>This is Ragfeldt. I hope you have enough money for your work.<page>Yes, this is enough. When I find a quiet moment, I immediately go to make that mighty heel.<page>If you're lucky, there won't be any pests next time you pass my roof. Thank you, traveler!

original_en_text: If you’re collecting Ragpelt from the crawbugs, those young’ns above here’ll be slim pickings. It’s the mature craws you want, over by the watermound. They’ll drop the stuff a-plenty.<page>Course, you’ll need to do some pointed persuading if you’re planning to separate rag from bug...
original_zh_text: 要收集腐囊虫的破毛皮，房顶那些小崽子可不够用。去水丘旁边找成年腐囊虫，它们身上有更多的货。<page>当然，你得用点“尖锐”的手段，才能让它们乖乖交出毛皮……
translated_text: ザリガニの砂の殻を集めている場合は、上記の子牛がいくつかの選択肢になります。これはあなたが望む成熟したカニです水の丘のすぐ隣ですたくさん投げています<page>もちろん、ぼろと虫を区別することを計画すれば、ある種のターゲットを絞った説得が必要になります。
secondary_translated_text: If you are collecting the sand shells of the crab, the calves mentioned above will be several options. This is the mature crab you want, right next to the water hill, throwing lots of it.<page>Of course, if you plan to distinguish between debris and bugs, you'll need some sort of targeted persuasion.

original_en_text: You’re back, miss! Heard a little commotion below. I trust everything went... erm, smoothly?<hpage><hpage>Sir, your cellar seems to have an ant problem. I assume, in sending me down, it merely slipped your mind to mention?<page>Ah... Oh yes! Well, with your weapon, and talent, and what... I’m sure they didn’t pose a problem? Ahem.<page>And why! I see you’ve collected your prize, so we’ve both come out well from the trade!<page>Enjoy your nectar, miss. No simple pilgrim will ever taste a drop so fine.
original_zh_text: 小姐，您回来啦！底下动静不小……没出什么岔子吧？<hpage><hpage>先生，你家地窖闹蚂蚁，怎么不提前知会？<page>哎！您这身手……小小蚂蚁肯定不在话下嘛！是吧？<page>啊哈！我看您也得到了战利品，这笔交易对咱们双方都算得上圆满！<page>小姐，好好享受这瓶蜜露吧。这滋味普通的朝圣者可尝不着。
translated_text: 帰ってきたよ、お嬢さん!そこで暴動が聞こえた。もう終わったと思う大丈夫ですか？<hpage><hpage>あなたの地下室には蟻の問題があるようです。私を降ろした時に言い忘れたのでしょう？<page>あっ...。ああ、そうだ!武器や才能などを使ってください本当に問題はなかったのでしょうか。咳をする<page>なんで!受賞したと思いますので、もう大丈夫です!<page>お酒を楽しんでください。これほど美味しい一滴を味わうことはできません。
secondary_translated_text: You're home, little girl! I could hear the riots there. you think it's over, okay?<hpage><hpage>There seems to be an ant problem in your basement. you forgot to tell me when you dropped me off?<page>ah... Oh, yes! Use your weapons, talents, etc. Was there really no problem? Coughing.<page>why! I think I won the prize, so I'm fine!<page>Please enjoy your drink. You can't taste a drop more delicious.

original_en_text: Ahh. Fair enough, traveller. You’ve clearly got your own tasks to be on with. I’ll manage, no doubt.
original_zh_text: 唉，理解理解。你毕竟有要事在身，我再想想办法吧。
translated_text: それは公正です、旅行者。明らかにあなた自身のタスクがあります。私は間違いなくそれを処理します。
secondary_translated_text: That's fair, traveler. Obviously you have your own tasks. I'll definitely handle it.

original_en_text: As payment goes, I’ve got something I think you’d make good use of. A spare crafting kit.<page>I’d been holding onto it for someone else, but they’ve been gone long enough now, I know they won’t be returning.
original_zh_text: 酬劳的话，我这有个东西，您应该能用得上——一个多余的制作匣。<page>本来这是要留给别人的，但那位怕是已经回不来了。
translated_text: 支払いが進むにつれて、私はあなたが非常に活用できると思うものがあります。予備生産キット。<page>私は他の人のためにそれを予約していますが、彼らは十分に長くいないので、戻ってこないことを知っています。
secondary_translated_text: As the payments go along, I think there are some that you can take great advantage of. Pre-production kit.<page>I've reserved it for others, but I know they won't come back because they're not here long enough.

original_en_text: <hpage>Thank you sir. This is a worthy trade for my work. My tools shall attain an even sharper edge.
original_zh_text: <hpage>多谢先生。这东西对我很有帮助，我的工具将更加锋锐。
translated_text: <hpage>ありがとうございましたこれは私の仕事にとって価値のある取引です。私のツールはより鋭いエッジを取得します
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Thank you, this is a valuable deal for my job. My tools get sharper edges.

original_en_text: My sore shell will cease tormenting me once I reach the Citadel. It’s sung that all ails are healed just as soon as we step beyond the Grand Gate...
original_zh_text: 现在疼就疼点吧，等我到达圣堡，这一切都不是问题了。据说所有的痛苦都会在迈入巨扉圣门后烟消云散……
translated_text: 城に着くと、痛みの殻はもはや私を苦しめませんでした。私たちがこの扉をくぐると、すべての病気は治ると言われていますが。
secondary_translated_text: When I arrived at the castle, the shell of pain no longer tormented me. Although it is said that when we pass through this door, all diseases will be cured.

original_en_text: Aye. A fair trade. The aged stuff’s down at the bottom of the cellar.<page>I’ll trust you to collect only the vessel you’re owed. I’d be grabbing it myself, but it’s become a hard climb for my stiffened shell.
original_zh_text: 好嘞，成交。陈酿在地窖最底层。<page>我这副甲壳现在僵硬了不少，不方便上上下下的。劳烦您自个儿去取。我相信您是不会多拿的，对吧？
translated_text: はい、それは公正な取引です。古いものは地下室の底にある。<page>あなたが値するボートを得ることを願っています。私は自分でそれをキャッチしますが、私の硬い殻のために難しくなります。
secondary_translated_text: Yes, it's a fair deal. The old ones are at the bottom of the basement.<page>Hope you get the boat you deserve. I catch it myself, but it's harder because of my hard shell.

original_en_text: S’only those few stronger pilgrims that survive to reach my home now... Pharloom’s curse claims the rest. Poor sods, left to wander.<page>I do sometimes get to wondering... Is it the dregs of their own mind in there keepin’em walking, or something else entirely...?
original_zh_text: 如今能来到我这儿的，大多是足够强大的朝圣者……剩下的都被纺络的诅咒害成游魂了。<page>我有时候会想……是他们自己残存的意识在支撑行走呢，还是别的什么鬼东西在作祟……？
translated_text: 少数の強力な巡礼者だけが生き残り、私の家に到着しました。ファウルの呪いは残りを奪った。かわいそうな男は、取り残された。<page>時々本当に考えます。彼ら自身の思考のクズが彼らを歩かせるのか、それとも全く別のものか。
secondary_translated_text: Only a few powerful pilgrims survived and arrived at my house. The curse of the foul took the rest. The poor man was left behind.<page>Sometimes I really think about. Does the crap of their own thinking make them walk, or something else entirely?

original_en_text: Bellhart, over the moors, a great town I’ve heard it once was, heart of the path’n all, right smack in the middle of these midlands.<page>Now it’s all a’crumble... And that brittle vein of bells is crawling with nasties. Ain’t no place left in Pharloom that can fairly claim to offer safety.
original_zh_text: 这片沼泽上方的钟心镇，当年可是个了不得的地方。位于整个中部地区的腹地，被称为朝圣之路的“心脏”。<page>如今全垮了……那儿的钟脉里爬满脏东西。纺络早没安全地界啦。
translated_text: 荒野の中にあるベルハルトは、かつては素晴らしい町だったと聞いています。道路の中心部はこれらの中心部の真ん中にありました。<page>今や全てが崩壊してしまったもろい時計静脈にミミズが覆われている。ファラムには安全を提供できると主張できる場所はない。
secondary_translated_text: I have heard that Berhardt, in the wilderness, was once a wonderful town. The center of the road was in the middle of these centers.<page>The fragile clock veins, where everything has now collapsed, are covered with worms. There is no place in the pharam that can claim to provide security.

original_en_text: You visited them pens up above here, miss? Horrid place, once all about growing meat or some such. Meant to keep us moorbugs livin’, and working, its told...<page>That damned place’s long gone to the Haunting. And now the meat’s running feral and free.
original_zh_text: 小姐，去过上头那个养殖场没？可怕的地方。早先是搞正经蟑螂肉养殖的——为了喂饱我们这些沼泽虫，好让我们认真工作……<page>那鬼地方早被丝咒侵占了。现在，养的蟑螂全都跑出来撒野。
translated_text: 上のフェンスを見ましたか？一番怖かったのは、肉の栽培でした。私たち沼虫は生きて働くことができることを教えてくれました。<page>その地獄は幽霊の場所に消えてしまった。肉は野生で自由です。
secondary_translated_text: Did you see the fence above? The most frightening thing was the cultivation of meat. We swampworms have taught us that we can live and work.<page>That hell has disappeared into the place of the ghosts. Meat is wild and free.

original_en_text: Welcome back, traveller. How’d you get along with collecting the Ragpelt from those mangy crawbugs? Their squawking and crooing up there is starting to wear mightily on my patrons!
original_zh_text: 旅行者，你回来啦？破毛皮收集得怎么样？屋顶上叽叽喳喳吵个没完，我的老顾客们都要跑光了！
translated_text: お帰りなさい、旅人。汚れたザリガニから砂利を集めるのはどんな感じですか？彼らの泣き声とうめき声がお客様に強く影響し始めました!
secondary_translated_text: Welcome home, traveller. How does it feel to collect gravel from a dirty crab? Their cries and moans began to have a strong effect on our customers!

translated_text: お酒を買う？
secondary_translated_text: buy some wine?

original_en_text: Hmm, holding on to them, eh? I won’t ask why, but I’d sure appreciate it if you reconsider.
original_zh_text: 嗯……不打算交给我？虽然不知道原因，但求您发发善心，再考虑考虑。
translated_text: いいか、捕まえてね？理由は分かりませんが、考え直していただければ幸いです。
secondary_translated_text: okay, we're gonna catch it. I don't know why, but I hope you can reconsider.

original_en_text: Planning to grab that Vintage Nectar? You passed a fair bundle of rosaries for the bottle, so I figured you’ll be eager to see it yours.<page>The old stuff’s down there, at the bottom of the cellar. I’ll keep the trap open for you, just be swift.
original_zh_text: 准备去取陈年蜜露了吗？您可为它付了不少念珠，我想您肯定也急着将它收入囊中。<page>陈酿在地窖的底层，地窖门给您开着，麻烦您手脚麻利点。
translated_text: そのレトロな甘露を取るつもりですか？ロザリオの山を身に着けてボトルを買いに行くので、ボトルを見るのが好きだと思います。<page>古いものは地下室の底にありました。私はあなたのために罠を開き、迅速に行動します。
secondary_translated_text: Are you going to take that retro honeydew? I think I like to look at the bottles because I dress up in the mountain of the Rosary and go to buy the bottles.<page>The old one was at the bottom of the basement. I will open the trap for you and act quickly. "

original_en_text: Harh! Well met, traveller. Lookin’ for a drink, or a rest, or both?<hpage>Fair greetings, good bug. The warmth of your hearth is welcome upon these wet plains.<page>Aye. It’s a damp climb through these parts. Used to be just pilgrims trekkin’ my way, but odd times these are, and you ain’t even the strangest shell wandering about.<page>A rowdy old warrior stopped through not long back, caused quite a scene, and now a young lass’s taken up lodging in my top room.<page>The lass mentioned she’s on the lookout for sharp types like yourself. Maybe pay her a visit, if you haven’t already?
original_zh_text: 哈！贵客临门。想来盏蜜露，还是歇个脚，或者两样都要？<hpage>这地方真是不错。这湿漉漉的平原上，最缺你这里暖烘烘的炉火。<page>是啊，这地界爬上来可不容易。早先只有朝圣者路过，如今世道古怪，连您这副稀罕甲壳都到处晃悠。<page>前阵子有个老战士在我这儿闹腾得欢，这几天顶层客房又住进个小姑娘。<page>那姑娘正想找您这样的利落角色，有空不妨上楼瞧瞧？
translated_text: はぁ!こんにちは、旅人さん。お酒を飲むか、休憩するか、または両方。<hpage>こんにちは、良い虫です。これらの湿った平原では、暖炉の暖かさが歓迎されます。<page>はい、これらの地域を通る湿った登りです。かつては私の道をハイキングする巡礼者だけでしたが、今では奇妙なことに、あなたは最も奇妙な貝殻でさえありません。<page>少し前に騒々しい退役軍人が騒ぎを起こすために立ち止まり、今は小さな女の子が私の最上階の部屋で寝ています。<page>彼女はあなたのような繊細な人を探していると言った。まだ会っていないのなら、訪ねてみてもいいですか？
secondary_translated_text: yeah! Hello, fellow traveler. Drink, take a break, or both.<hpage>Hello, you are a good bug. In these damp plains, the warmth of a fireplace is welcome.<page>Yes, it's a wet climb through these areas. Once upon a time you were only a pilgrim hiking my path, but now, strangely enough, you are not even the strangest shell.<page>A little while ago a noisy veteran stopped to make a fuss, and now a little girl is sleeping in my upstairs room.<page>She said she was looking for someone as sensitive as you. If you haven't seen it yet, can you visit?

original_en_text: Excellent, excellent! Let’s give those mangy craws the fright of their lives! Hah!<page>All I need is some Ragpelt from the crawbugs themselves. Hunt ‘em down, collect their pelts, and bring me back a heap of the stuff. I’ll do the rest!
original_zh_text: 好极了！让那群臭腐囊虫见识见识，什么叫吓破胆！哈！<page>我需要腐囊虫身上的破毛皮作为材料。劳烦您宰些腐囊虫，取一些它们的破毛皮来。剩下的交给我！
translated_text: すごい!すごい!すごい!かさぶたに苦しむ人たちに恐ろしい人生を送りましょう!はぁ!<page>私は小さなロブスター自身の肉が必要です。彼らを追跡し、毛皮を集め、私にたくさんのものを持って来なさい。残りは俺がやる!
secondary_translated_text: great! great! great! Let's give a horrible life to those who suffer from scabies! yeah!<page>I need my own little lobster meat. Track them down, collect the fur, and bring me lots of things. " I'll do the rest!

original_en_text: The sooner you’ve collected that Ragpelt, the better. I can’t have those pests killing more potential guests.<page>Business is slow enough already, and clearing corpses ain’t no fun at all.
original_zh_text: 赶紧把破毛皮弄来吧，越快越好。不能再让它们杀害我的潜在客户们了。<page>本来生意就不算好，收拾虫尸还费劲！
translated_text: 早くゴミを集めるほど良い。これらの害虫が潜在的なゲストを殺すことはできません。<page>ビジネスは十分に遅く、死体を片付けるのは楽しくない。
secondary_translated_text: The sooner the trash is collected, the better. These pests can't kill any potential guests, but they can't.<page>Business is slow enough, and it's not fun to clean up the corpses.

original_en_text: Wantin’ for a drink, traveller? Might soon be the end for all’o us, so no need to go easy on the nectar.
original_zh_text: 旅行者，要来喝一盏吗？反正大伙都快完蛋了，今朝有蜜今朝醉噢。
translated_text: 飲み物はいかがですか、旅人。私たち全員の終わりはすぐに来るかもしれないので、蜜についてあまりリラックスする必要はありません。
secondary_translated_text: How about a drink, traveler? There is no need to relax too much about honey, as the end for all of us may come soon.

original_en_text: <hpage>Barkeep, I have seen your request on the bell town’s wishwall. What assistance are you seeking?<page>Ah! Perfect! You’re the able sort that’ll make short work of the task.<page>The problem is those blasted craws atop here. My roof is fast becoming their cosy nest! Now they’ve grown so bold they’re starting to attack pilgrims as they pass.<hpage>Would you simply have me slay them? Your sturdy shell seems more than up to that task.<page>If only it were so simple. Kill the ones above and more just keep coming. It’s the warmth of this home you see. Draws ‘em right in.<page>I’m looking for a long-term solution. A scarecraw! I’ll build the biggest there’s ever been, so fearsome it’ll keep those craws away for good!<page>All I need is some Ragpelt from the crawbugs themselves. Hunt ‘em down, collect their pelts, and bring me back a heap of the stuff. I’ll do the rest!
original_zh_text: <hpage>酒保先生，我看见钟心镇祈愿墙上有你的委托。所为何事？<page>啊！太好了！可算找着行家了！<page>您看到房顶上那群腐囊虫了吗？它们快把我这儿当成自己的窝了！最近胆子越来越肥，已经开始攻击过路的朝圣者了。<hpage>你是想直接把它们杀光？看你这身强健的甲壳，办这事应该不费劲吧？<page>要这么简单就好了。杀完一茬又来一茬，全怪我这酒馆太暖和，招虫子。<page>得想个一劳永逸的办法——扎个巨型稻草人！保准吓得它们再不敢靠近！<page>我需要腐囊虫身上的破毛皮作为材料。劳烦您宰些腐囊虫，取一些它们的破毛皮来。剩下的交给我！
translated_text: <hpage>バーテンダー、ベルタウンのウィッシュウォールであなたのリクエストを見ました。どんな助けを求めていますか？<page>あっ! あっ!完璧だ!あなたは物事を素早く成し遂げることができるタイプです。<page>問題は上のクソカニです。私の屋根はすぐに彼らの隠れ家になります!彼らは大胆になり、通り過ぎる巡礼者を攻撃し始めた。<hpage>私に殺させてくれるの？あなたの頑丈なシェルは完全に機能するようです。<page>それだけシンプルであればいいのに。上の者を殺せば、さらに多くの者が来る。この家の暖かさを見てください。直接引き付けます。<page>私は長期的な解決策を探している。かかし!私は今までに作られた最大のものを作ります。とても恐ろしいので、カニから永遠に離れてしまいます!<page>私は小さなロブスター自身の肉が必要です。彼らを追跡し、毛皮を集め、私にたくさんのものを持って来なさい。残りは俺がやる!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Bartender, I saw your request at the Wish Wall in Beltown. What kind of help are you seeking?<page>ah! ah! perfect! You are the type who can get things done quickly.<page>The problem is the fucking crabs up there. My roof will soon be their hideout! " They became bold and began to attack passing pilgrims.<hpage>you're gonna let me kill you? Your sturdy shell seems to be working perfectly.<page>I wish it were that simple. If you kill the one above, many more will come. Look at the warmth of this house. It attracts directly.<page>I'm looking for a long-term solution. Shake! I'm going to make the biggest thing ever made. It's so scary that I'll be away from the crab forever!<page>I need my own little lobster meat. Track them down, collect the fur, and bring me lots of things. " I'll do the rest!

original_en_text: Hooked tool for the forceful retrieval of loot from bugs and husks.<br><br>Harpoon into foes to steal rosaries and shell shards, while causing additional damage.

translated_text: 記憶機能を持つ反射石。<br><br>損傷すると、持ち主の記憶はクリスタルによって形成される。敵がそれに触れると、記憶は鋭いとげに粉砕されます。

original_zh_text: 精密的织者装置，通过音乐共振增强演奏效果。<br><br>增强并扩大织忆弦针的效果范围。
translated_text: 複雑なウィーバー装備。演奏される音楽に共鳴し、パフォーマンスを増幅し強化します。<br><br>Nedolinの効果を拡大し、増強する。
secondary_translated_text: Complicated weaver equipment. It resonates with the music being played, amplifying and enhancing the performance.<br><br>Expand and enhance the effect of Nedolin.

original_en_text: Fabric pouch filled with volatile material.<br><br>Explodes on impact with enemies or when ignited by its fuse.
original_zh_text: 填充易爆材料的织物囊。<br><br>撞击敌人或引燃导火索时会爆炸。
translated_text: 揮発性物質でいっぱいのバッグ。<br><br>敵と衝突したり、ヒューズに点火されると爆発する。
secondary_translated_text: A bag full of volatile substances.<br><br>It can explode when it collides with an enemy or is ignited by a fuse.

original_en_text: Ornate artefact of the Citadel, able to hold a Bind’s worth of Silk. Used when healing is needed and one’s natural resources run low.<br><br>The Reserve Bind will be restored when resting at a bench.
original_zh_text: 圣堡华美遗器，可储存完整收缚的灵丝。可在自然灵丝枯竭时用于治疗。<br><br>在长椅休息时自动恢复。
translated_text: ビンダーワース絹を収容できる豪華な城の遺跡。治療が必要で天然資源が不足している場合に使用する。<br><br>ベンチ休憩中はリザーブチームの拘束力が回復する。
secondary_translated_text: The ruins of a sumptuous castle that could house Binderworth silk. It is used when treatment is needed and natural resources are in short supply.<br><br>During the bench break, the reserve team regains its binding power.

secondary_translated_text: mr. sherman.

secondary_translated_text: Flint slate

original_en_text: Icon of the mythical mother flea, passed down from caravans of old. A symbol of protection and kinship.<br><br>Decreases the cost of Silk Skills while health is full.
original_zh_text: 旅团传承的传说跳蚤之母圣像，象征庇护与亲缘。<br><br>生命值全满时降低灵丝技能消耗。
translated_text: ノミの母の神話的な偶像は、古代のキャラバンから受け継がれています。保護と感情の象徴。<br><br>健康ポイントがいっぱいになると、シルクスキルのコストを削減します。
secondary_translated_text: The mythical idol of the mother of fleas has been inherited from the ancient caravans. Symbols of protection and emotion.<br><br>When your health points are full, you will reduce the cost of silk skills.

translated_text: ピミロ
secondary_translated_text: Pimilo

original_en_text: Gleaming apparatus of Weaver make. Its core emits a faint glow.<br><br>Increases the speed of Silk regeneration.
original_zh_text: 织者制造的发光装置，核心散发微光。<br><br>提升灵丝恢复速度。
translated_text: ウィーバーは照明装置を作った。コアは微弱な光を放つ。<br><br>シルクの回収速度を上げる。
secondary_translated_text: Weaver built a lighting device. The core emits a faint light.<br><br>Increase the recovery speed of silk.

original_en_text: Powerful amulet of protection formed from many Mossberries.<br><br>As the bearer takes damage, the amulet weeps a green elixir that will form into Silk.
original_zh_text: 多重苔莓强化的护身符。<br><br>持有者受伤时，护符会渗出可转化为灵丝的绿液。
translated_text: 苔の果実が多く作られた強力なお守り。<br><br>持ち主が怪我をすると、お守りは緑色の万能薬から落ちて絹になります。
secondary_translated_text: A powerful protector made with lots of moss fruits.<br><br>When the owner is injured, the amulet falls from the green panacea and becomes silk.

translated_text: シルクスキルは装備できない。
secondary_translated_text: Silk skills cannot be equipped.

translated_text: 装備スキルセット
secondary_translated_text: Equipment skill set

translated_text: 採取した胆汁
secondary_translated_text: Collected bile.

translated_text: バーブブレスレット
secondary_translated_text: Barb Bracelet

original_en_text: Equip tools for aid in combat or exploration.
original_zh_text: 装备工具以辅助战斗或探索。
translated_text: 戦闘や冒険では道具を装備する。
secondary_translated_text: In combat and adventure, equip yourself with tools.

original_en_text: Heavy band favoured by those with an unsteady step.<br><br>The wearer will recoil less when striking foes and will not be flung as far when taking damage.
original_zh_text: 步履不稳者偏好的重环。<br><br>攻击和受击时不易后退。
translated_text: 重いバンドは不安定なペースの人々に人気がある。<br><br>敵を攻撃する際の反動が減少し、ダメージを受けても遠くに投げられない。
secondary_translated_text: Heavy bands are popular with people with unstable paces.<br><br>It has less reaction when attacking an enemy, and can't be thrown far even after damage.

original_en_text: Talisman fashioned from the talon of a large predator.<br><br>Increases the range of needle attacks.
original_zh_text: 大型掠食者利爪制成的护符。<br><br>增加织针攻击范围。
translated_text: 巨大な捕食者の爪で作られたお守り。<br><br>鍼灸の範囲を広げる。
secondary_translated_text: A talisman made from the claws of a huge predator.<br><br>Broaden the scope of acupuncture.

original_en_text: Shattered flask which once contained an invigorating beverage.<br><br>Acquire more Flea Brew to restore the tool.
original_zh_text: 曾装有活力饮品的破碎瓶。<br><br>需获取更多跳蚤秘酿补充。
translated_text: 壊れたフラスコにはかつて清涼飲料水が入っていた。<br><br>ツールを復元するためにもっとFlea Brewを入手します。
secondary_translated_text: The broken flask once contained a soft drink.<br><br>Get more Flea Brew to restore the tool.

translated_text: リングを投げる。
secondary_translated_text: Throwing the ring.

original_en_text: Ancient weapon of the Weavers, repaired to its original form.<br><br>Uses shell canisters and the wielder’s own Silk to fire.
original_zh_text: 修复至原始形态的织者古兵器。<br><br>需消耗甲壳罐与使用者的灵丝发射。
translated_text: 古い武器は元の形に戻った。<br><br>貝殻缶と所有者自身のシルクを使用して撮影した写真。
secondary_translated_text: The old weapon returned to its original form.<br><br>Photograph taken using a shell can and the owner's own silk.

translated_text: 円柱ピン
secondary_translated_text: Cylindrical Pin

original_en_text: Spin the needle as a screw, shredding foes. Spend Silk to rapidly craft new tools.
original_zh_text: 旋转织针撕裂敌人。消耗灵丝快速制作新工具。
translated_text: ネジのように針を回して敵を粉砕する。Flower Silkは新しいツールをすばやく作成します。
secondary_translated_text: They turn the needle like a screw to crush the enemy. Flower Silk creates new tools quickly.

translated_text: メモリクリスタル。
secondary_translated_text: The memory crystal.

original_en_text: Flat, layered weapon, crafted to be thrown in a set.
original_zh_text: 分层扁平武器，可成套投掷。
translated_text: よく作られたフラットでレイヤー化された武器はセットに入れることができる。
secondary_translated_text: A well-crafted flat, layered weapon can be placed in a set.

translated_text: スカイライト
secondary_translated_text: Skylight

original_en_text: The Citadel is calling us, sister! We stand so close. We need only the blessing of those bells to see the Grand Gate open.<hpage>I will awaken the bells, pilgrim. With luck, you will not be waiting long.
original_zh_text: 圣堡在召唤，姊妹！我们只有一步之遥了。只需群钟赐福，巨扉圣门定将开启。<hpage>我会敲响那些巨钟。幸运的话，你们无需久候。
translated_text: お姉さん城が呼んでる!私たちはとても近くに立った。ドアが開くのを見るためには、鐘の祝福が必要です。<hpage>ピルグリム、鐘を起こしたい。運が良ければ、長く待つ必要はありません。
secondary_translated_text: Sister, the castle is calling! We stood so close together. To see the door open, you need the blessing of the bell.<hpage>Pilgrim, I want to wake up the bell. If you're lucky, you don't have to wait long.

original_en_text: Only the holy bells of the great path shall open the way!<page>We beg you, traveller, see the bells awoken, that we may cross this final threshold.
original_zh_text: 只有朝圣途中的圣钟可开启此门！<page>恳求您，旅行者。令众钟苏醒，我们方可越过这最终的门槛。
translated_text: 大通りの聖なる鐘だけが道を切り開くことができる!<page>旅人よ、この最後の敷居を越えることができるように、鐘を鳴らしてください。
secondary_translated_text: Only the sacred bells of the thoroughfares can open the way!<page>Ring the bell, traveler, that we may pass this last threshold. "

original_en_text: Ahhh... the gate! The bells have awoken! All along the path. Now we need only music to see them attuned! <hpage>I have recently learnt the art of producing song by strumming Silk, though I confess it is a skill deserving of more practice.<page>Oh! Ohh! Have no doubt, sister! Play sincerely. Any music is sweet enough! Play for us, and surely the bells will resound! Play, and we will sing!
original_zh_text: 啊……巨门！圣钟皆已苏醒！眼下我们只需奏响音乐，使其共鸣！<hpage>我最近习得以灵丝拨弦成曲的技艺，但仍有些生疏。<page>噢！无需顾虑，姊妹！至诚则灵，凡乐皆美！为我们奏响音乐，圣钟必将回应！演奏吧，我们将为你歌唱！
translated_text: あっ...。ゲートだ!鐘が鳴った!その過程で、今では音楽だけで彼らの調整を見ることができます!<hpage>最近はシルクを演奏して作曲を学びましたが、もっと練習する価値のあるスキルだと思います。<page>おぉ!おぉ!間違いなく、シスター!正直に演奏する。どんな音楽でも甘い!私たちのために演奏し、鐘は鳴る!遊んで歌おう!
secondary_translated_text: ah... the gate! The bell has rung! In the process, you can now see their adjustments in just the music!<hpage>Recently, I learned to play silk and compose, but I think it's a skill worth practicing more.<page>oh! oh! Certainly, sister! I play honestly. Any kind of music is sweet! Play for us, and the bells ring! Let's play and sing!

original_en_text: Ahhh... the Grand Gate! The bells have awoken! <page>We beg you, sister. Play or sing, and we shall follow. Call out to the bells of the path and see the gate open!
original_zh_text: 啊……巨扉圣门！圣钟皆已苏醒！<page>恳求您，姊妹。奏乐咏唱，我们定将跟随你。呼唤圣途钟声，开启此门！
translated_text: あっ...。ゲートだ!鐘が鳴った!<page>お願いしますシスター。演奏したり歌ったりしてフォローします。道の鐘を鳴らして門が開くのを見た!
secondary_translated_text: ah... the gate! The bell has rung!<page>Please, sister. Play and sing and follow along. I rang the road bell and saw the gate open!

original_en_text: We beg you, sister. Delay no further! Play for us. Call out to the bells of the path and see the Grand Gate open!
original_zh_text: 恳求您，姊妹。勿再拖延！为我们奏乐，呼唤圣途钟声，开启巨扉圣门！
translated_text: お願いしますシスター。これ以上遅れるな!私たちのためにドアベルを鳴らしてドアが開くのを見てください!
secondary_translated_text: Please, sister. Don't be late any more! Ring the doorbell for us and watch the door open! "

original_en_text: The gate... the gate! O, the Grand Gate to the Citadel stands before us!<page>We are so close! O mighty ones beyond the gate, we beg you! Open the way and let we poor, insignificant little pilgrims crawl into the light...<hpage>I see no gatekeepers to heed your plea, pilgrim, though I too seek entry to the Citadel. Have you heard of a means to open this gateway?<page>Ahh... Weapons blunt it not. No holes for keys. ‘Tis the bells, they say! The holy bells upon the path that open the way!
original_zh_text: 巨门啊……巨门！通往圣堡的巨扉圣门近在眼前！<page>咫尺之遥！门后的尊者啊，求您垂怜！开启通路，容我等卑微朝圣者遁入圣光……<hpage>看来没有守门者回应答你的祈愿。我也想进入圣堡，你可知道开门的办法？<page>唉……兵刃伤不了分毫，也不见锁孔。只有朝圣途中的圣钟可开启此门！
translated_text: ゲートは、ゲートだ!お城の門が目の前に!<page>こんなに近いんだ!ドアの外の人たちよ、お願いします!私たち哀れな小さな巡礼者のために光の道を開きなさい。<hpage>私も城に入りたかったが、巡礼者の要求に従う門番が見えなかった。この扉の開け方を知っていますか？<page>あっ...。武器はそれを鈍らせない。鍵穴はない。“ベルが鳴っている!聖なる鐘が道にあり、あなたのために道を開く!
secondary_translated_text: The gate, the gate! The gates of the castle are in front of us!<page>It's so close! People outside the door, please! Open up the path of light for us poor little pilgrims.<hpage>I too wanted to enter the castle, but I could not see the gatekeeper obeying the pilgrims' demands. do you know how to open this door?<page>ah... The weapons will not dull it. There are no key holes. "The bell is ringing!" The holy bell is on the way, opening the way for you!

original_en_text: <hpage>I have passed several such bells, pilgrim. I know how to see them woken. Tell me what you know of their locations, and I shall seek those that still remain silent.<page>Sister? This is a mighty service you willingly perform! What a marvellous gift you would grant to your fellows. <page>Eagerly, I shall tell you of the shrines and their locations, as we have heard them spoken...
original_zh_text: <hpage>朝圣者，我途中遇到过多座此类巨钟，也知晓唤醒方法。请告知余下的位置，我这就去寻找未鸣之钟。<page>姊妹？这是何等伟大的侍奉！您对同伴的馈赠真是慷慨！<page>我会悉数告知神殿方位，将我们听闻的消息原封不动地告诉你……
translated_text: <hpage>巡礼者、私はそのような鐘のいくつかを通り過ぎた。目覚めるのを見ることができる。彼らの場所について知っていることを教えてください。黙っている人を探します。<page>お姉さん？これはあなたがボランティアで提供する素晴らしいサービスです!あなたが仲間に贈る素敵な贈り物です。<page>私たちが聞いたように、私は寺院とその場所について詳しく説明します。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Pilgrim, I have passed by some of such bells. I can watch you wake up. Tell me what you know about their location. " I look for those who are silent.<page>your sister? This is a great service you can provide as a volunteer! What a lovely gift you give to your companion.<page>As we have heard, I will give a detailed account of the temple and its location.

original_en_text: The gate... the gate! O, the Grand Gate to the Citadel stands before us!<page>We are so close! O mighty ones beyond the gate, we beg you! Open the way and let we poor, insignificant little pilgrims crawl into the light...<hpage>I see no gatekeepers to heed your plea, pilgrim, though I too would benefit from its opening. Have you heard of a means to pass through?<page>Ahh... Weapons blunt it not. No holes for keys. ‘Tis the bells, they say! The holy bells upon the path that open the way!
original_zh_text: 巨门啊……巨门！圣堡巨扉圣门近在眼前！<page>门后的尊者啊，求您垂怜！开启通路，容我等卑微朝圣者遁入圣光……<hpage>看来没有守门者回应你的祈愿。但开启这道门对我也有好处，你可知道开门的办法？<page>唉……兵刃伤不了分毫，也不见锁孔。只有朝圣途中的圣钟可开启此门！
translated_text: ゲートは、ゲートだ!お城の門が目の前に!<page>こんなに近いんだ!ドアの外の人たちよ、お願いします!私たち哀れな小さな巡礼者のために光の道を開きなさい。<hpage>巡礼者よ、私は門番があなたの要求を聞いているのを見ませんでしたが、私もその開放性から恩恵を受けるでしょう。アクセス方法を聞いたことがあるか。<page>あっ...。武器はそれを鈍らせない。鍵穴はない。“ベルが鳴っている!聖なる鐘が道にあり、あなたのために道を開く!
secondary_translated_text: The gate, the gate! The gates of the castle are in front of us!<page>It's so close! People outside the door, please! Open up the path of light for us poor little pilgrims.<hpage>Pilgrim, I have not seen the gatekeeper listening to your request, but I too will benefit from its openness. Have you ever heard of how to access it?<page>ah... The weapons will not dull it. There are no key holes. "The bell is ringing!" The holy bell is on the way, opening the way for you!

original_en_text: <hpage>On my journey up, I passed many large bells housed in old shrines. Each I have struck awake, yet still this gate stays closed. What other task must be done to see us pass beyond?<page>The bells are rung? Then this sacred threshold may now be crossed, for the final task is simple! Only music, played fair and true. Music shall attune the bells, and see the gate descend.<page>It must be you to lead us, sister! You, who brought this blessing! Play or sing, and we shall follow.
original_zh_text: <hpage>上行途中，我已敲响诸多钟殿内的巨钟，但此门仍然紧闭。还需要怎样的仪式吗？<page>巨钟皆已鸣响？那这神圣门槛便可跨越！最终仪式简单，唯有真诚演奏的音乐，方能使钟声共鸣，引导大门降下。<page>必须由你来引领我们，姊妹！是你带来了这份恩典。演奏或歌唱吧，我们定将跟随你。
translated_text: <hpage>山を登ると、古代寺院の鐘の音がたくさんありました。みんなを起こしたが、ドアは閉まったままだった。それを超えるために達成すべき課題は何でしょうか。<page>鐘が鳴った？最終的なタスクは非常に簡単なので、この神聖なしきい値は今越えられます!音楽だけが、公正かつ真実に演奏される。コンサートの鐘が鳴り、ドアが落ちるのを見た。<page>お姉さん、私たちを導いてくれる!この祝福をもたらす者よ!演奏したり歌ったりしてフォローします。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>As we climbed the mountain, there were many sounds of ancient temple bells. I woke everyone up, but the door remained closed. What are the challenges that need to be accomplished in order to surpass that?<page>the bell rings? The final task is so simple that this sacred threshold is now crossed! Only the music is played fairly and truthfully. I saw the concert bell ring and the door fall.<page>Sister, you will guide us! " You who bring this blessing! Play and sing and follow along.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, I have communed with the shrine above. Your learnings are unique, techniques born of cogwork hearts. Their mastery will require some commitment on my part.<page>Bug-Red, you are the first organic shell to fuse our memories. S-s-s-such behaviour, my line would have believed improbable-impossible. <page>Still, your broad arsenal did suggest strong affinity with the m-m-m-mechanical craft, enough to allow access to our thought-store.<hpage>Yours is an impressive skill, Master. I am grateful for the insight.
original_zh_text: <hpage>大师，我已拜访上方圣像。你们的知识独特，源自机枢之心。需要我专注投入才能掌握。<page>红姑娘是首个融合我等记忆的血肉之躯。这种行为，按我族逻辑本应不-不-不可行。<page>不过您精通各式武具，确实与机械造诣契-契-合，因此决定开放思维秘藏。<hpage>你们的技艺令我叹服。对这份知识，我感激不尽。
translated_text: <hpage>師匠、上の神社にはもう同意しました。あなたの学習はユニークで、認知的思考から派生したテクニックです。彼らの支配には私のコミットメントが必要です<page>バグレッド、あなたは私たちの記憶を統合した最初の有機的なシェルです。私の人々はこのような行為は不可能だと考えています。<page>それでも、あなたの豊富な武器庫は、私たちのイデオロギー的な倉庫に入るのに十分な機械工芸品への親和性を示しています。<hpage>マスター、あなたの技術は本当に印象的です。あなたの洞察力に感謝します。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Master, I have already agreed to the above shrine. Your learning is unique and is a technique derived from cognitive thinking. And their domination requires my commitment to it.<page>Bagdad, you are the first organic shell to integrate our memories. My people think that such an act is impossible. "<page>Even so, your rich arsenal shows enough affinity for mechanical crafts to fit into our ideological warehouse.<hpage>Master, your skill is really impressive. Thank you for your insight.

translated_text: と言う。...告白する。
secondary_translated_text: I said... I confess.

original_en_text: A fine artefact you carry there, Bug-Red. That broken tool, it is Weaver-make? <hpage>I believe so, Master. A relic of their old workshop, lost in fetid caves beyond this Citadel.<hpage>The parts suggest a weapon of thread, one I would attempt to repair myself, had I endless time.<page>An Architect’s work owes much to the art of the f-f-first children. They set expert standard for the tools and talents of Pharloom eternal.<page>If you desire-demand, I can remake the tool, though my own mind-directives may produce u-u-u-nique result.
original_zh_text: 红姑娘，你身上有件特殊遗物。这残器，是织者造物？<hpage>应该是。织者的旧工坊遗物，在圣堡外的腐臭洞窟里发现的。<hpage>看这构造应该是丝刃兵器。若不是时间有限，我倒想尝试修复。<page>建筑师技艺大多继承自初代织者子嗣。他们为永恒圣堡的器-器-具设下典范。<page>如果您有要求，我可以将它重铸，但成品恐怕会带有我的独-独-独特烙印。
translated_text: あなたがそこに持ってきた美しい遺物、赤い虫。その悪い道具は布でできていますか？<hpage>そう思います、マスター。城の外の洞窟の悪臭の中に消えてしまった彼らの古い工房の名残です。<hpage>これらのパーツはワイヤーアームのようなもので、時間があれば自分で修理してみたいと思います。<page>建築家の作品の多くは、彼の最初の子供の芸術に負っています。彼らはPharloomの時代を超越したツールと才能のエキスパートスタンダードを設定します。<page>あなたが望むなら、ツールを再作成することもできますが、私自身のマインドコマンドはu-u-u-u-u-u-niqueの結果を生成するかもしれません。
secondary_translated_text: The beautiful relic you brought there, the red worm. that bad tool is made of cloth?<hpage>I think so, master. It is a remnant of their old workshop that has vanished in the stench of the caves outside the castle.<hpage>These parts are like wire arms, and I'd like to repair them myself if I had time.<page>Much of the architect's work owes to the art of his first children. They set the expert standard for tools and talent that have outperformed the times of the Pharloom.<page>You can also re-create the tool if you want, but my own mind commands might produce u-u - nique results.

original_en_text: An intricate implement of Pharloom’s first children. I can restore-repair the w-w-weapon, though it will bear some trace of my identity-idiom.
original_zh_text: 初代子嗣的精巧造物。我可修-修-复此武具，但会留下我的工造印记。
translated_text: ファロの最初の子供の複雑な道具。私はこの武器を修正することができますが、私のアイデンティティのイディオムの痕跡があります。
secondary_translated_text: The complex tools of Pharaoh's first children. I can fix this weapon, but there are traces of idioms of my identity.

original_en_text: Bug-Red. Do you ask-need our service? We shall create, as is our d-d-directive. To serve, for Pharloom eternal.
original_zh_text: 红姑娘。需要服-服-服务？我将创造，如指-指-指令所示。为永恒圣堡。
translated_text: Bug-Redです。サービスが必要ですか？d-d-ディレクティブと同じように作成します。ファラオにとって、奉仕は不滅です。
secondary_translated_text: It's Bug-Red. Do you need a service? Create it in the same way as the d-d - directive. For Pharaoh, service is immortal.

original_en_text: Speak now. Thy confession will be heard.
original_zh_text: 说吧。你的忏悔将被聆听。
translated_text: 今すぐ話してくれあなたの嘆願は聞かれます。
secondary_translated_text: Speak now, and your plea will be heard.

original_en_text: Hrrr. Hrrrrrrr. Them sounds you make. Of holy sort. When me hear such sounds, me remember of home. Me remember of be little.<page>It make it painful hard to work, such remembers. Me must keep working. Please, friend. Do not make them sounds no more.
original_zh_text: 唔。唔唔唔唔。你弄的响动。像圣歌。让咱想起老家。想起小时候。<page>这些回忆让干活揪心。咱得继续干。朋友，求你别弄这些声了。<page>求你了……别再……
translated_text: Uh.。JA：あなたが作る音聖。この音を聞いて家を思い出しました。若い頃を覚えている。<page>それは仕事を苦痛にした。仕事を続けないと。さあ、友よ。音を立てないでください。
secondary_translated_text: Uh.. The sound you make is holy. When I heard this sound, I remembered my home. I remember my youth.<page>That made the job painful. I have to keep working. Come on, my friend. Please don't make any noise.

original_en_text: My s-s-service to you, Bug-Red... As it concludes, I must speak-confess. Long now I have felt my rotors slow their s-s-spin. My limbs lift weak. An ending is felt, coming, sudden-certain...welcome.<hpage>Whatever fading you feel has not shown in your craft, Master. You have provided tools of immaculate make.<hpage>What will follow if you pass? Would another take your place? <page>One cannot. The skill to construct an Architect... That was taken by t-t-time. I am the last-final. The core remains to sustain the song, but no more Architects to tend-toil or build anew. <page>S-s-strange... ‘For Pharloom eternal,’ states the d-d-directive-cage. But how can eternity sustain without an Architect to serve? This seems e-e-error. An end? An error... welcome?
original_zh_text: 为红姑娘效-效-力的时光……临别前必须坦-坦-白。我的齿轮渐-渐缓，臂膀无力。终结将至，突然但确-确-定……真好。<hpage>即便如此，大师的技艺也并未退步。您造的器具堪称完美。<hpage>您逝去后会怎么样，有后继者接任？<page>没有。锻造建筑师的技艺……早已失-失-失传。我是最后一位。核心尚能使圣歌存续，但再无工匠维缮新建。<page>荒-荒-谬……”为永恒圣堡”的指-指-令仍在。但无工匠何谈永恒？错-错-误？终局？错谬……真好？
translated_text: 私はあなたのために、赤い虫。最後に、告白します。長い間、プロペラの回転速度が遅くなっているのを感じました。手足を持ち上げることができない。エンディングが感じられ、近づいてくると、突然確認して丁寧<hpage>マスター、どんな色あせを感じても、あなたの技術には反映されません。完璧な製造ツールを提供します。<hpage>合格したらどうする？他の人はあなたを置き換えるか。<page>1つはできない。建築家のスキル時間通りに撮影された。私は最後の一人だ。コアはまだ歌の維持にありますが、もはやそれを維持したり再建したりする建築家は必要ありません。<page>奇妙なことに“ファロの不死のために”と双方向のケージは言った。しかし、建築家のサービスなしに、どうやって永遠を保つのでしょうか。それは間違っているようだ。終わりか？間違いです。ようこそ？
secondary_translated_text: I am for you, red bug. Lastly, I confess. For a long time, I felt the rotation speed of the propeller slowing down. He cannot lift his arms and legs. When the end is felt and approaching, suddenly check and carefully<hpage>Master, no matter how much fading you feel, it will not be reflected in your skill. It provides the perfect manufacturing tool.<hpage>what happens if you pass? Will someone else replace you?<page>One cannot do. The architect's skills were shot on time. I am the last one. " The core is still in the maintenance of the song, but we no longer need an architect to maintain it or rebuild it.<page>Strangely, "For the immortality of Pharaoh," said the two-way cage. But how can we keep it eternal without the services of the architect? That seems to be wrong. it's over? It's a mistake. welcome?

original_en_text: Hrr. Hrrrrr. Who is there? Me can not... can not clear see....<hpage>At ease, large one. I am no danger to you.<page>Hrrrrr? Hrrrr! Me see you now! So clean, so lively... Surely you did come from above! Me time has come at last! Me work is done. You come to bring me up! Up, up! Hrrr!<hpage>You mistake me. I am no resident of the Citadel. I am a stranger here, though no foe to you.<page>Hrrr. Hrrrrrrrrr. S-stranger? Me grave mistaken. Forgive me, thems above, for me unworthy hope! Of course, me work is not done! Harder, harder! Me must work harder!
original_zh_text: 唔。唔唔唔。谁？咱看不清……看不清……<hpage>别慌，大块头。我不是你的敌人。<page>唔唔？唔唔！看清你了！这么干净鲜活……肯定是从上层来的！咱终于等到！咱完工了！你是来接咱上去的！上去！唔唔！<hpage>你误会了，我不是圣堡居民，只是旅者。但也不是你的敌人。<page>唔。唔唔唔唔。旅……旅者？咱大错特错。宽恕咱吧，上边的大人们！咱痴心妄想！咱当然还没完工！加把劲！咱得加把劲！
translated_text: ハ。そこにいるのは誰？私は..。よく見えないわ<hpage>心配するな、ビッグ。私はあなたに危険はない。<page>え？えっ？え~!今見たよ!とても清潔で活発です。あなたは上から来たに違いない!ついに私の時間が来た!私の仕事は終わったあなたは私の成長を助けるためにここにいる!立ち上がれ!立ち上がれ!え~!<hpage>誤解している。城の住人ではない。私はあなたの敵ではないけれども、私はここで見知らぬ人です。<page>ああ、ああ、ああ。見知らぬ人？私は重大な過ちを犯した。許してください、それは私に価値のない希望を与えます!もちろん、私の仕事はまだ終わっていません!頑張れ、頑張れ!もっと頑張らないと!
secondary_translated_text: Ha. who's in there? I'm not... I can't see it.<hpage>Don't worry, Big. I am no danger to you.<page>what? what? yeah! i just saw it! Very clean and active. You must have come from above! " My time has finally come! My job is over You are here to help me grow! stand up! stand up! yeah!<hpage>They misunderstand me. Not the inhabitants of the castle. I am not your enemy, but I am a stranger here.<page>Oh, oh, oh, oh. a stranger? I have made a serious mistake. Forgive me, it gives me hope that is worthless! Of course, my job is not over yet! Keep going, keep going! I have to work harder!

original_en_text: Bug-Red. Do you ask-need our services, even n-now? Our duty is l-l-long, but we shall create for you, if you require it...
original_zh_text: 红姑娘。此刻仍需要服-服-服务？职责已尽，但如果您需要，仍可制-制造……
translated_text: Bug-Redです。今すぐサービスが必要ですか？私たちの責任は長いですが、必要な場合は作成します。
secondary_translated_text: It's Bug-Red. Do you need a service now? Our responsibilities are long, but we will create if necessary.

original_en_text: If Bug-Red could prove their aptitude with our implements, and others like, I would offer my key, to grant access to the chapel-store above.
original_zh_text: 如果红姑娘能证-证-明精通我等器械，我将献上钥匙，用以开启上方圣堂库房。
translated_text: Bug-Redが他の人たちと同じように私たちのツールで彼らの能力を証明できれば、私は私の鍵を提供し、上記の教会の店へのアクセスを許可します。
secondary_translated_text: If Bug-Red can prove their abilities with our tools as well as the others, I will provide my keys and grant access to the shop of the above church.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, I seek a melody held by your line, one part of a sequence and key to ascending above the Citadel. Can you teach it to me?<page>Our melody? I r-r-recall! Yes! There was melody, once, but its sound... that I possess no longer...<page>T-t-t-too long I have worked. From my mind-vault, the imprint has f-f-faded. With many things it is like this... remembrance, dimmed...<page>But you m-m-may hear it, still. At the height of our core, there is means-s-s-system, near complete... Constructs old-built to sound our song. They need only be set to functional form.
original_zh_text: <hpage>大师，我想要你这一族保管的旋律，那是登顶圣堡的钥匙。你可愿意传授？<page>我们的旋律？确-确-曾存在！但是声纹……已遗失……<page>长-长-久劳役使我记忆缺损。许多往事……都已模糊……<page>但您仍可-可-可以聆听。核心顶端有一奏鸣构造，几近完成……启动即可重现圣歌。
translated_text: <hpage>マスター、私はシーケンスの一部であり、城を登るための鍵であるあなたのラインが運ぶメロディーを探しています。教えてもらえますか？<page>私たちのメロディー？覚えてるよ!はい!はい!メロディーはありましたが、音はありました。もう持っていません。<page>仕事が長すぎる。私の心の底から、このマークは消えています。多くのことがこのような记忆、暗暗。<page>しかし、私たちのコアの高さには、ほぼ完全な手段のシステムがあると聞くかもしれません。私たちの歌を歌うために古い建物を建てる。機能的に設定するだけです。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Master, I'm looking for a melody that your line carries, which is part of the sequence and the key to climbing the castle. can you teach me?<page>Our melody? i remember it! yes! yes! There was a melody, but there was a sound. I don't have it anymore.<page>Work is too long. From the bottom of my heart, this mark is disappearing. A lot of things like this memory, obscurity.<page>But you may hear that at the height of our core there is a system of almost complete means. Build an old building to sing our songs. Just set it up functionally.

original_en_text: Are you still to c-c-climb our grand core, Bug-Red? Within you may marvel at the work of Architects, my own, and all those passed b-b-before.<hpage>My path takes me in many directions, Master, but in due course, I will ascend the core and claim the melody atop it.
original_zh_text: 您仍要攀-攀-登伟大核心？路上可见历代建筑师的神工创造，包括我的拙作。<hpage>我有许多地方要去，但若是需要，我会登顶获取旋律。
translated_text: まだビッグコアを登っているのか、バグレッド？中では、建築家、私自身の建築家、そして過去に合格したすべての建築家の仕事に驚くかもしれません。<hpage>マスター、私の道は多くの方向に私を連れて行きますが、適切なタイミングで私はコアに到達し、コアの上のメロディーを占めます。
secondary_translated_text: are you still climbing the big core, bagred? Inside, you might be surprised by the work of architects, my own architects, and all the architects who have passed in the past.<hpage>Master, my path takes me in many directions, but at the right time I reach the core and occupy the melody above the core.

original_en_text: <hpage>May I ask what you know of the Citadel above you, sir? You go to much effort to reach it.<page>Hrrrrrrrr! The Citadel! Most miracle of a place, bright and holy! Fresh water for all, much as can drink! Air so clean, can see the great rooves above! <page>When me thinks of Citadel above, me works hardest of all! Hrrrrrrrrr!
original_zh_text: <hpage>请问你对头顶的圣堡了解多少？为了上去这么煞费苦心。<page>唔唔唔唔！圣堡！神迹之地！亮堂圣洁！清水管够！空气清新能望见穹顶！<page>想着圣堡，咱就干得最卖力！唔唔唔唔！
translated_text: <hpage>上の城についてどれくらい知っているか聞いてもいいですか？あなたはそれを達成するために多くの努力をした。<page>ハハハ!お城!最も神聖な場所は明るく神聖です!できるだけ新鮮な水を飲みましょう!空気がとても新鮮で、大きな屋根が見えます。<page>上の城を考えると、私は一生懸命働きます!あっ! あっ!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>may i ask you how much you know about the castle above? You've put a lot of effort into achieving it.<page>ha ha ha! the castle! The most sacred place is bright and sacred! Drink as much fresh water as possible! The air is so fresh and you can see the big roof.<page>Considering the castle above, I work hard! ah! ah!

original_en_text: You have confessed a sin most grave and must by works cleanse yourself.<page>Return to your task and work off-cycle, neither eating nor supping until new-cycle begins.<page>By the grace of Pharloom eternal, may you never tire. Toil, and be forgiven.
original_zh_text: 你已供认重罪，须以苦役净化。<page>返回岗位持续劳作，禁食禁饮直至新周期始。<page>承永恒纺络之恩，愿你永不疲惫。劳作，方得救赎。
translated_text: あなた方は最も重大な罪を告白し、行いによって清めなければなりません。<page>あなたのタスクと非周期的な仕事に戻り、新しいサイクルが始まるまで食べたり食べたりしないでください。<page>ファラオの永遠の恵みに感謝し、疲れないように。一生懸命働き、許されなさい。
secondary_translated_text: You must confess your most serious sins and cleanse them by your deeds.<page>Don't go back to your tasks and non-cyclical work, and eat or eat until a new cycle begins.<page>May we be thankful for Pharaoh's everlasting grace and never tire. Work hard and be forgiven.

original_en_text: Hrr. Hrrrrr! Good, me friend, good! When us works together, is more holy! Is more work done!<page>Together, lets us work raw hard ‘til thems above see how worthy us is!
original_zh_text: 唔。唔唔唔！好，朋友，好！咱一起干，更虔诚！活干得更快！<page>来！咱们一起拼命干，让上边看看咱多卖力！
translated_text: ああ、ああ!ああ、私の友人、うーん!一緒に働くと、もっと神聖になります!もっと仕事があった!<page>上の人たちが私たちの価値を知るまで一緒に働きましょう!
secondary_translated_text: Oh, oh, oh! Oh, my friend, um! When we work together, we become more holy! I had more work!<page>Let's work together until the people above know what we value!

original_en_text: <page>What’s this, Bug-Red? Even down here, I d-d-did detect its working... Have you climbed our c-c-core, and woken the voices of my l-l-line?<hpage>I have maker. Clearly it was a climb never intended for regular bugs, and fair fortune that the skills gifted within your lands allowed my ascent.<hpage>The melody, and the voices... both are fine things heard and witnessed. Even in this fading moment, their artistry shines through.<page>Impressive-industrious... eternal... You have seen a glimpse, Bug-Red, of us-s-s, how once we were. The minds of Architects inspired. What majesty we did create...
original_zh_text: <page>怎么回事，红姑娘？即便身处此地，我也感-感-感知到它的运转……莫非你已攀上我们的核-核-核心，唤醒了我族先辈的歌声？  <hpage>正是如此，大师。这段攀登本非寻常虫类所能企及，所幸这片土地赋予的技艺助我登上了顶端。  <hpage>那旋律与歌声……皆是值得聆听见证的瑰宝。即便在此衰微之际，其中匠心仍熠熠生辉。  <page>勤勉卓绝……永垂不朽……红姑娘，你已见证我族-族-族昔日的荣光。建筑师们迸发的智慧，我们曾创造的伟业何等壮丽……
translated_text: <page>この赤い虫は何ですか？ここでも働いています。私たちのC-C-Coreに登って、私のL-L-Lineの声を目覚めさせたのですか？<hpage>メーカーがいます。普通の昆虫登山ではありません幸運なことに、あなたの土地固有のスキルが私を登ることができます。<hpage>メロディー、音。どちらも音と見た目が美しい。この色あせた瞬間にも、彼らの芸術性は輝いています。<page>印象的な勤勉さ。永遠に。あなたは私たちを見た、赤い虫、私たちがどんな人か。建築家からのインスピレーションわたしたちが創造した偉大さ。
secondary_translated_text: <page>what is this red bug? I'm working here as well. Did you climb our C-C - Core and wake up my L-L - Line voice?<hpage>There are manufacturers. It's not an ordinary insect climbing Fortunately, your land-specific skills allow me to climb.<hpage>Melody, the sound. Both sounds and looks beautiful. Even in this faded moment, their artistry is shining.<page>Impressive hard work. Forever and ever. You have seen us, red worm, what kind of people we are. Inspiration from architects The greatness we have created.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, you seem the lone maker left in this ruined Citadel. Are you my enemy? The other constructs of this place did object aggressively to my presence. <page>Bug-Red? I am a m-m-maker. Yes. Enemy. No. I am an Architect. Only an Architect. To build-automate, it is our nature-directive-c-c-c-cage.<page>Why are you here, Bug-Red? The time is late. Do you seek-need service of an Architect? You are weave-type, yes, a first child. Rare-e-e-extinct? Or not it does so seem.<hpage>You see it true, Master. I bear the lineage of Weaver, along with other strands, equally strange.<page>Then on your r-r-request, Bug-Red, as directive demands, for Pharloom’s first children, a-a-a-and our kingdom-eternal, I shall c-c-craft.
original_zh_text: <hpage>阁下，你似乎是圣堡最后的工匠，但是要与我为敌么？这里的构造体对我很有敌意。<page>红衣虫？我是制-制-造者。敌人。不是。建筑师。只是建筑师。建造-自动化，并非选择。是本性-指-指-指令牢笼。<page>您为何在此，是寻-寻求建筑师协助？您有织者血脉，是，初代子嗣。稀-稀-稀有种？但又似乎不是。<hpage>你眼光很独到，我确实有织者血脉，但只有一半。<page>那依红姑娘要-要-要求，遵循指令，为纺络初代子嗣，为永恒圣堡，我将效劳。为您制-制-造。
translated_text: <hpage>マスター、あなたはこの廃墟の城の唯一の創造者のようです。あなたは私の敵ですか？この場所の他の建物は私の存在に強く反対します。<page>赤い虫？私はm-m-makerです。そう、敵。いいえ、いいえ。私は建築家です。ただの建築家ですオートメーションの場合、これは自然な順序です-c-c-c-c-c-c<page>なんでここにいるの？赤い虫建築家の助けを求めるのは遅すぎますか？あなたは編み物タイプです、はい、最初の子供です。希少で絶滅。またはそのように見える。<hpage>“マスター、本当に見てください。私の体には織女の血があり、他の血があり、同じように奇妙なものがある。”<page>それから、あなたの要請により、レッドワーム、指示に従って、私はファーナムの最初の子供、私たちの永遠の王国のためにC-C-Cを行います。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Master, you seem the sole creator of this ruined castle. are you my enemy? The other buildings in this place strongly oppose my presence.<page>red bugs? I am an m-m - maker. Yes, enemy. No, no, no. I am an architect. I'm just an architect. In the case of automation, this is a natural sequence - c-c - c.<page>what are you doing here? Is it too late to ask for the help of a red bug architect? You're the knitting type, yes, the first child. Rare and extinct. Or it looks like it.<hpage>"Master, really look." I have a woman's blood woven in my body, and other blood, and something equally strange. "<page>Then, at your request, Red Worm, in accordance with the instructions, I will do C-C - C for the first child of Farnham, our eternal kingdom.

original_en_text: <hpage>Master, you seem the lone maker left in this Citadel. Are you my enemy? The other constructs of this place object aggressively to my presence. <page>Bug-Red? I am a m-m-maker. Yes. Enemy. No. I am an Architect. Only an Architect. To build-automate is not choice. It is our nature-directive-c-c-c-cage. <page>You are weave-type, yes, a first child. Rare-e-e-extinct? Or not it does so seem.<hpage>You see it true, Master. I bear the lineage of Weavers, along with other strands, equally strange.<page>Then on your r-r-request, Bug-Red, as directive demands, for Pharloom’s first children, a-a-a-and our kingdom-eternal, I shall serve. I shall c-c-craft.
original_zh_text: <hpage>阁下，你似乎是圣堡最后的工匠，但是要与我为敌么？这里的构造体对我很有敌意。<page>红衣虫？我是制-制-造者。敌人。不是。建筑师。只是建筑师。建造-自动化，并非选择。是本性-指-指-指令牢笼。<page>您有织者血脉，是，初代子嗣。稀-稀-稀有种？但又似乎不是。<hpage>你眼光很独到，我确实有织者血脉，但只有一半。<page>那依红姑娘要-要-要求，遵循指令，为纺络初代子嗣，为永恒圣堡，我将效劳。为您制-制-造。
translated_text: <hpage>マスター、あなたはこの城で唯一のメーカーのようです。あなたは私の敵ですか？この場所の他の建物は私の存在に強く反対した。<page>赤い虫？私はm-m-makerです。そう、敵。いいえ、いいえ。私は建築家です。ただの建築家です自動化は選択肢ではない。これが私たちの自然な秩序です-c-c-c<page>あなたは編み物タイプです、はい、最初の子供です。希少で絶滅。またはそのように見える。<hpage>“マスター、本当に見てください。私の体には織女の血があり、他の血があり、同じように奇妙なものがある。”<page>それゆえ、バグレッドよ、あなたの要請により、私はファラムの最初の子供たち、私たちの永遠の王国に仕えます。我知道是c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-c-
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Master, you seem the only maker in this castle. are you my enemy? The other buildings in this place strongly opposed my presence. "<page>red bugs? I am an m-m - maker. Yes, enemy. No, no, no. I am an architect. I'm just an architect and automation is not an option. This is our natural order - c-c - c.<page>You're the knitting type, yes, the first child. Rare and extinct. Or it looks like it.<hpage>"Master, really look." I have a woman's blood woven in my body, and other blood, and something equally strange. "<page>Therefore, O Bagred, at your request, I serve the first children of Pharam, our eternal kingdom. I know it's c-c-c I'm not going to be able to do this. I'm not going to be able to do this. c-

translated_text: 第12代建築家
secondary_translated_text: 12th generation architect

original_en_text: Hrrrrrrr. The harder me work, the sooner it come. Thems above, them watch us, always. Work hard, work hard, and us will go up. Hrrrr.<hpage>Sir, I fear you are long forgotten by your masters. Should you not rest? The burden this toil is placing on your shell is plain to see.<page>Hrrrrr? Hrrrrrr. You speaks strange. Me can not rest. Us works, and Citadel breathes, and thems above do sing, and all is right.<page>And when us works enough, thems see it... Hrrr... thems see it, and us gets us holy reward...
original_zh_text: 唔唔唔。越使劲干，就越早离开。上边的大人们看着咱呢。使劲干，使劲干，就能上去。唔唔。<hpage>先生，恐怕你早被主人遗忘了。为何不休息？这苦役正在摧残你的甲壳。<page>唔唔？唔唔唔。你说怪话。咱不能歇。咱干活，圣堡呼吸，上边唱歌，这才对劲。<page>等咱干够活，大人们会看见……唔唔……会看见，就给咱圣赐……
translated_text: 一生懸命働けば働くほど早くやってきます。彼らは上記のトピックに焦点を当てています。努力、努力、我々は上昇する。UH。<hpage>ご主人様に忘れられてしまいました。休まないのか？あなたの殻の負担は明らかです。<page>え？えっ？変な話をしている。休むことができない。私たちは仕事をしていて、城は呼吸していて、上記のテーマは本当に歌っていて、すべてがうまくいった。<page>十分に働けば、彼らは見るでしょう。うーん。それを見れば、神聖な報酬を得ることができます。
secondary_translated_text: The harder you work, the faster you work, the faster you come. They are focused on the topics mentioned above. Effort, effort, we rise. Uh.<hpage>I have been forgotten by my master. you're not resting? The burden of your shell is obvious.<page>what? what? He's talking a weird story. I can't rest. We were at work, the castle was breathing, the above themes were really singing, and everything went well.<page>If you work hard enough, they will see. hmm. If you see it, you will receive a divine reward.

original_en_text: Tools of my craft. They could be used to improve your own. Make harder, sharper.
original_zh_text: 我的工具。可以用于改进您自己的。更硬，更利。
translated_text: 私のクラフト道具。自己改善に利用できます。より強く、より鋭くする。
secondary_translated_text: My craft tools. It can be used for self-improvement. Make it stronger and sharper.

original_en_text: A flexible shell-prosthetic. It would enhance a weave-type’s flexibility, allowing evasive options.
original_zh_text: 柔性甲壳义肢。能提升织者机动性，便于闪避。
translated_text: 柔軟なシェルの人工体。織りタイプの柔軟性を高め、回避オプションを可能にします。
secondary_translated_text: Flexible shell artificial body. Increases the flexibility of the weaving type, allowing for avoidance options.

original_en_text: You... ... sin... ... cleanse....<page>Return... ... work... ... begins....<page>... Pharloom... ... never... ... forgiven.
original_zh_text: 你……罪……净化....<page>返回……劳作……周期始....<page>...纺络……永不……救赎。
translated_text: あなたは..。...罪、そして。清潔で、<page>戻ってくる。...仕事..。...始まります。<page>...ファラオは決して..。...許してくれ
secondary_translated_text: You're... you're... Sin, and. clean,<page>i'm coming back... work... work... It starts.<page>... The pharaoh never... please forgive me.

original_en_text: You have affinity for such radial blades? I can b-b-build upon the idea-knowledge. Make them retract. Make them force-store.
original_zh_text: 您偏爱这类机轮刃？我可基-基-据此改良。加回收装置。强化储能。
translated_text: このような放射性物質に興味がありますか？私はこのアイデアの知識に基づいています。それを取り戻してください。強制保管にしてください。
secondary_translated_text: Are you interested in such radioactive materials? I'm based on my knowledge of this idea. Please take it back. Please put it in mandatory storage.

original_en_text: Acquire {0} more tools to prove aptitude.
original_zh_text: 再收集{0}件工具以证明资质。
translated_text: 取得する。{0}能力を証明するためのツール。
secondary_translated_text: Acquire it.{0}Tools for proving competence.

original_en_text: Hrrrrrr. Me can not say much more, friend. Thems is watching. Us must keep working.
original_zh_text: 唔唔唔唔。咱不能多说了，朋友。上边看着呢。咱得接着干。
translated_text: 皆さん、これ以上は言えません。テーマは監視中です。仕事を続けなければ。
secondary_translated_text: Ladies and gentlemen, I can't say more. The subject is under observation. You have to keep working.

original_en_text: A locked gate bearing the symbol of an Architect.
original_zh_text: 一扇锁住的门，刻有建筑师徽记。
translated_text: 建築家のサインが入った鍵付きの扉。
secondary_translated_text: A locked door with the architect's signature.

original_en_text: Raw materials, for creation. Carry them with you always, that y-y-you may be prepared.
original_zh_text: 原材料，随身携带。有-有备无患。
translated_text: 創造的な原料。準備ができるように常にそれらを持参してください。
secondary_translated_text: Creative raw materials. Always bring them with you so you can be ready.

original_en_text: Acquire 1 more tool to prove aptitude.
original_zh_text: 再收集1件工具以证明资质。
translated_text: あなたの能力を証明するために別のツールを購入する。
secondary_translated_text: Purchase another tool to prove your abilities.

original_en_text: Those pieces of a h-h-heart-core you carry upon you, how did you acquire-recover an artefact so rare?<hpage>They were scattered about the Citadel, each seemingly laid with purpose. Someone wished the thing dismantled, but showed respect enough to see it stored safe.<page>That heart is an inspired form, conceived by the first of my line for a knight of cog and blade.<page>In it, I see my predecessor’s talent, immense, now lost-forgotten. I could never create-copy a work s-s-so fine.<hpage>And the knight that once bore the heart? Tell me of them.<page>A gleaming order, cogwork sentinels, so impressive-majestic in function they were charged-b-b-bound to the highest holy duty.<page>Long before the c-c-creation of the core, the sentinels ventured, even beyond these walls, to see all bugs brought-forced safe to serve the Citadel.<page>If the h-h-h-heart were restored within the sentinel’s shell, would it give thanks for the awakening? Or would it grieve those lands now l-l-lost?<hpage>In time, maker, I may find out...
original_zh_text: 您携带的心-心-脏残片，您是怎么找到如此珍贵造物的？<hpage>它们散落在圣堡各处，似乎是被刻意安置。虽然被拆解，却有妥善保管。<page>这心脏构造精妙，出自我的先辈之手，为机枢骑士所铸造。<page>我能在其中看到先辈才华，如今却已失-失-传。我无法复刻这份神工。<hpage>那曾经承载这颗心的骑士？我想了解详情。<page>光辉教团，机枢戍卫。他们曾经威仪赫赫，掌管圣职。<page>远在核心铸-铸-造之前，戍卫就远征墙外，强掳众虫效忠圣堡。<page>如果将此心-心-脏重新装入戍卫甲中，它会为苏醒而感激？还是为圣堡衰颓哀伤？<hpage>假以时日，大师，或许我能知晓……
translated_text: 携帯していたコア断片をどのように入手し、復元していますか<hpage>彼らは城の周りに散らばり、誰もが嘘をついているように見えた。誰かがそれを分解したいが、それを安全に保つのに十分な敬意を示した。<page>“The Heart”は私の最初のシリーズのアイデアのインスピレーションで、ギアとブレードナイトのためにデザインされました。<page>そこで、私は偉大で、今は忘れられている私の前任者の才能を見ました。こんな美しい作品を再現することはできません。<hpage>あなたのことを気にかけてくれた騎士が教えてくれた。<page>輝く騎士団、犬歯の歩哨は、非常に印象的で威厳のある機能を果たし、最高の神聖な義務を与えられた。<page>コアが建設されるずっと前から、センチネルは危険を冒しており、これらの壁の外でさえ、すべてのバグは城のために安全に働くことを余儀なくされた。<page>心臓がセンチネルの殻の中で回復したら、目覚めに感謝するでしょうか？これは失われた土地を悲しませるのか？<hpage>時間が経つにつれて、創造主を見つけることができます。
secondary_translated_text: How do you obtain and restore the core fragments you were carrying with you?<hpage>They were scattered around the castle, and it seemed that everyone was lying. Someone wanted to break it down, but showed enough respect to keep it safe.<page>"The Heart" was the inspiration for my first series of ideas, designed for Gear and Blade Knight.<page>There, I saw the talent of my predecessor, who was great and now forgotten. I cannot reproduce such a beautiful piece.<hpage>The knight who cared about you told me. "<page>The shining knighthood, the canine-toothed sentry, performed a very impressive and dignified function, and was endowed with the highest sacred duty.<page>Long before the core was built, the sentinels were in danger, and even outside these walls, all the bugs were forced to work safely for the castle.<page>When the heart recovers in the shell of the sentinel, will you be grateful for the awakening? Does this grieve the lost land?<hpage>As time goes on, we can find our Creator.

original_en_text: This band of metal teeth, sharp and light-fine. It could be woven within your red outer layer? A hidden weapon.
original_zh_text: 金属齿环，轻便锐利。可编入您的红色披风？作为暗器。
translated_text: 金属製の歯帯は鋭くて軽い。赤の外側に織り込まれますか？シェーダ
secondary_translated_text: The metal braces are sharp and light. Is it woven on the outside of the red? Shadow

original_en_text: <page=S>You seem displeased, Old One. We only did as you asked, yes? The snare is sprung, the creature consumed.<hpage>You bound it to that void!<page=S>Don’t play daft. You should well know our family’s fixations. Surely you had a hunch?<page=B>How else could we hope to trap one of your pale kin? Or see her consumed with such insatiable efficiency?<hpage>Then you have miscalculated, gravely. The white knight, she fell with the mother...<page=M>Oh ho... The quakes, yes? We have felt their force, even here. So the mother resists the dark... to save the child?<hpage>That is my guess. I must descend to the void below, and see clear that truth for myself.<page=M>Ohhhh. How… unfortunate. All of Pharloom will fall to her flailing.<hpage>So it may, but I will not watch idle while it crumbles.
original_zh_text: <page=S>古老者，您似乎不太高兴？我们不过照您吩咐行事罢了。陷阱已发，猎物入彀。<hpage>你们把它和虚空捆在了一起！<page=S>别装傻了。您该清楚我们家族对力量百无禁忌，难道没料到这步？<page=B>不然怎困得住您那苍白同族？又怎教她贪婪吞噬得这般彻底？<hpage>那你们可大错特错了，那苍白骑士也随其母亲一同坠落了……<page=M>哦嚯嚯……是说那些震颤？即便在这里也能感知到。所以是母亲正抵抗黑暗……为了救孩子？<hpage>我是这么猜想的。但必须亲自下去深渊，看清真相。<page=M>哎呀呀……这可……不妙。整个纺络都要被她垂死挣扎掀翻。<hpage>或许吧，但我不会坐视王国崩塌。
translated_text: <page=S>あなたは不幸そうです、老人。言われたとおりにするだけですよね？トラップが飛び出し、クリーチャーは飲み込まれる。<hpage>あなたはそれを虚空に縛り付けた!<page=S>私たちの家族の仕組みについてもっと知るべきです。本当に予感がしたのか？<page=B>ではどうやって青白い親戚を捕まえるのでしょう？それとも、そんな貪欲な効率に飲み込まれてしまうのか。<hpage>あなたは重大な誤算を犯した。白衣の騎士、彼女は母と共に倒れた。<page=M>ああ、ホー。地震あったよね？ここでもその力を感じます。だから母親たちは闇に抵抗する彼らの子供を救うために<hpage>これは私の推測です。私は下の空に潜り、真実を見なければならない。<page=M>ああ、どうして？残念ながら、ファラオ全体が彼女の手に落ちます。<hpage>そうかもしれませんが、私は傍観しません。
secondary_translated_text: <page=S>You look unfortunate, old man. you just do what you're told, right? Traps pop out, and the creature is swallowed.<hpage>You have bound it to the void!<page=S>We should know more about how our families work. did you really have a hunch?<page=B>so how do we catch our pale relatives? Or are we going to be swallowed up by such greedy efficiency?<hpage>You have made a serious miscalculation. Knight in white, she fell with her mother.<page=M>Oh, ho. there was an earthquake, right? I can feel that power here too. So mothers resist the darkness to save their children.<hpage>This is my guess. I must dive into the sky below and see the truth.<page=M>oh, why not? Unfortunately, the entire pharaoh falls into her hands.<hpage>That may be true, but I'm not going to stand by.

original_en_text: This lump here is well heavy, and shiny too, so it’s surely worth somethin’!
original_zh_text: 这块沉甸甸的，还闪着光，肯定值点钱儿！
translated_text: ここでは、この塊は重くて光沢があるので、間違いなく価値があります!
secondary_translated_text: Here, this lump is heavy and shiny, so it's definitely worth it!

original_en_text: Desperate times make for desperate customers, heh heh! So let’s get to tradin’, eh?
original_zh_text: 世道混乱，方便宰客！嘿嘿！赶紧的！
translated_text: 絶望的な瞬間は絶望的な顧客を作るHey!取引を始めましょうか？
secondary_translated_text: A desperate moment makes a desperate customer Hey! do you want to start a deal?

original_en_text: Again... Huu... Huu. Truly incredible!<page>Was it the course? Did I lose focus? Or are you simply the bug I have waited so long for? Her of such skill that my wish could, at last, be granted?<page>Another reward must be given for your speed, nimble bug. One deserved in full!
original_zh_text: 又输了……呼……真不可思议！<page>是我分心了？还是你太强？我的心愿终于有机会实现了吗？<page>我得再送你个奖励，你应得的！
translated_text: 再び..。呼び出し。呼び出し。これはすごい!<page>これがコース？集中力を失ったか？それとも私が待っていたバグなのか？彼女の技術はとても高いので、ついに私の願いが叶うのでしょうか。<page>スピードと俊敏性のミスに対するもう一つの報酬を提供する必要があります1人はそれに値する!
secondary_translated_text: Once again... Calling. Calling. This is amazing!<page>is this the course? have you lost your concentration? or is it the bug i was waiting for? Her skills are so high, will my wish finally come true? "<page>You have to offer one more reward for your speed and agility mistakes1 man deserves it!

original_en_text: Have you heard, miss grown-up? Beyond the moss, in the crumbled caverns filled with worms, much change is happening, different to the horrid, stretching dark outside.<page>What brings such bright and bold transformation? Is it a beast? Or a bug unseen? How wondrous it would be to discover them, hidden away in some deep corner!<page>You must go searching, miss grown-up! You and that sharp, sharp blade. Think of the strange and succulent shell waiting to be added to your journal?
original_zh_text: 大姐姐听说了吗？苔原深处满是蠕虫的崩塌洞窟里，正在发生剧变，与外界的恐怖黑灾截然不同。<page> 是什么带来这种鲜明蜕变？是巨兽？还是未知虫类？要是能知道它们是什么，藏在哪里，该多奇妙呀！<page> 你一定要去探索，大姐姐！带上你那锋利的针刃，给记录册里多添上几份奇异的甲壳记录！
translated_text: 聞こえましたか、陛下。苔の向こう、虫が出没する壊れた洞窟では、外に広がる恐ろしい暗闇とは異なり、多くの変化が起こっています。<page>このような大胆で大胆な変化の原因は何でしょうか。獣なのか。これは見えない間違いですか？それが深い隅に隠れているのを見つけることができたら、どんなに素晴らしいことでしょう。<page>陛下、奥様、ぜひご覧ください!あなたとそのナイフ。あなたの日記に追加するのを待っている奇妙でジューシーな貝殻を考えてみてください。
secondary_translated_text: Do you hear me, Your Majesty? Beyond the moss, in a broken cave infested with insects, there are many changes taking place, unlike the terrifying darkness that spreads outside.<page>What is the cause of such a bold and bold change? Is it a beast? Is this an invisible mistake? How wonderful it would be if we could find it hiding in a deep corner.<page>Your Majesty, Madam, please take a look! You and your knife. Think of a strange, juicy shell waiting to be added to your diary.

original_en_text: Now, isn’t this a wondrous place! Golden bells, for weary shells! Ha ha ha!<hpage>This settlement offers safety now, little pilgrim. Perhaps you should make a home here?<hpage>You’ve done well to make it this far, and the roads ahead will only be more dangerous.<page>Oh, dangerous they surely are! But I will gladly tread any path that holds wonders as magnificent as this, red maiden!
original_zh_text: 这地方太妙了！金钟给累瘫的虫子报时！哈哈哈！<hpage>小朝圣者，此处暂时安全，为何不在此安家？<hpage>走到这里实属不易，前方只会更加凶险。<page>凶险又如何！能见到这般奇景，刀山火海我也愿前往！
translated_text: ここは素晴らしい場所ではないでしょうか。疲れた貝殻に鐘を鳴らす!ハハハ!<hpage>この和解は若い巡礼者に安全を提供した。ここに定住するべきか？<hpage>よくやったね。この時点で、前方の道路はより危険になるだけです。<page>彼らは本当に危険です!しかし、私はこのような偉大な奇跡の道に行くことができます、ミス·レッド!
secondary_translated_text: Isn't this a wonderful place? Ringing bells on tired shells! ha ha ha!<hpage>This reconciliation provided security for the young pilgrims. should i settle here?<hpage>You did well. At this point, the road ahead will only be more dangerous.<page>They are really dangerous! " But I can go on the path of such a great miracle, Miss Red!

original_en_text: <hpage>You have keen sight for my skill, bug, but my childhood has long since passed. What has happened here? I see signs of battle all around.
original_zh_text: <hpage>你的眼力不错，我确是一名战士，但早已称不上是孩子。这是怎么回事？到处是打斗痕迹。
translated_text: <hpage>あなたは私の技術をよく知っているバグでも私の子供時代は終わった何が起きてる？周りには戦闘の兆候がありました。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>you know my skills well, bug, but my childhood is over. what's going on? There were signs of fighting all around.

translated_text: <hpage>...
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>...

original_en_text: <hpage>The time is close, Shakra. The cost was grave, and the challenge steep, but I have claimed a power that can put end to this disaster. <page>Gendaa... This is good, Hornet Wielding Needle, essential. My own strength has near reached its limit, and the dark husks continue their assault unceasing.<page>Take your final action, and let us all see the end of this.
original_zh_text: <hpage>时机到了。虽然代价惨重，但我找到了终结灾祸的方法。<page>哏嗒……太好了，小姑娘。我正好快撑不住了，黑虫的攻势永不停歇。<page>放手去干吧，让我们一起见证结局。
translated_text: <hpage>時間は近い、シャクラ。コストは大きく、課題は大きいですが、私にはこの災害を終わらせる力があります。<page>遠大···それでは、バンブルビーは針を振っています。これは不可欠です。自分の力は限界に達し、ダークシェルは攻撃を続けた。<page>最後の一歩を踏み出して、すべての終わりを見てみましょう。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>The time is near, Shakra. The costs are great, the challenges are great, but I have the power to end this disaster.<page>So far... then, Bumblebee is waving the needle. This is essential. His power reached its limit, and Darkshell continued to attack.<page>Let's take the last step and see the end of it all.

original_en_text: Your achievements in the games are inspiring! In time, I may have to challenge those impressive scores...
original_zh_text: 你创下的记录真令我激动！改天我要挑战看看！
translated_text: あなたのゲームでの成功は励みになります!時間が経つにつれて、この印象的な結果に挑戦する必要があります。
secondary_translated_text: Your success in the game is encouraging! As time goes on, you will have to challenge this impressive result.

original_en_text: <hpage>Good luck on your quest Garmond. If you hope to claim justice for your fellows passed, I suspect you’ve some challenge yet ahead.<page>Aye! Zaza and I’ll fight to cavern’s end if it need be, for the bugs held in our hearts, and our honour as knights!
original_zh_text: <hpage>祝你们好运，要找圣堡讨公道可不容易。<page>为了心中的记忆，为了骑士的荣耀！就算要杀遍每处洞穴我们也在所不惜！
translated_text: <hpage>あなたの仕事で幸運を祈る。死んだ同胞のために正義を求めているなら、まだいくつかの課題に直面していると思います。<page>はい!はい!必要ならザザと私は洞窟の果てまで戦い、心の虫のために、そして騎士としての名誉のために戦う。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Good luck in your work. If you are seeking justice for your dead compatriots, I think you are still facing some challenges.<page>yes! yes! If necessary, Zaza and I will fight to the end of the cave, fighting for the worm of the heart, and for the honor of knighthood.

original_en_text: Ahh, can you feel it too? The thralls of the Citadel are gathered close, in overwhelming numbers!<page>Together though, the three of us would be more overwhelming still! Would you allow us to fight by your side, brave sister?
original_zh_text: 啊哈，感觉到了吗？圣堡的傀儡在集结，非常多！<page>咱们三个联手，肯定不可阻挡！要一起战斗吗，勇敢的姐妹？
