translated_text: ああ、あなたも感じますか？城の奴隷たちは圧倒的に集結!<page>しかし、私たち3人が一緒になれば、さらに圧倒的になります!勇敢な妹よ、一緒に戦わせてくれませんか？
secondary_translated_text: oh, do you feel it, too? The slaves of the castle are overwhelmingly assembled!<page>But when the three of us come together, it becomes even more overwhelming! brave sister, will you let me fight with you?

original_en_text: Well, well! See what happens to nasty bully-bugs when they come after poor old Grindle? That’s a well-deserved end, we reckon.<page>We heard this old Sitty-dell was nice and quiet and burstin’ with goodies. So what’s happened, eh? Why’s it crawlin’ with bullies and busybodies?<hpage>The creature that haunts this place is stirring, little thief. The Citadel’s caste now roam the halls. You would do well to leave soon, if you mean to survive.<page>What what? You bein’ mirthful? We’re stayin’ here ‘til we’re done pilfering! You should be the one leavin’ if you’re so afeared!
original_zh_text: 啧啧！瞧瞧那些欺负格林德尔恶霸虫是什么下场？真是活该！<page>都说圣堡既清净，宝贝又多，怎么全是打手？<hpage>掌控此地的怪物正在苏醒，圣堡的守卫四处游荡，想活命就快逃吧，小毛贼。<page>怕什么！起码得等偷够本再说！你要是害怕了，那就自己逃吧！
translated_text: うん。うん。この厄介ないじめっ子がかわいそうなグリンデルに追いつくとどうなるでしょう？これはふさわしい結末だと思います。<page>この古いシティデールは美しく、静かで、美しいものに満ちていると聞きました。何があったんだ？なぜこの場所はいじめっ子やうるさい人でいっぱいなのか？<hpage>この場所を苦しめる生き物は興奮している、泥棒。城のカーストは現在ホールを歩き回っている。生きたいなら、できるだけ早く出た方がいい。<page>何だ？笑ってるのか？盗難が終わるまでここにいます!そんなに怖いのなら、出て行け!
secondary_translated_text: yeah. yeah. What happens when this nasty bully catches up with poor Grindell? I think this is a fitting end.<page>I've heard that this old Citydale is beautiful, quiet, and full of beautiful things. what's going on? why is this place so full of bullies and noisy people?<hpage>The creatures that torment this place are excited, thieves. The castle caste is now wandering the hall. If you want to live, you better get out as soon as possible.<page>what's that? are you laughing? I'll be here until the theft is over! If you are so scared, get out!

original_en_text: High up, above the caverns all of crust, Nuu has been told of a hole, filled with writhing things, all zipping and zapping.<page>But so sad! Nuu cannot herself see it. The lands quake and rattle. The savage threads stretch. The dangers are too much.<page>It must be you, miss grown-up, older, stiffer, a shell less precious. Seek the cave, and the things within. How else will the journal be complete?
original_zh_text: 努努听说，在布满硬壳的洞窟高处，有个满是扭动生物的洞穴，噼啪作响。<page> 但好可惜！努努不能去看。大地震动，凶暴丝线蔓延，太危险了。<page> 必须靠你了，大姐姐，你甲壳厚实，经验丰富。去探查那个洞穴吧！不然记录册怎么完整呢？
translated_text: そこで、地殻の中のすべての洞窟の上に、ヌーは、ねじれたもので満たされた穴があると言われました。<page>しかし、それは悲しい!ノア自身は見えない。大地が揺れ、揺れる。野蛮さの痕跡は続く。危険が大きすぎる。<page>それはあなたです、マダムとマダム。あなたは年を取り、懸命に働き、あなたの殻はもはや貴重ではありません。洞窟とその中にあるものを見つける。ジャーナルはどう終わるのか？
secondary_translated_text: There, Noah was told that over every cave in the crust, there was a hole filled with twisted things.<page>But it's sad! Noah himself is not seen. The earth shakes and shakes. The traces of barbarism continue. The danger is too great.<page>It's you, madame and madame. You are old, you work hard, and your shell is no longer valuable. Find the caves and what's in them. how does the journal end?

original_en_text: Ahh miss grown-up, Nuu hoped you would return here. For clever Nuu can track well where you have been, she sees your cut-marks and sniffs out your fragrant trail!<page>And look where the trail has led sweet Nuu! A thick wriggler lived in this nest, rumbling and crackling in the darkness.<page>Its sour juices still line these rocky insides, and patient Nuu will gather it all up!<hpage>There is much to learn in these crusted highlands Nuu, but much danger as well. Indulge your curiosity if you must, but keep your senses trained on the darkness.
original_zh_text: 大姐姐！努努跟着你的刀痕和体香找到这啦！<page>这个巢穴住着条乱扭的胖家伙，在黑暗里咔咔响！<page>岩壁上还粘着它的酸液，努努要全部收集！<hpage>这里虽然知识多，但也很危险，别只顾着好奇，也要小心黑暗中的动静。
translated_text: “主よ、ここに戻ってきてください。スマートNuuはあなたがいる場所を追跡できます。彼女はあなたのナイフを見て、あなたの匂いを嗅ぐ!<page>この道は、美しいヌーを導いたところです!巣の中には巨大なワニが住んでいて、暗闇の中でゴロゴロ鳴っていた。<page>石はまだ酸味に満ちており、Nuu患者はそれらを収集します!<hpage>ヌーのハードコア高原では、学ぶべきことがたくさんありますが、危険もたくさんあります。必要に応じて好奇心を満たし、暗闇の中で感覚を訓練しましょう。
secondary_translated_text: "Lord, please come back here." SmartNuu can keep track of where you are. She looks at your knife, smells you!<page>This road is where you led the beautiful Nu! Inside the nest lived a giant crocodile, which buzzed in the darkness.<page>The stones are still full of sour taste, and the Nui patient collects them!<hpage>In the hardcore plateau of Nu, there is a lot to learn, but there are also a lot of dangers. Fill your curiosity as needed, and train your senses in the dark.

original_en_text: Don’t let defeat weigh on you, nimble bug! If strength remains, simply step again to the challenge. Let us soar swift together!
original_zh_text: 别灰心！还有力气就再比一次！
translated_text: 失敗に負けないでください、敏捷な虫!権力が残っている場合は、再び挑戦します。一緒に飛ぼう!
secondary_translated_text: Don't be defeated by failure, agile bugs! If the power remains, we will challenge again. Let's fly together!

original_en_text: Oh! Those horrible beasty-beasts are gone! Much and many thanks for you, mighty warrior!<hpage>It was a simple thing, small bug. I assume you are Tipp, the courier?<hpage>Frey, the Bellhart trader, seemed concerned for your safety... and for the cargo you carry.<page>She sent you?! Bah! She needs to learny-learn a little patience! I’m is barely been away! But still... is lucky-lucky for me you came.
original_zh_text: 哇！那些丑、丑八怪全被干掉了！多谢勇士！<hpage>举手之劳。你是蒂普？<hpage>钟心镇的芙蕾很担心你……还有你带的货。<page>她找的你？切！让她学、学着点耐心！我才离开一会儿！
translated_text: おぉ!恐ろしい獣が消えた!ありがとうございます、偉大な兵士!<hpage>それは簡単なことです、バグ。あなたは宅配便のティップですね。<hpage>ベルハルトの交易業者フレイは、あなたの安全そしてあなたが持っている貨物を心配しているようです。<page>彼女が送ったのか？うわー!彼女は学ぶ必要があります-忍耐を学ぶ!私はほとんど去らない!しかし、それでも..。あなたがここにいて幸運です。
secondary_translated_text: oh! The terrifying beast is gone! Thank you, great soldier!<hpage>It's an easy thing, Bug. You are a courier tip, right?<hpage>Frey, a merchant in Berhardt, seems to be concerned for your safety and the cargo you have.<page>did she send it to you? Wow! She needs to learn - learn to be patient! I hardly ever leave! However, even then... You are lucky to be here.

translated_text: Karak Beachの地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of Karak Beach

original_en_text: Well, I’m is be off now. That old grubly-grub in the bell will come after me herself if she not get her goods!
original_zh_text: 好吧，我这就送货去。再不回去那个老、老财迷要亲自追来了！
translated_text: わかった今から行くよ鐘の中の頑固な老人が何も得られなければ、彼女は自分で私のところに来るでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: All right, I'm going from now on. If the stubborn old woman in the bell gets nothing, she'll come to me herself.

original_en_text: Now I must train, and strive, further and faster by your example. Your skill upon these tracks has roused my spirit, nimble bug. You shall forever have my thanks.
original_zh_text: 现在，我要以你为榜样加倍训练！你点燃了我的斗志！我会永远感谢你的！
translated_text: 私は今、あなたの例に従って訓練し、より遠くに、より速く行く必要があります。これらのトラックでのあなたのスキルは私の精神を目覚めさせました，敏捷なバグ。いつもありがとうございます。
secondary_translated_text: I need to train now, follow your example, and go further and faster. Your skills in these tracks have awakened my spirit, agile bug. Thank you always for your support.

original_en_text: A town built within the thick vein of bells that runs through Pharloom’s core. One wonders who would craft so many, and for what purpose?
original_zh_text: 建在钟脉上的小镇。谁造的这么多钟？图什么？
translated_text: ファロの中心部を流れる深い鐘の静脈に囲まれた町。誰が何のためにこんなに作ったのか知りたいのです
secondary_translated_text: A town surrounded by a vein of deep bells that runs through the heart of Faro. I want to know who made all this for what.

original_en_text: Hornet Wielding Needle! With my master’s passing, I have resolved to improve my skills that, in time, I may match her prime.<page>Much work I must do to achieve that goal. I have found this wide bare stone fine ground on which to train.<page>Would you spar with me now? Raise that blade and test my rings! You may prove my greatest challenge yet.
original_zh_text: "使针的小姑娘！导师不在了，我决定要练到她巅峰水平。<page>这块裸岩地正适合特训。<page>来比划比划？亮兵器吧！你或许是我最大的挑战。"
translated_text: バンブルビーが針を振る!マスターが亡くなったことで、私は自分のスキルを磨き、やがてマスターの全盛期に追いつくことを決意しました。<page>この目標を達成するためには、多くの仕事が必要です。私はこの広い、むき出しの石のような良い場所を見つけ、そこで訓練することができました。<page>今、私と競争したいですか？ブレードを上げて指輪をテスト!今までで最大の挑戦になるかもしれません。
secondary_translated_text: Bumblebee's swinging the needle! With Master's passing, I was determined to hone my skills and eventually catch up with Master's heyday.<page>A lot of work is needed to achieve this goal. I could find this wide, bare stone-like good place, and train there. "<page>Do you want to compete with me now? Raise your blade and test the ring! It may be the biggest challenge I've ever had.

original_en_text: <hpage>Your charts and tools show fine skill, Shakra. I’ve met few who’d match your talent.<page>Cartography! Peh. Bakallo! It is a craft-skill common amongst my tribe. Most important to keep one’s mind sharp when on a journey.<page>The charting of caverns, the memory of travel, the knowing of one’s place within the kingdom, an engaging task for a warrior’s mind.<page>An unfortunate thing that my great mentor never learnt the skill. Her talent at getting lost... I should almost be impressed...
original_zh_text: <hpage>你的图纸工具很专业，很少见过这般手艺。<page>测绘？呵！吧咔咯！这是我们部落必学的手艺，最重要的是能在旅途中保持专注。<page>记山洞、画路线、辨方位，最适合战士动脑子的活计。<page>可惜我得导师没这本事。她迷路的本事……反而令我佩服……
translated_text: <hpage>Shakla、あなたのチャートとツールは素晴らしいスキルを示しています。あなたの才能に匹敵する人はほとんどいません。<page>地図作成!ペバカロー!これは私の部族の共通のスキルです。旅の中で頭を澄ませることが最も重要です。<page>洞窟をマッピングし、記憶を旅し、王国での自分の居場所を知ることは、戦士の心にとって魅力的な仕事です。<page>残念ながら、私の偉大な教師はこのスキルを学ばなかった。失った才能。私はほとんど感銘を受けるべきです。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Shakla, your charts and tools show you some great skills. Few people can match your talents. "<page>Create a map! Peppercaro! This is a common skill of my tribe. It is most important to clear your head during the journey.<page>Mapping caves, traveling through memories, and knowing your place in the kingdom is a fascinating job for the warrior's mind.<page>Unfortunately, my great teacher did not learn this skill. The lost talent. I should almost be impressed.

original_en_text: Lots of good stuff tucked away in this old prison... lovely place to bring a lucky little snitchbug like Grindle! What a favour those lugs did us! O-hoho!
original_zh_text: 这破监狱藏着不少好货呀……格林德尔就爱关在这种地方！哦嚯嚯！
translated_text: この古い刑務所には良いものがたくさんあります-グリンデルのような幸運な小さな密告者を受け入れる素敵な場所!この耳がどれほど役に立つか!ああ、ホー!
secondary_translated_text: There's a lot of good in this old prison - a nice place to accept a lucky little informer like Grindell! How helpful this ear is! Oh, ho!

original_en_text: Oooh, ma. Miss grown-up, you deny poor Nuu? So sour!<hpage>I am sorry, Nuu. Though I recognise the value in your wish, my own task is too pressing.
original_zh_text: 呜呜，天啊。大姐姐，你拒绝可怜的努努？好伤心！<hpage>抱歉，努努。我知道你这份祈愿的价值，但我的使命更为紧迫。
translated_text: ああ、ママ。主よ、かわいそうなヌーを否定しますか？酸が多い!<hpage>ごめんね、ヌー。皆さんの願いの価値は理解していますが、私自身の使命はあまりにも緊急です。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, Mama. Lord, will you deny poor Nu? Lots of acid!<hpage>I'm sorry, nu. I understand the value of your wishes, but my own mission is too urgent.

original_en_text: Come to rest here, miss grown-up? Then let Nuu see our journal, for she is eager to see your cuts!
original_zh_text: 大姐姐来这休息？那快让努努看看记录册，等不及要看你的战果啦！
translated_text: 主よ、ここに来て休まないのですか。彼女はあなたのビデオを見たいので、Nuuは私たちの日記を見てください!
secondary_translated_text: Lord, do you not come here to rest? " She wants to see your video, so Nui, check out our diary!

original_en_text: This great structure... It would have taken the lifetimes of so many bugs to build it. Now its wounds run deep, and I can hear the groaning of its final breaths.<page>Everything that grows must pass, I suppose. Still, to witness even its current state is a privilege I’ll not squander.<page>And what of you, friend Hornet? Where are your travels taking you?<hpage>They have taken me deep, and will take me yet deeper still. I have a responsibility to cut this land free of its dark fate.<hpage>That is no concern of yours though, sir. You should continue your own journey, albeit with a claw on your weapon at all times.
original_zh_text: 这宏伟建筑……不知耗费了多少代虫的心血。如今却只能发出垂死呻吟。<page>盛极必衰吧，大概。不过能见证这最后的余晖也是荣幸。<page>你呢？你的旅途通向哪里？<hpage>我要往更深处去，我有责任斩断这片土地的诅咒。<hpage>但这与你无关。继续你的旅程吧，但要记得握紧武器。
translated_text: この偉大な構造。多くの間違いを犯すのに一生かかります。その傷は深くなり、最後の息のうめき声が聞こえました。<page>すべての成長は通過する必要があります。でも、ありのままに見ることができるのは、無駄にしない特権です。<page>あなたはどうですか、バンブルビー。あなたの旅はどこに連れて行く？<hpage>彼らは私を深く魅了し、私を深くします。この地を暗い運命から解放するのは私の義務です。<hpage>しかし、それはあなたには関係ありません。武器に常に爪があっても、旅を続けるべきです。
secondary_translated_text: This great structure. It takes a lifetime to make many mistakes. The wound grew deeper, and I could hear the moans of my last breath.<page>All growth has to pass through. But to be able to see it as it is is a privilege not to be wasted.<page>How about you, Bumblebee? " Where will your journey take you?<hpage>They fascinate me deeply and they make me deep. It is my duty to free this land from its dark fate.<hpage>But it has nothing to do with you. Even if there are always claws in the weapon, you should keep on the journey.

original_en_text: To our safe haven? Our home... This is what’s left of it after the great breaking began.<page>There was that terrible noise from above. Everything shook and fell apart, and the black threads sprung up from beneath. Many a poor pilgrim has already been lost to the destruction.<page>You might have been too, if not for some fleeing pilgrims who found you fallen and carried you back to us.<hpage>The black threads... I may understand their source.<hpage>I must speak with the old Caretaker. Do you know what has become of him? I see he has left you his garb.<page>Oh, yes. He charged me with looking after those remaining here, said he had to confer with his family down below.<hpage>Down below... Then they have slunk away to hide in their ruined chapel.<hpage>I must pay them a visit. Thank you, Sherma. Stay safe, and take care of your fellow pilgrims.
original_zh_text: 这里原本是我们的避难所……大崩塌之后就变成这样了。<page>头顶传来可怕的巨响，天花板塌了，地下还冒出黑丝，好多同袍都被卷走了。<page>要不是几个逃难的同袍发现你昏倒在路边，恐怕你也……<hpage>那些黑丝……我大概知晓其源头。<hpage>我得去找老看守者。你可知道他去哪了？你穿着他的衣服。<page>他让我照顾留下的人，说要去下面和家人商量事情。<hpage>下面……肯定是躲到破教堂里了。<hpage>我得去找他们。你多保重，照顾好大家。
translated_text: 私たちの安全な避難所？私たちの家は、プライドが崩壊してから残っています。<page>上から恐ろしい音がした。すべてが震え、崩壊し、下から黒い線が浮かび上がる。多くの貧しい巡礼者が破壊で死んだ。<page>あなた方が倒れたのを見つけて私たちに連れ戻された逃亡者がいなければ、あなた方も同じだったかもしれません。<hpage>黒い線。その起源がわかるかもしれない。<hpage>私は古い警備員と話す必要がある。彼がどうなったか分かる？彼はあなたの服を残した。<page>ああ、そうだ、ここに残っている人たちの面倒を見て、下の家族に相談しなければならないと言った。<hpage>その後、破壊された教会に潜入した。<hpage>訪問しなければならない。ありがとう、シャーマン。安全を保ち、仲間の巡礼者の世話をしてください。
secondary_translated_text: our safe haven? Our home has remained after the collapse of the Pride.<page>There was a terrifying noise from above. Everything trembles and collapses, and a black line emerges from below. Many poor pilgrims perished in the destruction.<page>If there were no fugitives who found you down and brought us back, you might have been the same.<hpage>The Black Line. Perhaps we can see its origin.<hpage>I need to talk to the old security guard. you know what happened to him? He left your clothes. "<page>Oh, yes, I said that I must take care of those who remain here and consult with the family below.<hpage>Then he infiltrated the destroyed church.<hpage>You must visit them. Thank you, Shaman. Please stay safe and take care of your fellow pilgrims.

original_en_text: Bakkana! A battle well won! The haunted bugs have been defeated and the way forward is yours. Let us meet again soon, away from this dreadful Citadel.
original_zh_text: 啵咔呐！赢得漂亮！迷途虫都被消灭了，你可以继续前行了。后会有期，离这鬼圣堡远点。
translated_text: バカナでの勝利の戦い!幽霊の虫は打ち負かされ、前進の道はあなたのものです。この恐ろしい城から離れて、すぐにまた会いましょう。
secondary_translated_text: A victorious battle in Bacana! The ghost worm has been defeated and the way forward is yours. Get away from this terrible castle and see you again soon.

original_en_text: Huge caves ascending to Pharloom’s Citadel. The roads are slowly being devoured by sand and howling wind.
original_zh_text: 通向圣堡的巨洞，风沙正在逐渐吞噬这里的道路。
translated_text: ファレム城に広がる巨大な洞窟。道路は砂と轟音に飲み込まれていた。
secondary_translated_text: A huge cave extending over the castle of Phalem. The road was swallowed up in sand and roaring.

original_en_text: <hpage>Farewell, tall bug, until we cross again.<page>Or until death calmly claims us both...
original_zh_text: <hpage>再会，下次碰面……<page>或许就是我们的死期……
translated_text: <hpage>さようなら、また通り過ぎるまで。<page>死が穏やかに私たちを連れ去るまで、
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Goodbye, until we pass by again.<page>until death takes us away peacefully,

original_en_text: Again and again you prove your mastery, nimble bug, yet still I never tire of the challenge!<page>As reward for such an impressive feat of endurance, I have only this small trophy, a memento given by my own speed teacher, now fairly passed to you.
original_zh_text: 你一次又一次证明了自己！但我永不厌倦挑战！<page>对这份惊人耐力的奖励，我只有这小奖杯了，是我师父给我的，现在传给你了！
translated_text: あなたは何度も何度もあなたの能力、敏捷性を証明してきましたが、私はまだ挑戦が大好きです!<page>このような印象的な持久力の偉業の報酬として、私はこの小さなトロフィーを持っています。私自身のスピードの先生からのお土産で、今、あなたに公平にお渡しします。
secondary_translated_text: You have proven your ability, agility time and time again, but I still love the challenge!<page>As a reward for such an impressive feat of endurance, I have this little trophy. In a souvenir from my own speed teacher, I now give you fairly.

original_en_text: <page=S>Bring us the hearts, Old One. Make’em beat, fierce and final. See for yourself the forgotten strength of this land of bugs before we burn those memories in its saving.
original_zh_text: <page=M>把心带来，古老者。通过它们的搏动，见证这片虫族土地被遗忘的伟力，再焚尽这些记忆换取救赎。
translated_text: <page=S>老人よ、心を与えてください。最終的に失敗した。これらの記憶を救う前に、この忘れられたバグの国の力を直接見てください。
secondary_translated_text: <page=S>Old man, give me a heart. He ultimately failed. Before you save these memories, take a first-hand look at the power of this forgotten bug country.

original_en_text: Tch... Hahahaa. Marvelous! So the spider knows something of fathomless beings, and still it hopes to stand against one, a god... <page>Where do you hide this boundless strength you claim, spider? I’ve watched your struggle towards us. Yours was a painful, broken trek. One needs grace to stand before the divine.<hpage>Then best you keep watching, child. I’ve found those who claim themselves a god can rarely match the title.<hpage>And experience tells me, even gods can fall.
original_zh_text: 哈！有意思！明知对手是神还妄想反抗？<page>你的底气在哪？爬得又慢又狼狈，谒见神明要优雅！<hpage>那你就继续看好了。自封为神的存在往往名不副实。<hpage>何况经验告诉我，即使是神也会陨落。
translated_text: 略称はHAHA。それは素晴らしい!クモは無意識の生き物について何かを知っていますがそれでも神と戦いたいのです<page>蜘蛛、無限の力はどこにあるの？私たちとの戦いを見ました。あなたの旅は痛みと壊れた旅です。人は神の前に立つために恵みが必要です。<hpage>子供たちを見続けた方がいいでしょう私は、神を自称する人がその称号にふさわしいとは思いません。<hpage>経験は神でさえ落ちることを教えてくれました。
secondary_translated_text: It's called HAHA. That's awesome! Spiders know something about unconscious creatures, but they still want to fight with God.<page>Spider, where is the infinite power? I saw the fight with us. Your journey is a painful and broken journey. A man needs grace to stand before God.<hpage>You'd better keep watching the children, I don't think anyone who claims to be God deserves that title.<hpage>Experience has taught us that even God can fall.

original_en_text: <hpage>Shakra, you look well at home in these wilds.<page>Poshanka! These scorched fields offer many paths and much combat. To leap from vantage upon the red-shells or to meet them face-front with rings ready? These are decisions to live for!<page>I am much surprised those soft pilgrims ever safely climbed this scorched and savage place.
original_zh_text: <hpage>沙克拉，我看你在这荒野中自在的很。<page>啵尚咔！这片荒野多的是战斗机会。是从高处突袭红壳怪？还是正面对决？这才是战士的生活！<page>那些软脚的朝圣者能爬上这鬼地方，倒是让我吃惊。
translated_text: <hpage>シャクラ、あなたはこの荒野で快適に見えます。<page>ボシャンカ!これらの焼け野原は多くの道路と多くの戦いを提供した。赤い貝殻に飛び乗るべきか、それとも指輪をつけて正面から迎えるべきか。これが私たちが生きる決断です!<page>柔らかい巡礼者がこの焼け焦げた野蛮な場所を安全に登ったことに驚きました。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Shakra, you look comfortable in this wilderness.<page>boshanka! These burnt fields provided many roads and many battles. Should I jump on the red shell, or should I wear a ring and greet him from the front? This is the decision that we live!<page>I was amazed that the soft pilgrims climbed safely to this scorched barbaric place.

original_en_text: Here, the proof of our majesty... mark of our divine right...
original_zh_text: 这是王权之证……神授之印……
translated_text: これは私たちの偉大さの証です。神聖な権利の象徴。
secondary_translated_text: This is a testimony to our greatness. Symbol of sacred right.

original_en_text: Hoi hoi! A nimble opponent appears. At last! At last!<hpage>If you are seeking challengers, sir, you should choose a location less far afield. It is rare chance I, or any bug, would come upon this distant cavern.<page>True! Though once discovered, could there be a more perfect spot? This giant, boney body, so distant from Pharloom’s ails.<page>Here, freely, we can test our speed and our sleek shells. Here we may race!<page>You must be eager to step to the task, challenger? Fulfil my wish! Let us discover our limits together!
original_zh_text: 哟嚯！终于来个能跑的！<hpage>先生，若想找虫比试，不该待在如此偏远之地。<page>有道理，但最棒的赛道就在这！还远离纺络的破事。<page>这里能尽情展现速度与甲壳之美！来赛一场吧！<page>你也等不及了吧？快来满足我的愿望，一起测试极限！
translated_text: えっ!!柔軟な相手が現れた。最後に!最後に!<hpage>挑戦者を探しているなら、遠くない場所を選ぶべきです。私や昆虫がこの人里離れた洞窟に入る機会はほとんどありませんでした<page>本当に!!しかし、それを発見したら、何が完璧ですか？この巨大で骨の折れる死体は、ファルムの状態とはかけ離れている。<page>ここでは、スピードと滑らかなケースを自由にテストできます。ここで競争できます!<page>挑戦者、あなたはそれを達成したいですか？私の願いを叶える!一緒に限界を発見しましょう!
secondary_translated_text: what?! A flexible opponent appeared. At last! Finally!<hpage>If you're looking for a challenger, you should choose a location that's not far away. There was very little chance for me or the insects to enter this remote cave.<page>Really!! But once you discover it, what is perfect? This huge, bone-broken corpse is far removed from the state of Farme.<page>Here you can freely test your speed and smooth case. You can compete here!<page>Challenger, do you want to accomplish it? Let my wish come true! Let's discover the limits together!

original_en_text: Our capital, built grand... The seat of our sovereignty... slipped from my mind...<page>Why does it fade? Why can I not recall that sacred place?
original_zh_text: 我的宏伟的都城……我的王座……为什么记不清了……<page>为什么消失了……为什么想不起圣地模样……
translated_text: 私たちの首都は素晴らしい。主権はどこにあるのか。頭の中から消えた。<page>なぜ消えるのか？なぜ聖地を思い出せないのか。
secondary_translated_text: Our capital is great. Where is the sovereignty? It disappeared from my head.<page>why are they disappearing? Why don't we remember the holy place?

original_en_text: Zaza and I will tarry here a little longer... These pilgrims need watching over, and we are committed to the task.
original_zh_text: 我和扎扎会在这多待一会……这些朝圣者需要照看。
translated_text: ザザと私はもう少し長くここにいるだろうこれらの巡礼者は世話をする必要があり、私たちはその使命に専念している。
secondary_translated_text: Zaza and I will be here a little longer these pilgrims need to be cared for and we are dedicated to that mission.

original_en_text: Delicious! I like you already!<page>But what a bore it would be to cut you down now, when you’re so achingly close to our grand Citadel...<page>Climb higher, little spider. I want to savour your struggle just a little longer!
original_zh_text: 有意思！我开始喜欢你了！<page>但现在杀你太无聊了，离圣堡就差一步……<page>继续爬吧小蜘蛛！让我想多看看你挣扎的样子！
translated_text: おいしい!もう好きだよ!<page>しかし、今あなたを切り倒すのはどんなに退屈だろう、あなたが私たちの壮大な城の近くにいるときには。<page>もっと高く登って、小さな蜘蛛。また戦いを楽しみたいです!
secondary_translated_text: Delicious! I already like it!<page>But how boring it would be to chop you down now, when you are near our magnificent castle. "<page>Climb higher up, little spider. I want to enjoy fighting again!

original_en_text: But Nuu is sensible, she understands. Miss grown-up has purpose, she must be away.<page>The cleaning can wait for another time. Nuu is patient... always patient.
original_zh_text: 但努努很懂事，知道大姐姐有正事要忙。<page>清洁可以等下次，努努很耐心……最有耐心了……
translated_text: ダニーは賢く、理解している。この女性には目的があり、去らなければならない。<page>掃除は次回まで待てます。ヌーは非常に忍耐強い。常に忍耐強く。
secondary_translated_text: Danny is smart and understands. This woman has a purpose, and she has to leave.<page>I 'll wait until next time to clean up. Nu is very patient. Always be patient.

original_en_text: <hpage>You seem to have some familiarity with this prison and its guards. Do you know a path to escape?<page>Escape! A little jailbug like you ain’t ever escapin’ anything! Get out of here, will you? Stop bothering us! You got nothing to steal, so we got nothing to talk about!
original_zh_text: <hpage>你看起来对这里很熟，知道越狱路线吗？<page>想逃？就你？下辈子吧！别烦我们了，身上什么也没有，没资格跟爷说话！
translated_text: <hpage>刑務所や警備員に詳しいようですね。逃げる方法を知っていますか？<page>走れ!あなたのような小さな囚人は決して逃げられません!ここから出て行ってもう邪魔するな!盗むものは何もないので、話すことはない!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>You seem familiar with prisons and guards. do you know how to escape?<page>run! A little prisoner like you can never escape! " get out of here and don't bother me anymore! There's nothing to steal, so there's no talking!

original_en_text: Though the dust has not yet settled over our battle here, Zaza and I must soon be away. The memory of our village calls us ever onward. Farewell, brave sister!
original_zh_text: 虽然战斗激起的尘埃还没落定，但我们该走啦。村里的大伙催着我们前进呢，保重，姐妹！
translated_text: ここでの戦いはまだ終わっていないが、ザザと私はできるだけ早く去らなければならない。村の記憶は私たちを前進させる。さようなら、勇敢な妹!
secondary_translated_text: The battle here is not over yet, but Zaza and I must leave as soon as possible. The memory of the village moves us forward. Farewell, brave sister!

original_en_text: <page>You would challenge again, nimble bug? You have proven yourself time and again.<hpage>Your course can still provide understanding, sir. Upon it, I see my own limits clearer and learn to push them further. <page>Of course! Of course! And I can learn much following behind your fair form.<page>I’d need only a moment, and the track would again be ready.
original_zh_text: <page>还要比？你已经证明实力了。<hpage>还需练习，你的赛道让我能看清自己的极限。<page>那当然好！跟在你这矫健身姿后面也能学到很多！<page>稍等，马上就能布置好新赛道！
translated_text: <page>またミスに挑戦したいですか？あなたは何度も自分自身を証明した。<hpage>先生、あなたのコースはまだ理解を提供します。それ以来、自分の限界をより明確に見て、それをさらに推し進めることを学びました。<page>もちろんです!もちろんです!その美しさから学ぶことがたくさんあります。<page>少し時間が必要で、コースは再び準備が整います。
secondary_translated_text: <page>Do you want to challenge Miss again? You've proven yourself many times.<hpage>Teacher, your course still provides understanding. Since then, I've learned to see my limitations more clearly and push them even further.<page>of course! of course! There is so much to learn from that beauty.<page>It will take a little time and the course will be ready again.

original_en_text: <hpage>Your threats are worthless, child. If you are my foe, stay your voice and raise your blade.
original_zh_text: <hpage>不必多费口舌，孩子，要打的话，就亮兵器吧。
translated_text: <hpage>あなたの脅威は無意味です。もしあなたが私の敵なら、声を上げて剣を上げてください。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Your threat is meaningless. If you are my enemy, raise your voice and raise your sword. "

original_en_text: I can save you, little spider. All the trouble you’d face above. All the suffering. It’s so simple.<page>I’ll just skewer you here and now, pluck that flickering life right out of you.
original_zh_text: 我能救你哦~小蜘蛛。只要现在刺穿你，把那点小火星掐灭……<page>所有的苦痛，所有的折磨，就都能解脱了。
translated_text: 私はあなたを救うことができる、クモ。あなたがそこで直面するすべての問題。全ての苦しみ。とてもシンプルです<page>私は今、あなた方を結びつけ、あなた方の中に輝く生命を引き出します。
secondary_translated_text: I can save you, Spider. All the issues you face there. All the suffering. It's so simple.<page>I now unite you and bring forth the life that shines within you.

original_en_text: How sad. A little spider has fallen from its cage. So lost. So weak. Poor little morsel.
original_zh_text: 可怜的小蜘蛛从笼中跌落。多迷茫，多脆弱，真是令人心疼。
translated_text: 小さな蜘蛛が檻から落ちてしまったのは悲しいことです。だから負けたんだ弱すぎた。かわいそうな小さな男。
secondary_translated_text: It is sad that a little spider has fallen out of the cage. That's why I lost. I was too weak. Poor little guy.

original_en_text: Ooooh ma, is well-begun. Many creatures have been recorded, but many many more still to be learned of!<page>Miss grown-up, you should rest quick and venture out to hunt again soon, thinks Nuu!
original_zh_text: 哇哇，开了个好头！记了好多生物，但还有更多等着发现！<page>大姐姐赶紧休息完再去打猎呀！
translated_text: ママ、これは良いスタートです。多くの生物が記録されていますが、もっと知る必要があります。<page>早く休んで、できるだけ早く狩りに行きなさい。考えてみろ!
secondary_translated_text: Mom, this is a good start. Many organisms have been documented, but we need to know more about them.<page>Rest early and go hunting as soon as possible. think about it!

original_en_text: Well fought sister, well fought! Though terrible and tenacious, the beast was no match for us.<page>Be proud! The bugs of this land will sing of our victory to their offspring, and their offspring’s offspring, forever more!
original_zh_text: 打得漂亮！这畜生虽然强悍，但不是我们的对手！<page>等着听这儿的虫子们传唱咱们的战绩吧！
translated_text: お姉ちゃん、よくやった!この獣は恐ろしくて頑固だが、我々の敵ではない。<page>誇りに思う!この地の虫たちは、われわれの勝利を、その子孫のために永遠に歌う。
secondary_translated_text: Sister, well done! This beast is terrifying and stubborn, but it is not our enemy.<page>I'm proud! The worms of the earth will sing of our victory forever for their descendants.

original_en_text: Hah... aha ha ha ha ha!<page>Congratulations, spider. Finally, I felt your sting, and you’ve bared the truth of my pathetic empty shell.<hpage>You always had the scent, child. You are no bug. Yours is a life born entirely from thread.<page>Life? You’re too generous! This weak, wasting existence. This was not life, just a husk shaped to act as a child.<hpage>Yours was life, pale one. Do not confuse your unique creation with its absence. I have seen others make the same mistake.<page>Platitudes, spider? From you? Don’t be gross.<page>Head on. Climb up, up and away. You’ve earned your audience with the divine.<page>Face the holy mother who would fashion so cruel and crude a daughter as me.
original_zh_text: 哈……哈哈哈哈！<page>恭喜啊小蜘蛛，你终于刺痛了我……也知道了我是具可悲的空壳。<hpage>我早察觉到了，孩子。你根本不是虫类，纯粹是丝线捏造的生命。<page>生命？你还真是心善！这种虚弱、日渐腐朽的身躯……这算什么生命，就是具空壳罢了。<hpage>你确实活着，苍白之子。我见过与你类似的存在……即便内里空无一物，你也是独一无二的生命。<page>少说漂亮话了，我只觉得恶心。<page>上去吧，你赢得觐见神明的资格了。<page>去面见那位造出我这般残次品的'圣母'吧……
translated_text: ああ! ああ!<page>おめでとう、クモ。最後に、私はあなたの痛みを感じ、あなたは私の悲しみの殻の真実を暴露しました。<hpage>あなたはいつもそうです、子供。お前は虫じゃないあなたの人生はラインから生まれます。<page>人生は？あなたは寛大すぎる!この弱くて無駄な存在。これは生命ではなく、子供として機能する体です。<hpage>あなたの人生、白い人生です。あなたのユニークな創造物とその不在を混同しないでください。私は同じ間違いをする他の人を見る。<page>古い、蜘蛛？あなたから？病気にならないで<page>上を向いて立って、立って、去る。あなたは神聖な聴衆を獲得した。<page>聖母マリアと対峙すれば、彼女は私のように残酷で暴力的な娘を作るでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: oh! oh!<page>Congratulations, spider. Finally, I felt your pain, and you exposed the truth of my grief shell.<hpage>You are always, child. You are not a worm, your life is born from the line.<page>what about life? You're too generous! This weak and useless existence. This is not life, but a body that functions as a child.<hpage>Your life, a white life. Do not confuse your unique creation with its absence. I see others making the same mistakes.<page>Old, spider? from you? don't get sick.<page>Stand up, stand up, and leave. You've gained a sacred audience.<page>If you confront the Virgin Mary, she will make a cruel and violent daughter like me.

original_en_text: Conversing is a pleasure, but I must return to my observance. Try not to leave too much of a trail when you leave, please.
original_zh_text: 和你聊天很愉快，但我得继续去观察了。离开时注意别留太多痕迹。
translated_text: 話すのは楽しいですが、私は儀式に戻らなければなりません。出発時に痕跡を残さないようにしてください。
secondary_translated_text: It's fun to talk about, but I have to get back to the ritual. Try not to leave any traces when you leave.

original_en_text: <page=M>Enough chatting, Old One. Best you get heading below. Whatever action you’re planning, time is against you.
original_zh_text: <page=M>那么闲话少叙，古老者。赶紧下去吧，您的计划可拖不起。
translated_text: <page=M>やめなさい、老人。運転してください。どんな行動を取ろうとしても、時間はあなたと戦っています。
secondary_translated_text: <page=M>Stop it, old man. Please drive me. No matter what action you take, time is fighting you.

original_en_text: For sharing this moment I shall have you accept a gift, one I had believed I would never pass. <page>You would take these rings, and the learnings to make more.<page>They are built of a clever method devised by my master and will crush hard this kingdom’s toughest shell. Use them, and she is remembered!<hpage>My thanks, Shakra. To gain a tool so defined by its owner, I am much grateful. They shall prove a great aid on my own journey.
original_zh_text: 谢谢你陪我度过这一时刻，这些东西我本想永远留着……你当作谢礼收下吧。<page>这些环刃和制法都传给你。<page>它们是按我导师的巧思打造的，能击碎最硬的壳。希望你用得上，以此纪念她！<hpage>感激不尽，沙克拉。能继承如此珍贵的武器，对我的旅程大有帮助。
translated_text: この瞬間を分かち合うために、私は決して渡さないと信じている贈り物を受け取ってください。<page>これらのリングを取って、詳細を学びます。<page>王国で最も硬い貝殻を粉砕するために、私のマスターが考案した巧妙な方法で建てられました。使用して記憶されます!<hpage>ありがとうございました。所有者が定義したツールを使用できることに感謝します。私自身の旅に大いに役立つでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: To share this moment, please accept the gift that I believe I will never give away.<page>Take these rings and learn the details.<page>It was built in an ingenious manner devised by my master to crush the hardest shells in the kingdom. It will be used and remembered!<hpage>Thank you very much. We appreciate the owner being able to use the tools defined. It will help me a lot on my own journey.

original_en_text: The warmth of these caverns keeps many smells alive! Is good for Nuu, who is always searching carefully for learnings!
original_zh_text: 洞窟里的余温保留着气味！正适合努努慢慢探索！
translated_text: この洞窟の暖かさは、多くの匂いを残します!常に知識を求めているヌーにとっては朗報です!
secondary_translated_text: The warmth of this cave leaves a lot of smell! This is good news for Noo, who is always looking for knowledge!

original_en_text: <hpage>Little pilgrim, these baths provide some respite from the dangers without, but even so you should not let down your guard.<hpage>You must have seen now that the bugs of this Citadel are long fallen to the Haunting.<page>Ahh... some of my brothers and sisters have seemed... lost somehow, yes. But to be lost is to be sometime found, is it not sung?<page>Yes... The Citadel will provide for them. It is a holy place indeed, that holds wonders such as this lovely warm bath!
original_zh_text: <hpage>小家伙，别因为泡澡放松警惕。<hpage>你也看到了，此地的虫民多半被丝咒侵蚀。<page>有些同袍确实……看着不太对劲。但迷途终有归时，对吧？<page>圣堡自会庇佑他们。能有这么舒服的暖泉，肯定是圣地没错！
translated_text: <hpage>小さなシャンク、これらの浴槽は一時的に外の危険を緩和しますが、それでもあなたは警戒を緩めることはできません。<hpage>お分かりのように、この城の昆虫はすでに幽霊の手に落ちています。<page>あっ...。私の兄弟姉妹のようです。なんで負けたんだよ、うん。でも、失ったものはいつか見つかるんですよね。<page>そうですね。城は彼らに仕える。ここは本当に神聖な場所で、この素敵なホットタブのような驚異があります!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>A small sink, these bathtubs will temporarily alleviate the dangers outside, but even then you can not relax your vigilance.<hpage>As you can see, the insects in this castle have already fallen into the hands of the ghosts.<page>ah... Like my brothers and sisters. Why did you lose, yeah? But you'll find what you've lost someday, right?<page>That's right, sir. The castle serves them. This is a truly sacred place, and there are wonders like this lovely hot tub!

original_en_text: Hoi! Let our mighty contest of shells commence again!
original_zh_text: 哟嚯！再战一轮！<page>我马上布置新的赛道！
translated_text: おい!また、強力なシェルレースを始めましょう!
secondary_translated_text: Hey! Let's also start a powerful shell race!

original_en_text: Hoy! We thought one of them buzzing bullies was sneakin’ up on us, but it’s just a mangy jailbug!<page>Why you in here, then? Caught thievin’ were you? Greedy, greedy!<hpage>I’ve stolen nothing. Rather, I suspect the wardens are servants of the Citadel. The cage used in my capture bore similar runes to the one that first brought me to this land.<hpage>Bound in that cage, I’d have proved a fine gift were they to deliver me to their masters.<page>Pah, there ain’t nothin’ fine about you, jailbug. We recognised a fellow thief soon as we saw you!<page>Now, don’t be lingerin’ around here. Those guards’ll be wanting to pop you back in your cage quick quick!<hpage>They’ll not get the chance. I will reclaim my belongings and leave this grim place with haste.
original_zh_text: 还当是狱卒呢，结果是只脏老鼠！<page>你是因为偷什么进来的？贪心鬼！<hpage>我没偷东西。这儿的狱卒应该侍奉于圣堡，抓我的笼子和最初那个有相同印记。<hpage>如此执着于我，看来它们真的认为我是一份献给主人的好礼物。<page>呸，你身上有什么好的！少装蒜，我一看你就一脸贼相！<page>快走快走！别在附近瞎晃悠，小心又被关回笼子！<hpage>他们没机会的，我取回自己的东西就走。
translated_text: おい!いじめっ子が近づいてきたと思ったが、それはただの汚い脱出だった!<page>なぜここに来たの？泥棒を捕まえたのか？貪欲だ貪欲だ!<hpage>何も盗まなかった。私は、看守が城の召使いであることを疑う。私を監禁する檻には、私を最初にこの地に連れて行った檻に似たルーン文字が刻まれています。<hpage>もし彼らが私を主人に引き渡し、私が檻の中に閉じ込められていたら、私は素晴らしい贈り物になるでしょう。<page>あなたは良いものを持っていない、看守。見た瞬間に泥棒がわかりました!<page>ここに留まらないでください。警備員はあなたを檻に戻したいと思います。急げ!<hpage>チャンスはなかった。私は自分のものを取り戻し、できるだけ早くこの暗い場所から抜け出したい。
secondary_translated_text: hey! I thought the bully was approaching, but it was just a dirty escape!<page>why did you come here? did you catch the thief? Greed, greed!<hpage>I didn't steal anything. I suspect that the keeper is a servant of the castle. The cage in which I am imprisoned is carved with a runic letter similar to the cage that first brought me to this land.<hpage>If they handed me over to my masters and I was locked in a cage, I would be a wonderful gift.<page>You don't have a good one, Warden. The moment I saw it, I knew the thief! "<page>Please do not stay here. The guards want you back in the cage. hurry!<hpage>He had no chance. I want to get my things back and get out of this dark place as soon as possible.

original_en_text: You recover quickly. Already, my ring-marks have faded from your shell. If you are prepared, let us duel again.
original_zh_text: 你恢复真快，我留下的环印都消了。准备好了我们就再战。
translated_text: 回復が早いですね私の指輪の刻印はあなたの殻から消えてしまった。準備ができていれば、また戦いましょう。
secondary_translated_text: Your recovery is fast, my ring imprint has vanished from your shell. If we are ready, we will fight again.

original_en_text: ...Yes, communication is the heart of it. The grandest boasts and the tiniest murmurings all have their meanings...<page>...Your point is well made. Even the flowers have their stories to tell. Light can be cast anywhere...<hpage>I’ve no desire to interrupt your meditations, Herald, but I am eager to speak with you, if you would listen...<page>...Take note of it all, render it in line, you’ll be glad that you did. You can take the journey home with you...
original_zh_text: ……沟通至关重要。无论豪言壮语还是呢喃低语皆有深意……<page>……此言甚是。野花亦在诉说故事。光明无处不在...<hpage>使者大人，无意打扰冥思，但我急盼能与您交谈，您……<page>……记录所见所闻，他日必将受用。故乡之路存于心……
translated_text: ...はい、コミュニケーションはコアです。最大の吹聴と最小の囁きには道理がある<page>...あなたは意味がある。花にも物語があります。光はどこにでも投影できる。<hpage>私はあなたの考えを中断したくない、パイオニア、しかし、もしあなたが聞いてくれるなら、私はあなたと話したいです。<page>...それをすべて書き留め、順番に提示すれば、それをしたことを喜ぶでしょう。家に帰る旅をすることができます。
secondary_translated_text: ... Yes, communication is core. There's a reason for the biggest blowing and the smallest whistling.<page>... You have a meaning. Flowers also have a story. The light can be projected anywhere.<hpage>I don't want to interrupt your thoughts, Pioneer, but I'd like to talk to you, if you would listen.<page>... If you write it all down and present it in order, you'll be glad you did it. You can make the journey home.

original_en_text: Oooh, but the scroll is so heavy with beautiful beasts! Could it be that the works is almost complete? Miss grown-up, you must keep your preyings up. No time for rest!
original_zh_text: 哎呀，记录册都快写满了！是不是快完成了？大姐姐不能偷懒哦！
translated_text: しかし、巻物には美しい獣がたくさんいます!プロジェクトはほぼ完成ですか？主よ、お嬢さん、狩りを続けてください。休む時間がない!
secondary_translated_text: But there are plenty of beautiful beasts in the scroll! Is the project almost complete? Lord, miss, please continue to hunt. No time to rest!

original_en_text: The myth we made... by grace... by blade...<page>All bowed before we princes green...
original_zh_text: 我们缔造的传说……凭恩泽……凭利刃……<page>万虫皆向绿王臣服……
translated_text: 私たちが作り上げた神話。あなたの恵みに感謝します。刃を使う。<page>皆が私たちの緑の王子にお辞儀をして
secondary_translated_text: The myths we have created. I thank you for your grace. Use the blade.<page>and all of you bow down to our green prince

original_en_text: So many moments spent simple... joyful... free...
original_zh_text: 那些简单……快乐……自由的时光……
translated_text: 多くの瞬間はシンプルです。自由と喜び。
secondary_translated_text: Many moments are simple. Freedom and Joy.

original_en_text: Do you see? How crass and frail that Citadel’s machines! This one groans in pain at its very existence.<hpage>Its mechanism is likely jammed. If the gears were unstuck its clamorous complaints would soon cease, and it could become a useful place to rest.<page>A place to rest or no, I desire only for the noise to stop!
original_zh_text: 瞧见没？圣堡的破机器嘎吱乱叫，活着都费劲。<hpage>齿轮卡住了。修好应该能当个歇息的好地方，噪音也能停。<page>歇不歇息无所谓，我只想赶紧让这破响动停下来！
translated_text: 見たか？要塞の機械はどれほど単純で壊れやすいのか!男はその存在に苦しみながらうめき声を上げた。<hpage>メカニズムは立ち往生するかもしれない。ギアを外すと、その騒音はすぐに止まり、便利な休憩場所になります。<page>休憩場所があるかどうかにかかわらず、騒音を止めたいだけです!
secondary_translated_text: did you see that? How simple and fragile are the machinery of the fortress! The man groaned, suffering at his presence.<hpage>The mechanism may get stuck. When you take off the gear, the noise immediately stops, making it a convenient place to rest.<page>Whether you have a break or not, you just want to stop the noise!

original_en_text: These root-woven roads show evidence of my master’s passage. A thrice-crushed bug, gouged wood, score-prints of sharp claws passing. Small signs that only I can read.<page>Though the trail is cold, it eases me to know she is still within this land.
original_zh_text: 这附近有导师踪迹：尖锐的爪痕、凿开的树木、压扁的虫尸……只有我看得懂。<page>虽然痕迹都挺久了，但知道她还在纺络我就安心了。
translated_text: これらの根が織りなす道は、師匠が歩んだ証です。1匹の虫は3回粉砕され、木は切り裂かれ、爪は鋭い跡を残した。私にしか読めない小さな看板です。<page>道は寒かったが、彼女がまだ陸地にいることを知ってほっとした。
secondary_translated_text: The paths weave by these roots are a testimony that the Master has walked. One worm was crushed three times, the tree was torn apart, and the claws left sharp marks. It's a small sign that only I can read.<page>The road was cold, but he was relieved to know she was still on land.

original_en_text: <hpage>These are dangerous fields, young one, not for casual wandering. What task sees you brave them?<page>A treacherous quest! But a crucial one! Upon the last wish of my father, I’ve taken up the study of these wild caves.<page>These fields still display life and growth, even as the lands around erode to dust.<page>There is a hot harmony here that eludes the grey wastes above and the dry Marrow beside. With time and study, I shall uncover why.
original_zh_text: <hpage>小虫子，这片荒野很危险，你怎么有胆子进来闲逛？<page>虽然危险，但很重要！我是继承父亲遗志在研究这些洞穴！<page>即便到处都是腐蚀和灰烬，这片荒野却还显露着生机。<page>这里肯定有特殊热源维系，我要找出原因！
translated_text: <hpage>若い人たち、ここは危険な領域であり、ただぶら下がるだけではありません。彼らに立ち向かう勇気は何ですか？<page>危険な任務だ!しかし、これは不可欠です!父の希望で野生の洞窟の研究を始めました<page>周囲の土地が浸食されてほこりになっても、畑は活気に満ち、成長します。<page>上の灰色の廃棄物と隣の乾燥した骨髄を避ける燃えるような調和があります。時間と研究があれば、理由がわかります。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Young people, this is dangerous territory, and we can't just hang around. What courage do you have to face them?<page>It's a dangerous mission! However, this is essential! In my father's hopes, I began to study the wild caves.<page>Even when the surrounding land is eroded and turned to dust, the fields are still vibrant and growing.<page>There is a burning harmony avoiding the gray waste on top and the dried bone marrow next door. With time and research, you'll see why.

original_en_text: Track your location throughout these winding lands with a bone compass. Each member of our tribe can craft them. I would pass you mine, for a small price.
original_zh_text: 这个骨制罗盘能让你分辨自己的位置。我们部落都会做，付点小钱就给你。
translated_text: 骨コンパスを使用して、曲がりくねった土地の位置を追跡します。私たちの部族の誰でも作れます私はあなたに私の小さなお金を与えるだけです。
secondary_translated_text: Use a bone compass to track the location of the crooked land. Anyone in our tribe can make it I'll just give you my little money.

original_en_text: Ooooh, ma ma! Even young Nuu never guessed that Pharloom held so many fascinating creatures! Soft ones, hard ones, small ones, big ones! Nuu is greedy to see what remains!
original_zh_text: 哇！连努努都没想到纺络有这么多神奇生物！软的硬的大的小的！好贪心，好想看剩下的！
translated_text: ああ、ママ!若いヌーでさえ、ファロ島にこんなに多くの魅力的な生き物がいるとは思わなかった。ソフト、ハード、スモール、ビッグ!ヌーは残っているものを見るために貪欲です!
secondary_translated_text: Oh, Mama! Even the young Nu never thought there were so many fascinating creatures on Faro Island. Soft, hard, small, big! Noo is greedy to see what's left!

original_en_text: You see this idol before us, red maiden? I have passed its like before. They mark our pilgrimage well.<page>If we sing to it, a miraculous shrine will rise from the ground, and we will have a place to rest! Such a wonder!<hpage>It is not song that rouses this shrine, but payment in rosaries.<hpage>Without rosaries, the shrine remains hidden. I have encountered similar constructs on Pharloom’s paths. This kingdom does not grant rest lightly.
original_zh_text: 看见这圣像了吗？沿途都有标记。<page>对着它歌唱，圣椅就会升起供我们歇息！多神奇！<hpage>唤醒长椅的不是歌声，谢尔玛，而是念珠。<hpage>无念珠者不得休憩，纺络从不轻易施恩。
translated_text: 私たちの前に赤い女の子が見えますか？前にも経験した。私たちの巡礼をよく覚えています。<page>それに向かって歌えば、魔法の寺院が立ち上がり、休息の場所ができるのです。なんて奇跡だ!<hpage>寺院を目覚めさせるのは歌ではなく、ロザリオの報酬です。<hpage>ロザリオはなく、神社は隠されたままです。私はファラムに向かう途中で同じような建物に出くわしました。王国は簡単には休まない。
secondary_translated_text: Do you see the red girl in front of us? I have experienced it before. I remember our pilgrimage very well.<page>If you sing to it, a magical temple will rise up and become a place of rest. what a miracle!<hpage>It is not the song that wakes the temple, but the reward of the Rosary.<hpage>There is no Rosary, and the shrine remains hidden. I came across a similar building on my way to Faram. The Kingdom does not rest easily.

original_en_text: You can use these to mark places of importance or reminders on your map.<br><br>These I have fashioned from the husks of old bells. A hard task to make, so the cost reflects the extra effort.
original_zh_text: 你可以用这个在地图上标记重要地点或提醒事项。<br><br>用古钟的壳打磨成的，可费劲了。
translated_text: 地図上の重要な場所やリマインダーをマークするために使用できます。<br><br>古い時計ケースで作りました。これは困難な作業であるため、コストは余分な努力を反映します。
secondary_translated_text: It can be used to mark important places and reminders on the map.<br><br>I made it with an old watch case. This is a difficult task, so the cost reflects the extra effort.

original_en_text: Poshanka! Here we meet, high atop this twisted steel structure. I can sense fierce enemies ahead.<page>It seems you too draw closer to your trail’s end. With my own task now resolved, my rings call for combat.<page>Hornet Wielding Needle, shall we fight forward together?
original_zh_text: 啵尚咔！你好啊，又见面了。我能感受到前面有强大的敌人在呢。<page>看来你的旅途也走了很远了。现在我的任务也完成了，正手痒呢。<page>使针的小姑娘，怎么说，我们一起上吧？
translated_text: ボシャンカ!私たちはここで会いますこのねじれた鉄骨構造のすぐ上です目の前に激しい敵を感じることができる。<page>道の終わりに近づいているようですね。私の使命が終わった今、私の指輪は戦う必要があります。<page>スズメバチが針を振って一緒に戦うのか？
secondary_translated_text: boshanka! We meet here, right above this twisted steel structure, you can feel the fierce enemy in front of you.<page>You seem to be nearing the end of the road. Now that my mission is over, my ring needs to fight.<page>do hornets wave their needles and fight together?

original_en_text: All of these marvellous healing supplies... Surely they, at least, are some proof of the Citadel’s holy nature?
original_zh_text: 这么多神奇药品……至少说明圣堡还是灵验的吧？
translated_text: すべての素晴らしい治療法。少なくとも、それらは城の神聖な性質の証拠ですか？
secondary_translated_text: All great treatments. At least, are they evidence of the sacred nature of the castle?

original_en_text: H-hoy red m-maiden! Have no f-fear, ‘tis only I, Sherma!<page>I found healing supplies, b-but then the way back collapsed... and I heard moaning from the dark... oh, how thankful I am to see you!
original_zh_text: 红、红衣姑娘！是我是我！<page>我找到药，可是路塌了……又听见黑暗里有怪声……见到你太好了！
translated_text: おい、レッドガール!恐れるな、俺だシャーマン!<page>治療用品を見つけたのに、帰りの道は陥没していた暗闇の中でうめき声が聞こえてきて、あなたに会えてどれほど感激していたか!
secondary_translated_text: Hey, red girl! Don't be afraid, it's me, Shaman!<page>How grateful I was to see you when I found the healing supplies, and when I heard groans in the darkness that was sinking on my way home!

translated_text: ワームの地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of Worms

translated_text: 一緒に戦いましょうか？
secondary_translated_text: shall we fight together?

original_en_text: The great Citadel is so close, I can hear the voices of our brother and sister pilgrims calling out to us!
original_zh_text: 圣堡近在咫尺！兄弟姐妹的呼唤已传到我耳中了！
translated_text: 大いなる城が近くにあり、兄弟姉妹の巡礼者たちの呼びかけが聞こえました。
secondary_translated_text: The great castle was nearby, and the call of the brothers and sisters of the pilgrims could be heard.

original_en_text: What a battle, brave warrior! You’re the first I’ve seen who could match the red-shells and emerge victorious.<hpage>They are deadly foes indeed, and seemingly keen hunters. You did well to keep yourself hidden from them, young bug.<page>I did, didn’t I? Disguise and subterfuge are skills I’ve honed keenly, all in aid of my most important work!
original_zh_text: 打得太漂亮了！我还是头回见有虫能干掉红壳怪！<hpage>它们确实是狠角色，狩猎本能很强。你躲得挺好。<page>是吧？伪装潜行可是我的绝活，都是为了伟大研究！
translated_text: 何という戦いだ、勇敢な兵士たち!あなたはレッドシェルと競争して勝つことができた最初の人です。<hpage>彼らは本当に致命的な敵であり、熱心なハンターのようです。あなたは彼らから離れて自分自身を保つ良い仕事をしている、小さなバグ。<page>やったんだよね？変装とトリックは私が最も重要な仕事をするのに役立つように、私が慎重に磨いたスキルです!
secondary_translated_text: What a fight, brave soldiers! You're the first one who could compete with Red Shell and win.<hpage>They are truly deadly enemies, and they seem to be avid hunters. You're doing a good job of keeping yourself away from them, little bug.<page>you did, right? Costumes and tricks are skills that I have carefully honed to help me do the most important work!

original_en_text: Mind yourself while you travel this grim land. A great winged beast has been stalking the heights, swooping without warning and tearing the life out of unwary travellers!<hpage>I believe I have seen the creature you speak of. It may have marked me as prey, and followed me down onto the lower roads of the moor.<page>What what! Gurrrooo! The beast has been spotted! Once Zaza has fully rested, we’ll set to tracking it down!
original_zh_text: 当心天上，有只长翅膀的畜生专抓路人！<hpage>我见过它，多半是盯上我了，还跟到了沼泽这边。<page>你说什么！嘎噜！那畜生就在附近！等扎扎歇够了就去宰了它！
translated_text: この過酷な土地を旅する際には注意してください。巨大な翼を持つ獣が上空をさまよい、警告もなく潜り、不注意な旅人の命を奪っている!<hpage>私はあなたが言った生き物を見た。それは私を獲物としてマークし、荒野の低い道をたどるかもしれません。<page>何だ？なんだよ!ゴーラム!獣が発見された!ザザが完全に休息したら、追跡を開始します!
secondary_translated_text: Be careful when traveling in this harsh land. A giant winged beast wanders the skies above, lurking without warning, and taking the lives of careless travelers!<hpage>I saw the creature you mentioned. It may mark me as prey, and follow the low path of the wilderness.<page>what's that? what are you doing? GORAM! The Beast has been found! Once Zaza is fully rested, we will start the pursuit!

original_en_text: Welcome back red maiden, and thank you again for coming to my aid.<page>I’m no healer, but with the supplies we found in the ward below even my unlearned claws can ease the suffering of our brothers and sisters.<page>That such darkness could creep into this most holy of places, even though we pilgrims kept our promise to ascend...<page>I confess, I wonder at the meaning of it all. But enlightenment does not come easily, or all at once... I should just continue my task in the meantime.
original_zh_text: 红衣姑娘回来啦！再次感谢你帮忙。<page>我本来不懂医术，不过从下面拿来了药，简单包扎也能止痛。<page>我们千辛万苦爬上来，黑暗还是钻进了圣地……<page>实在想不通！但悟道要慢慢来……先做好手头的事吧！
translated_text: お帰りなさい、赤い女の子、助けてくれてありがとう。<page>私はセラピストではありませんが、下の病棟で見つけた物資があれば、私が学んでいない爪でさえ、兄弟姉妹の苦しみを和らげることができます。<page>私たち巡礼者は登山の約束を守りますが、この最も神聖な場所に暗闇が忍び込みます。<page>その意味を知りたいと思います。しかし啓蒙は容易ではない、あるいは突然やってくる― ―それと同時に、私は私の使命を続けなければならない。
secondary_translated_text: Welcome home, red girl, thank you for your help.<page>I'm not a therapist, but with the supplies I found in the ward below, even the nails I haven't learned can ease the suffering of my brothers and sisters.<page>We pilgrims keep our promises to climb the mountain, but darkness creeps into this most sacred place.<page>I want to know what that means. But enlightenment is not easy, or it comes suddenly - - and at the same time, I must continue my mission.

original_en_text: Hrm...? Oh, hoy there! I was hoping we would meet here, red maiden.<page>Rising at last to the heights of the Citadel and being amongst so many of my brothers and sisters... it is a blessing indeed. Yes, a blessing.<hpage>Your voice belies some hesitation in that belief, little pilgrim. You have seen now the reality of this broken place. What do you make of it, truly?
original_zh_text: 嗯？红衣姑娘！没想到在这儿碰上了！<page>能登上圣堡和这么多同袍团聚……真是恩赐……嗯，是恩赐。<hpage>你听起来有些犹豫？想必你已看清此地的破败真相，有什么感想？
translated_text: え？えっ？ああ、そこだ!ここで会いましょう、レッド。<page>やがて私は城の中で高く登り、多くの兄弟姉妹の仲介者となりました。これは本当に恵みです。そう、祝福です。<hpage>小さな巡礼者よ、あなたの声はこの信仰のためらいを隠しています。今、この壊れた場所の現実を見てきました。これについてどう思いますか？
secondary_translated_text: what? what? Oh, there it is! See you here, Red.<page>Eventually I climbed high in the castle and became a mediator for many brothers and sisters. This is truly a blessing. Yes, a blessing.<hpage>Your voice, little pilgrim, hides this fear of faith. Now, we have seen the reality of this broken place. what do you think about this?

original_en_text: Safely-saved is Pill! But who is this rare carer for the shell of another? Name yourself, good bug!<hpage>I am Hornet, Pill. Your brother wished for your return to Bellhart, where he waits now. I’m sure he will be eager to see you alive.<page>Young Tipp! How he worries always. Blessed I am for the care, him and you Miss Hornet! A lucky bug is me!
original_zh_text: 皮尔安、安全了！这位好心女士怎么称呼？<hpage>我叫大黄蜂。你的兄弟蒂普在钟心镇等你，快回去吧。<page>小蒂普！总是瞎操心。多谢你啦大黄蜂小姐！我运气真好！
translated_text: 錠剤は安全です!しかし、他の人間の殻の世話をする珍しい男は誰ですか？自分の名前を言って、良いバグ!<hpage>こちらはワスプ、ピエール。あなたの兄弟はあなたをバーハルトに戻したいと言っています彼はそこで待っています生きているのを見たいと思うでしょう。<page>ヤング·チップ!いつも心配していた。私は彼とあなたの世話をすることができて幸運ですミス·ホーネット私は幸運です!
secondary_translated_text: The pills are safe! But who is the unusual man to take care of the shells of other humans? Say your own name, good bug!<hpage>This is wasp, Pierre. Your brother says he wants you back to Berhardt alive and he'll want to see you waiting there. "<page>Young Chip! I was always worried about her. I'm lucky to be able to take care of him and you, Miss Hornet. I'm lucky!

original_en_text: I pray my dice bring you luck on your final climb, sister. And I pray that by parting with them, my own ascent shall be made lighter.
original_zh_text: 愿骰子保佑你登顶，姐妹。送走它们，我身上的负担也轻了。
translated_text: シスター、私のサイコロがあなたの最後の登山に幸運をもたらすことを祈ります。彼らから離れることで、私自身の上昇が容易になることを祈ります。
secondary_translated_text: Sister, I pray that my dice will bring you good luck on your final climb. I pray that by being away from them, my own ascension will be easier.

original_en_text: See here, this old statue. I’ve been thinking long on it, what clues it might hold.<page>The claw-work seems beyond the other structures throughout these caves. Who was she I wonder, to deserve such refined remembrance?<hpage>Hers is the form of a dancer, and the craft is indeed exquisite. There must once have been more to these ants, before the Haunting snared their shells and minds.
original_zh_text: 看这尊古雕像！我盯着它看了好久。<page>工艺比周围建筑精细多了。她到底是谁呢，值得被这样铭记？<hpage>看样子是名舞者，造型确实精美。看来蚁族被丝咒控制前肯定辉煌过。
translated_text: この古い像を見てください。長い間、私はそれが何を意味するのか疑問に思った。<page>爪はこれらの洞窟の他の構造を超越するように見える。そんな思い出にふさわしい彼女は誰なのでしょうか。<hpage>彼女のスタイルはダンサーの形であり、クラフトマンシップは本当に素晴らしいです。幽霊が殻や心を閉じ込める前に、アリはもっと多くのものを持っていなければならない。
secondary_translated_text: Look at this old statue. For a long time, I wondered what that meant.<page>The claws appear to transcend the other structures of these caves. Who was she to deserve such a memory?<hpage>Her style is the shape of a dancer, and the craftmanship is really great. Before the ghosts can enclose their shells and their hearts, ants must have a lot more.

translated_text: あっ...。禁断の匂い。
secondary_translated_text: ah... The smell of prohibition.

original_en_text: Holy water, nice and hot,<br>Makes a perfect swimming spot,<br>Heals your worries in a flash,<br>So jump on in... splash splash splash! Ha ha ha!
original_zh_text: 圣水暖又清，<br>泡澡好舒心，<page>烦恼顷刻散，<br>扑通跳进来！哈哈哈！
translated_text: 聖水は、暖かくて、<br>泳ぐのに最適な場所、<br>すぐに心配を解消し、<br>だから飛び込んで。スプラッシュ!ハハハ!
secondary_translated_text: The holy water is warm.<br>The best place to swim,<br>Release your worries immediately,<br>So jump in. Splash! ha ha ha!

original_en_text: Very, very lucky little trinket we got ‘ere! Pulls ‘em little clickie-clackies right into yer waitin’ claws!
original_zh_text: 超级幸运的招财符！把叮当响都吸过来！
translated_text: ここにはとてもラッキーな小物があります!あなたの足にそれらを引っ張る!
secondary_translated_text: There are some very lucky little things here! Pull them to your feet!

original_en_text: Gurrroo! A fellow warrior braves this blighted place! Know you stand before the honoured knight Garmond, and brave companion Zaza.<page>Together, Zaza and I are wish bound to scale this Citadel, and vanquish the horrors at its heart!<hpage>Then good luck to you, sir bug. It is heartening to meet another of sound mind and fortitude enough to fight back against the many haunted husks.<page>Aye! Never-ending, these unnatural opponents! This Citadel seems its twisted source, and honour decrees we must fight on, until we rend the heart of its decay!
original_zh_text: 嘎噜！又来个勇士！我乃荣耀骑士加蒙德，这位是忠仆扎扎！<page>我们要杀上圣堡，端了诅咒的老巢！<hpage>那祝你好运。难得能遇见敢反抗丝咒傀儡的清醒者。<page>是啊，这些傀儡，杀都杀不完！圣堡似乎就藏着祸根，必须捣毁！
translated_text: ゴーラム!同志たちはこの荒廃した場所に勇敢に立ち向かう!あなたは尊敬される騎士ガモンドと彼の勇敢な仲間ザザの前に立っていることを知っている。<page>ザザと私は一緒に城を登り、恐怖を払拭したいです!<hpage>それでは幸運を、バグさん。他の人が頭が良く、意志が強く、幽霊の貝殻の多くを撃退するのを見るのはエキサイティングです。<page>はい!はい!永遠に、これらの不自然な敵!この城はそのねじれの根源のようであり、我々はその腐った心を引き裂くまで名誉勲章を尊重しなければならない!
secondary_translated_text: GORAM! Comrades stand up bravely in this desolate place! You know that you are standing before the revered knight Gamond and his brave companion Zaza.<page>Zaza and I want to climb the castle together and dispel the terror!<hpage>Good luck then, Mr. Bug. It's exciting to see others be smart, strong-willed, and repel many of the ghost shells.<page>yes! yes! Forever, those unnatural enemies! This castle seems to be the root of that twist, and we must respect the Medal of Honor until we tear its rotten heart apart!

original_en_text: <hpage>I found the well in the hidden chambers beyond. The power that remained at its base I have taken for myself.<page=S>Bound yourself a new nature, aye? And from the shells of our ancestors, no less, all those many who’ve called these lands their own.<page=S>You make it seem so simple-like. All o’that learning, all o’that strength... sucked up in a whirl of Silk.<page=M>We’d call you a thief, Old One, and cruel for the taking, but its all coming down soon if you can’t stop it.<page=M>If there’s advantage in your act that might see these caves safe, then it’s better you make your claim.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我在密室深处找到了那口井。已将其底部的力量纳为己用。<page=S>给自己添了一种新本源，嗯？用的还是我们先祖的躯壳——那些曾以此地为家的无数先祖。<page=S>你说得轻巧。所有学识，所有力量……都被灵丝漩涡吸走了。<page=M>我们本该骂你是小偷，古老者，如此残忍夺取……但若你阻止不了黑暗，一切马上都要崩塌了。<page=M>若你真能保全这些洞窟，那还是由你取走为好。
translated_text: <hpage>私は遠くの隠れた部屋で井戸を見つけました。私はそれに基づいて残りの力を取った。<page=S>自分に新しい性質を与えてください。同様に、私たちの祖先の殻から、これらの土地を主張するすべての人々は、私たちの祖先の殻から生まれました。<page=S>とてもシンプルに見えます。全ての学び、全ての力絹の渦に飲み込まれてしまった。<page=M>私たちはあなたを泥棒と呼びます。強盗は残酷ですが、それを止められなければ、すぐに起こります。<page=M>あなたの行動がこれらの洞窟の安全を確保する上で利点がある場合は、あなた自身の主張をする方が良いでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I found a well in a hidden room in the distance. I took the rest of the power based on it.<page=S>Give yourself a new nature. Similarly, from the shells of our ancestors, all the people who claim these lands were born from the shells of our ancestors.<page=S>It looks so simple. All the learning, all the power, was swallowed up in the vortex of silk.<page=M>We will call you a thief. " Robbery is cruel, but if it can't be stopped, it happens quickly.<page=M>If your actions have an advantage in ensuring the safety of these caves, you'd better make your own claim.

original_en_text: Best keep your visits brief, Hornet Wielding Needle. Without swift action taken, our world’s ruin seems certain.<page>If you cannot calm Pharloom’s tortured throes, then certainly no other bug could face the task. <hpage>As you say, Shakra. I shall do what I must.
original_zh_text: 别逗留太久，小姑娘。不快点解决，世界就要完蛋了。<page>如果你都搞不定，更没虫能行。<hpage>我会尽力而为。
translated_text: インタビューは短くし、バンブルビーは針を振った。迅速な対応がなければ、世界は確実に破壊されるでしょう。<page>ファラムの痛みを鎮めることができなければ、他の間違いは間違いなくその仕事を引き受けることはできません。<hpage>あなたが言ったように、シャーク。やるべきことはやります。
secondary_translated_text: The interview was short, and Bumblebee waved the needle. Without a swift response, the world is sure to be destroyed.<page>If you can't calm the pain of pharam, then other mistakes will undoubtedly not be able to undertake that job.<hpage>Like you said, shark. I do what I have to do.

original_en_text: Near the edge of those lands swept by wind and sand, Nuu has seen it, a single bug, watching, waiting.<page> Too scared was Nuu to crawl close, for fear it would wake, and its big blade might mark this perfect shell.<page>For the journal’s sake, you should seek the bug, up on edge, through a tall tunnel hidden by crust.<page>A hard find, that one, but Nuu is not worried! She knows your adult cunning will see you there quick!
original_zh_text: 在风沙之地的边缘，努努曾看见一只虫子在守望等待。<page> 努努怕它醒来，怕它的巨刃划破我的漂亮甲壳，所以不敢靠近。<page> 但为了使记录册完整，大姐姐去找它吧——就在高处边缘，穿过一段硬壳掩藏的高耸隧道就到了。<page> 虽然难找，但努努不担心！以成年虫的机灵劲儿肯定能很快找到！
translated_text: 風と砂に覆われた土地の端で、ヌーはそれを見て待っている昆虫を見た。<page>ヌーは怖くて近づくことができず、目が覚めるのを恐れ、大きな刃が完璧な殻をマークしている。<page>日記をつけるためには、地殻に隠された高いトンネルを通って端から虫を探す必要があります。<page>それは難しい発見でしたが、ヌーは心配しませんでした!彼女はあなたの大人の狡猾さがすぐにそこに着くことを知っている!
secondary_translated_text: At the edge of the wind and sand-covered land, Noo saw an insect waiting to watch it.<page>Noo is afraid and unable to approach, afraid to wake up, and his large blade marks the perfect shell.<page>In order to keep a diary, you need to go through a high tunnel hidden in the crust and look for bugs from the end.<page>It was a difficult discovery, but Noo didn't worry! She knows that your adult cunning will get there soon!

original_en_text: For my mapping stock, we have traded all the charts and tools I can provide. While this new threat remains, I shall not make more.<page>My cartography may be a simple sort, but I hope that my craft shared has made your travels easier.
original_zh_text: 我的存货都卖光了。危机不解除，我也没法做新的。<page>我绘制的图纸可能有些简略，但希望能帮上你的忙。
translated_text: 私のマップストックでは、私が提供できるすべてのチャートとツールを交換しました。この新たな脅威が存在する間、私はそれ以上の脅威を生み出さない。<page>私の絵はシンプルかもしれませんが、私が共有するクラフトマンシップがあなたの旅行をより簡単にすることを願っています。
secondary_translated_text: In my map stock, I exchanged all the charts and tools I could offer. As long as this new threat exists, I will not create any more.<page>My drawings may be simple, but I hope the craftsmanship I share will make your journey easier.

original_en_text: Lead on, sister! Zaza and I will be close behind!
original_zh_text: 带路吧姐妹！我和扎扎自会跟上！
translated_text: お姉さん、先導!ザサと私はそれを見ています!
secondary_translated_text: Sister, lead me! Tasa and I are watching it!

original_en_text: Hoy! Did you see it, red maiden? The great gate heard my song and, in its infinite and ancient kindness, has opened the way forward for us!
original_zh_text: 瞧见没？骨门听到歌声，为我们让路了！
translated_text: おい!見たか？赤い女偉大な門は私の歌を聞いて、無限の古代の慈悲で私たちの道を開いた!
secondary_translated_text: Hey! did you see that? The red woman the great gate listened to my song, opened our way with infinite ancient mercy!

original_en_text: <hpage>Must you not press on, sirs?<page>Oh, yes! We will be off at once. Very soon. I fear though, that Zaza must rest a little longer...
original_zh_text: <hpage>二位还不出发么？<page>马上！这就出发！我就是觉得，扎扎可能要多休息一会……
translated_text: <hpage>皆さん、続けられませんか。<page>ああ!はい!すぐに出発しました。すぐだが、ザザがしばらく休むのが心配だが。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Guys, can we continue?<page>oh! yes! We set off immediately. Soon, but I'm worried that Zaza will rest for a while.

original_en_text: Poshanka! Edges sharp and senses keen!
original_zh_text: 啵尚咔！握紧兵刃，保持警惕！
translated_text: ボシャンカ!鋭いエッジと鋭い感覚!
secondary_translated_text: boshanka! Sharp edges and a sharp feel!

original_en_text: <page=M>Even knowing her motivation, it is a shock the monarch can resist so long. We’d thought none could survive that void.<hpage>She will have retreated within her protective form, that cocoon of thread. Even as the dark eats its outer, she will spin its Silk anew.<hpage>The effort would be immense and it will strain her soul thin, but what other choice remains?<hpage>This is the desperate act of a dying god. A defiance that, left unchallenged, will bring your kingdom’s ruin.
original_zh_text: <page=M>就算清楚她的动机，君主能撑这么久也是令我们惊讶。本以为生物不可能在虚空中存活。<hpage>她必是缩进了护体茧壳。这样即便外层被黑暗啃噬，也能重织新丝。<hpage>但这样耗力巨大，魂魄都将稀薄，但还有得选吗？<hpage>这是垂死神明的困兽之斗。若不阻止，必会让王国化为废墟。
translated_text: <page=M>彼女の動機が分かっていても、君主が長く耐えられるショックだった。そんな空虚な中では誰も生き残れないと思った。<hpage>彼女は彼女の保護形態-繭に戻るでしょう。闇がその外見を飲み込んでも、彼女は絹を紡ぎ直す。<hpage>努力は計り知れず、彼女の魂を消耗させますが、他にどんな選択肢がありますか？<hpage>それは死にゆく神の絶望の行為です。この抵抗は、挑戦されなければ、あなたの王国に破滅をもたらします。
secondary_translated_text: <page=M>It was a shock the monarch could endure for a long time, even if he knew her motives. I thought no one would survive in such an emptiness.<hpage>She will return to her form of protection - the kite. Even if the darkness swallows up its appearance, she spins the silk again.<hpage>The effort is immeasurable and consumes her soul, but what other options do she have?<hpage>It is an act of despair of God's dying. This resistance, if not challenged, will bring ruin to your kingdom.

original_en_text: <page=M>The quakes... This collapse will take Pharloom all.<hpage>If the void doesn’t claim it first. Surely you’ve seen them, the black threads that wrack your lands? The dark leeches up, possessed upon the fallen monarch’s Silk.<hpage>Pharloom’s roads were not safe before. Now they’ll prove impassable. Those pilgrims still alive in your lands best huddle and hope. <hpage>If there can be another end to this, it is up to us to discover it.
original_zh_text: <page=M>这震颤……纺络要全塌了。<hpage>怕不是会被虚空先吞了去。没见那些撕裂大地的黑丝么？黑暗正顺着坠落君王的灵丝涌上来。<hpage>纺络的道途本就不安稳，如今更是绝路，残存的朝圣者只能抱团等死。<hpage>但若还有转机，唯有靠我们能寻得。
translated_text: <page=M>地震と崩壊はファルのすべてを奪うでしょう。<hpage>空白が最初に占有されなかった場合。あなたの土地を破壊した黒い線を見たことがありますか？堕落した君主の絹に付着した闇の吸血鬼。<hpage>ファロの道路は安全ではなかった。彼らは乗り越えられないことが証明される。あなたの土地にまだ住んでいる巡礼者は、一緒に集まって希望を持った方が良い。<hpage>これに別の結末があるなら、それを見つけるのは私たち次第です。
secondary_translated_text: <page=M>The earthquake and collapse will take all of the fal.<hpage>If the space is not occupied first. Have you ever seen the black lines that destroyed your land? A dark vampire attached to the silk of a fallen monarch.<hpage>The roads of Faro were not safe. They prove to be insurmountable. The pilgrims who still live in your land had better gather together and have hope.<hpage>If this has another ending, it's up to us to find it.

original_en_text: <hpage>Why do you sing, little one? This bony gate seems like a poor audience.
original_zh_text: <hpage>小家伙，为何对着骨门歌唱？这可不是什么知音。
translated_text: <hpage>リトルボーイ、なぜ歌うの？細いドアは貧しい観客の群衆のように見えた。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>little boy, why are you singing? The narrow door looked like a crowd of poor spectators.

original_en_text: <hpage>Can you safely make your way back to the settlement, little one? I could escort you if need be.<page>Oh no, I’ll lay no more of my troubles upon you, red maiden. With the way cleared I can return under my own guidance.<page>After all, what’s another pilgrimage, eh? Ha ha!<page>Oh! And I have something for you as well. I found it buried amongst the broken relics down here in the darkness, glowing with a pale light.<page>’Tis an odd-looking thing... not exactly holy-seeming... but I would be honoured if you accepted it all the same!
original_zh_text: <hpage>需要我护送你回去吗？<page>不能再给你添麻烦了！路通了我就自己走。<page>就当再朝圣一回呗！哈哈！<page>对了，这个送你。在黑乎乎的地方挖到的，会发光。<page>虽然看着不像圣物……但请你收下吧！
translated_text: <hpage>無事に入植地に戻れますか？ご希望であればご案内いたします。<page>ああ、私はもうあなたを責めません、赤い女の子。道が開いたら、私のリーダーシップの下に戻ることができます。<page>結局のところ、別の巡礼は何ですか？ハハハ!<page>おぉ!あなたにもあげたいものがある。私はそれが暗闇に埋もれ、壊れた遺物の中で青白い光を放っていた。<page>不思議なことに...完全に神聖ではないようだ。それでも受け入れていただければ幸いです!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>will we be able to return to the settlement safely? If you wish, we can show you.<page>Oh, I don't blame you anymore, red girl. When the way is clear, I can go back under my leadership. "<page>After all, what's another pilgrimage? ha ha ha!<page>oh! I also have something I want to give you. I saw it buried in the darkness, and gave off a pale light among the broken relics.<page>it's amazing... It doesn't seem completely sacred. I hope you still accept it!

original_en_text: The challenge! The course! It shall be improved. Yes! Yes! The truest test is still to come. We shall fly fast together once more!
original_zh_text: 赛道还要改良！没错，真正的考验在后头！
translated_text: 挑戦!もちろんです!それは改善される。はい!はい!はい!はい!本当のテストはまだ来ていない。また一緒に飛びましょう!
secondary_translated_text: challenge! of course! It will improve. yes! yes! yes! yes! The real test is yet to come. Let's fly together again!

original_en_text: I’ve learnt too that travelling is not without its dangers... but I find myself wielding my weapon quite adeptly.<page>It’s curious, the way our instincts can guide us with such precision.
original_zh_text: 我现在知道旅途中总伴有危险……不过我武器用得倒挺顺手。<page>本能的指引竟如此精准，真奇妙。
translated_text: 旅行はリスクがないことも学びました。しかし、私は武器を非常に巧みに操ることができた。<page>私たちの直感がこれほど正確に導くのは不思議です。
secondary_translated_text: I also learned that traveling is risk-free. However, I was able to manipulate the weapon very skillfully.<page>It is a wonder that our intuition can lead us so accurately.

translated_text: ベルハルトの地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of Berhardt

original_en_text: Un-Daak... well struck. To face the fury of your weapon in a true battle would be an experience indeed. I would gladly duel again, if you have the time for it.
original_zh_text: 唔-嗒克……打得好。跟你打一架真是受益匪浅，等你有空我们再练。
translated_text: ウィンダックがよくプレーした。戦闘中に武器に直面する怒りは、確かに経験です。時間があれば、また戦いたい。
secondary_translated_text: Winduck played well. Anger in the face of weapons during combat is certainly an experience. If I have time, I will fight again.

original_en_text: Hoho sister, my whiskers are still quivering! That’s how you know you had a rousing battle!<page>You go on ahead. Zaza and I will keep guard here and catch any stragglers.
original_zh_text: 嚯嚯，真是一场酣畅淋漓的战斗！我的胡子都还在颤抖呢！<page>你先前进吧，我和扎扎在这守着一会，看看有没有漏网之虫。
translated_text: ねえ、私の髭はまだ煙が出ている!これはあなたがエキサイティングな戦いをしていることを知る方法です!<page>さあ、ザザと私はここで見張りをし、後ろにいる者を逮捕する。
secondary_translated_text: Hey, my beard is still smoking! This is how you know you are in an exciting battle!<page>Come on, Zaza and I will keep watch here and arrest whoever is behind.

original_en_text: Hoy, red maiden. ‘Tis a prayer answered to see you safely wake.<hpage>Little Sherma? What has happened here?
original_zh_text: 红衣姑娘！圣堡庇佑，你醒了！<hpage>小谢尔玛，此处发生了什么？
translated_text: やあ、赤い女の子。あなたが無事に目覚めることを祈るための祈りです。<hpage>リトル·シャーマン？何が起きてる？
secondary_translated_text: Hi, Red Girl. It is a prayer to pray that you will wake up safely.<hpage>little shaman? what's happening?

original_en_text: Poshanka! So you found my calling ring, Child Wielding Needle. I recognised the sound of your weapon’s foreign metal against it.<page>On the hunt for my master, I am often away, but I still use this place as camp. Use the ring to call me whenever you wish to make trade.
original_zh_text: 啵尚咔！发现我的传讯了？听到你武器发出的那异域的金属声就知道是你。<page>我把这当作据点，但常外出寻找导师。想找我交易就摇铃。
translated_text: ボシャンカ!私の指輪を見つけた子供は針を振っています異物や金属が武器に及ぼす影響を知っています。<page>私はよくオーナーを探しに出かけますが、今でもキャンプ場として利用しています。取引したい場合は、携帯電話の着信音で私に電話してください。
secondary_translated_text: boshanka! The child who found my ring is waving a needle and knows how foreign objects and metals can affect a weapon.<page>I often go out to look for owners, but I still use them as campgrounds. If you want to trade, please call me on the ringing tone of your mobile phone.

translated_text: 遠隔地の地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of remote areas

original_en_text: <hpage>Gladly I will accept your aid Shakra. Let us cut closer to this Citadel’s haunted heart.<page>Garrok! Hornet Wielding Needle. Beside you, I will gladly raise my rings!
original_zh_text: <hpage>求之不得。一起杀进圣堡里去吧。<page>嘎咯克！使针的姑娘。能和你并肩作战，我的战环乐意至极！
translated_text: <hpage>私はシャクラがこの城の幽霊の中心部に近づくためにあなたの助けを喜んで受け入れます。<page>ガロック!バンブルビーは針を振った。あなたの隣で、私は指輪を持ち上げたい!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I will gladly accept your help to get Shakra closer to the ghostly heart of this castle.<page>gallock! Bumblebee shook his needle. Next to you, I want to raise the ring!

original_en_text: I’d hoped to never step these hateful halls, yet here I stand, as all those hapless bugs before.<hpage>You’ve journeyed far from that damp cell, tall bug. If you would oppose the minions of this Citadel, you have my respect.<page>Hmph. Then we share a rare stance, warrior. Few others seem possessed of will enough to resist.<page>So many weak minds, drawn up and strung, in love with the great golden leech atop their lands.
original_zh_text: 我本不想踏入这憎恶之地，却还是步了前虫的后尘。<hpage>你既然从潮湿牢笼走到这里，若是想反抗圣堡，我愿助一臂之力。<page>哼，倒是难得。鲜少有虫能生出抵抗之心。<page>大多数都意志薄弱，沉溺受缚，被上头那黄金监牢所蛊惑。
translated_text: 私はこの憎しみに満ちたホールに足を踏み入れたくなかったが、私は目の前の不幸な虫のようにここに立っている。<hpage>あなたは濡れた独房から出てきた、背の高い虫。もしあなたがこの城の駒に反対するなら、私はあなたを尊重する。<page>ああ、それから私たちは珍しい場所を共有しました、兵士。抵抗する意志を持っている人は少ないようです。<page>多くの弱く神経質な人々は、自分たちの土地の巨大なネギに恋に落ちました。
secondary_translated_text: I didn't want to step foot in this hate-filled hall, but I stand here like an unhappy worm in front of me.<hpage>You have come out of a wet cell, tall worm. If you oppose this castle piece, I respect you. "<page>Oh, and then we shared an unusual place, soldier. Few people seem to have the will to resist.<page>Many weak and nervous people have fallen in love with the giant figs of their land.

original_en_text: Ho there, brave sister! What poetry has fate writ, that we should meet here at the peak of this ghastly Citadel!<page>Beasts and fiends, all here are lost to that horrid Haunting! And out from this golden corpse it seeps to plague the good bugs of the land below. Well, no more we say!<hpage>You should beware brave sirs, the creature that commands this curse is a foe far beyond bug. I would not see your lives given in vain.<page>Pah! We beware nothing! We would give our lives a hundred times over to finally cut away the evil that clutches our kingdom!
original_zh_text: 哟，勇敢的姐妹！真有缘，能在这鬼圣堡顶上见面！<page>那些被邪丝牵着走的虫兽，就是从这金色死城跑出去祸害纺络的，但到此为止了！<hpage>当心，萦绕于圣堡之上的存在远非虫类能敌，不要白白丢了性命。<page>呸！我们才不怕！只要能斩断缠住这破地方的丝线，死一百回都值！
translated_text: お姉ちゃん、勇者!運命の詩は何ですか？この恐ろしい城の頂上で会おう!<page>獣と悪魔、すべてが恐ろしい幽霊の中に消えてしまった!それは疫病の下の土地の良い昆虫であるこの黄金の死体から滲み出ていた。さあ、話はやめましょう!<hpage>勇敢な紳士諸君、気をつけて、この呪いを発した生き物は、ワームの敵をはるかに超えている。無駄に命を犠牲にするのは見られません。<page>うわー!何も気をつけなかった!私たちの王国を取り巻く悪を根絶するために、私たちは百倍の命を捧げます。
secondary_translated_text: My sister, brave! What is the poetry of fate? See you at the top of this terrible castle!<page>Beasts and demons, all vanished into a terrible ghost! It had leaked out of this golden carcass, a good land insect under the plague. Come on, let's stop talking!<hpage>Beware, brave gentlemen, the creature that cast this curse is far beyond the worm's enemy. I don't see them sacrificing their lives in vain.<page>Wow! I wasn't careful about anything! To eradicate the evil that surrounds our kingdom, we will give our lives a hundred times.

original_en_text: Goodness! This is just too embarrassing! Detected even through my perfect cover! What tell? What error? Surely something gave me away!<hpage>It was no one thing, young bug. Your disguise is near faultless. I’ve merely spent a long life being watchful.<page>Gah! Then I’ll just have to hope the beasts about don’t share such keen sight. It’ll be so much harder to accomplish my work if I’m detected, or eaten!
original_zh_text: 哎呀！太丢脸了！完美伪装都被识破！哪里露馅了？<hpage>你没露出破绽，小虫子。只是我活得够久，眼神也比较好。<page>好吧！但愿怪物们没这么眼尖。万一被发现或被吃掉都会耽误我工作！
translated_text: なんてこった!これは恥ずかしい!完璧なカバーでも!何を言った？どんな間違い？何かが私を暴露した!<hpage>それは何もない、小さな虫。あなたの変装はほぼ完璧です。私は長い間警戒していました。<page>あっ! あっ!周りの獣がそんなに鋭い目を持たないことを願うばかりです。食べられたり食べられたりしたら、仕事を終えるのが大変になります!
secondary_translated_text: oh, my god! This is embarrassing! Even the perfect cover! what did i say? what mistake? Something has exposed me!<hpage>It's nothing, little bug. Your costume is almost perfect. I've been alert for a long time.<page>ah! ah! I only wish the beasts around me didn't have such sharp eyes. If you get eaten or eaten, it will be hard to get the job done!

original_en_text: <hpage>The battle ahead may indeed be arduous. I accept your offer of aid, sirs.<page>Gurrrro! Yes! No force in the kingdom can withstand our might! Lead on, sister! Zaza and I will be close behind!
original_zh_text: <hpage>前方战斗凶险，有劳二位了。<page>嘎噜！咱们联手肯定所向披靡！带路吧姐妹！我和扎扎自会跟上！
translated_text: <hpage>これからの戦いは本当に難しいでしょう。皆さん、私はあなたの援助の申し出を受け入れます。<page>ゴーラム!はい!はい!王国には我々の力に抵抗する力はない!お姉さん、先導!ザサと私はそれを見ています!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>The battle from now on will be really tough. Gentlemen, I accept your offer of assistance.<page>GORAM! yes! yes! The kingdom has no power to resist our power! Sister, lead me! Tasa and I are watching it!

original_en_text: Sister, sister, tired and glum,<br>We will sing, and you can hum,<br>Together we shall overcome!
original_zh_text: 姐妹同袍，圣途相聚，<br>齐声歌唱，忘却忧伤，<br>同心协力，共度难关！
translated_text: 姉妹、姉妹、疲れて落ち込んでいる。<br>We Can Sing You Canハミング<br>一緒に失敗した!
secondary_translated_text: Sisters, sisters, tired and depressed.<br>We can sing you can humming<br>We failed together!

original_en_text: <page=M>Oh ho! Back from the depths with nary a scratch! Is it as you feared?<hpage>It is, and worse. Your snare has sunk the monarch deep, deeper than I can safely descend.<hpage>To cut Pharloom free, I must plunge below the surface of that lake of liquid nothing.<page=B> No shell survives submersion in that void, Old One, not even yours.<hpage>Not without aid, certainly. Though aid may exist. The flower that resists the dark. Do you know of it?<page=M>The Everbloom?... We’ve heard the tale, but had thought it a myth. If ever it sprouted in our lands we would surely have known?<hpage>I would not seek it in these lands. I need its power full, and it is too fragile to sustain here long. I would seek it in my memory.<page=S> Oh ho ho! So you’d have us wrench open your soul, to retrieve the fabled bloom? Can such a thing be done?<hpage>For another bug, no, but I am Weaver enough to attempt it.<hpage>In the distant past, I knew the flower. My thread still holds its faint memory. If the Everbloom was grasped strongly enough within my Silk, it could be made to manifest.<page=M>Ah! So you’re asking another spell of us? To reveal the flower clear?... But to illuminate one of your kind’s old memories, so acutely... This is no easy thing, even for us...<page=M>Old One, you must give us a moment to confer...
original_zh_text: <page=M>哦嚯！毫发无损从深渊归来！情况果真如您所料？<hpage>比预料的更糟。你们的陷阱将君主沉得极深，深过我安全下潜的极限。<hpage>要斩断纺络的枷锁，须要直入虚无之湖深处。<page=B>古老者，没有躯壳能在虚空浸泡中幸存，您也不例外。<hpage>单凭自己当然不成，但若有助力……那朵抗暗之花，你们知道吗？<page=M>永绽花？……听说过，但只当是传说。如果曾在此地绽放过，我们怎会不知？<hpage>此地当然找不到，我需要完全盛放的花，此地养不活。得去我的记忆中找。<page=S>哦嚯嚯！是要我们撕开您魂魄，取出那朵神花？这真能成功？<hpage>其他虫不行，但我有织者血脉，可以一试。<hpage>在遥远过去，我记得此花，灵丝中尚存其残影。若能在记忆中紧紧抓住，或许能使其显形。<page=M>啊！所以又要我们施法？让花影清晰？……可要照彻您这一族的古老回忆……就算是我们也……<page=M>古老者，请让我们商议一下……
translated_text: <page=M>ああ、叫んだ!无伤地从深底了!本当に心配しているように？<hpage>はい、さらに悪いです。あなたの罠は王の手に深く落ち、私が安全に落ちたよりも深い。<hpage>ファロを解放するために、私は何もない湖に潜らなければならなかった。<page=B>その空虚に貝殻は生き残れない、老人、あなたのものでさえ。<hpage>もちろん、助けがなくても、それは真実です。助けがあるかもしれない闇の花に抵抗する知ってるか？<page=M>永遠の花？この話は聞いたことがありますが、神話だと思います。私たちの土地で成長しているなら、私たちは知るでしょう。<hpage>私はこの土地でそれを探しません。私はそれが必要ですが、ここで長く続くには弱すぎます。私は記憶の中でそれを探します。<page=S>ああ、ホー!あなたの魂を開き、伝説の花を取り戻したいのですか？そんなことができるのか。<hpage>別の間違いについては、いいえ、しかし、私はそれを試すのに十分なウィーバーです。<hpage>遠い昔、私はこの花を知っていた。私の記憶はまだ弱いです。私の絹が永遠の花をつかむほど強くなれば、それは現れるでしょう。<page=M>あっ! あっ!また魔法をかけてほしいのですか？花をはっきりさせるべきか？しかし、それはあなたの種族の古い記憶をはっきりと照らすことができます。私たちにとっても簡単な作業ではない。<page=M>おじいさん、ちょっと時間をかけて討論してみないと
secondary_translated_text: <page=M>Oh, I screamed! From the bottom unharmed! like you're really worried?<hpage>Yes, it is even worse. Your snare has fallen deep into the king's hand, deeper than I have fallen safely.<hpage>To free Faro, I had to dive into a lake where there was nothing.<page=B>A shell cannot survive in that emptiness, old man, not even yours.<hpage>Of course, it's true, even without help. you know how to resist the flower of darkness that might help?<page=M>The eternal flower? I have heard this story before, but I think it is a myth. If they are growing on our land, we will know.<hpage>I don't look for it in this land. I need it, but I'm too weak to last here long. I look for it in my memories.<page=S>Oh, ho! Do you want to open up your soul and get back the flower of legend? Can you do that? "<hpage>As for another mistake, no, but I'm a weaver enough to try it.<hpage>Long ago, I knew this flower. My memory is still weak. If my silk is strong enough to grasp the eternal flower, it will appear.<page=M>ah! ah! do you want me to use my magic again? Should I make the flowers clear?
