However, it can clearly illuminate the old memories of your race. It's not an easy task for us either.<page=M>Grandpa, we need to take a moment to discuss it.

translated_text: ハンターの地図。
secondary_translated_text: The Hunter's map.

original_en_text: My wish is granted... and now everything I love is lost...
original_zh_text: 愿望实现了……可我珍视的一切都消失了……
translated_text: 私の願いは叶いました。。。。私が愛したものはすべて失われた。
secondary_translated_text: My wishes have been fulfilled... All that I loved was lost.

original_en_text: Gara Takana! What has happened to you, Child Wielding Needle, to cause you such brutal weakening?<hpage>You are seeing the effects of a parasite, Shakra, a writhing entity implanted by force. It will not kill me, not quickly at least, but its presence wears greatly on my shell.<page>It is a horrid state you suffer. Fight yourself free, or find help with haste. I would not wish to see you defeated by such deceitful strength.
original_zh_text: 加拉塔卡纳！使针的小姑娘，你怎么了？竟变成这副惨状？<hpage>是寄生物的影响，沙克拉。它被强行植入了我的躯壳。虽不会立刻致命，但持续侵蚀着我。<page>这状态太可怕了。要么挣脱它，要么快去寻求援助。我可不愿见你败给如此诡诈的力量。
translated_text: ハイガーナ!本当に、何があなたをそんなに弱くしたのですか？<hpage>あなたが見ているのは寄生虫シャクラの影響ですシャクラは強制的に埋め込まれた歪んだ実体です少なくともすぐには私を殺すことはできませんが、その存在は私の殻に大きな摩耗を引き起こします。<page>あなたが苦しんでいるのはひどい状態です。できるだけ早く助けを求めなさい。私はあなたがそのような欺瞞的な力に負けるのを見たくない。
secondary_translated_text: High Ghana! What really made you so weak?<hpage>What you're looking at is the effects of the parasitic chakra, a forcibly embedded distorted entity that can't kill me, at least not immediately, but its presence causes a great abrasion on my shell.<page>It is a terrible condition that you are suffering. Ask for help as soon as possible. I don't want to see you lose to such a deceptive force.

original_en_text: Hoi! Let our mighty contest of shells commence again!
translated_text: おい!また、強力なシェルレースを始めましょう!
secondary_translated_text: Hey! Let's also start a powerful shell race!

original_en_text: You’re in the habit of craftin’ all kinds’a nasty tools’n traps, aint’cha? This kit’ll let you build ‘em even nastier, heh heh...
original_zh_text: 你这家伙成天捣鼓些工具跟陷阱，是吧？这匣子能帮你更进一步，嘿嘿……
translated_text: いろいろな迷惑な道具や罠を使う癖がありますよね。これは彼らを悪化させるでしょう？
secondary_translated_text: You have a habit of using all kinds of annoying tools and traps, right? Would this make them worse?

original_en_text: Poshanka, Child Wielding Needle. This heart-home is cut free of its curse.<page>Tell me, was it your blade that brought its saving? My shock would be great if another here managed the feat.<hpage>I slew a tall creature above the town, a Weaver I suspect, though one twisted in purpose.<hpage>By voice and claw it aided, perhaps guided, the thread that strung the town. <page>Weaver? Those vicious old things! To our young we tell the tales, but had thought them long dead, only corpses bound in spires. <hpage>This one still lived, though if it was a Weaver, it was broken in a savage way.<hpage>Its own Silk was bound, pinned deep within its shell. A cruel punishment I’ve not before witnessed. <page>Even broken, my envy remains. A Weaver’s fabled skills... To meet one in combat means great challenge, and great pride in victory.
original_zh_text: 啵尚咔，使针的小姑娘。这镇子的诅咒解除了？<page>是你干的？别的虫可没这本事。<hpage>我斩了镇子上头的高个怪物，像是个变异的织者。<page>是它用声音和利爪操控缠绕镇子的丝线。<page>织者？那群老毒物！还以为早死绝了，只剩塔里的干尸。<hpage>这只还活着，但被折磨得不成样。<hpage>灵丝被钉在壳里，残忍的刑罚。<page>就算残了我也羡慕。织者的本事……能交手是幸运，能得胜更是荣耀。
translated_text: ボサンカの子供たちは針を振り回している。この魂の家は呪いから解放されました。<page>あなたの剣は救いをもたらすのか？他の人がこの偉業を成し遂げたら、私は非常にショックを受けます。<hpage>私は町の上空で背の高い生き物を殺したが、それは意図的にねじれていたが、織機であると疑った。<hpage>音と爪で助け、おそらく町を結ぶ電線を導くのに役立ちます。<page>ウィーヴァー？古いものが悪い!私たちは若者たちに物語を話しましたが、彼らはとっくに死んでいて、尖塔には死体しかないと思いました。<hpage>これはまだ生きていますが、織機だったらひどく損傷していたでしょう。<hpage>独自の絹は縛られ、殻の奥深くに固定されていた。見たことのない残酷な罰でした。<page>それが壊れても、私の嫉妬は残ります。伝説の技を織る。戦いに挑むことは勝利を誇りに思うこと。
secondary_translated_text: The children of Bosanka are waving their needles around. This house of souls has been freed from the curse.<page>will your sword bring salvation? If other people accomplish this feat, I will be very shocked.<hpage>I killed a tall creature in the sky above the town, which I suspected was a loom, though it was twisted intentionally.<hpage>Help with sounds and claws, and perhaps help guide the electric wires that connect the town.<page>wiver? Old things are bad! We told the stories to the young men, but they had long since died, and we thought there were only corpses in the spire.<hpage>This one is still alive, but if it were a loom, it would have been badly damaged.<hpage>The silk of its own was tied and fixed deep in the shell. It was a cruel punishment I had never seen before.<page>Even if it is broken, my jealousy will remain. Weave a legendary skill. To challenge to battle is to be proud of winning.

original_en_text: <hpage>Fair greetings, Shakra. You are a welcome sight amidst the sodden gloom of these caverns. <page>Child Wielding Needle, your aspect is still sharp. My respect remains. Heed a warning, many fierce bugs roost nearby.<page>On the lake beyond this cave nest a ragged horde atop an old watermound. Their mastery of flight makes them dangerous. My shell will forever carry the score of their pins.<page>If you’re seeking a safer path, head back, towards this land’s core.
original_zh_text: <hpage>幸会，沙克拉。能在这阴湿洞穴里见到你真好。<page>使针的小姑娘，身手还是那么利索。提醒你，附近猛虫可不少。<page>前面湖心住着群飞虫，我壳上被它们的针弄得全是伤。<page>想走安全点的路就就回头，往这地方的中心走。
translated_text: <hpage>こんにちは、シャクラ。これらの湿った洞窟では、あなたは歓迎される光景です。<page>あなたの外見はまだ鋭いです。尊敬は残っている。警告に注意すると、近くには凶暴な昆虫がたくさん生息しています。<page>洞窟の背後には、湖の古代の水の丘の上に、ぼろぼろの部族のグループが位置しています。彼らの飛行能力は彼らを危険にさらす。私の貝殻は常にバッジの先端を持っています。<page>より安全な道を探している場合は、戻ってランドセンターに向かいます。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Hi there, Shakra. In these wet caves, you are a welcome sight.<page>Your appearance is still sharp. The respect remains. If you pay attention to the warnings, there are many ferocious insects in the vicinity.<page>Behind the cave is a group of rundown tribes, located on the hills of ancient water in the lake. Their ability to fly puts them at risk. My shell always has the tip of the badge.<page>If you're looking for a safer route, head back towards the Land Center.

original_en_text: Nuu is a long way from her safe lodging... perhaps she will stay in this nice, dark little squeezy place a little longer.
original_zh_text: 努努离家好远……暂时在这个黑暗小缝里窝会儿吧。
translated_text: 彼女の隠れ家からは長い道のりがありました。多分彼女はこの美しく暗く混雑した小さな場所にもう少し長く滞在するでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: It was a long way from her hiding place. Maybe she'll stay a little longer in this beautiful, dark, crowded little place.

original_en_text: <hpage>Sherma, I bring supplies from the town of bells below. Since you are now caretaker here, I entrust them to you.<page>Oh, what a blessing! This will surely raise the hopes of our poor brothers and sisters.
original_zh_text: <hpage>小谢尔玛，我从下面镇子带了补给。既然现在你是看守者，就交给你了。<page>真是雪中送炭！兄弟姐妹们肯定会振作起来的！
translated_text: <hpage>シャーマン、ベルタウンから物資を持ってきたあなたは今、この場所の守護者ですから、私はあなたにそれを任せます。<page>ああ、なんてラッキーだ!それは、貧しい兄弟姉妹に希望を与えてくれるでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Shaman, you brought supplies from Beltown, and now you're the guardian of this place, so I leave it to you.<page>Oh, how lucky! It will give hope to our poor brothers and sisters.

original_en_text: Red maiden, you have some great task ahead of you, do you not? If so, then I fear the time of our final parting draws near.<hpage>You sense it true, Sherma. I shall soon descend to the darkness below the kingdom and quell the source of Pharloom’s rending.<hpage>If that task is achieved, my future may take me far from Pharloom, but know I have faith that you will hold these bugs together, and see them prosper.<page>Ah! In truth, I’m still only a fool, but I’ll hold dearly to your faith in me. That warmth will help me to endure whatever challenges lie ahead!<page>Now let me pray for you, dear friend, and may my hopes follow you into the deepest darkness and beyond!
original_zh_text: 红衣姑娘，您身负重大使命，对吧？若是如此，恐怕我们分别的时刻临近了。<hpage>你的直觉得没错，谢尔玛。我即将深入王国底部的黑暗，平息撕裂纺络的源头。<hpage>若使命达成，我或许会远行。但我坚信你能团结这些虫子，带领他们重建繁荣。<page>哈！说得对，说得对！毕竟我虽然攀登至此，但终究只是个愚者，而看护这些虫民同胞的生涯才刚开始。<page>现在我要为您祈祷，亲爱的红衣姑娘，静待我们齐声歌颂您凯旋的时刻！
translated_text: レッドガール、まだやるべきことがたくさんありますよね？もしそうなら、最後の別れの時が来ることを恐れています。<hpage>あなたは本物です、シャーマン。私はすぐに王国の下の闇に潜入し、ファルの破滅の原因を鎮める。<hpage>このタスクが完了すれば、私の未来はFarhamから私を遠ざけるかもしれませんが、あなたはこれらの間違いをまとめ、繁栄するのを見ることができると信じています。<page>あっ! あっ!実際には、私はまだ愚か者ですが、私は深くあなたの信頼を信じ、この暖かさは私が将来のどんな困難にも耐えるのを助けるでしょう!<page>親愛なる友よ、今、私の希望が深い闇とその先へと続くように祈りましょう。
secondary_translated_text: red girl, there's still a lot of work to do, right? If so, I fear that the time for the final parting will come.<hpage>You are real, Shaman. I will soon infiltrate the darkness beneath the kingdom and quell the cause of the ruin of the Fall.<hpage>If this task is completed, my future may take me away from Farham, but I believe you can put these mistakes together and see me thrive. "<page>ah! ah! In fact, I am still a fool, but I deeply believe in your trust, and this warmth will help me to endure any difficulties in the future!<page>My dear friend, let me now pray that my hope will continue into the deep darkness and beyond.

translated_text: ベンダー Pin
secondary_translated_text: Vendor Pin

original_en_text: The way forward is yours. Let us meet again soon.
translated_text: 前進の道はあなたのもの。すぐにまた会いましょう。
secondary_translated_text: The way forward is yours. I'll see you again soon.

original_en_text: <hpage>Shakra, you pit yourself against the black-threaded bugs? They are dangerous foes, even for a hardened warrior.<page>I relish such danger, and have little choice besides. These creatures besiege the town within. They are relentless, and empowered. <hpage>...It is the void, stretched up into this world and its husks. I know it well, this force, its nature. If it senses soul within, it will drive voracious towards it.<page>As you say! Many bugs now huddle within the bells. Nowhere else is safe with this black threat rising.<page>Some luck, at least, that I chose to remain, and can offer my rings’ defence.<hpage>Shakra, I seek to end this new disaster, for in it I share much blame, but know, I shall need time to complete my task.<hpage>I ask you hold fast till then. This town and its bugs need a guardian, and I can think of none better.<page>Very well, Hornet Wielding Needle. A pact made strong. If you are working towards the venom’s end, I shall fight with faith renewed.
original_zh_text: <hpage>沙克拉，你在独自抵挡黑灾虫群？再强悍的战士面对它们也很危险。<page>我享受这份危险，但也没得选择。它们在围攻小镇，没完没了，还有邪力加持。<hpage>……是虚空，侵入现世操纵躯壳。我很了解这东西，它的力量，和本质。它只要嗅到灵魂就会想要吞噬。<page>话是这么说，现在虫民都躲钟里……但别处更危险。<page>我选择留下已经算他们走运，至少还能挡一阵。<hpage>沙克拉，我会想办法终结这场灾难，毕竟我也有责任。但我需要时间，请你坚守下去。<hpage>小镇需要守卫，没有虫比你更合适。<page>好吧，使针的小姑娘。我答应你，只要你能解决源头，我会死守到底。
translated_text: <hpage>シャクラ、あなたは黒い線の誤りと戦うことを許しますか？彼らは強力な兵士にとっても危険な敵です。<page>私は危険が好きで、それをするしかない。これらの生き物は町の内部を取り囲んでいる。彼らは冷酷で強力です。<hpage>...世界とその殻に広がるのは空虚です。私はその力、その性質をよく知っています。その中の魂を感じれば、貪欲にそれに向かって進む。<page>あなたが言ったように!時計は昆虫でいっぱいです。この黒の脅威が高まるにつれて、他のすべては安全です。<page>少なくとも幸運なことに、私は留まることを選び、リング防衛を提供できました。<hpage>シャクラ、私は大きな責任を負っているので、この新たな災害を終わらせようとしていますが、任務を果たすには時間が必要だと分かっています。<hpage>それまで頑張ってください。この町とその虫には守護者が必要で、これ以上のものは考えられません。<page>ホーネットは針を振った。強力な合意だ。もしあなたがこの毒を終わらせようとするなら、私は新たな信念をもって戦います。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Chakra, do you allow yourself to fight the mistakes of the black line? They are a dangerous enemy, even for powerful soldiers.<page>I like danger and I have no choice but to do it. These creatures surround the interior of the town. They are cold and powerful.<hpage>... It is emptiness to spread out into the world and its shell. I am well aware of its power, of its nature. If you feel the soul in it, you go greedyly towards it.<page>As you said! " The clock is full of bugs. As this black menace rises, all else is safe.<page>At least fortunately, I chose to stay and was able to offer a ring defense.<hpage>Shakra, I am trying to end this new disaster, because I have a great responsibility, but I know that it will take time to fulfill my mission.<hpage>Please work hard until then. This town and its bugs need a guardian, and I can't think of anything better.<page>The Hornet waved his needle. It is a strong agreement. If you are going to end this poison, I will fight with a new conviction. "

original_en_text: Let us charge on. My rings shall sing loud on the shells of our enemies.
original_zh_text: 冲吧！让我用战环在敌人的壳上奏响战歌！
translated_text: 走りましょう。私の指輪は敵の殻に大声で歌うでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: Let us run. My ring will sing loudly to the shell of the enemy.

original_en_text: And now, miss grown-up, the task is done! Nuu must be away.<page>But do not be sour! Just think! Pharloom is only one land. So many more must hide out there, filled full with beasts and scents and tastes, all waiting to be discovered.<page>For Nuu, her journey is only at its start. And for you, miss grown-up, Nuu wishes too your happy hunting, much and more!
original_zh_text: 任务完成了！那么大姐姐，努努要出发了。<page>别难过！纺络只是开始！外面还有无数大地等着探索呢！<page>努努的旅程刚开始，祝大姐姐也狩猎愉快！
translated_text: 陛下、お嬢さん、任務は完了し、シスターは去らなければならない。<page>しかし、酸はやめなさい!考えてみろ!ファロはただの土地です。そこにはもっと隠された何かがあったに違いない。獣、匂い、匂い、匂い、すべてが発見されるのを待っている。<page>ヌーにとって、旅は始まったばかりだった。陛下、ヌーもお楽しみください!
secondary_translated_text: Your Majesty, Miss, the mission is complete, and the Sister must leave.<page>But stop the acid! think about it! Faro is just a land. There must have been something more hidden in there. The beast, the smell, all waiting to be discovered.<page>For Nu, the journey had just begun. Your Majesty, enjoy the Noo too!

original_en_text: <hpage>Shakra, what has happened here? For these masses to huddle so amongst such destruction?<page>The dark-spun bugs, they besiege the town, relentless. I have defended against each wave anew, but they are empowered in foul ways, and I am much fatigued.<hpage>...It is the void, stretched up into this world and its husks. I know it well, that force, its nature. If it senses soul, it will drive voracious towards it.<page>As you say! All these bugs, gathered close within the bells... but nowhere else is safe with this black threat rising.<hpage>Shakra, I seek to end this new disaster, for in it I share much blame, but know, I shall need time to complete my task. I would ask you hold fast till then.<hpage>This town and its bugs needs a guardian, and I can think of none better.<page>Very well, Hornet Wielding Needle. A pact made strong. If you are working towards the venom’s end, I shall fight with faith renewed.
original_zh_text: <hpage>沙克拉，这是怎么回事？废墟里挤着这么多虫？<page>黑虫围攻小镇，击退一波又来一波。它们有邪力加持，我快顶不住了。<hpage>……是虚空，侵入现世操纵躯壳。我很了解这东西，它的力量，和本质。它只要嗅到灵魂就会想要吞噬。<page>话是这么说，现在虫民都躲钟里……但别处更危险。<hpage>沙克拉，我会想办法终结这场灾难，毕竟我也有责任。但我需要时间，请你坚守下去。<hpage>小镇需要守卫，没有虫比你更合适。<page>好吧，使针的小姑娘。我答应你，只要你能解决源头，我会死守到底。
translated_text: <hpage>シャクラ何があったの？このような混乱に巻き込まれているのか。<page>暗い昆虫は容赦なく町を包囲した。私はそれぞれの波を守りましたが、それらは邪悪な方法で力を与えられ、私は非常に疲れていました。<hpage>...世界とその殻に広がるのは空虚です。私はそれ、その力、性質をよく知っている。魂を感じると、貪欲に魂に向かって進みます。<page>あなたが言ったように!すべてのこれらの虫は、鐘の音の中に集まっているしかし、この黒人の脅威が上昇するにつれて、他の場所は安全ではなかった。<hpage>シャクラ、私は大きな責任を負っているので、この新たな災害を終わらせようとしていますが、任務を果たすには時間が必要だと分かっています。それまで頑張ってください。<hpage>この町とその虫には守護者が必要で、これ以上のものは考えられません。<page>ホーネットは針を振った。強力な合意だ。もしあなたがこの毒を終わらせようとするなら、私は新たな信念をもって戦います。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>what happened, shakura? Are we getting caught up in such a mess?<page>The dark insects mercilessly surrounded the town. I defended each of the waves, but they were powered in an evil way, and I was very tired.<hpage>... It is emptiness to spread out into the world and its shell. I know it well, its power, its nature. " When you feel the soul, you go greedyly toward the soul.<page>As you said! " All these bugs are gathered in the sound of the bells, but as this black menace rises, the other places were not safe.<hpage>Shakra, I am trying to end this new disaster, because I have a great responsibility, but I know that it will take time to fulfill my mission. Please work hard until then.<hpage>This town and its bugs need a guardian, and I can't think of anything better.<page>The Hornet waved his needle. It is a strong agreement. If you are going to end this poison, I will fight with a new conviction. "

original_en_text: Eugh. Is it gettin’ hotter down here? Mustier? Grindle’s been down here too long. Reckon it’s time to climb back up soon, to where all the serious treasures is!
original_zh_text: 呃。这底下是不是越来越热了？格林德尔在这底下待太久了，该上去淘真宝贝了！
translated_text: ここは暑くなってきた？ムスチエ？グリンデルは長い間ここにいたので、私は戻ってきて、できるだけ早く重要な宝物をすべて見つける時間だと思いました!
secondary_translated_text: it's getting hot in here? muschier? Grindel has been here so long, I thought it was time to come back and find all the important treasures as soon as possible!

translated_text: Dark Marketsシングル
secondary_translated_text: The Dark Markets

original_en_text: So this is... defeat? Can it be? Huu... A shell so fast! Wonder of Pharloom! A bug whose pace could match my own.<page>Though I set a simple course, you have proven its match and more. Take this small reward, nimble bug, and remember well our grand contest!
original_zh_text: 居然……输了？怎么可能？呼……太快了！真是神奇！<page>虽然这条赛道不难，但你证明了自己！收下这个奖励，纪念我们的巅峰对决！
translated_text: それだけだ失敗？大丈夫ですか？呼び出し。キャノンボールは速い!ファラオの奇跡!私と同じ速さの虫です。<page>私は簡単なルートをセットアップしましたが、互換性などが証明されました。この小さな報酬を受け取り、ミスに機敏になり、素晴らしいゲームを思い出してください!
secondary_translated_text: that's all. failure? are you okay? Calling. The cannonball is fast! The Pharaoh's Miracle! It's a worm at the same speed as me.<page>I set up a simple route, but it proved to be compatible and so on. Receive this small reward, be alert to mistakes and remember the great game!

original_en_text: Oh, hoy there! Why, I must have dropped off to sleep as soon as I arrived!<page>Certainly, the pilgrim’s way is exhausting, but a good rest is a reward unto itself!
original_zh_text: 哎呀！刚到这地方就睡着了！<page>朝圣虽累，但一场美梦就是最好的犒赏！
translated_text: ああ、そこだ!なんで？着いたら寝ちゃったんだよ!<page>もちろん、巡礼は疲れるものですが、良い休息はそれ自体が報酬です!
secondary_translated_text: Oh, there it is! why? when i got dressed, i was asleep!<page>Of course, the pilgrimage is exhausting, but a good rest is a reward in itself!

original_en_text: That was a battle well-fought, Child Wielding Needle. Your master would be proud of you.<hpage>The one who trained me long ago... I never called her master. Whether she would be proud of what has become of me, I cannot say.<page>Nu-Hakkata! Whether she is dead or alive, have faith! Nothing a pupil does escapes their master’s sight!
original_zh_text: 打得好！你的导师肯定很骄傲。<hpage>教导我的……我从没叫过她导师。她会不会以我为荣……我不知道。<page>努-哈咔嗒！不管她是死是活，你都要自信！徒弟干的事，师傅都看在眼里！
translated_text: それは良い戦いで、子供たちは針を振っていた。あなたのホストはあなたを誇りに思うでしょう。<hpage>ずっと前に鍛えてくれた人たち。マスターとは呼ばなかった。彼女が私に起こったことを誇りに思うかどうかはわかりません。<page>空っぽの側!生きても死んでも、信仰が必要です。生徒がすることは先生の注意を逃れられません。
secondary_translated_text: It was a good fight, and the kids were waving their needles. Your hosts will be proud of you.<hpage>People who trained me a long time ago. I didn't call him Master. I don't know if she's proud of what happened to me.<page>The empty side! Whether you live or die, you need faith. What a student does cannot escape the teacher's attention.

original_en_text: Wide, dim hollows, choked by rag and dust. The bugs who once tended these lands have clearly lost their way.
original_zh_text: 昏暗广袤的洞窟塞满破布灰尘，原本照料这里的虫早已迷失了方向。
translated_text: 広大で暗い空虚はぼろとほこりで塞がれていた。かつてこの土地を世話していた昆虫は明らかに道を見失った。
secondary_translated_text: The vast, dark emptiness was clogged with mud and dust. The insects that once looked after this land have obviously lost their way.

original_en_text: Red maiden! Dear sister! At last, our great pilgrimage is at its end!<page>Our faith never wavered, and now here awaits our glorious reward, the shining Citadel! Where all sing as one!<hpage>I will not tell you to turn back, for I know you will not, but I urge you at least to be cautious. Terrible things lurk within this Citadel, little pilgrim.<page>Oh, sister! There is no need for caution, and no need for fear. Let us step forward under guidance of our faith!
original_zh_text: 红衣姑娘！好姐妹！我们终于到了！<page>守住信念不容易，现在终于看到圣堡了！大家齐声歌颂的地方！<hpage>我知道劝不动你回头，但千万小心。这里头藏着可怕的东西。<page>用不着小心！跟着信仰往前走就对了！
translated_text: レッド·ガール!親愛なる妹よ!いよいよ大巡礼が終わりました!<page>私たちの信仰は揺らぐことなく、今ここに栄光の報いが待っている。みんなで歌え!<hpage>戻ってこないことを知っているので、戻るように言うつもりはありませんが、少なくとも慎重にしてください。小さな巡礼者この城には恐ろしいものが潜んでいる<page>お姉ちゃん!警戒や恐怖は必要ありません。信仰の道を歩みましょう!
secondary_translated_text: The Red Girl! My dear sister! The great pilgrimage is finally over!<page>Our faith will not waver, and our glorious reward awaits us here and now. Sing it all!<hpage>I'm not going to tell you to go back, because I know you're not coming back, but at least be careful. little pilgrim, there's something terrible lurking in this castle.<page>sister! There is no need for alarm or fear. Let us walk the path of faith!

original_en_text: This vein of gilded bells creates an effectively defended settlement. I can see it once gave a long time of peace to its bugs.<page>And yet, look at their numbers now. Stricken by cursed thread. Only a few have survived.<page>We must learn from them, Child Wielding Needle. Peace is a slow poison that would wither even the hardiest bug.
original_zh_text: 这金钟钟脉易守难攻，以前肯定十分安全。<page>看看现在，大半被丝咒侵蚀了，虫民也所剩寥寥。<page>要从这镇子上吸取教训，使针的小姑娘。安逸最腐蚀虫心。
translated_text: これらの金色の鐘は効果的な防衛ソリューションを構成する。私はそれが長い間その虫に穏やかさを与えていたことを見ることができます。<page>しかし、現在の数字を見てください。呪われたラインに閉じ込められた。生き残ったのはわずか。<page>子供たちから学ばなければなりません平和はゆっくりとした毒であり、最も頑固な昆虫でさえも広がります。
secondary_translated_text: These golden bells constitute an effective defence solution. I can see that it has been giving that bug some calmness for a long time.<page>But look at the current numbers. Trapped in a cursed line. " Only a few survived.<page>We must learn from our children that peace is a slow poison that spreads even to the most stubborn insects.

original_en_text: <hpage>Your camp here looks comfortably set, Shakra. Are you planning to stay a time?<page>Perhaps, yes. This heart-home makes a fine base for now and later if needed.<page>Still! I must take care not to rest overlong. My shell would soften and my senses dull.<page>
original_zh_text: <hpage>沙克拉，我瞧你营地布置得不错，打算长住？<page>或许吧，这镇子看来能暂时当个据点。<page> 但不能久待，会钝了爪子和脑子。
translated_text: <hpage>シャクラ、あなたのキャンプは快適に見えます。しばらく滞在する予定ですか？<page>たぶん、そうだ。必要に応じて、この心臓の家は今も良い拠点になります。<page>それでも!あまり休まないように気をつけなければならない。私の殻は柔らかくなり、感覚は鈍化します。<page>
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Shakra, your camp looks comfortable. Are you planning to stay a while?<page>Probably, yes. If necessary, this heart house will still be a good base.<page>Still! You have to be careful not to rest too much. My shell becomes softer, and my senses become dull.<page>

original_en_text: Oh, hullo again! This time, I most certainly do recognise you! ‘Tis a pleasure to bump into you here, deep in this serene wood.<page>Do you have a name, like I do? Would you share it with me?<hpage>Certainly, sir. I am Hornet.<hpage>I notice you gazing at the buds above us... are they familiar to you, perhaps?<page>Hm? No, not at all. Very beautiful though! Perhaps I should gather some up before venturing on...
original_zh_text: 又见面了！这次绝对认得你！能在这林中深处偶遇也是缘分。<page>能告诉我你的名字吗？<hpage>我名为大黄蜂。<hpage>你在看那些苍白花苞……莫非曾经见过？<page>那倒没有，但它们很美！出发前或许该采些带着……
translated_text: ああ、また来た!今回は絶対に認めました!“この静かな森の奥深くでお会いできて光栄です。<page>あなたは私と同じ名前ですか？私と共有したいですか？<hpage>もちろんですよね私はバンブルビーです。<hpage>頭上のつぼみを見つめているのに気づいた。ご存じかもしれません<page>え？えっ？全然ないけど、とても綺麗!冒険する前にいくつか集めたほうがいいかもしれない。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, here you come again! This time I absolutely admitted it! "It is an honor to meet you deep in this quiet forest."<page>Are you the same name as me? Would you like to share with me?<hpage>Of course I am, I am Bumblebee.<hpage>He noticed that he was staring at the bumps on his head. You may know that.<page>what? what? Not at all, but so beautiful! You might want to collect a few before you venture.

original_en_text: You can use these to mark places of importance or reminders on your map.<br><br>These markers I have modelled after the sheen of my own shell. Perhaps you will think of me when you use them.
original_zh_text: 你可以用这个在地图上标记重要地点或提醒事项。<br><br>按我的壳抛光做的，用的时候会想起我吧？
translated_text: 地図上の重要な場所やリマインダーをマークするために使用できます。<br><br>自分の殻の輝きを真似てマーカーを作りました。使用するときに私のことを考えてください。
secondary_translated_text: It can be used to mark important places and reminders on the map.<br><br>I made a marker by imitating the shinyness of my own shell. Please think of me when you use it.

original_en_text: There are signs that pilgrims once travelled even these crumbling paths, long ago. Now only the voracious worms nest here.
original_zh_text: 这破路早年也有朝圣者走，现在只剩贪吃蠕虫。
translated_text: 昔、巡礼者がこれらの不安定な道を歩いていた兆候があります。今は貪欲な虫だけが巣を作っている。
secondary_translated_text: There are signs that in the past pilgrims were walking these unstable paths. Now only the greedy insects are making their nests.

original_en_text: Hoi! Nimble bug! Surely you have reconsidered? Let us discover our limits together!
original_zh_text: 嘿！改变主意没？来一起突破极限！
translated_text: おい!賢い間違いだ!本当に考え直したのか？一緒に限界を発見しましょう!
secondary_translated_text: Hey! That's a smart mistake! did you really reconsider? Let's discover the limits together!

original_en_text: You have purchased the last of my mapping stock, for now. Stay alive on your journey, and when our paths next cross we may trade again.
original_zh_text: 你把我的货买光啦，小姑娘。多保重，下次碰面再做交易。
translated_text: これで、私の最後のストックマップを購入しました。旅行中も元気を保ち、次に会ったときにまた取引するかもしれません。
secondary_translated_text: With this, I have purchased my last stock map. You may stay in good spirits while traveling and trade again the next time you see them.

original_en_text: Don’t be lingerin’ here too long! We got snitchin’ to do and we ain’t keen on company!
original_zh_text: 别在这儿磨蹭太久！我们还要干活呢，不欢迎围观！
translated_text: ここに長くいないで!報告したいのですが、仲間には興味がありません。
secondary_translated_text: Don't be here too long! I would like to report it, but my colleagues are not interested.

original_en_text: If you venture further and higher into these caverns, beware. The sickly air only grows thicker.
original_zh_text: 如果你要往高处的话，走小心，那儿的瘴气更浓。
translated_text: 洞窟に入る場合は注意してください。病気の空気が濃くなるだけです。
secondary_translated_text: Be careful if you enter the cave. It will only make the sick air thicker.

original_en_text: I’ll be off soon, once I’m good and rested. Beyond the wood lies the final climb, and then at last we shall reach the Citadel!<page>Which of us will reach the Grand Gate first? If it’s me, I shall wait for you so we can enter together!
original_zh_text: 歇够了我就出发，穿过甲木林就是最后攀登，圣堡就在眼前！<page>看我们谁先到巨门？要是我先到，肯定会等你一起进去！
translated_text: 体調が良くなったらすぐに木の後ろを歩いて最後の登りで、やっとお城に着きました!<page>誰が最初にスターゲートに行くのか？私だったら、待って一緒に入ります!
secondary_translated_text: As soon as I felt better, I walked behind the trees and on the last climb, I finally reached the castle!<page>who's going to go to the stargate first? If it were me, I would wait and enter with you!

original_en_text: If you would fight alone, I will say nothing more.
original_zh_text: 你要自己上的话，我也没意见。
translated_text: 一人で戦う気があるのなら、これ以上は言わない。
secondary_translated_text: If you are willing to fight alone, I will say no more.

original_en_text: <hpage>Fair meeting again, sir knight. I see this bell has drawn you too towards its safety.<page>Who would have guessed, sister! A safe corner, hidden so high atop Pharloom’s cursed crown!<page>Our fair village may have fallen, but for these fellows... these scared few, our honour charges us to keep them safe. Our hornlance shall raise for them! After some rest, of course.<hpage>Hold fast to your new charge, Garmond. See these bugs survive, and know I aim, in time near, to cut down this curse at its core.
original_zh_text: <hpage>又见面了，骑士。看来这钟也把你吸引过来了。<page>谁能想到呢，圣堡顶上还有避难所！<page>村子没了，但这些吓坏了的……为了荣耀，我会拿起长枪保护好他们！不过得先歇会。<hpage>守好他们，加蒙德。我会斩断诅咒的核心，不会让你等太久的。
translated_text: <hpage>もう一つのフェアな出会いだ、騎士。この時計は、その安全性にも注目されます。<page>誰が推測できますか？ファロの呪われた王冠の上に隠された安全コーナー!<page>私たちの美しい村は陥落したかもしれませんが、彼らのために。私たちの名誉は、これらの恐ろしい少数派の安全を確保することを要求する。私たちの角は彼らのために吹く!もちろん短い休憩の後。<hpage>あなたの新しい突撃をしっかりつかんで、ガモンド。これらの過ちが生き残るのを見て、私の目標は近い将来呪いを根絶することです。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Another fair encounter, knight. This watch is also paid attention to its safety.<page>Who can guess? A safe corner hidden above the cursed crown of the pharo!<page>Our beautiful village may have fallen, but it is for them. Our honor demands that we ensure the safety of these terrible minorities. " Our horns will blow for them! After a short break, of course.<hpage>Hold on tight to your new assault, Gammon. As I watch these mistakes survive, my goal is to eradicate the curse in the near future.

translated_text: 罪人の道図
secondary_translated_text: The Sinner's Road Map

original_en_text: O-hoho! Into Grindle’s pockets they go! And for you, a secret to remember us by...<page>Beneath here and further on, the burly bellheads have a big, hot, gleaming hive! Full of all sorts of tasty snitchables!<page>But there’s this big gate they got down in its belly... shut tight, locked up. If you could wriggle through, you’d get your claws on all kindsa goodies!
original_zh_text: 哦嚯嚯！都进我们的口袋啦！那就送你个秘密当纪念……<page>底下更深的地方，那些钟头怪物有个又大又亮的宝库！全是好东西！<page>但最底下有道大门被锁死了。要是能溜进去就发啦！
translated_text: ああ、ホー!グリンデルのポケットの中に!私たちの秘密を覚えている人に。<page>ここや他の場所で、この騒々しい時間には、大きくて熱く、輝く蜂の巣があります!おいしいレポーターがいっぱい!<page>しかし、彼らはその腹の中にドアを置いた-しっかりと閉じられ、鍵がかかっていた。それを通り抜けることができれば、あなたの爪はすべてをつかむでしょう!
secondary_translated_text: Oh, ho! In Grindell's pocket! To the one who remembers our secrets.<page>Here and elsewhere, in this noisy hour, there are big, hot, shining beehives! Lots of delicious reporters!<page>But they put the door in its belly - tightly closed and locked. If you can get through it, your nails will grab it all!

original_en_text: You see this idol before us, red maiden? I have passed its like before, they mark our pilgrimage well.<page>If we sing to it, a miraculous shrine will rise from the ground, and we will have a place to rest! Such a wonder!<hpage>I suspect it is not song that rouses this shrine, but payment in rosaries.<hpage>I have encountered similar constructs on Pharloom’s paths. It seems this kingdom does not grant rest lightly.
original_zh_text: 看见这圣像了吗？沿途都有标记。<page>对着它歌唱，圣椅就会升起供我们歇息！多神奇！<hpage>我认为唤醒长椅的不是歌声，谢尔玛，而是念珠。<hpage>我在路上曾遇到过此类长椅，看来纺络从不轻易施恩。
translated_text: 私たちの前に赤い女の子が見えますか？私は以前と同じようにそれを経験し、彼らは私たちの巡礼のために良いマークを付けました。<page>それに向かって歌えば、魔法の寺院が立ち上がり、休息の場所ができるのです。なんて奇跡だ!<hpage>寺院を目覚めさせたのは歌ではなく、ロザリオの報酬だったと思います。<hpage>私はファラムに向かう途中で同じような建物に出くわしました。王国は安らかに眠れなかった。
secondary_translated_text: Do you see the red girl in front of us? I experienced it as before, and they put a good mark on it for our pilgrimage.<page>If you sing to it, a magical temple will rise up and become a place of rest. what a miracle!<hpage>I don't think it was the song that woke up the temple, but the reward of the Rosary.<hpage>I came across a similar building on my way to Faram. The kingdom did not sleep peacefully.

original_en_text: O-hoho! Into Grindle’s pockets they go! And for you, a secret to remember us by...<page>There’s lots of pickings round here, right? Well, it’s all nothing compared to what they got hidden up, up above us. The great big Sitty-del they calls it!<page>A golden place, groaning with goodies! Could never steal it all in a thousand snitch-bug lifetimes they reckon!<page>Oh yes, that’s where ol’ Grindle is headin’. Don’t you dare follow us, though! We want it all for us-selves!
original_zh_text: 哦嚯嚯！都进我们的口袋啦！那就送你个秘密当纪念……<page>这附近好东西不少对吧？但跟上边的圣堡比，什么都不是！<page>听说那是金山银山，几辈子都掏不完！<page>格林德尔这就去捞个够！你可别跟来抢！
translated_text: ああ、ホー!グリンデルのポケットの中に!私たちの秘密を覚えている人に。<page>ピックアップはたくさんありますよね。彼らが私たちの頭の上に隠しているものに比べれば、何でもない。彼らはそれを偉大なシティデルと呼ぶ!<page>美しいうめき声でいっぱいの黄金の場所!彼らは内部告発者が千人の人生ですべてを盗むことができないと信じている!<page>そう、これが“グリンドル”の目的地です。私たちに従ってください!私たちはこれをすべて私たちのもの!
secondary_translated_text: Oh, ho! In Grindell's pocket! To the one who remembers our secrets.<page>There's a lot of pick-ups, right? It's nothing compared to what they're hiding over our heads. They call it the Great Citadel!<page>A golden place full of beautiful moans! They believe that whistleblowers can't steal everything in a thousand lives!<page>Yes, this is the destination of the "grindles." Please follow us! We make this all our own!

original_en_text: O-hoho! Into Grindle’s pockets they go! And for you, a secret to remember us by...<page>You know where all them dreary raggedies are camping? Back near the ol’ chapel? Well, beyond that chapel is a dirty great grave!<page>Not much in there but husks, right? But but! My sniffer tells me there’s something worth the trouble buried down at the bottom!
original_zh_text: 哦嚯嚯！都进我们的口袋啦！那就送你个秘密当纪念……<page>你知道那处破破烂烂的朝圣者营地吧？那附近的破教堂后头有个大坟场！<page>那乍一看都是尸壳对吧？但是但是！我能嗅到底下埋着值钱货，我鼻子灵得很！
translated_text: ああ、ホー!グリンデルのポケットに入っていた。私たちの秘密を覚えてくれる人に。<page>どこにゴミがあるか分かりますか？古い教会に戻る？教会の裏には、汚れた墓がある。<page>殻以外何もないんですよね。しかししかし、しかし!私のスニファは、底に何か心配するものが隠されていると言った!
secondary_translated_text: Oh, ho! It was in Grindell's pocket. To someone who will remember our secrets.<page>do you know where the trash is? Back to the old church? Behind the church is an unclean grave.<page>There's nothing but a shell, right? But but, but! My sniff said there was something to worry about hiding at the bottom!

original_en_text: <hpage>The groaning docks, beyond the caverns of bone. There I have seen a vessel able to pass below, a heavy bell built for descent.<hpage>I need only gain access, and an operator to assist. I will investigate the docks, and uncover the means.<page=M>You’d be the first in an age to dive so deep, Old One. That space below remains long unseen, even to our family. <hpage>For those depths, I am more prepared than most. I will reach the base of this land, and know the truth of the new disaster we, together have wrought.
original_zh_text: <hpage>穿越骸骨洞窟，那锈蚀的深坞中停着一口沉钟，专为下潜打造。<hpage>只需寻得入口与操钟人。我会探查深坞，找出通路。<page=M>古老者，您是数个纪元以来第一个敢下潜的。那片黑暗连我们家族都未曾窥见。<hpage>对于深渊，我早有准备。我会抵达此地根基，看清你我共酿的新灾祸。
translated_text: <hpage>骨の穴の外にうめき声を上げるドック。下を通過できる船があり、落下するために作られた重い時計がありました。<hpage>必要なのはアクセス権とオペレーターだけです。私は港を調査し、方法を見つけます。<page=M>老人よ、あなたはこの時代に深く研究する最初の人になるでしょう。私たちの家族にとっても、その下の空間は常に未知でした。<hpage>私はほとんどの人よりもこの深さに対処します。私はこの地の底に行き、私たちが共に引き起こした新たな大惨事の真実を知るでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Moaning dock out of the bone hole. There was a ship that could pass underneath, and a heavy watch made for the fall.<hpage>All you need is access rights and an operator. I'll investigate the harbour and find a way.<page=M>Old man, you will be the first to study deeply in this age. Even for our family, the space below it was always unknown.<hpage>I deal with this depth more than most people do. I will go to the bottom of this earth and know the truth of the new catastrophe we have caused together.

original_en_text: Why does it fade? Why can I not recall that sacred place?
original_zh_text: 为什么消失了……为什么想不起圣地模样……
translated_text: なぜ消えるのか？なぜ聖地を思い出せないのか。
secondary_translated_text: why are they disappearing? Why don't we remember the holy place?

original_en_text: <hpage>Here you lie, monarch. Sunk so deep, yet still you cling to life. <hpage>Would you let your lands be choked black... to protect just her?
original_zh_text: <hpage>苍白之主，沉沦至此也要苟活么？<hpage>你宁愿让纺络被黑暗吞噬……只为护着她？
translated_text: <hpage>主よ、あなたはここに横たわる。深く沈んでも、あなたはまだ生きています。<hpage>あなたはあなたの土地を窒息させるつもりですかそれを守るためだけですか
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Lord, here you lie. Even if you sink deeply, you are still alive.<hpage>Are you going to suffocate your land, just to protect it?

original_en_text: <hpage>Take care, Garmond. Whatever dangers these lands present, I’m sure what waits in that Citadel will be worse.<page>Aye, sister! Until that Citadel is reached and justice is served, Zaza and I shall not fall.
original_zh_text: <hpage>保重，加蒙德。圣堡必然比外面更加危险。<page>你也保重，姐妹！不跟圣堡之主讨个公道，我和扎扎不会倒下的！
translated_text: <hpage>気をつけて、ガモン。これらの土地にどんな危険があろうとも、城に待ち受けているものはもっと悪いと思います。<page>はい、お姉さん!ザザと私は砦に到着して正義を果たすまで倒れない
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Be careful, gamon. Whatever dangers may be in these lands, I think what awaits in the castle is worse.<page>Yes, my sister! Zaza and I will not fall until we reach the fort and do justice.

original_en_text: Letting you live was my rebellion, spider. I’ve denied my mother your silken strength. I’ve won.<page>She can thrash, and waste, and know her pathetic, broken child caused the mortal wound.<page>Rejoice! And let it all come down.<hpage>I will not. I have already stood the sentinel for one dying land. That role... I will never play again.<hpage>While I live, and possess the strength to resist, this kingdom, and the bugs within it, shall not fall.
original_zh_text: 留着你的性命就是我的反叛。母亲得不到你的灵丝，是我赢了。<page>让她抓狂吧！知道是我这残次品带给她致命伤！<page>欢呼吧！一切都将崩塌！<hpage>恕难从命。我曾守望过一个将死的国度，同样的角色……我不想再扮第二次。<hpage>只要我还活着，还有力气反抗，这个王国与其子民就不会陨落。
translated_text: お前を生かしておくのは俺の抵抗だ蜘蛛私は母に力を与えなかった。俺の勝ちだ<page>彼女はむち打ち、無駄にすることができ、悲しみ、壊れた子供が致命傷を負ったことを知る。<page>幸せになれ!すべてをダウンさせる。<hpage>私は死んだ場所の見張りになりません。この役割。もう二度と演奏しない。<hpage>私が生きていて抵抗する力がある限り、王国とその中の昆虫は陥落しない。
secondary_translated_text: It's my resistance to keep you alive. I didn't give Spider Mother any power. i won.<page>She knows that the whip, can be wasted, grief, broken child was fatally wounded.<page>Be happy! Putting everything down.<hpage>I will not be the watchman of the place of death. This role. I will never play it again.<hpage>As long as I live and have the strength to resist, the kingdom and the insects in it will not fall.

original_en_text: Hahahhaa! Spider. Spider. What a marvellous specimen you are! You fight and fight, heedless as the world crumbles around you.<page>Pharloom and her bugs will be crushed to dust, and still you’ll be vainly swinging your blade.<hpage>...There may still be a way to prevent that fate. I will claim the hidden power, the bloom that repels the dark.<hpage>Those snails share some fault in the snare, and their callous use of the void. They shall help me now to seek its counter.<hpage>I will return, child, when I bear the strength to dive below, and cut this land finally free of your mother’s grasp.
original_zh_text: 哈哈哈哈！顽固的小蜘蛛！即便你继续挣扎，这个世界一样会崩塌！<page>一切都将化为尘埃，继续挥舞那针刃还有什么用<hpage>……或许还有转机。我会取得驱散黑暗的永绽花。<hpage>蜗牛一族滥用虚空难辞其咎，现在它们得帮我找到破局之法。<hpage>等我取得力量，就来斩断你母亲的掌控。
translated_text: ハハハ!ハハハ!クモ、あなたは良い例です!周りの世界が崩壊すると、知らず知らずのうちに戦い、戦います。<page>ファルと彼女の虫は粉々に砕かれ、あなたはまだ無駄に刃を振っています。<hpage>...この運命を防ぐ方法はまだあるかもしれない。私は隠された力を持ち、闇の花を拒否する。<hpage>これらのカタツムリの罠にも欠点があり、隙間を容赦なく利用します。彼らは私の反撃を見つけるのを助ける。<hpage>息子よ、私が海に潜り、ついにこの土地をあなたの母から解放する力を得たとき、私は戻ってくる。
secondary_translated_text: ha ha ha! ha ha ha! Spider, you are a good example! When the world around us collapses, we fight and fight without knowing it.<page>Fal and her worms are crushed to pieces, and you are still waving your blades in vain.<hpage>... There may still be ways to avert this fate. I have a hidden power and reject the flowers of darkness.<hpage>These snail traps also have drawbacks, and they relentlessly exploit the gaps. They will help me find my counter-attack.<hpage>My son, when I have dived into the sea and at last gained the strength to free this land from your mother, I will come back.

original_en_text: After some tasty goodies? We never say no to a fair trade, heh heh! Take a look at what we’s got...
original_zh_text: 想要宝贝？只接受公平交易！随便看看吧……
translated_text: おいしい食べ物を食べた後？フェアトレードにノーとは言いません。持っているものを見てみましょう
secondary_translated_text: after eating a good meal? I'm not saying no to fair trade. So let's see what we have.

original_en_text: We could add a little pocket to yer tool pouch for you. You could pack even more goodies in there! All your shards’n sharp things!
original_zh_text: 给你工具包加个兜，能多装点好宝贝。
translated_text: 道具箱に小さなポケットを入れることができます。もっと良いものを入れることができる!あなたのピースはすべてシャープなものです!
secondary_translated_text: You can put a small pocket in the tool box. I could put in something better! All of your pieces are sharp!

original_en_text: <hpage>Shakra, if I may, I’d ask a small task of your carving talents.<hpage>Within the halls of the Citadel, I encountered a means of travel new to me, a network of pipes traversed in vessels propelled by steam and air.<hpage>That Citadel is a labyrinth, and pins to mark each station would prove useful to me.<page>What you describe sounds as hideous and unnatural as anything in that place. Still, if it will aid you, I shall craft the pins.<page>Seek me at a moment not long from now. The pins will be carved, and we may trade.
original_zh_text: <hpage>沙克拉，方便的话，借你的手艺办件小事。<hpage>圣堡里有种我没见过的蒸汽管道交通网。<hpage>但那跟一座迷宫一样，因此我需要标记站点的图钉。<page>圣堡里都是这种难看又不自然的玩意。但你要就给你做吧。<page>过阵子再来找我，图钉做好了才能交易。
translated_text: <hpage>シャクラ、もしよければ、彫刻の才能にちょっとした仕事をさせていただきたい。<hpage>城の大広間では、蒸気と空気を動力とする船が通るパイプのネットワークという、奇妙な旅の方法に出会いました。<hpage>城は迷路のようで、駅ごとにマークされているピンはとても役に立ちました。<page>あなたが説明したことは、その場所の他のものと同じくらい恐ろしく、不自然に聞こえます。でも、役に立つならピンを作ります。<page>できるだけ早く見つけて。ピンは彫刻され、交換できます。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Shakra, I'd like to let my sculptural talent do a little work, if you like.<hpage>In the great halls of the castle, I encountered a strange way of traveling: a network of pipes through which steam and air-powered ships pass.<hpage>The castle was like a maze, and the pins marked at each station were very helpful.<page>What you have described sounds as terrifying and unnatural as anything else in that place. But if it helps, I'll make a pin.<page>Find them as soon as possible. The pins are sculpted and can be replaced.

original_en_text: These overgrown caves offer little challenge to a skilled warrior. A place for reflection, perhaps.
original_zh_text: 这长满苔藓的洞穴对高手没挑战性，适合发呆。
translated_text: これらの生い茂った洞窟は熟練した兵士にはほとんど挑戦しない。反省の場かもしれない。
secondary_translated_text: These lush caves offer little challenge to a skilled soldier. It may be a place for reflection.

original_en_text: Fear not, red maiden! This shrine will surely rise for us, we only need to patiently wish for it!
original_zh_text: 别担心！只要诚心祈愿，圣椅定会为我们显现！
translated_text: 恐れるな、レッドガール!この聖地は必ず私たちのために立ち上がります。忍耐強く祈るだけです。
secondary_translated_text: Don't be afraid, Red Girl! This holy place will surely stand up for us. We just have to pray patiently.

original_en_text: <page=M>In the heights of the great wood, nestled deep in its roots, vines and branches, find the one who sowed the first seed.<page=S>They’re the very essence of the place, the nub of it all. Ain’t really a bug, to be told, but a powerful presence nonetheless.<page=M>We’d heard the Citadel once made grudging accord with that creature, sent their servants in reverence, even built a shrine up there somewhere. Maybe it’s worth you searching for it?
original_zh_text: <page=M>甲木林最深处，根枝藤蔓之间，埋着最初播种者。<page=S>那是纺络的精华所在，虽算不得虫子，但也十分强大。<page=M>听说圣堡曾与之立约，建造圣所供奉，还派遣仆从侍奉。或许值得一探？
translated_text: <page=M>森の高いところで、根やつるや枝の奥深くで、最初の種をまいた者を見つけなさい。<page=S>彼らはこの場所の本質であり、すべての中心にあります。私が言いたいのは、それは本当の間違いではないが、それでも強力な存在であるということです。<page=M>城はかつてこの生き物と不本意な合意を結び、弔問のために召使いを送り、どこかに寺院を建てたと聞いています。探す価値はある？
secondary_translated_text: <page=M>High in the woods, deep in the roots and branches, find the one who sowed the first seed.<page=S>They are the essence of this place, and they are at the heart of everything. What I want to say is that it's not a real mistake, but it's still a powerful being.<page=M>I've heard that the castle once made an unwilling agreement with this creature, sent a servant for a mourning, and built a temple somewhere. is it worth looking for?

original_en_text: Old roads and passages overrun by roaches and their keepers. The ways are covered thick with filth.
original_zh_text: 被蟑螂及其饲主侵占的古道，路面上覆满污秽。
translated_text: 古代の道路や通路はゴキブリとその飼育員で占められている。道路は泥だらけです。
secondary_translated_text: Ancient roads and passageways are occupied by cockroaches and their keepers. The road is muddy.

original_en_text: In this moment, I have no more items to trade. Perhaps, if we meet again on the roads ahead, I shall have crafted new goods to sell.
original_zh_text: 暂时没货了，小姑娘。下次碰面会准备好新玩意的，保重。
translated_text: 今のところ、取引する商品はありません。また道路で会ったら、新しい製品を作って売るかもしれません。
secondary_translated_text: At the moment, there are no products to trade. If we meet again on the road, we might create a new product and sell it.

original_en_text: You like this gleaming spinner I snitched from the big Sitty-dell? There’s a way to make it sing to you, or so they says!
original_zh_text: 从圣堡顺来的转轮！据说用某种方法能让它唱歌呢！
translated_text: 私がシティデール大聖堂で報告したこの輝くスピナーは好きですか？歌を歌う方法があります、少なくとも彼らはそう言っています!
secondary_translated_text: Do you like this shining spinner I reported on at Citydale Cathedral? There is a way to sing a song, at least they say so!

translated_text: 骨髄の地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of Bone Marrow

original_en_text: You can use these to mark places of importance or reminders on your map.<br><br>This dark-shell material is cold to the touch, and more resilient than it looks.
original_zh_text: 你可以用这个在地图上标记重要地点或提醒事项。<br><br>黑壳材质冷冰冰的，比看着结实。
translated_text: 地図上の重要な場所やリマインダーをマークするために使用できます。<br><br>この深い殻の素材は冷たく感じ、見た目よりも弾力性があります。
secondary_translated_text: It can be used to mark important places and reminders on the map.<br><br>The material of this deep shell feels cold and is more elastic than it looks.

original_en_text: Crumbling roads built upon the shells of ancient bugs. All of Pharloom rests upon these fragile foundations.
original_zh_text: 建在古虫壳上的破路，整个纺络都靠这些脆架子撑着。
translated_text: この不安定な道は古代の昆虫の殻の上に築かれた。ファロ全体はこの脆弱な基盤の上に成り立っている。
secondary_translated_text: This precarious road was built on the shells of ancient insects. The whole Faro is built on this fragile foundation.

original_en_text: Crusted heights above those howling steps. Signs suggest great warriors once ruled this winding place, though the sand has eroded much of their mark.
original_zh_text: 风蚀台阶上的矿脉高地。迹象表明曾有强族统治，现已被沙尘掩埋。
translated_text: 轟音の階段の上部は硬い皮でいっぱいです。偉大な戦士たちがかつてこの曲がりくねった場所を支配していた兆候がありますが、砂は彼らの痕跡のほとんどを侵食しています。
secondary_translated_text: The top of the roaring stairs is full of hard skin. There are signs that the great warriors once ruled this winding place, but the sand is eroding most of their traces.

original_en_text: <hpage>To search these lands so thoroughly, Shakra... I wonder, who is it you hope to find?<page>Okklu-Din... a perceptive question. I travel in search of my mentor, the greatest of my tribe. I have followed her trail throughout this kingdom, but have so far failed to catch her.<page>She will have travelled much farther by now, but if I keep moving and stay vigilant, we shall reunite.
original_zh_text: <hpage>又见面了。我看你把这片地区都找遍了……你到底在找谁？<page>唉……问得好。我在找导师，我们部落的最强者。我追着她的踪迹跑遍了王国，还是没找到。<page>她肯定走得更远了，但只要保持警惕总能重逢。
translated_text: <hpage>この土地を徹底的に調べてくださいシャクラ。誰を見つけたいのか知りたいですか？<page>Okudinの洞察力のある質問私は自分の師、部族の中で最も偉大な師を見つけるために旅をしました。私はこの王国で彼女を追ったが、今のところ彼女を捕まえていない。<page>彼女は今さらに遠くに行っていますが、私が前に進み、警戒していれば、私たちは再会できます。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Please examine this land thoroughly, Shakura. do you want to know who you want to find?<page>Okudin's insightful question I have traveled to find my teacher, the greatest teacher in the tribe. I have pursued her in this kingdom, but I have not yet caught her.<page>She's going even further now, but if I go forward and stay alert, we can meet again.

original_en_text: The stone structures of this place suggest clear waters once ran throughout.<page>What fantasy that now seems! Even this swamp’s inhabitants seem spawned of its noxious nature.
original_zh_text: 这里的石制结构说明以前有清水流过。<page>现在呢？连原本栖居在这里的虫都像是从毒瘴里孕育出来的。
translated_text: この場所の石造りは、かつては水が流れていたことを示す。<page>今はなんと幻想的でしょう!この沼の人々でさえ、その有毒さのために上昇しているようです。
secondary_translated_text: The stonework at this site indicates that water once flowed.<page>How fantastic it is now! Even the people of this swamp seem to be rising because of its toxicity.

original_en_text: But look here! As soon as our sacred journey begins, we are tested. This huge gate stands between us and the way forward.<page>Only holy prayer and song will open the way! In this kingdom, even mighty bone is moved by music!
original_zh_text: 可你看看！朝圣之路刚启程就遇到考验，被这道巨大骨门拦住了去路。<page>唯有圣歌能够撼动它！在纺络，最顽固的骨头都会为旋律让道！
translated_text: でもここを見ろ!聖なる旅が始まると、私たちは試されます。大きな扉が私たちと私たちの道を塞いでいました。<page>神の祈りと歌だけが道を開く!この王国では、強い骨でさえ音楽に触れることができます。
secondary_translated_text: But look at this! When the sacred journey begins, we are tested. A big door was blocking us and our path.<page>Only God's prayer and song will open the way! In this kingdom, even the strong bones can touch the music.

original_en_text: You win again! Never have I met a luckier pilgrim...<hpage>You mistake, sir. It was skill that won me this game. One must be careful not to rely merely on luck.<page>Hmph. Fairly said, sister.<page>I must confess something though. Truth is, I already lost the last of my rosaries. I can’t pay our last wager.<page>I do have something small for you, at least. These dice. They certainly seem to have taken a liking to you. Take them, in memory of our meeting.
original_zh_text: 你又赢了！没见过运气这么好的朝圣者……<hpage>错了，我是靠技术赢的，别光指望运气。<page>哼，倒也说得在理。<page>其实……我已经输光家底了。最后这把的赌注我给不起。<page>但我可以把这些小玩意送你。这对骰子跟你有缘，收下当纪念吧。
translated_text: また勝ったぞ!こんなに幸運な巡礼者は見たことがない。<hpage>あなたは間違っています。テクノロジーが私をこのレースに導いたのです運だけに頼らないように注意してください。<page>よく言った、シスター。<page>でも認めなければなりません実は、最後のロザリオの本をなくしました。最後の賭けをすることができなかった。<page>少なくとも私はあなたのための小さなものを持っている。彼らは本当にこれらのカードのあなたを愛しているようです。私たちの出会いを記念するために。
secondary_translated_text: We won again! I have never seen such a fortunate pilgrim.<hpage>You're wrong, my friend. Technology is what led me to this race Be careful not to rely on luck alone.<page>Well said, Sister.<page>But I have to admit, in fact, that I lost my last Rosary book. I couldn't make my last bet.<page>At least I have a little one for you. " They seem to really love you for these cards. To commemorate our meeting.

original_en_text: <page>Who are you hoping you’ll find down there, spider? An ailing child and a Silk starved beast? <page>If so, I’m afraid we may sorely disappoint. What waits below is me no longer.
original_zh_text: <page>小蜘蛛，你指望能在下面见到谁？虚弱的傀儡还是饥渴的空壳？<page>要让你失望了，在下面等着的早已不是我。
translated_text: <page>スパイダー、誰を探していますか？病気の子供と飢えた獣。<page>もしそうなら、私たちは非常に失望するかもしれません。私はもうそこで待っていない。
secondary_translated_text: <page>spider, who are you looking for? A sick child and a hungry beast.<page>If so, we may be very disappointed. I'm not waiting there anymore.

original_en_text: Hoy, you’re still hanging around then? Quiet in here. Good for hidin’ out.<page>You gots the li’l clicky-clackies on you then, eh? The rolly-roundies? What the shops like to swap for?
original_zh_text: 哟，还在附近晃悠呢？这很安静，适合躲藏。<page>带叮当响了没？就是商店爱换的那种小圆珠？
translated_text: おい、まだ吊るしてるの？ここは静かだ。隠れるのに適してる<page>だからジングルがあるんですよね？お店は何を変えたいですか？
secondary_translated_text: hey, are you still hanging? It's quiet here. it's good for hiding<page>that's why there's a jungle, right? What would you like to change in the store?

translated_text: カップ戦のマーク
secondary_translated_text: Mark of the Cup

original_en_text: You... So, it is done... My wish granted before ever I arrived...<hpage>The bronze pair that danced this chamber, it is clear, tall bug, how closely they mimicked your shell. Was it you who provided their inspiration?<page>Not I, warrior. For this place, my heart holds only loathing...<page>The dancers... they were the last free act of my partner... Always hopeful. Always naive.<page>His whole he gave, in desperate trade to see our own caves left safe. His shell and soul became the mould.<page>So long, I dared not visit... Even as our lands fell to thread and ruin... Instead I wasted, a coward caged, too weak to witness his grace bound in parody so cruel.<hpage>Take some solace, tall bug. His soul is now free from that shell of iron, and the fate that befell your lands, this Citadel too has been claimed full by it.<page>Aye... Slim consolation, warrior, now that everything I loved is lost...
original_zh_text: 你……这样啊……竟然在我抵达前就完成了……<hpage>厅里那对铜像，分明是照着你的模样铸的。是你给的灵感？<page>与我无关。对这地方……我只剩恶心……<page>舞者……是我伴侣最后的自由创作……他总是满怀天真与希望。<page>为保我们故土平安，他献出了全部。躯壳和灵魂都成了铸模。<page>这么久以来，我不敢来看……哪怕故土被丝咒吞噬……懦弱地困在牢里，不敢面对他的优雅被如此践踏……<hpage>宽心吧，至少现在他的灵魂挣脱铁壳了。你们故土遭受的厄运，圣堡也逃不过。<page>是啊……但这不过是无力的安慰……如今我爱的一切都化为乌有……
translated_text: あなたは..。それが決まった。到着する前に願いが叶いました。<hpage>ブロンズのパートナーは部屋の中で踊っていますとてもクリアで背が高く貝殻がどれだけ近づいているかを模倣します彼らにインスピレーションを与えますか？<page>俺じゃない兵士。私はこの場所が嫌い。<page>ダンサーたち。これがパートナーの最後のフリー·ショーです。常に希望に満ちて。いつもナイーブ。<page>彼は私たち自身の洞窟の安全のために全力を尽くしました。彼の体と魂は一つの形になった。<page>長い間、見るのが怖かった。たとえ私たちの土地が荒廃し、廃墟になったとしても...それどころか、私はそれを無駄にしました。檻の中の臆病者は、そのような残酷な模倣によって彼の優雅さを直接見るには弱すぎました。<hpage>自分を慰める、高い虫。彼の魂は今や鉄の殻から解放され、その運命はあなたの土地に落ち、城はそれによって占領されました。<page>そう、ささやかな慰め、兵士、今私が愛していたものすべてが失われた。
secondary_translated_text: You are a... That's what we decided. My wish was fulfilled before we arrived.<hpage>The bronze partner is dancing in the room, so clear, so tall, mimicking how close the shell is, do you inspire them?<page>It's not me, soldier. I hate this place.<page>The dancers. This is our partner's last free show. Always filled with hope. Always naïve.<page>He did everything in his power for the safety of our own cave. His body and soul became one form.<page>For a long time, I was afraid to watch. Even if our land is desolate and ruined... On the contrary, I have wasted it. The coward in the cage was too weak to see directly his grace by such a cruel imitation.<hpage>Comfort yourself, high insect. His soul is now freed from the iron shell, and its fate falls on your land, and the castle has been occupied by it.<page>Yes, a little consolation, soldier, all that I loved now was lost.

original_en_text: <page=M>What’s this? That’s an unexpected heart you’re holding, Old One...<page=M>We can guess to its source, though we’d believed it long gone from these lands. <hpage>The heart of a graceful lord. In its taking I was able to witness his caves and kingdom as once they flourished.<hpage>A stunning sight. Unique. All gone... Lost to the pale monarch... and the system to keep her caged.
original_zh_text: <page=M>咦？这颗心出乎意料啊，古老者……<hpage>一位优雅领主的心。取心时我见到了其洞窟王国昔日繁盛景象。<hpage>真是瑰丽无双。但都消逝了……毁于苍白君主……以及囚困她的体系。
translated_text: <page=M>これは何だ？おじいさん、あなたは思いがけない心を手に持っている。<page=M>その起源は推測できますが、長い間この土地を離れていたと考えられています。<hpage>主の恵みの心。撮影の過程で、私は彼の洞窟と王国の繁栄を目撃しました。<hpage>見事な景色。ユニークな、みんな行ったよ蒼白の君主に敗れる― ―そして彼女を檻の中に閉じ込めるシステム。
secondary_translated_text: <page=M>what is this? Grandpa, you have an unexpected heart in your hand.<page=M>Its origins can be guessed, but it is believed that it has long left this land.<hpage>The heart of the Lord's mercy. In the course of filming, I witnessed the prosperity of his cave and kingdom.<hpage>Great views. Unique, everyone went to defeat the Pale Monarch - - and the system that locks her in a cage.

original_en_text: A beat of rosaries is our wager. Once you find enough, I’d be happy to play.
original_zh_text: 赌注是一奏念珠。等你攒够了，我很乐意再陪你玩。
translated_text: 私たちの賭けはロザリオです十分なものが見つかったら、喜んで遊びます。
secondary_translated_text: Our bet is the rosary, and when we find enough, we'll be happy to play.

original_en_text: Nimble bug, you return refreshed! And so perfectly timed, for I have a new challenge prepared.<page>The course shall remain the same as last, but length, the laps, will greatly extend.<hpage>You propose a test of endurance? I have undertaken many in my time.<page>Excellent! Excellent! Though know, for this race, I can only provide slight reward for victory.<page>What say you, nimble bug? Let us stride fast forth!
original_zh_text: 你看起来状态绝佳！正好我准备了新的挑战！<page>赛道和上次一样，但长度、圈数大幅增加！<hpage>要比耐力？我平时可没少锻炼。<page>那太好了！不过这次如果你赢了，奖励价值或许不高。<page>怎么说？一起冲刺吧！
translated_text: 賢い昆虫、元気に帰ってきた!新しい挑戦の準備ができているので、タイミングはちょうどいいです。<page>レースは前回と同じですが、長さ（周回数）が大幅に延長されます。<hpage>持久力テストをお勧めしますか？私は人生で多くのことをしました。<page>それは素晴らしい!それは素晴らしい!この試合では、勝利のためにわずかな報酬しか与えられないことはわかっています。<page>何を言っているのか、スピードエラー？“Let's Go Go!
secondary_translated_text: Smart insects, you're back in good health! The timing is just right as we are ready for a new challenge.<page>The race is the same as the previous one, but the length (lap count) is significantly extended.<hpage>Do you recommend endurance testing? I've done a lot in my life.<page>That's awesome! That's awesome! I know that in this game, you can only be rewarded with a small reward for winning.<page>What are you talking about, speed error? "Let's Go Go!

original_en_text: <hpage>Another time, Shakra. I am always eager to learn, but for now my tasks call me away. <page>Bakelo! Answer to your tasks, then. My rings shall await your return.
original_zh_text: <hpage>改天吧。虽然想锻炼技艺，但要事在身。<page>吧咔咯！那忙你的去吧！我的战环随时恭候。
translated_text: <hpage>次回は、サクラ。私はいつも学びたいと思っていましたが、今は義務がなくなりました。<page>バクロ、任務を遂行せよ。指輪が戻ってくるのを待っている。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Next time, Sakura. I've always wanted to learn, but now I have no obligation to do so.<page>BACKRO, do your job. Waiting for the ring to come back.

original_en_text: Gurrroo! Fellow warrior, if you are wishing to lock blades, know you stand before the honoured knight Garmond, and brave companion Zaza. Together we will face bold to any challenge!<hpage>I have no wish to fight you, sir bug. It is heartening to meet another on these roads of sound mind, and with fortitude enough to fight back against the haunted husks.<page>Aye! Too many, these unnatural opponents! We did hope Pharloom’s vast expanse would still possess some place free of that tainted thread. <page>Alas, so far we’ve encountered only violence and decay. We greatly fear the Haunting afflicts this kingdom all.
original_zh_text: 嘎噜！想打架？先报上名来！我乃荣耀骑士加蒙德，这位是忠仆扎扎！<hpage>没兴趣比武。只是难得能遇见敢反抗丝咒傀儡的清醒者。<page>是啊！到处都是被操控的傀儡！还以为纺络如此广袤，说不定能有片净土……<page>唉，结果走到哪都是腐烂和杀戮！这诅咒怕是蔓延全境了！
translated_text: ゴーラム!同志諸君、剣に鍵をかけたいなら、あなたは立派な騎士ガモンドとその勇敢な仲間ザザの前に立っていることを知っておいてください。一緒にどんな挑戦にも立ち向かいます!<hpage>私はあなたと戦いたくありません、バグさん。これらの賢明な道で、幽霊の殻に対抗するのに十分な忍耐力を持っている別の男に会うことはエキサイティングです。<page>はい!はい!あまりにも多すぎる、これらの不自然な敵!ファラムの広大な土地にはまだ汚染線のない地域があることを願っています<page>残念ながら、これまでのところ暴力と腐敗しか見られませんでした。私たちは、この強迫観念が王国のすべての人を苦しめることを恐れています。
secondary_translated_text: GORAM! Comrades, if you wish to lock your sword, know that you are standing before the noble knight Gamond and his valiant companion Zaza. Together we will face any challenge!<hpage>I don't want to fight you, Mr. Bug. It's exciting to meet another man on these wise paths who has enough patience to counter the shells of the ghosts.<page>yes! yes! Too many, too many, these unnatural enemies! I hope there's still an area in the vast landscape of Faram that has no contamination lines.<page>Unfortunately, so far, we have seen only violence and corruption. We are afraid that this obsession will afflict everyone in the kingdom. "

original_en_text: Poshanka! Edges sharp and senses keen!<page>In my land, that is the way warriors greet each other. For though you are a child barely hatched, you are also a warrior. Your stance, your weapon, your movements all proclaim it so.<page>I am a navigator amongst my tribe, and have been making maps of these lands. I can trade them with you, and supplies, if you wish.
original_zh_text: 啵尚咔！握紧兵刃，保持警惕！<page>在我们部落，战士们都这么打招呼。虽然你看着像个刚破卵的娃娃，但架势、武器、动作都像个战士。<page>我是部落的测绘师，一直在画这里的地图。想要可以拿物资来换。
translated_text: ボシャンカ!鋭いエッジと鋭い感覚!<page>私の国の兵士たちはこう挨拶しました。あなたは生まれたばかりの子供ですが、兵士でもあります。あなたの立場、あなたの武器、あなたの行動はそれを示しています。<page>私は部族のパイロットでこの土地の地図を作っていましたご希望であれば、商品や商品を交換できます。
secondary_translated_text: boshanka! Sharp edges and a sharp feel!<page>The soldiers of my country greeted me like this. You are a newborn child, but you are also a soldier. Your position, your weapons, and your actions show it. "<page>I was a tribal pilot mapping this land, and if you want, you can exchange goods and merchandise.

original_en_text: Rest below while you can. In the lands beyond these bells, it is rare to see such safety.
translated_text: できるだけそこで休んで。これらの鐘の外の土地では、そのような安全性はまれです。
secondary_translated_text: Rest there as much as you can. In the land outside these bells, such safety is rare.

translated_text: グレモア地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of Gremoir

original_en_text: <hpage>Child, if your wish is to gain learning of this land’s creatures, why not hunt them yourself?<page>Ma? Nuu, herself to hunt? No, no! Is not Nuu’s nature to hunt, is hers to come later and learn. Such is the way of things!<page>But you... a predator! Know it from your smells can clever Nuu! So Nuu asks you to cut and record, so we both may learn!
original_zh_text: <hpage>小丫头，想了解生物怎么不自己去抓？<page>啊？努努自己去？不行不行！努努的天职是研究，这是规矩！<page>但你……是掠食者！努努闻得出来！所以拜托你砍怪记录，我们一起学习！
translated_text: <hpage>子供よ、この土地の生き物を知りたいなら、なぜ自分で狩りをしないのか。<page>ママ？彼女は自分で狩りをしたいのか？ダメだ!ダメ!努の本性は狩猟ではなく、后から学ぶことであ った。それが問題です!<page>しかし、あなたは-捕食者!あなたの匂いから、それがスマートになることがわかります!だからNuuは皆さんに編集して録音してもらい、みんなで学べるようにしてください。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>My child, if you want to know the creatures of this land, why don't you hunt for yourself?<page>mom? she wants to hunt herself? no! no! no! The nature of Nu was not to hunt, but to learn from later. That's the problem!<page>But you are - a predator! From your smell, you can tell it's going to be smart! So, please let Nuu edit it and record it, so that everyone can learn it.

original_en_text: <hpage>Little pilgrim, these baths provide some respite from the dangers without, but there is a still safer place high on the other side of the Citadel.<hpage>A settlement has formed around the old shrine there. The bell housed within seems to provide some sanctuary from the dangers of the Haunting.<hpage>Your brother and sister pilgrims who now huddle around it would be glad of your company, I am sure.<page>Oh, how wonderful! Yes, I will make my way over there with haste... after I have bathed a little longer. I want to arrive fresh and clean to such a holy place!
original_zh_text: <hpage>小家伙，温泉虽然舒服，但圣堡另一边更安全。<hpage>老钟殿旁边有个新聚落，那里的钟声能抵御丝咒。<page>逃到那边的同伴肯定欢迎你。<page>太好了！等我泡舒服了就过去……拜见圣地前得收拾体面！
translated_text: <hpage>小さな巡礼者として、これらの浴場は外の危険を軽減する機会を提供しますが、城の反対側にはより安全な場所があります。<hpage>古い神社の周りに集落が形成されていた。内部の時計はトラブルの危険を免れたように見えた。<hpage>今、彼らの中に集まっている巡礼者の兄弟姉妹は、あなたと一緒にいることをとても喜ぶでしょう。<page>ああ、それは素晴らしい!はいすぐに行きます。シャワーを浴びた後。こんな神聖な場所に行きたいです!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>As a small pilgrim, these baths offer an opportunity to mitigate the dangers outside, but on the other side of the castle there is a safer place.<hpage>A settlement was formed around the old shrine. The internal clock seemed to have escaped the danger of trouble.<hpage>The pilgrim brothers and sisters who are gathered among them now will be very happy to be with you.<page>Oh, that's great! Yes, I'll be right there. After the shower. I want to go to such a holy place!

original_en_text: You hold many charts, Child Wielding Needle. You should consider trading for a quill.<page>With a quill in claw, your maps can be further extended from your own travels. Record enough and you may, in time, come to know this kingdom all.
original_zh_text: 你身上的图纸不少，使针的小姑娘，该买支笔了。<page>带着笔就能边走边画。画够多了，迟早能摸清纺络的全貌。
translated_text: 子供たちが針を振っているチャートがたくさんあります取引に羽根ペンを使用することを検討するべきです。<page>足に羽根ペンを装着すると、マップは自分の旅からさらに拡張できます。十分な記録を保持すれば、王国を知ることができます。
secondary_translated_text: There are a lot of charts that kids are waving needles on, and you should consider using a feather pen to trade.<page>With a feather pen attached to your feet, the map can expand further from your own journey. If you keep enough records, you will know the kingdom.

original_en_text: Poshanka! Child Wielding Needle. You too have discovered this haven of bells.<page>For a long time, I avoided this place for sense of something strange. Now arrived, I find it free, and its few remaining residents offering trade and welcome.<hpage>I slew a tall creature above the town, a Weaver I suspect, though one twisted in purpose.<hpage>It was her you may have sensed. A formidable force, even aged. By voice and claw she aided, perhaps guided, the haunted thread that grasps these lands. <page>Weaver? Those vicious things. To our young we tell the tales, but had thought them long dead, only corpses bound in spires. <hpage>This one still lived, though if it was a Weaver, it was broken in a savage way.<hpage>Its own Silk was bound, pinned deep within its shell. A cruel punishment I’ve not before witnessed. <page>Even broken, my envy remains. A Weaver’s fabled skills... To meet one in combat means great challenge, and great pride in victory.
original_zh_text: 啵尚咔！使针的小姑娘。你也找到这镇子了？<page>之前总能察觉到这儿的古怪，就一直避开。现在诅咒没了，剩下的住民还挺热情。<hpage>我斩了镇子上头的高个怪物，像是个变异的织者。<page>你此前察觉到的应该就是它。是它用声音和利爪操控缠绕镇子的丝线，很难对付。<page>织者？那群老毒物！还以为早死绝了，只剩塔里的干尸。<hpage>这只还活着，但被折磨得不成样。<hpage>灵丝被钉在壳里，残忍的刑罚。<page>就算残了我也羡慕。织者的本事……能交手是幸运，能得胜更是荣耀。
translated_text: ボシャンカ!子供たちは針を振る。この鐘の安全な避難所もあります。<page>長い間、私は奇妙な気持ちでこの場所を避けてきました。私が到着した今、私はここが無料であり、残りの少数の住民も貿易と歓迎を提供していることを発見しました。<hpage>私は町の上空で背の高い生き物を殺したが、それは意図的にねじれていたが、織機であると疑った。<hpage>既に感じているかもしれません。高齢者でも強力な力を発揮します。声と爪で、彼女はこれらの土地の幽霊の手がかりをつかむのを助け、おそらくガイドした。<page>ウィーヴァー？これらの邪悪なもの。私たちは若者たちに物語を話しましたが、彼らはとっくに死んでいて、尖塔には死体しかないと思いました。<hpage>これはまだ生きていますが、織機だったらひどく損傷していたでしょう。<hpage>独自の絹は縛られ、殻の奥深くに固定されていた。見たことのない残酷な罰でした。<page>それが壊れても、私の嫉妬は残ります。伝説の技を織る。戦いに挑むことは勝利を誇りに思うこと。
secondary_translated_text: boshanka! The children are waving their needles. There is also a safe haven for this bell.<page>For a long time I have avoided this place with a strange feeling. Now that I have arrived, I have discovered that this place is free, and that the few remaining inhabitants also offer trade and welcome.<hpage>I killed a tall creature in the sky above the town, which I suspected was a loom, though it was twisted intentionally.<hpage>You may already be feeling it, but you are not. Even in the elderly, they show great strength. With her voice and claws, she helped and perhaps guided them to grasp clues about the ghosts of these lands.<page>wiver? These evil ones. We told the stories to the young men, but they had long since died, and we thought there were only corpses in the spire.<hpage>This one is still alive, but if it were a loom, it would have been badly damaged.<hpage>The silk of its own was tied and fixed deep in the shell. It was a cruel punishment I had never seen before.<page>Even if it is broken, my jealousy will remain. Weave a legendary skill. To challenge to battle is to be proud of winning.

original_en_text: This outpost that the shambling pilgrim-bugs have built for themselves... Dondakku!<page>Where are the armaments? The watch-poles? Never have I seen such a poorly defended encampment!<hpage>The pilgrims here seem to have no mind for war, Shakra. I suspect most depart for the Citadel soon after their arrival.<page>Hmph. If they persist in their carelessness, they will find only death in these harsh lands.
original_zh_text: 朝圣虫建的这破营地……东达库！<page>防御工事呢？瞭望塔呢？没见过这么不设防的营地！<hpage>朝圣者们不懂争斗，估计刚到就奔着圣堡去了。<page>哼！继续这么马虎，迟早死在纺络的险地里。
translated_text: この不安定な前哨基地は巡礼者によって建てられた。イーストサイド!<page>武器はどこにある？ポールって？こんなに弱いキャンプは見たことがない!<hpage>ここの巡礼者は戦争の概念を持っていないようです。ほとんどの人は到着後すぐに城に行くと思います。<page>もし彼らが不注意であれば、この不毛の地で死ぬだけです。
secondary_translated_text: This unstable outpost was built by pilgrims. the east side!<page>where are the weapons? what about paul? I've never seen such a weak camp!<hpage>The pilgrims here seem to have no concept of war. I think most people will go to the castle as soon as they arrive.<page>If they are careless, they will only die in this barren land.

original_en_text: What’s this? The little spider climbs so high, here to stand aquiver at our startling Citadel.<hpage>Pale child, you return only to mock? Neither you nor your land have proven my match. This sleeping Citadel shall be no different.<page>Spider, dear. Why must you remain so distressingly... optimistic? The power that waits above, you cannot conceive, her who would snuff that hope with barely a glance.<hpage>Fool child. You still think me blind to the form of your liege? Having come this far?<hpage>This land’s grandeur, the devotion of its bugs, and the curse that befalls them. The signs are clear.<hpage>Your kingdom is in the thrall of a creature beyond bug, one of that higher caste.<hpage>Whatever its desire for my Silk and my shell, it shall find I’m quite attached to both.
original_zh_text: 瞧瞧？小蜘蛛抖抖索索爬到圣堡脚下了。<hpage>苍白之子，你只是来废话的么？纺络没有虫能阻挡我，圣堡也不例外。<page>亲爱的，你怎么还傻乐呢？上面那位吹口气就能灭了你那点希望。<hpage>傻孩子，真以为我现在还看不出你主子的真身吗？<hpage>这地方的辉煌、虫民的虔诚、还有他们的诅咒……线索太明显了。<hpage>这个王国被超脱虫类的存在掌控，属于更高阶的存在。<hpage>但无论它多想要我的灵丝和躯壳，我都不会给。
translated_text: これは何だ？この小さなクモはとても高く登り、素晴らしい城の中に立っています。<hpage>青白い少年、笑うために戻ってきたのか？あなたもあなたの土地も私を敵としていません。この眠りの城は違いません。<page>クモ、ハニー。どうしてそんなに辛くて楽観的になりたいの？そこに力があるとは思えない。彼女はすぐにその希望を打ち消すことができる。<hpage>バカな子。私があなたの王の姿を見ないと思うか？そんなに遠いのか？<hpage>大地の素晴らしさ、昆虫の忠誠心、そしてそれらに降りかかる呪い。兆候は明白です。<hpage>あなたの王国は、より高いカーストの一つであるワームを超えた生き物に縛られています。<hpage>私の絹と貝殻にどんな憧れを抱いても、私は両方にとても愛着があることがわかります。
secondary_translated_text: what is this? This little spider climbs very high and stands in a magnificent castle.<hpage>the pale boy, did you come back to laugh? You and your land have not made me an enemy. This sleeping castle is no different.<page>The spider, honey. why do you want to be so hard and optimistic? I don't think there's any power there. She can quickly dispel that hope.<hpage>Stupid child. do you think i will not see your king? is it that far away?<hpage>The splendor of the earth, the loyalty of the insects, and the curse that befalls them. The signs are clear.<hpage>Your kingdom is bound by creatures beyond the Worm, one of the higher castes.<hpage>No matter what longing I have for my silk and shells, I can see that I have a great attachment to both.

original_en_text: Aren’t those solemn judge-bugs nice? They do not speak or sing, but I sense great wisdom behind their gleaming gazes!<hpage>Beware them, little one. Wise or not, their judgements are often followed by violence. Many of your fellow pilgrims have fallen to them on these great steps.<page>Oh...? But even the fallen will sometimes stand again, and all pilgrimages will be completed, yes? That’s how I’ve heard it!
original_zh_text: 看那些肃穆的判官虫多亲切！虽然他们不言语也不歌唱，但眼中却闪着智慧！<hpage>要小心，小家伙。他们的判决常伴暴力，不知多少朝圣者倒在这些石阶上。<page>可是……倒下者终会再起，朝圣终将完成，不是吗？
translated_text: 真面目な裁判官のバグは素晴らしいですか？彼らは話さず、歌わないが、輝く目の後ろには大きな知恵が隠されているのを感じた。<hpage>気をつけて、小さな人たち。賢明であろうとなかろうと、彼らの判断は暴力を伴う。多くの巡礼者がこの巨大な階段で倒れています。<page>ああ...？でも、倒れた人も時々立ち上がり、巡礼は完了しますよね。それが聞こえたんだ
secondary_translated_text: Are serious judges' bugs great? They did not speak, they did not sing, but they felt a great wisdom hidden behind their shining eyes.<hpage>Be careful, little people. Whether wise or not, their judgments are accompanied by violence. Many pilgrims fall down on this huge staircase.<page>oh, huh...? But the fallen also sometimes get up and the pilgrimage is complete, right? i heard that.

original_en_text: These twisting tunnels hide many worthy opponents, but many traps as well. Watch your footing closely.
original_zh_text: 这些弯道里藏着不少好对手，但陷阱也多。走路看着点。
translated_text: これらのねじれたトンネルは多くの貴重な敵を隠すだけでなく、多くのトラップを隠す。ステップをよく見てください。
secondary_translated_text: These twisted tunnels not only hide many precious enemies, but also many traps. Take a good look at the steps.

original_en_text: As you requested, these pins will mark the travel stations within that hideous structure of steel and steam.
original_zh_text: 按你要求的，这些图钉能标记那些铁皮蒸汽管的站点。
translated_text: リクエストに応じて、これらのピンは恐ろしい鋼鉄と蒸気構造の中にステーションをマークします。
secondary_translated_text: Upon request, these pins mark the station within a formidable steel and steam structure.

original_en_text: <hpage>Head fast for Bellhart, Pill. These lands are not for travelling without a sharp blade in claw.<page>Aye! Yes! To Bellhart, and my brother, I shall fly quickly-quick. If you pass that way again, stop and give greeting!
original_zh_text: <hpage>回钟心镇吧，这地方没武器别乱跑。<page>这就回！我飞得可、可快了！你要是经过钟心镇记得和我打招呼！
translated_text: <hpage>BerhardとPeelへの高速アクセス。これらの土地は爪なしの旅行には適していない。<page>はい!はい!はい!はい!私はバーハルトと兄弟のために非常に速く飛ぶでしょう。また通りを渡る場合は、立ち止まって挨拶してください。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Fast access to Berhard and Peel. These lands are not suitable for travel without claws.<page>yes! yes! yes! yes! I will fly very fast for Berhardt and the brothers. If you cross the street again, please stop and say hello.

original_en_text: <hpage>Who are you calling for, Shakra? Your voice echoes through the caverns.<page>I came deeper into Pharloom in search of my mentor, the greatest of my tribe. I could not keep pace though, and her trail grew cold.<page>She will have travelled much farther by now, but if I keep moving and stay vigilant I will reunite with her.
original_zh_text: <hpage>沙克拉，你在喊谁？整个山洞都是你回声。<page>我来纺络深处寻找导师，我们部落的最强者。可惜跟丢了。<page>她肯定走得更远了，但只要保持警惕总能重逢。
translated_text: <hpage>シャクラ誰に電話してるの？あなたの声は洞窟に響き渡る。<page>私は自分の師、私の部族の中で最も偉大な師を探してファロに入りました。しかし、私は追跡できず、彼女の足跡は冷たくなった。<page>彼女は今さらに遠くに行きましたが、私が前に進み、警戒していれば、私は彼女と再会するでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>sakra, who are you calling? Your voice echoes through the caves.<page>I went into the Faro in search of my teacher, the greatest of my tribe. But I couldn't keep track, and her footsteps grew cold.<page>She's gone even further now, but if I go forward and be vigilant, I'll see her again.

original_en_text: We must never let our shells soften, or Pharloom’s sharp teeth will sink in quick.<page>Would you duel with me, Hornet Wielding Needle? Together we shall sharpen one another’s skill.
original_zh_text: 战士不能养尊处优，纺络到处藏着危险。<page>来切磋吧？我们互相磨练技艺。
translated_text: 殻を柔らかくしてはいけません。さもなければ、ファルの鋭い歯がすぐに入り込んでしまいます。<page>マルセル針、私と戦ってくれるか？お互いのスキルを向上させるために協力する。
secondary_translated_text: Do not let the shell soften. Otherwise, the sharp teeth of the falcon will soon get in.<page>marcel needle, will you fight me? They work together to improve each other's skills.

original_en_text: I’ll wish you success in your grand task, miss, but forgive me my sadness for knowing the cruel cost...
original_zh_text: 我希望你能成功，女士。但一想到代价这么沉重，还是很难过。
translated_text: お嬢さん、偉大な使命を全うすることを願っていますが、私の悲しみを許してください。私は残酷な代価を知っているので。
secondary_translated_text: Miss, I hope you will fulfill your great mission, but please forgive my sorrow. " Because I know the cruel price. "

original_en_text: Hurry it up, let us out quickly then! We got places to go, bugs to see, trinkets to pilfer!
original_zh_text: 快点放人！我们还要去捞宝贝呢！
translated_text: さあ、出して!行くべき場所、見るべき虫、盗むべきアクセサリーがある!
secondary_translated_text: Come on, get out! There are places to go, bugs to see, accessories to steal!

original_en_text: Warrior... I heard your approach. Why do you come? Surely you’ve no desire to see these long collapsed caves?<hpage>The way was open, sir. I merely followed the path through. Am I correct to guess you were once a resident of these borderlands?<page>Aye... and glorious they were, in their time. Pharloom’s end approaches, but my caves, these caves, fell to fate long before. <page>Of that fair land, I am the last... Now to remain till the end, and remember the splendour that was...
original_zh_text: 战士……我听见你的脚步了。来这废墟做什么？<hpage>道路通畅，我只是顺路而来。你曾是边境之民？<page>曾是……昔日辉煌……不复存在。如今纺络快完了，但我的家园……早就覆灭了。<page>我是故土最后的遗民……要守到末日，铭记曾经的荣光……
translated_text: 兵士たち。近づいてくるのが聞こえた。なぜここに来た？こんな長い穴を見たくないですよね？<hpage>道路は開いています。私はこの道を歩いているだけです。あなたは国境地帯の住人でしたか？<page>確かに、彼らはその時代に素晴らしいです。ファルの終わりが近づいているが、私の洞窟、これらの洞窟は長い間運命の手に落ちてきた。<page>この美しい土地では、私は最後の一人です。最後まで頑張り、栄光を忘れないといけない。
secondary_translated_text: The soldiers. I could hear him approaching. why did you come here? you don't want to see this long hole, do you?<hpage>The road is open. I'm just going down this path. Were you a resident of the border area?<page>Certainly, they are great in their time. The end of the fal is approaching, but my caves, these caves have long fallen into the hands of fate.<page>In this beautiful land, I am the last one. We have to work hard to the end and forget the glory.

original_en_text: Miss grown-up, you have hunted long with little rest, thinks Nuu.<page>Perhaps you are covered in too many juices, weighed down by beastly filth? Let sweet Nuu clean you, make you fresh!
original_zh_text: 大姐姐，你一直狩猎，好久没休息了吧？<page>是不是浑身都沾满了黏液和血液？让努努帮你清洁吧！
translated_text: 閣下、お嬢さん、あなたは長い間狩りをしており、ほとんど休むことができません。考えてみて<page>あなたは、あまりにも多くのジュースと泥で覆われた獣ですか？甘いNuuがあなたをきれいにし、あなたをリフレッシュします!
secondary_translated_text: Your Excellency, Miss, you have been hunting for a long time, and you can hardly rest. think about it.<page>Are you a beast covered in too much juice and mud? Sweet Noo will clean you up and refresh you!

original_zh_text: 有意思！我开始喜欢你了！
translated_text: おいしい!もう好きだよ!
secondary_translated_text: Delicious! I already like it!

original_en_text: <page=M>We could do it. The spell can be cast, with enough power, enormous power, equal maybe to that monarch...<hpage>I cannot grant you mine, if it even were enough. My strength is still needed to face her below. Where else do you propose we seek a source?<page=M>From Pharloom! Ho ho ho! Remember, ours is a kingdom of wishes granted.<page=B>Pharloom was not born of that monarch, Old One. Power existed in these lands even before she bound them beneath her.<page=B>Grnk. Seek the old hearts of our kingdom and the last successors to bear their strength.<page=M>They’re still out there, hidden away, much faded by the pale one’s long dominion. You must make them stir.<page=M>We will teach you how, in the way befitting a Weaver, a sombre song to reach down into their memories and enliven them a final time.
original_zh_text: <page=M>我们或许能够施咒，但要有足够力量，堪比那君主的力量。<hpage>我给不了这份力，即便有也要留着对付她。还能从哪里获取？<page=M>纺络！嚯嚯！别忘了，我们的王国最擅长实现愿望。<page=B>纺络并非君主创造，古老者。在她到来之前，这片土地就存在着力量。<page=B>您该去寻找古老的纺络之心，与其最后的传承者。<page=M>虽然几乎被苍白统治消磨殆尽，他们仍在某处苟存。必须唤醒他们。<page=M>我们会教你织者的方法。用挽歌深入他们的记忆，激醒他们的力量。
translated_text: <page=M>私たちにはできるこの呪文は使えるし、十分に強い。あの君主に相当するのか<hpage>それだけでも、私はあなたに私のを与えません。彼女と向き合うには強さが必要です。他にどこで情報提供者を見つけられると思いますか？<page=M>『 Pharlooom!ああ、ホー!私たちの王国は、願いが叶う王国です。<page=B>ファウルはその君主から生まれたものではない。権力は彼女がこれらの土地を彼女の下に縛る前から存在していた。<page=B>グレンジャー。私たちの王国の長老と最終的な相続人を見つけ、彼らの力を引き継ぐ。<page=M>彼らはまだそこにいて、隠れて、青白い者たちの長い支配によって色あせていた。かき混ぜなければなりません<page=M>ウィーバーに合った憂鬱な曲で最後にアクティブになる方法をお教えします。
secondary_translated_text: <page=M>This spell we can do is workable and strong enough. is he equivalent to that monarch?<hpage>That alone, I will not give you mine. You need strength to face her. where else do you think we can find informants?<page=M>"Pharlooom! Oh, ho! Our kingdom is a kingdom where wishes come true.<page=B>The foul was not born of that monarch. The power had existed before she had tied these lands under her.<page=B>Granger. Find the elders and ultimate heirs of our kingdom and take over their power.<page=M>They were still there, hidden, and faded by the long rule of the pale ones. You have to stir it up.<page=M>We'll teach you how to get active at the end with a melancholy song that suits your weaver.

original_en_text: Owoww, what a rotten turn! Keep your nasty junk to yourself, then!
original_zh_text: 哎哟！真倒霉！你就自个儿留着这些破烂货吧！
translated_text: うわー、なんて恐ろしい変化だ!あなたの迷惑なゴミをあなた自身に残す!
secondary_translated_text: Wow, what a horrible change! Leave your annoying junk to yourself!

original_en_text: O-hoho! Share some of your little clicky-clackies with us, help us fill our pockets. If you do, we’ll share a sneaky secret with you!
original_zh_text: 哦嚯嚯！分点叮当响给我们，就告诉你个秘密！
translated_text: ああ、ホー!あなたの曲をシェアして、ポケットを埋めるのに役立ちます。もしそうなら、私たちはあなたと秘密を共有します!
secondary_translated_text: Oh, ho! Share your songs to help you fill your pocket. If so, we'll share the secret with you!

original_en_text: Miss grown-up, for your continued huntings you should climb up, up above here, above the tallest spinning towers!<page>Hidden in the dark thickets are strange bugs who call up dancing flames. So pretty! So warm!<page>But when Nuu tried to crawl near, the flames became angry and swooped all around! Poor Nuu was half roasted!<page>Nuu leaves it to you, miss grown-up, to climb up there and cut those flames apart. For our journal, such must be done.
original_zh_text: 大姐姐，要继续狩猎的话，你得往上爬，越过最高的纺塔！<page> 暗蕨丛里藏着会召唤舞焰的怪虫。好漂亮！好暖和！<page> 可努努刚靠近，火焰就发怒冲了上来！差点把努努烤焦啦！<page> 这事就交给你啦，大姐姐，上去把那些火焰斩碎吧。为了填满记录册，必须这么做！
translated_text: 主よ、狩りを続けるには、最も高い回転塔の上に登るべきです。<page>暗いジャングルには奇妙な昆虫が潜んでおり、鼓動する炎を呼んでいる。とても綺麗です!とても暖かいです!<page>しかし、ヌーが近づこうとすると、炎は怒り、あちこちに飛びついた。Nuちゃんは中途半端です!<page>ミス·ヌーはあなたに責任を与えた。火を消すために登る。私たちの雑誌では、それが必要です。
secondary_translated_text: Lord, to continue hunting, you should climb on top of the tallest revolving tower.<page>A strange insect lurks in the dark jungle, calling for a pulsating flame. It's so beautiful! It's so warm!<page>But when Noo tried to get closer, the flames were furious and leaped here and there. Nooooo<page>Miss Nu gave you the responsibility. Climbing to put out the fire. In our magazine, it is necessary.

original_en_text: Poshanka! Child Wielding Needle, have you seen trace of my master nearby?
