We feel the cruelty of your writing, our ultimate destiny.<page>If you have the power you come to look for it, mine fade, ordinary people take time.<hpage>I have not come, great man, to see what kind of man you are, but to remind you of what kind of man you were once when your heart pulsed brightly and valiantly before the pale monarch.<hpage>I want to take away that beating heart, but I know my intentions are worth it.<hpage>To save this land from this deadly disease which the thread and the void produce, I have sought it.<page>stop it! If possible, beast. It used to be a force. Pride in the wild.

original_en_text: <hpage>Your land’s fate has turned too dire, child. I cannot delay now to help you in your growth.<page>Sssss... So huntersss live... kill... only for selvesss... same as siblings...
original_zh_text: <hpage>你们的这片土地危在旦夕，小不点。时间紧迫，我没法帮你长壮实了。<page>咝……猎手为了生存……而杀戮……只顾自己……和离我而去兄弟姐妹没什么两样……
translated_text: <hpage>息子よ、あなたの土地の運命は恐ろしくなっています。あなたの成長を助けるためにこれ以上遅れることはできない。<page>ヒスの声。ハンターは現場で殺害された。自撮りのみ許可。兄弟姉妹のように。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>My son, the fate of your land is becoming dreadful. You can't delay any longer to help your growth.<page>Heath's voice. Hunter was killed at the scene. Self-portraits only permitted. Like brothers and sisters.

original_en_text: These fields are hot and harsh, a miserable place for we pilgrims, and just above are the dreary moors, a place once of abundance lost to falling silt and murky rain.<page>The lands in every direction punish us, but such is our test. Above it all, the Citadel shines, our destination and our reward...<page>I’ll make it there, you’ll see. I’ve easily earned my place in such a paradise.
original_zh_text: <page>再往上，是一片阴雨连绵的沼地，过去的丰饶都化作了泥泞。<page>凶险又容易迷失，是对朝圣者的试炼。而圣堡就在上方，既是终点亦是奖赏……<page>我肯定能抵达，等着瞧。入那乐园我当之无愧。
translated_text: これらの畑は暑くて荒れており、巡礼者にとっては悲惨な場所です。その上には、かつて沈泥と濁った雨によって肥沃な土地を失った退屈な荒れ地があった。<page>あらゆる土地がわれわれを罰しているが、これはわれわれの試練である。何よりも、城は私たちの目的地とリターンで輝いていました。<page>私はそこに着き、あなたはそれを見るでしょう。そんな楽園に簡単に居場所を見つけた。
secondary_translated_text: These fields are hot and barren, and a miserable place for the pilgrims. Above it was a dull wasteland that had once lost its fertile land to silt and muddy rain.<page>Every land punishes us, but this is our test. " Above all, the castle shone in our destination and return.<page>I will get there and you will see it. It was easy to find a place in such a paradise.

original_en_text: <hpage>Is this place your permanent home, sir, or do you only make camp?<page>We pilgrims have no home, there is only the path. We climb, and suffer, and are thusly judged.<page>I will linger here only a moment, for the sake of trade. Once I’ve gathered enough rosaries, I’ll be holy enough to ascend without fear.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生可是以此地为家，还是暂驻？<page>朝圣者居无定所，唯有攀登圣途。前路如何，谁能晓得。<page>我小憩片刻就会启程。等攒够念珠，自能无畏登顶。
translated_text: <hpage>この場所はあなたの永遠の家ですか？それともキャンプだけ？<page>巡礼者には家がなく、道がある。私たちは登り、苦しみ、判断される。<page>貿易のために、私はしばらくここにいるだけです。ロザリオを十分に集めると、恐れることなく立ち上がるのに十分神聖になります。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Is this place your forever home? Or just camping?<page>The pilgrims have no home, they have a road. We climb, we suffer and we are judged.<page>For the trade, I'm only here for a while. When you gather enough of the Rosary, you become holy enough to stand up without fear.

original_en_text: <hpage>On the far side of Pharloom, I chanced upon a bug starkly similar to yourself.<hpage>From her home, her dress, and her skill, I am guessing you share some relation?<page>Aye. Met my sister, you did, in order at least. Glad to hear she’s still among the living.<page>Last to hold true to the old ways of the pin, she was... I sure ain’t sharing many of those violent values no more.<page>I’ll warn you, stray one, my sister might seem all cheer and charm, but buried beneath there’s the soul of a killer.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我在纺络另一端遇见过与你极为相似的虫。<hpage>根据其居所、衣着和技艺，也许是你血亲？<page>是，那是我的姐妹。她还活着呢？也挺好。<page>她是最后恪守古训的针匠……我早就不玩那套杀戮把戏了。<page>提醒你，我那姐妹看着亲切，骨子里可是杀胚。
translated_text: <hpage>ファラムの向こう側で、私はあなたにそっくりな虫に遭遇しました。<hpage>彼女の家、彼女の服、彼女の技術から判断すると、あなたは何の関係があると思いますか？<page>はい、あなたは私の妹を見ました、少なくとも順序で。彼女が生きていると聞いて嬉しい。<page>彼女は古いピンの方法に固執する最後の人です。私は二度と暴力的な価値観を共有しません。<page>警告するよ、放浪者、私の妹は幸せで魅力的に見えるかもしれないが、彼女の中には殺人者の魂が隠されている。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>On the other side of the pharam, I came across a worm that looked just like you.<hpage>Judging by her house, her clothes, her skills, what do you think you have to do with it?<page>Yes, you have seen my sister, at least in order. Glad to hear that she is alive.<page>She's the last person to stick to the old pin way. I will never share violent values again. "<page>I warn you, vagabond, my sister may seem happy and attractive, but within her lies the soul of a murderer.

original_en_text: You would deny my brood their strength, ssspiidderr? A cruel creature you are. Surely your sssmall shell needs hardly so much?
original_zh_text: 你准备饿着我的孩子吗，小蜘蛛？咝——心肠够硬啊。不过，你这小身板能独吞这么多？
translated_text: あなたは私の子供たちの力を否定するつもりですか？あなたは残酷な生き物です。SSsmallシェルはそんなに必要ないのでしょうか？
secondary_translated_text: Are you going to deny my children the power? You are a cruel creature. Isn't SSsmall shell so necessary?

original_en_text: I’ll string your rosaries tight, for a modest fee. It’s the safest way to keep them close.
original_zh_text: 分我一些念珠，我帮你把它们串牢。贴身保管最稳妥。
translated_text: 私はあなたのロザリオをしっかりと結びます。それはそれらを得る最も安全な方法です。
secondary_translated_text: I will tie your rosary tightly. It is the safest way to get them.

original_en_text: Uoohhh... Sister, my aching shell’s close to breaking. My voice weakens... I can hardly sing a word.<hpage>I fear the path ahead will be no easier for you, ma’am. If you can not abandon your pilgrimage, you should at least rest well before continuing.<page>Ahh... but impurities stalk our every step, sister. If we rest too long, they shall catch us. So... so it is sung...
original_zh_text: 啊……姐妹，我的甲壳快撑不住了……嗓子也哑……唱不动圣歌了……<hpage>前路只会更加凶险，女士。若不愿放弃朝圣，至少养足精神再走。<page>唉……可邪秽如影随形，歇久了必被追上……圣训……是这么唱的……
translated_text: あっ...。妹よ、私の痛みの殻は破裂しそうです。声が弱まった。ほとんど一言も歌えませんでした。<hpage>残念ながら先の道は簡単ではありません巡礼をあきらめることができない場合は、少なくとも休憩を取るべきです。<page>あっ...。すべてのステップで私たちと一緒にいる、シスター。長く休むと捕まってしまいます。だから···それを歌った。
secondary_translated_text: ah... Sister, my pain shell is about to burst. Her voice weakened. I could hardly sing a word.<hpage>Unfortunately the road ahead is not easy, if you can not give up the pilgrimage, you should at least take a break.<page>ah... Be with us every step of the way, sister. If you rest for too long, you will get caught. So... I sang it.

original_en_text: That golden knight’s out there, sister, cutting down the lost, keeping us safe.<page>Reckon this place would’ve already been overrun if not for them’n their noble blades.
original_zh_text: 小姐，那位金甲骑士在外面斩杀着被诅咒者，保护我们的安全。<page>没有他那伟大的刺刃，这地方早就败落了。
translated_text: シスター、黄金の騎士がそこにいて、失われた人々を破壊し、私たちを守ってくれる。<page>ブレードがなければ、ここはとっくに占領されていたでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: Sister, the Golden Knight is there to destroy the lost and protect us. "<page>If it weren't for the blade, this place would have been occupied long ago.

original_en_text: Take some beads for your effort, miss bellringer, and know this sad lot’ll be survivin’ a little longer thanks to you.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者小姐，拿些念珠当作辛苦费吧。多亏你，这些可怜虫又能多苟活几天了。
translated_text: ミス·ベル·リンガー、あなたの努力のためにビーズを用意しなさい。あなたのおかげで、この悲しい運命はしばらく続くでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: Miss Bellinger, prepare beads for your efforts. " Thanks to you, this sad fate will last for a while.

original_en_text: S’done! The parts are prepared. I’m headin’ up now to set the heavy thing.<page>Even with the trap laid, best be guessin’ her on top won’t go down so simple. She’ll sense what’s comin’.<page>That blade of yours is gonna have to do its work ‘fore this thing can snap.<hpage>I’d expected such, sir. And I am ready. Set your snare. I shall attend shortly.
original_zh_text: 搞定了！部件准备完毕。我这就上去布置。<page>就算陷阱就位，顶上那位也不会乖乖受死。她能预感到潜在的危机。<page>你得先用你的针刃削弱她，这玩意才能触发。<hpage>我早有预料，先生。我已准备就绪。布置陷阱吧，我随后就到。
translated_text: 終わった!部品の準備完了。今から体重を増やします。<page>たとえ罠が仕掛けられていても、彼女は簡単に罠から落ちないと仮定した方が良いでしょう。彼女は来るべきことを感じる。<page>それが壊れる前に、あなたのブレードは働かなければならない。<hpage>予想していました私はあなたに罠を仕掛ける準備ができている。すぐに参加します。
secondary_translated_text: it's over! Parts are ready. I'm going to gain weight from now on.<page>Even if a trap is set up, it's best to assume she won't fall easily out of it. She feels that she should come.<page>Before it breaks, your blade has to work.<hpage>I was expecting I was ready to set a trap for you. I'll be joining soon.

original_en_text: Everything is falling apart, my dear one. Be sure to share your rosaries with me before it’s too late!
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，这里的一切都在分崩离析。趁现在还来得及，把你的念珠分我一些吧！
translated_text: すべてが壊れている、ダーリン。手遅れになる前にロザリオを私と共有してください!
secondary_translated_text: Everything's broken, darling. Please share your rosary with me before it's too late!

original_en_text: Lots of stories being sung about you, dear one. Gathering supplies, saving lost bugs... all sorts of good deeds!<page>Very clever to craft such a reputation for yourself. If you keep it up, you’ll fast become a legend among these simple sorts.<hpage>I’ve no interest in becoming one, madam. In my long life, I’ve known enough legends, watched them rise and fall and fade away, many times.<page>Is that so, dear? How humble you are! You should know though, this old pilgrim has her sight keenly trained on you! Nothing gets by old Jubilana!
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，现在好多虫子都在传颂你的事迹呢。收集物资、拯救迷失的虫子……全是各种各样的善举！<page>你很聪明，给自己打造了这么好的名声。这样下去，你很快就会成为这些单纯的家伙们心中的传奇啦。<hpage>女士，我可没兴趣成为什么传奇。在漫长的一生中，我见识过足够多的传奇，无数次看着他们崛起、衰落、消逝。<page>这样啊？亲爱的，你可真谦逊！不过你要知道，我这个老朝圣者可一直密切关注着你呢！什么都逃不过老朱比拉娜的眼睛！
translated_text: あなたの物語はたくさんあります。物資を集め、迷子の昆虫を救出する。あらゆる種類の善行!<page>その評判を自分で作るのが賢明です。それを続ければ、すぐにこれらの単純なキャラクターの伝説になるでしょう。<hpage>私はそれに興味がない、女性。私は長い人生の中で、伝説を十分に学び、その興亡を何度も目撃してきました。<page>そうですか、ハニー。なんと謙虚なことでしょう!しかし、この巡礼者の目は熱心にあなたを見ていることを知ってください。オールド·ジュビラーナは何もしていない!
secondary_translated_text: You have a lot of stories. Collect supplies and rescue lost insects. All sorts of good deeds!<page>It's wise to build that reputation yourself. If you keep on doing that, you'll soon become a legend of these simple characters.<hpage>I'm not interested in that, lady. In my long life, I have studied the legend well enough, and witnessed its rise and fall many times.<page>Is that right, honey? How humble that is! But know that the eyes of this pilgrim are looking at you with ease. The old Jubilee is doing nothing!

original_en_text: It was you, wasn’t it? Ringin’ that great clanging bell just now! Right when I’m tryin’ to get some sleep!
original_zh_text: 刚才敲钟的是你吧？叮呤咣啷的！我正要补觉呢！
translated_text: あなたですよね？巨大な音が鳴った!眠ろうとしているとき!
secondary_translated_text: you are, aren't you? There was a huge sound! When you are trying to sleep!

original_en_text: Please don’t go too far, sister. Right here’s the only safety you’ll find within this whole cursed place.
original_zh_text: 小姐，千万别走远。在这片诅咒之地，这儿是唯一安全的地方。
translated_text: シスター、遠くに行かないでください。ここはあなたがこの呪われた場所で見つける唯一の安全な場所です。
secondary_translated_text: Sister, please don't go far. This is the only safe place you'll find in this cursed place.

original_en_text: There must be a few more goodies to gather up here, and I don’t need you lingering around in the meantime. Blessings, and farewell!
original_zh_text: 我这会儿可没法跟你一块回去，路上可能还有好东西等着我捡漏呢。愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: ここには確かに収集する良いものがありますし、この時間はあなたが歩き回る必要はありません。祝福、さようなら!
secondary_translated_text: There is certainly a good thing to collect here, and this time you don't need to walk around. Blessings, goodbye!

original_en_text: Well, well! See here what your brash behaviour has wrought, bellringer!<page>Just as I predicted, this once-peaceful sanctuary is now crawling with all sorts. We’ve the beginnings of a shabby little settlement, all huddled around this old shrine!<hpage>These poor bugs, all are victims of the Citadel and its insidious attraction. This place draws them up, into its maw, only to consume them, utterly.<page>Aye, inside and out, s’nothing but a grand, gilded lie. Well, at least these few stragglers can enjoy a moment’s safety. Poor fools...
original_zh_text: 瞧瞧你干的好事，敲钟者！<page>跟我料想的一样，这座本来平静的钟殿现在挤满了各色杂碎！一帮可怜虫围着那旧钟搭了个窝！<hpage>这些可怜虫都是圣堡的牺牲品，被它的谎话骗来，最终将被吞噬殆尽。<page>哼哼，这里就是个外表光鲜的巨大骗局。不过至少这群蠢货能享受片刻安宁……
translated_text: うん。うん。ベルリンガー、あなたの傲慢さが引き起こしたものを見てください!<page>予想通り、かつて静かだったこの避難所は、今ではあらゆる種類の人々でいっぱいです。私たちはこの古代の神殿の周りにすべてを詰め込む小さな質素な集落を建てました!<hpage>これらの貧しい昆虫は城とその狡猾な魅力の犠牲者でした。この場所はそれらを引き付け、胃に入れ、完全に消費するだけです。<page>はい、内側から外側まで、それは壮大で金色の嘘に過ぎません。少なくとも、取り残された人々は安全な瞬間を楽しむことができます。かわいそうな愚か者。
secondary_translated_text: yeah. yeah. Look at what your arrogance has caused, Berlinger!<page>As expected, this once quiet refuge is now full of people of all kinds. We have built a small, austere settlement that packs everything around this ancient temple!<hpage>These poor insects were victims of the castle and its cunning charm. This place will only attract them, put them in the stomach and consume them completely.<page>Yes, from the inside out, it's just a grand, golden lie. At the very least, the people left behind can enjoy a safe moment. Poor fool. "

original_en_text: A precious order passed down by the holy conductors. Rare now to find these old texts, and rarer still to find a bug able to read ‘em.
original_zh_text: 神圣指挥官亲笔签发的珍稀敕令。如今，这种古卷已经很难找到了，而能读懂它们的虫子就更少见了。
translated_text: 神聖な指揮官。これらの古いテキストを見つけるのは難しく、それらを読むことができるエラーを見つけるのはさらに難しい。
secondary_translated_text: The Sacred Commander. It's hard to find these old texts, and even harder to find errors that can read them.

original_en_text: Ooh, what a turn-up! I’d feared t’was naught but meself left sane about these halls. Seems this old bug’s luck has not yet worn thin!<hpage>It was more than luck that saw me to you, madam. I promised the wish of bugs concerned for your safety.<hpage>I urge you to head their way now, beside the old bell, up and over.<hpage>A small settlement has formed there, and the bell, reawakened, seems to ward away the worst of the Citadel’s many dangers.<page>A settlement? In these long-haunted halls? Are you telling naughty little lies, dear one? Well, I suppose there’s not too much danger in going and seeing the truth for meself.
original_zh_text: 哎呀呀！还以为这鬼地方只剩我没发疯呢！看来我这只老婆子运气还没用完！<hpage>我能找到你可不只是运气使然，女士，我是受其他虫子所托来确保你的安全。请尽快前往上方那座古钟，同那些虫子会合。<hpage>那古钟周围形成了一个小型庇护所，重鸣的钟声似乎能驱散圣堡的大部分危险。<page>庇护所？在这闹鬼的圣堡？亲爱的，你在编故事吧？不过亲眼去看看也无妨~
translated_text: ああ、それは素晴らしい!大丈夫だと思ったけど、このホールに集中した。どうやらこの古い虫の運は尽きていないようだ!<hpage>私はあなたに会えて幸運ではない。私はあなたの安全を気にするバグの願いに同意します。<hpage>今すぐ彼らの方向に行き、古い鐘のそばに行き、再び上に行くことをお勧めします。<hpage>そこには小さな集落が形成され、鐘は再び呼び起こされ、城の多くの危険の中で最悪のものを守ることができるように見えた。<page>和解か？この長いお化け屋敷の中で？ハニー、あなたはいたずらな嘘をついていますか？真実を見るのは危険ではないと思います。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, that's great! I thought it was okay, but I focused on this hall. Apparently, this old bug's luck is not running out!<hpage>I am not lucky to meet you. I agree with the wishes of bugs that care about your safety.<hpage>I suggest you go in their direction right now, go by the old bell, and go up again.<hpage>A small settlement was formed there, and the bells were again summoned, and it seemed that they could protect the worst of the castle's many dangers.<page>reconciliation? in this long haunted mansion? Honey, are you lying a naughty lie? I don't think it's dangerous to look at the truth.

original_en_text: Be away then, dear one, and leave me to gather up my trinkets and baubles.<page>If this settlement of yours truly has bugs settled safe, I’ll be able to make some lucrative trades. Blessings and farewell!
original_zh_text: 快走吧，亲爱的。别耽误我收拾我的宝贝货物。<page>要是你那庇护所真能安生做生意，老婆子我定能大赚一笔！愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: さあ、ハニー、さあ、私の小さなものを片付けさせてください。<page>あなたの和解が間違いを安全に解決すれば、私はいくつかの有益な取引をすることができる。祝福とさよなら!
secondary_translated_text: Come on, honey, come on, let me clean up my little things.<page>If your settlement resolves the mistake safely, I can make some profitable deals. Blessings and farewell!

original_en_text: It’s feelin’ almost time, eh, bellringer? You and her who waits up there. That fated meeting won’t hold forever... Ready to make your play, to oust one ruler and claim her place?<hpage>I’ll not deny some part of me desires that outcome... Dominance, it seems, is baked deep in my blood, as too, no doubt, for the one up top.<hpage>And yet, another part resists... A part, over time, I find myself siding with more...<hpage>That part wishes not to claim a monarch’s mantle, rather it would see my freedom regained, and this kingdom’s bugs unshackled from their pale chains.<page>...Remarkable idea you’re speakin’ there, bellringer, a world cut free. Not a wish I’ve had much cause to hope on, serious like... but I ain’t so surprised to hear you speak it.<page>For all your helpin’, I been seein’ it clearer. You’ve still got the monarch in you, alright, and the glare of a Weaver, but the ambition... that’s wild different from both.<hpage>If you have already guessed to my desire, sir, and share some part of it, would you offer me aid in the conflict to come?<page>Aye... Maybe, yes. I can barely bear to tell it... But there’s an idea, one rare discussed, for fear of her up there sensin’ the score.<hpage>You have conceived a method, I take it? A way to see a monarch... removed? And me left free from claiming her station?<page>...We have, me and what remains of my family. S’a trap, of a sort, beyond the skill of this Citadel, one to go further than just her binding. You’d be just the hunter to set it, if you’re dare enough to try...
original_zh_text: 时机快到了吧，敲钟者？你和顶上那位迟早要碰面……准备好推翻旧主，自己上位了吗？<hpage>一定程度上，我不否认自己渴求这样的结果……我的统治欲深植血脉，和顶上那位一样。<hpage>但另一部分的我在抗拒……而这一部分正变得愈发强烈……<hpage>不想戴上王冠，只盼重获自由，让这王国的虫民挣脱苍白的枷锁。<page>一个解脱束缚的世界……真是难以想象。我虽然不敢奢望，但从你嘴里说出来倒不意外。<page>看你四处救援，我也明白了。你确有君王的血统和织者的锋芒，但野心……和两者都截然不同。<hpage>先生，既然你已了解我的想法，可否在即将到来的纷乱中助我一臂之力？<page>啊……或许可以吧。我有一计……但这是一招险棋，鲜少被提及，唯恐被顶上那位察觉。<hpage>也就是说……你有能让我弑君并自由脱身的方法？<page>我们……我那残存的家族确实有个计划。那是一种陷阱，一种超越圣堡的陷阱。而你恰好能成为安放这个陷阱的猎手——如果你胆子够大的话……
translated_text: 時間が近づいているような気がします。あなたと彼女はそこで待っている。運命的な出会いは永遠に続かない― ― ―支配者を倒し、彼女の座を奪う計画を始める準備はできているか？<hpage>私の一部が結果を望んでいることは否定しません。支配は私の血に深く根ざしているようで、トップで支配することは間違いありません。<hpage>しかし他は抵抗した。時間が経つにつれて、私はより多くの側に立っていた。<hpage>彼らは君主のマントを望んでいないが、私が自由になり、王国の昆虫が青白い鎖から解放されるのを見たい。<page>...ベリンジャー、あなたがそこで話しているのは、自由な世界の素晴らしいアイデアです。私が望む理由はあまりありませんが、真剣に好きです。でもそう言われても驚かない。<page>助けてくれてありがとう、はっきり見えてきた。あなたはまだ君主の気質、まあ、機織りの才能、しかし野心を持っています。これは両者とは全く異なる。<hpage>もしあなたが私の願いを推測し、その一部を共有してくれたら、来るべき紛争で私を助けてくれるでしょうか。<page>はい、たぶん、はい。私はそれを言う勇気がない。しかし、彼女がスコアを感じることを恐れて、めったに議論されないアイデアがあります。<hpage>あなたは君主に会う方法を理解したと思います。削除する？私は彼女を置き換えなかったか？<page>...私と私の家族だけ。それはある種の罠であり、この城の能力を超えており、彼女の鎖よりもはるかに遠い罠であった。挑戦する勇気があるなら、あなたはそれを設定するハンターです。
secondary_translated_text: I feel like the time is approaching. You and she are waiting there. A fateful encounter doesn't last forever - - are you ready to begin a plan to take down the ruler and take her throne?<hpage>I can't deny that a part of me wants a result. Dominance seems to be deeply rooted in my blood, and I have no doubt about dominating at the top.<hpage>But others resisted. " As time went on, I was on more side.<hpage>They don't want the monarch's cloak, but they want to see me set free and the insects of the kingdom set free from their pale chains.<page>... What you're talking about there, Belinger, is a wonderful idea of a free world. I don't have much reason to want it, but I seriously like it. But I wouldn't be surprised if they told me so.<page>Thank you for helping me, I can see clearly. You still have the temperament of a monarch, well, a talent for weaving, but ambition. This is completely different from both.<hpage>If you could guess my wishes and share some of them, would you help me in the conflict to come? "<page>Yes, maybe, yes. I don't have the courage to say that. But there are ideas that are rarely discussed for fear that she will feel the score.<hpage>I think you have understood how to meet the monarch. delete it? did i not replace her?<page>... Just me and my family. It was a trap of some sort, beyond the capacity of this castle, and far beyond her chains. If you have the courage to take the challenge, you are the hunter who sets it.

original_en_text: What’s that you got there, bellringer? Stole someone else’s soul for yourself?<hpage>You speak of the remnant I found in the muck-choked caves beside the Citadel? This is soul siphoned from a once powerful bug.<hpage>It’s only a thin mix now, but there is still some strength left. At peak, their talents must have been impressive.<page>Aye, they was that. I knew the bug, in ‘is prime, long time back. Braver’n most, and as little a fan of this Citadel as you yourself.<page>Went seekin’ alliance with those basic bugs of the swamps. Thought they’d both gain from the union... Scheming defiance, or some such stupidity!<page>Now he’s as dead as he was daft! Don’t go tryin’ ta make friends in Pharloom, bellringer. Nothin’ good comes of it.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者，你手里攥着什么？偷了谁的灵魂？<hpage>你是说我在圣堡旁边泥沼洞穴里找到的灵魂？这是从一只强大的甲虫身上剥离出来的。<hpage>虽然稀薄但尚存力量，全盛时期定非等闲之辈。<page>啊，没错！我认识那虫子，当年也算条好汉，而且跟你一样厌恶圣堡。<page>居然想联合沼泽平民搞叛乱！以为能互利共赢……真是蠢到家的反抗计划！<page>现在死得渣都不剩！所以说，在纺络交朋友准没好下场！
translated_text: 何を持っているの、鐘の鳴る？他人の魂を自分のために盗む？<hpage>城の隣の泥だらけの洞窟で見つけた残骸のことですか？かつて強大だった昆虫から引き出された魂<hpage>今は弱い組み合わせですが、まだ一定の強さがあります。彼らの才能はピーク時には印象的だったでしょう。<page>ああ、そうだ。この間違いはずっと前に黄金時代だったと思います。最も勇敢な人はあなたほど城を愛しません。<page>これらの基本的なバクテリアとの同盟は湿地で発見されます彼らは皆、同盟から利益を得る。陰謀と挑発、またはそのようなもの!<page>彼は今までと同じように愚かに死んだ!ファロで友達を作ろうとするな、ベル·リンガー。良い結果はない。
secondary_translated_text: what do you have, the bell ringing? stealing someone else's soul for yourself?<hpage>you mean the remains found in the muddy cave next to the castle? a soul drawn from a once mighty insect.<hpage>It is a weak combination now, but it still has a certain strength. Their talents would have been impressive at their peak.<page>Oh, yeah. I think this mistake was a golden age long ago. The bravest man does not love the castle as much as you.<page>Alliances with these basic bacteria are found in wetlands and they all benefit from alliances. Conspiracy and provocation, or anything like that!<page>He died as stupidly as ever! " Don't try to make friends in the Faro, Bel Linger. There are no good results.

original_en_text: Hmph. Bellringer, you might think me a dullard, but I understand this place and have well-good senses.<page>Brought here, weren’t you? From beyond the border of our lands?<hpage>You are correct. The one who waits atop this Citadel... Through their hospitality, I arrived in this kingdom. I seek now to return that welcome in kind.<page>Hmph. Beastly words, them. Finely spoken, but beastly all the same.<page>I just pray you don’t bring any more unneeded pain down on the heads of these gormless little pilgrims...
original_zh_text: 哼，敲钟者，别当我是蠢货。我对这地方算是知根知底，而且我的预感往往很灵验。<page>你是从纺络境外被“请”来的吧？<hpage>没错。圣堡顶端那位邀请我来到这个王国……盛情难却，现在轮到我回礼了。<page>冠冕堂皇的野兽做派！话说得再漂亮，骨子里还是透出兽性！<page>只希望你别再牵连这些呆头呆脑的朝圣者……
translated_text: ねえ、ベルリンガー、私は馬鹿だと思われるかもしれませんが、私はこの場所を知っていて、素晴らしい感覚を持っています。<page>ここに連れてこられたんでしょ？私たちの土地の境界の外？<hpage>城の頂上で待っている人々についてのあなたの意見は正しい。彼らのもてなしによって、私は王国に来ました。今、私はその歓迎を同じように返しています。<page>あなたは獣のように話す。彼は非常によく話したが、彼はまだ野蛮だった。<page>この愚かな巡礼者たちにこれ以上不必要な苦しみを与えないように祈っています。
secondary_translated_text: Hey, Berlinger, you may think I'm an idiot, but I know this place, and I have a great sense of it.<page>you brought me here, didn't you? Outside the boundaries of our land?<hpage>You are right about the people waiting on the top of the castle. By their hospitality, I have come into the kingdom. Now, I'm returning that welcome in the same way.<page>You speak like a beast. He spoke very well, but he was still barbaric.<page>I am praying that these foolish pilgrims will not suffer any more unnecessary suffering.

original_en_text: Found it all, did ya, bellringer? Then join me and let’s get to preppin’! I’ll be askin’ both your Silk and your claws ‘fore the construction.
original_zh_text: 找齐了是吧？那就快来搭把手！我需要你的灵丝和利爪参与构建。
translated_text: 全部見つかったんですよね？ベル·リンガー？私と一緒に準備を始めましょう!建設前に絹と爪についてお聞きします。
secondary_translated_text: you found it all, right? belllinger? Let's start preparing with me! We will ask you about silk and nails before construction.

original_en_text: The Citadel chose us, granted us a little more living. For what purpose though, who could say?
original_zh_text: 圣堡选择了我们，赏我们多活两天。谁知道是出于什么目的呢？
translated_text: 城は私たちを選び、より多くの命を与えてくれた。しかし、誰がその目的を説明できますか？
secondary_translated_text: The castle chose us and gave us more life. But who can explain its purpose?

original_en_text: If’n your wantin’ that trap made, you’d best get to collectin’. I’ll point you toward what’s needed, best as I can.
original_zh_text: 如果决定要把那个陷阱造出来，就快去收集所需的部分。我会告诉你需要做什么。
translated_text: その罠が欲しければ、それを集めた方がいい。私はあなたが望むものを伝えるために最善を尽くします。
secondary_translated_text: If you want that trap, you better collect it. I will do my best to tell you what you want.

original_en_text: Heard you did the savin’ for our dear merchant there? I’ve seen her about, sneaking and scrounging, even a’fore you was ringing that bell.<page>She’s a useful sort, but don’t let her age be foolin’, she’s still the sharpest mind for a deal.<page>Won’t be long till there’s nary a rosary about this shrine that ain’t found its way into her pockets.
original_zh_text: 听说你救了那个奸商？早在你敲钟之前，我就瞧见她在这儿鬼鬼祟祟扒拉破烂了。<page>别看她老，坑钱手段多着呢！<page>要不了多久，这附近的念珠全得进她腰包！
translated_text: 私たちの親愛なるビジネスマンのお金を節約したと聞きました。ドアベルを鳴らす前から、彼女が物乞いをしているのを見た。<page>彼女は有用な人ですが、年齢にしても愚かにしないでください。彼女はまだ周りで最も賢い人です。<page>しばらくして、寺院からのロザリオが彼女のポケットに入った。
secondary_translated_text: I heard you saved our dear businessman's money. Before he could ring the doorbell, he saw her begging.<page>She's a useful person, but don't make her stupid even though she's old. She's still the smartest person around.<page>After a while, a rosary from the temple came into her pocket.

original_en_text: Bellringer... Re-thinkin’ on that trap, are ya? It’s a mad method, for sure, but you’d be just the hunter to set it, if’n you’re dare enough to try...
original_zh_text: 敲钟者……有重新考虑过陷阱的事吗？这想法虽然疯狂，但对你来说最合适不过了……如果你胆子够大的话。
translated_text: 鐘を鳴らす人。罠を再考していますか？もちろん、それはクレイジーなアプローチですが、あえて試してみると、あなたはそれを設定するハンターに過ぎません。
secondary_translated_text: The one who rings the bell. Are you rethinking the trap? Of course, it's a crazy approach, but if you dare to try it, you're just a hunter setting it up.

original_en_text: <hpage>Grant me your aid, sir. If your trap provides a path to freedom, both for myself and your land’s bugs, I may indeed choose to trigger it.<hpage>What work do you require of me now to see your service made?<page>It’s my family’s strength you’ll need be seeking, bellringer, us three ol’ bugs still alive, spread ‘cross this kingdom, and one poor cousin dead and drained in swamps choked rotten.<page>Each has power. Raw, savage stuff! For you, they’ll give it, if for their fascination at the act, or the thrill of defiance... or because they have no choice at all.
original_zh_text: <hpage>请助我一臂之力，先生。若你的陷阱真能为这片土地的虫子和我带来自由，我愿成为那个安放它的猎手。<hpage>现在需要我做些什么？<page>去召集我家族的力量——三个苟活的老家伙，他们分散王国各处。还有个可怜的表弟，他死在了腐臭的沼泽。<page>我的家人每个都带着野蛮原始的力量！他们会把力量交给你——或是出于对你这种勇气的欣赏，或是享受反抗带来的的亢奋……抑或是别无选择。
translated_text: <hpage>助けてください、サー。あなたの罠が私とあなたの土地の虫たちに自由への道を提供するなら、私はそれを引き起こすことを選ぶかもしれません。<hpage>あなたのサービスを見るために今何をしたいですか？<page>ベル·リンガー私の家族の強さを見つける必要があります私たちの王国にはまだ3匹の“虫”が生きていて、沼で窒息死したかわいそうな従兄弟がいます。<page>誰にでも力がある。野蛮で野蛮なもの!あなたにとっては、彼らが演技に夢中になったり、反抗的な興奮があったりするなら、彼らはあなたに与えるだろうあるいは選択肢が全くないからです。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Please help me sir. If your trap offers me and the worms of your land a way to freedom, I may choose to cause it. "<hpage>What would you like to do now to see your service?<page>Bel Linger I need to find the strength of my family There are still three "worms" alive in our kingdom, and a poor cousin who has suffocated in the swamp.<page>Everyone has power. " Barbaric, barbaric things! For you, it's because if they get into acting or have a rebellious excitement, they'll either give you or have no choice at all.

original_en_text: Real fine key this. No doubt it’ll open the way to somewhere special. Somewhere full of goodies, I’ll bet. Find the lock, and it’ll practically pay for itself!
original_zh_text: 上等货色！毫无疑问，它准能打开某个特殊地方的通路。我敢打赌，那地方肯定堆满了好东西。找到对应的锁，这钥匙就物超所值啦！
translated_text: これは非常に良い鍵です。それは間違いなく特別な場所への道を開くでしょう。良いものに満ちた場所だと思います。ロックを見つけると、効果的に自己負担ができます!
secondary_translated_text: This is a very good key. It will undoubtedly pave the way to a special place. I think it's a place full of good things. Once you find the lock, you can effectively be self-supported!

original_en_text: <hpage>Caretaker, I bring supplies from the town of bells below the Citadel.<page>And badly needed they are, miss bellringer. Ain’t much finding or foraging happening with this mob, what with them choir types all stalkin’ about the chambers beside.
original_zh_text: <hpage>看守者先生，我从圣堡下方的钟心镇带了补给。<page>啊！真是雪中送炭！圣咏团在附近晃悠，这帮怂包根本不敢出去觅食。
translated_text: <hpage>バトラー城の下にあるベルの町から物資を持ってきた<page>ベリンジャーさんの暴徒たちは、彼らを必死に必要としていましたが、彼らの合唱団は近くの部屋をうろついていました。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>i brought supplies from the town of bell beneath butler castle.<page>Mr. Bellinger's mob desperately needed them, but their choir was prowling around a room nearby, and they were all in the same place.

original_en_text: Buried in the warren of bells, at Pharloom’s core, seek my sullen uncle. That one has power to spare.
original_zh_text: 去纺络的核心地带，在到处是钟的地方找我那阴沉的叔叔，他的力量多得没处使。
translated_text: ファルムの中心部の鐘の中に埋もれて暗い叔父を探してその人は余分な力を持つ。
secondary_translated_text: The man has extra power when he searches for his dark uncle buried in a bell in the center of the farm.

original_en_text: So you found this place too, sister? This Citadel’s grand promise has been strangled away by cursed thread, but at least the great bell here grants us some sanctuary.<page>We’re amongst the blessed few... granted just a little more living.
original_zh_text: 小姐，你也找到这个地方了啊？我们可真是走运。圣堡曾经的宏伟都因丝咒化为了泡影，但多亏了那座大钟，我们才能安全地待在这儿。<page>也许只是片刻安宁，但能多活一会儿……但在这病怏怏的鬼地方，多活片刻就是最好的福报了。
translated_text: この場所も見つけたのか、お姉ちゃん。城の壮大な展望は呪いの糸で窒息していますが、少なくともここにある巨大な時計は私たちに避難所を与えてくれます。<page>私たちは少数派ですほんの少しの命。
secondary_translated_text: Did you find this place, sister? The magnificent views of the castle are suffocated by a curse thread, but at least the huge clock here gives us some shelter.<page>We are a minority, a little bit of life.

original_en_text: Off you go now, dear one. If it’s my trinkets you covet, you can trade me your rosaries up at the shrine. Blessings and farewell!
original_zh_text: 你该走了，亲爱的。如果你想要我的这些宝贝，就来钟殿用念珠跟我换！愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: ダーリン、もう行っていいよ。もし私の小さなものを欲しがるなら、あなたのロザリオを神社に持ってきてください。祝福とさよなら!
secondary_translated_text: Darling, I can go now. If you want my little one, please bring your rosary to the shrine. Blessings and farewell!

original_en_text: Ooohh... If we’re no longer pilgrims... What are we?
original_zh_text: 噢……我们如果不再是朝圣者了……那会成为什么呢？
translated_text: ああ、もし私たちが巡礼者でなくなったら私たちは何なのか。
secondary_translated_text: Oh, what are we, if we cease to be pilgrims? "

original_en_text: Crafty types used to go all a’clamour for this metal. S’not much to look at, but I still remember its value.
original_zh_text: 当年被工匠们抢破头的金属材料。看着不起眼，但老婆子我记得它可金贵着呢。
translated_text: 狡猾な人々はかつてこの金属を賞賛した。何も見えませんが、その価値は覚えています。
secondary_translated_text: Crafty people once admired this metal. I don't see anything, but I remember its value.

translated_text: おい!ここにいるぞ!
secondary_translated_text: Hey! I'm here!

original_en_text: This shrine, awakened... it calls out to ‘em, you see. “It’s safe here. Come on over!” ringing in the ears of every lost pilgrim and grubby so-and-so unlucky enough to have made it to this blasted Citadel with their wits intact.<page>Well, what’s done is done, and what’s rung is rung. Just make sure you come back here soon, you lout! I ain’t dealing with all the fresh intake myself!<hpage>If time permits, sir bug, I shall visit again.
original_zh_text: 只要这钟殿醒着，那些迷途的朝圣者和肮脏的食腐者就会收到召唤。<page>就像在那些家伙耳边低语“这里安全，快来！”，然后他们就会屁颠屁颠地涌向这座被诅咒的城堡。<page>事已至此，你最好尽快回来帮忙！我可不想独自应付这些新来的蠢货！<hpage>先生，若有空闲，我会再来。
translated_text: この寺はすでに覚醒したそれは彼らを呼び出している、见て。“ここは安全です。こっちへ来い!“失われた巡礼者や汚れた不幸な者たちはみな耳に響き、その知恵は無傷で放棄された城にたどり着いた。<page>JA：あなたがしたことは、あなたがしたことは、あなたがしたことです。早く戻ってきて、バカ野郎!新鮮な食べ物は自分では食べられません!<hpage>時間が許せば、バグさん、また訪れます。
secondary_translated_text: This temple has already awakened it is calling them, look. "This is safe. come here! "The lost pilgrims and the filthy unhappy all resounded in their ears, and their wisdom reached the castle unblemished and abandoned."<page>What you did, what you did, what you did. Come back quickly, you idiot! You can't eat fresh food on your own!<hpage>If time permits, Mr. Bug, I will visit again.

original_en_text: Guess I shouldn’t be surprised. It’s a fool act to try such a thing... Maybe even to think on it. Your kind ain’t designed to die.
original_zh_text: 果然还是有所顾虑吗？企图弑君本就是蠢行……或许连想都不该想。你们这一族的命数本就不包括死亡。
translated_text: 驚くべきことではないと思います。こんなことを試すのは愚かだ考えてみることすらできるかもしれない。あなたのような人は死ぬために設計されていない。
secondary_translated_text: I don't think that's surprising. You might even think it would be stupid to try this. People like you are not designed to die.

original_en_text: For the last part, I’ll also be needin’ that rune setter you’re carryin’. Clever old Weaver tool, that thing, and the perfect base on which to stretch our power.<page>Once you’ve collected for yourself the other critical parts, I’ll ask you pass it over as well.
original_zh_text: 最后还需要你身上那个陷阱设置器。精巧的织者工具，正好可以用来作为我们陷阱的基底。<page>等你集齐了其他部分，就把这玩意也交给我。
translated_text: 最後の部分では、“あなたが持っていくルーンの設定”も必要です。巧妙な昔ながらのウィーバーツール、それ、そして私たちの力を拡張する完璧な基盤。<page>あなた自身のために他の重要なコンポーネントを集めたら、私はそれらを渡すように頼みます。
secondary_translated_text: In the last part, you also need to "set up the runes you take with you." A clever old-fashioned weaver tool, it, and the perfect foundation to extend our power.<page>Once you've collected the other important components for yourself, I'll ask you to pass them on.

original_en_text: Find the husk of my cousin, claimed by the scorned bugs of the swamps. A careless fool to let himself be taken, and dead they might be, but some glimmer of his soul can still be sensed.
original_zh_text: 找到我表弟的躯壳，它被沼泽中满怀怨愤的虫子占据了。他粗心大意，才会被抓住并害死。但我仍能感受到他灵魂散发的的一丝微光。
translated_text: 私のいとこの殻を見つけると、それは沼の軽蔑的な昆虫に占領されます。不注意な愚か者は、自分自身を奪われ、彼らは死んでいるかもしれませんが、あなたはまだ彼の魂に光を感じることができます。
secondary_translated_text: When I find my cousin's shell, it will be occupied by the contemptuous insects of the swamp. The careless fool, deprived of himself, and they may be dead, but you can still feel the light in his soul.

original_en_text: <hpage>Sir, I have the items requested. Craft me your trap that we may see these lands free.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生，所需物品已集齐。请为我制作陷阱，还此地自由。
translated_text: <hpage>必要なものがあります私をあなたの罠にして、この土地を自由に見せてください。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I need something, make me your trap, and let me show you this land at liberty.

original_en_text: T’was a good deed you did up above, dear one, saving me from them screeching flocks. Not seen the like of it in a long, long time.<page>I’ve returned with all sorts of new goodies, too. Let’s see if anything I’ve scavenged will fit your fancy.
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，多亏你把我从那些可怕的家伙手上救了出来。我好久遭遇过那样的危险了。<page>我还带了各种各样新鲜的好东西回来。来看看我搜罗到的货物有没有合你心意的。
translated_text: あなたはそこで良いことをして、悲鳴を上げる羊の手から私を救ってくれました。こんなものは久しぶりに見ました。<page>新しいものを持って戻ってきました。私が選んだものがあなたの好みに合うか見てみましょう。
secondary_translated_text: You did good there and saved me from the hand of the screaming sheep, and I was not afraid of you. I haven't seen anything like this for a long time.<page>I came back with a new one. Let's see if what I have chosen suits your taste.

original_en_text: Don’t think I ain’t see’in it, bellringer! A whole lotta helpin’ you’ve been up to, both here and down below!<page>S’a strange mantle you’re takin’ for yourself, seeing all them bugs saved and wishes promised.<hpage>You find it strange, sir? I’ve found some solace in the service, and the rewards received have proved a boon on my journey.<page>Aye! But it ain’t your place now, is it? I see well what you are, Weaver’n more! It’s below your station! You ain’t no common sort meant for carin’ on us low folk.<hpage>I could say the same for you, who still chooses to remain cowled. You continue to pose as only a simple pilgrim. Don’t you think it’s past time you ceased the performance?<page>Leave off, Old One! Permit a bug their small disguise! It’s been a pleasant thing to play simple. And I weren’t calling for change, even if you seem insistent on bringing it!<hpage>Change was unavoidable, sir, whether I arrived or not. The monarch stirs. Its threads stretch far. My presence only accelerates the inevitable.<page>So what’re you hopin’ for, eh? Planning to usurp, to perch above us all as queen? Build up our hopes only to string us all in your own beastly web? Such is the way of Weavers and gods both...
original_zh_text: 敲钟者！别当我没看见！你在这里和下层当活菩萨呢！<page>披着救世主的皮，到处行侠仗义，很别扭吧？<hpage>先生觉得我别扭？帮助其他虫子让我获得了某种慰藉。当然，获得的报酬也能助我前行。<page>呵！可这不是你该干的！我看得出来，你有织者血统！屈尊来操心我们这些贱民的死活，太掉价！<hpage>那你扮成普通朝圣者，不也是在演戏？是时候摘掉伪装了吧？<page>该死！就不能让我活个清净吗？安安静静的普通日子不好过吗？非得去寻求变革！<hpage>变革不可避免，无论我来与否。圣堡之主已然有所行动，其丝线已遍及全境。我的到来不过是加速了这过程。<page>所以你到底图什么？想夺权篡位，成为新的女皇？先点燃我们的希望，然后再把我们困入网中？你们织者和神灵都这副德行……
translated_text: 見なかったと思わないでください、ベル·リンガー!あなたがここにいても、あなたは多くの助けを得るでしょう!<page>あなたが身に着けているコートは奇妙なコートで、すべての虫が救われるのを見て、あなたの願いが叶うのです。<hpage>これは奇妙だと思いますか？私は自分の奉仕に慰めを見出し、受け取った報酬は私の旅の福音を証明しています。<page>はい!はい!でも今はそういう状況じゃないですよね。あなたが誰か知っている、ウィーバー!あなたの場所のすぐ下に!下層階級を批判する普通の人ではありません<hpage>同じことが言えるのですが、やはりスカーフを着用しています。あなたはただの巡礼者のふりをしています。演技をやめるべきだと思いませんか？<page>逃げろ、老人!小さな虫に変装させましょう!ただ遊ぶことは喜びです。変化を求めているわけではありませんが、それを主張しても!<hpage>私が到着するかどうかにかかわらず、変化は避けられません。君主は興奮した。線は遠くまで伸びている。私の存在は避けられないことを加速する。<page>私たちの王座を奪う計画は何ですか？私たち全員を自分の獣の網に縛り付けるためでしょうか？それが神々や神々のやり方です。
secondary_translated_text: Don't think you haven't seen it, Bell Linger! Even if you are here, you will get a lot of help!<page>The coat you are wearing is a strange coat, and you will see that all the worms are saved, and your wishes will be fulfilled.<hpage>do you think this is strange? I have found solace in my service, and the rewards I have received attest to the gospel of my journey.<page>yes! yes! But that's not the situation now, is it? You know who you are, Weaver! Just below your place! I'm not an ordinary person who criticizes the lower classes.<hpage>I can say the same thing, but I still wear a scarf. You're just pretending to be a pilgrim. don't you think you should stop acting?<page>Run away, old man! Let them disguise themselves as little bugs! Just to play is a pleasure. I'm not asking for change, but even if I insist on it!<hpage>Change is inevitable, whether I arrive or not. The monarch was excited. The line goes far away. My presence accelerates what is inevitable.<page>what is your plan to take our throne? to bind us all in the net of our own beast? That's how the gods and gods do it.

original_en_text: You keep at all that helpin’, you’re gonna start inspiring it in others! Best you think serious about what effect you might be causin’, bellringer!<page>Too much hope could prove a dangerous thing, ‘specially for all these bugs starved so long of it.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者！你再这么当救世主，其他虫子都要学样了！你最好想清楚这样会引发什么后果！<page>让浑浑噩噩几辈子的虫子看到希望——这是非常危险的！
translated_text: 助け続けることで、他の人にインスピレーションを与え始めます!ベルリンガー、あなたが与える影響を真剣に考えた方がいいでしょう!<page>あまりにも多くの希望は危険なことであることが証明されます特に長い間それを切望していたこれらのバグすべてにとって。
secondary_translated_text: By continuing to help, you will start inspiring others! Berlinger, you'd better seriously think about the impact you're having!<page>Too much hope will prove to be a dangerous thing, especially for all these bugs who have longed for it.

original_en_text: Now, why don’t you hurry back to the shrine and let them all know what a good job you’ve done?<page>There might be a few more goodies to gather up on my way back, and I don’t need you lingering around in the meantime. Blessings and farewell!
original_zh_text: 现在，快回去替我报平安吧！<page>我这会儿可没法跟你一块回去，路上可能还有好东西等着我捡漏呢。愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: さあ、急いで神社に戻って、自分がどれだけうまくやっているかを伝えてみませんか。<page>帰り道にはいいものがあるかもしれませんし、この間は歩き回る必要はありません。祝福とさよなら!
secondary_translated_text: Now, why not hurry back to the shrine and tell him how well you're doing? "<page>There might be some good things on the way home, and you won't have to walk around in the meantime. Blessings and farewell!

original_en_text: Simply forged, and simply styled. Designed to open all sorts of different locks, if they be basic enough.
original_zh_text: 锻造工艺粗糙，样式也朴素。但能打开各种不同的锁——只要锁芯别太复杂。
translated_text: 簡単な鍛造、簡単な成形。十分に基本的であれば、さまざまなロックを開くように設計されています。
secondary_translated_text: Easy forging, easy molding. If it's basic enough, it's designed to open a variety of locks.

original_en_text: Sister, sister! Let me confide in you! As I ascended the Citadel’s chambers to reach this place, I swear I heard the laughter of a child!<page>Wasn’t much more than an echo, and I confess me fear’s been playing awful tricks on me... and yet that voice still keeps ringing in my head.<page>Surely though, no bug so young and lively could survive within those heartless halls?
original_zh_text: 小姐！你且听我说！在圣堡殿堂上来此地的路上，我分明听到了幼虫的嬉笑声！<page>肯定是回声作祟，要么就是我吓出幻觉了……但那笑声一直在我脑子里萦绕。<page>这鬼地方哪可能有活着的幼虫？你说对吧！
translated_text: お姉ちゃん!お姉ちゃん!私はあなたに打ち明けます!城の部屋に入ってこの場所に着いた時、子供の笑い声が聞こえたと誓いました。<page>ただのエコー、私は恐怖が私に大きな役割を果たしていることを認めます。でもその声はまだ頭の中で<page>もちろん、そのような若くて活発な昆虫は、その無慈悲なホールで生き残ることができませんか？
secondary_translated_text: sister! sister! I will confide in you! I swore that when I entered the castle chamber and arrived at this place, I heard a child laughing.<page>Just an echo, I admit that fear plays a big part in me. But that voice is still in my head.<page>Of course, such a young and active insect can not survive in its ruthless hall?

original_en_text: Sister, you seen ‘em out there? Our new champion, that golden knight stalking the Citadel’s crumbling halls?<page>Tall, righteous bug. Not much for conversing. Still! I’d be long dead if not for their appearance.<page>And I ain’t the only one. Others have spoken of the knight’s timely deeds and rare bravery.<page>We’re desperate for any protection we can get, and that gleaming champion’s been offering their aid almost as much as you yourself.
original_zh_text: 嘿，小姐，瞧见没？那位在圣堡摇摇欲坠的大厅里巡逻的金甲骑士！<page>高大正直，威风凛凛，不太爱说话。不过！要不是他，我早没命了！<page>不光是我！好多朝圣者都说曾被他及时搭救。<page>现在大伙就指望你和那位英雄护着咱了。
translated_text: お姉さん、そこで見ましたか？私たちの新しいチャンピオン、城の崩壊しつつあるホールをさまよう黄金の騎士？<page>背が高くて正義の虫会話はあまりしない。それでも!彼らがいなければ、とっくに死んでいたでしょう。<page>私だけではない。他の者は騎士のタイムリーな行動とまれな勇気について語った。<page>私たちはできる限りの保護を必死に必要としており、この輝かしいチャンピオンはあなたと同じくらいの支援を提供してくれました。
secondary_translated_text: Sister, did you see it there? Our new champion, the golden knight wandering the crumbling halls of the castle?<page>He is tall and doesn't talk much about fairness. Still! If it weren't for them, they would have been dead long ago.<page>Not only me. Others spoke of the knight's timely actions and rare courage.<page>We desperately need all the protection we can, and this glorious champion has provided us with as much support as you have.

original_en_text: If you’re going to keep skulkin’ around here while I work, you may as well buy something. Take a look dear one, don’t be shy!
original_zh_text: 如果你打算在我干活的时候一直偷偷摸摸地在这儿晃悠，那你还不如找我买点东西。来看看吧，亲爱的，别害羞！
translated_text: 私が働いている間にここに隠れたいなら何か買った方がいいハニー、見て、恥ずかしがらないで!
secondary_translated_text: If you want to hide here while I'm working, you better buy something, honey, look, don't be ashamed! "

original_en_text: And last, as the base, seek a weapon of Weavers past. Should still be one left, down there in their largest nest, a snare to set a rune’o searing Silk. Our own trap’ll be woven tight about it.
original_zh_text: 最后是陷阱的基底部分，去找到古织者的工具——陷阱设置器，它可以用来设下灼烧灵丝的符文。<page>应该还剩一个，就在织者最大的巢穴里。我们的陷阱将以它为核心进行制作。
translated_text: 最後に、ベースとして、ウィーバーの過去の武器を探します。ルーンの焦げた絹を最大の巣に入れるための罠がもう一つ残っているはずです。私たち自身の罠はそれの周りを回る。
secondary_translated_text: Finally, as a base, we look for weapons from Weaver's past. There should be one more trap left to get the Rune's scorched silk into the biggest nest. Our own traps revolve around it.

original_en_text: Admit it! You done it! You shifty li’l bell-runger!<hpage>You have chosen a curious place to rest, sir. Do you perhaps know something of this shrine and its companions in the lands below?<page>Oh, so you ask funny questions as well as cutting bells free, eh? You certainly ain’t a pilgrim, but you’re clearly not of the Choir either. No! I know exactly what you are...<page>A bell-ringing lout! A weirdo! Don’t you realise what you’ve done, waking that shrine back up?<page>That bell has rung out far and wide! The wretched and the lost will have heard its call. They’ll be making their way here now.<page>Well, what’s done is done, and what’s rung is rung. Just make sure you come back here soon, you lout! You can help me deal with all the dirty little pilgrims and desperate scavengers who turn up.
original_zh_text: 承认吧！就是你干的！你这莽撞的敲钟者！<hpage>先生，你选了个有趣的地方歇脚。莫非知晓这处钟殿与下方各处钟殿的关联？<page>哈！又会问怪问题又会乱敲钟，既非朝圣者也不像圣咏团……我算看明白了——<page>你就是个扰我清梦的怪胎！知道唤醒这座钟殿会引来什么吗？<page>迷途的朝圣者和食腐者都会循钟声而来！<page>事已至此，你最好尽快回来帮忙对付那些脏兮兮的家伙！
translated_text: 認めよう!やったぞ!あなたは狡猾な小さな鐘のメッセンジャーです!<hpage>あなたは奇妙な場所を選んだ。あなたはこの寺院とその下の土地の仲間を知っていますか？<page>面白い質問と無料の着信音が出てきましたね。あなたは巡礼者ではありませんが、聖歌隊の一員でもありません。いいえ!あなたが何者かはよく分かります。<page>鐘を鳴らすバカ。変だ!神殿を取り戻すために何をしたか分かりますか？<page>遠くの鐘が鳴った!失われた者と失われた者はその呼びかけを聞く。今ここにいるわ<page>JA：あなたがしたことは、あなたがしたことは、あなたがしたことです。早く戻ってきて、バカ野郎!あなたはすべての汚れた小さな巡礼者と絶望的なスカベンジャーに私を助けることができます。
secondary_translated_text: Let's admit it! you did it! You are a cunning little bell messenger!<hpage>You chose a strange place. Do you know of this temple and its companions in the land below?<page>You've got some interesting questions and a free phone call. You are not a pilgrim, but you are not a member of the choir. No! I know very well who you are.<page>Stupid bell ringing. That's weird! do you know what i did to get the temple back?<page>The bells in the distance have rang! The lost and the lost hear its call. i'm here right now.<page>What you did, what you did, what you did. Come back quickly, you idiot! You can help me to all the dirty little pilgrims and desperate scavengers.

original_en_text: Oi! What’s this? Suddenly havin’ second thoughts? For sure it’s a frightful thing to attempt, but you’ve already put in all the leg work!<page>She up top’ll already be sensin’ your goal, vague-like maybe, but there ain’t no worth to backin’ out now.
original_zh_text: 喂！这就反悔了？虽然这计划确实骇人，但你都已经走到这一步了！<page>顶上那位早就隐隐约约地感应到了你的企图，现在退缩太迟了！
translated_text: おい!これは何だ？突然の心変わり？確かに、それを試みることは恐ろしいことですが、あなたはすべての物理的な努力を入れています!<page>彼女はすでにあなたがそこでしたことを感じています，多分メアリーのように，しかし、今あきらめる価値はありません。
secondary_translated_text: Hey! what is this? sudden change of heart? Sure, it's scary to try it, but you're putting in all the physical effort!<page>She already feels you've been there, maybe like Mary, but it's not worth giving up now.

original_en_text: Stretch a spool out nice and long with this fine-wrought tool. The perfect purchase if you’re planning to hoard a lot of Silk for yourself!
original_zh_text: 这件制作精良的工具能拓展你的灵丝轴容量。如果你打算为自己囤积大量灵丝，这件绝对是必买！
translated_text: この優れたツールを使用してスクロールを拡張します。大量のシルクを自分で購入する予定がある場合は、これは完璧な購入です!
secondary_translated_text: Use this excellent tool to expand the scroll. If you plan to buy a large amount of silk yourself, this is the perfect purchase!

original_en_text: You keep at all that helpin’, you’re gonna start inspiring it in others! Best think serious about what effect you might be causin’, bellringer!<page>Too much hope could prove a dangerous thing, ‘specially for all these bugs starved so long of it.
original_zh_text: 你再这么当救世主，其他虫子都要学样了！最好想清楚这样会引发什么后果！<page>让浑浑噩噩几辈子的虫子看到希望，这是非常危险的！
translated_text: 助け続けることで、他の人にインスピレーションを与え始めます!ベルリンガー、あなたが与える影響を真剣に考えてください!<page>あまりにも多くの希望は危険なことであることが証明されます特に長い間それを切望していたこれらのバグすべてにとって。
secondary_translated_text: By continuing to help, you will start inspiring others! Berlinger, think seriously about the impact you're having!<page>Too much hope will prove to be a dangerous thing, especially for all these bugs who have longed for it.

original_en_text: Ooohh... What new horror now besets us?<page>Is this fresh punishment for our sins, or yet another test to prove our faith?<hpage>It is neither, good bug. In this disaster you bear no blame.<hpage>Hold close to your companions, and I will work swift to see this madness stilled.
original_zh_text: 噢……现在又是什么新的灾祸降临到我们头上了？<page>这是对我们罪孽的报应，还是又一次考验我们信仰的试炼？<hpage>都不是。在这场灾厄中，你并无任何过错。<hpage>别离开你的同伴，我会尽快让这场狂乱平息下来。
translated_text: 今、どんな恐怖が私たちを悩ませているのか？<page>これは私たちの罪に対する新たな罰なのか、それとも信仰の試練なのか。<hpage>どちらも、良い虫。この災害では責任はありません。<hpage>あなたの仲間をしっかりつかんで、私はできるだけ早くこの狂気を終わらせます。
secondary_translated_text: What kind of fear is plaguing us right now?<page>Is this a new punishment for our sins, or is it a test of faith?<hpage>Both are good bugs. There is no responsibility in this disaster.<hpage>Hold on tight to your companion, and I will end this madness as soon as I can.

original_en_text: For the base, we’ll be needin’ a weapon of Weavers past. Search down low, aside the paths of bone, inside their largest nest. S’a snare device, one to set a rune’o searing Silk.
original_zh_text: 陷阱的基底部分需要用到一件古织者的工具——可以设下符文的陷阱设置器。往底层搜寻，就在满是骨头的道路旁，织者最大的巢穴里。
translated_text: ウィーバーの過去の武器が必要です。彼らの最大の巣では、骨の道を見下ろす。ルーンを設定して絹を燃やすトラップ装置です。
secondary_translated_text: We need weapons from Weaver's past. In their largest nest, they look down on the path of bones. It is a trap device that sets the runes to burn silk.

original_en_text: I swear I heard it, sister... That laugh! It almost sounded like they were enjoying themself...
original_zh_text: 小姐，我真没幻听……那笑声……听着像是它们在嬉戏玩乐一样……
translated_text: 私はそれを聞いたと誓います、お姉さん...その笑顔!楽しんでいるようですね。。
secondary_translated_text: I swear I heard that, sister... That smile! You seem to be enjoying yourself...

original_en_text: Hold this while makin’ music and you’ll soon hear its function. Amplifies song, it does! Sends it out full and bright. Ideal if you’re ever planning on performing for a crowd.
original_zh_text: 演奏时握着这件宝贝，你就能很快体会到它的作用。它能放大乐声，让声音饱满又响亮。要是你打算登台表演，这东西再合适不过了
translated_text: 音楽を作るときにそれを保持すると、すぐにその機能が聞こえます。この曲をアップグレードして、本当に!完全で明るい音を出す。群衆のためにショーを計画しているなら、これはあなたのための完璧なオプションです。
secondary_translated_text: If you hold it when you make music, you can immediately hear its function. Upgraded this song, really! It makes a full, bright sound. If you're planning a show for the crowd, this is the perfect option for you.

original_en_text: How about we get your loose beads all strung up safe? I’ll pinch a few for their braiding, but that’s surely worth it for the peace of mind.
original_zh_text: 我来帮你把零散的念珠穿起来，做成便携的链子怎么样？收点手工费不过分吧？图个心安嘛！
translated_text: すべての緩いビーズを安全に束ねたらどうでしょう？私はいくつかをつまんで織らせますが、安心のために、それは間違いなく価値があります。
secondary_translated_text: What if you bundled all the loose beads securely? I'll have some knitted and weaved, but for peace of mind, it's definitely worth it.

original_en_text: Ooh, I’m glad I wriggled my way over here! What a bounty’s been laid out by our benefactors, those generous Conductors! Giants amongst bugs they are, all-seeing and kind!<page>It’s beautiful here, and goodies are everywhere. Only enough for one though, deary, so don’t be greedy! You know I got here first. Blessings, and farewell!
original_zh_text: 啊哈！幸亏我一路摸到这儿来了！咱们的恩主——慷慨的指挥家们，可真是留下了丰厚的赏赐啊！他们全视全知，又心地善良！<page>这儿可真美，到处都是好东西。不过嘛，亲爱的，这些东西只够我拿哦，所以别贪心！你该懂得先来后到。愿你蒙福，再见！
translated_text: ああ、私は振り向いてよかった!私たちの寄付者、寛大な指揮者は、なんと大きな見返りを提供します!彼らは昆虫の中の巨人であり、全知全能で親切です。<page>美しく、どこにでも良いものがあります。ハニー、これは一人で食べるのに十分です!私が最初に来た。祝福、さようなら!
secondary_translated_text: Oh, glad I turned around! What a great return our donors, generous conductors, will give! They are giants among insects, omniscient and kind.<page>It's beautiful, and there's good stuff everywhere. Honey, this is enough to eat alone! I came first. Blessings, goodbye!

original_en_text: You stay close, sister. Them halls beside are crawling with haunted husks.<page>Wandering will only bring death, pointed and painful!
original_zh_text: 小姐，你跟紧点。旁边的那些大厅里到处都是被丝咒附身的躯壳。<page>四处乱走只会带来痛苦的死亡。
translated_text: しっかりして、シスター。近くのホールは幽霊の貝殻でいっぱいです。<page>放浪は死、鋭く、痛みをもたらすだけです!
secondary_translated_text: Hold tight, sister. A nearby hall is full of ghostly shells.<page>Wanderings only bring death, sharpening and pain!

original_en_text: Have you done it yet, bellringer? Wriggled deep? Discovered the depths of obsession that brought this place so low?<hpage>If you speak of this Citadel and its Silk, Caretaker, then yes, I now know the start of it. <hpage>In the ward down below, I saw it clear, the hollowed husks, and the many torturous implements... machines to instill a bug with thread, that would see their life extended.<page>Aye! That’s it, in part! But there’s more scale to it than all that. Just think of’em greedily shoving the Silk into their shells, the madness that overcame them, eternal life for mortal bugs! Then think on how long it’s all gone on...<hpage>...The children born of them, and all the pilgrims after... The Silk has seeded deep into this kingdom’s shells, generations deep...<hpage>No wonder Pharloom’s bugs proved such easy prey for that haunted thread. It had only to seek for itself to reach them.<page>Ho ho! Now you’re seein’ it, bellringer! These poor pilgrims, all born bound to the cruel system of our world, now stricken in its new cursed web.<page>You at least are free from it. And free to shake it all up... if’n that’s your choosing.
original_zh_text: 事情办成了吗，敲钟者？找出那些让圣堡堕落的疯狂执念没？<hpage>若是指圣堡的丝咒，是的，我已知晓其根源。<hpage>下层病房里尽是空壳，以及无数刑具般的器械……那些向甲壳灌注丝线延续生命的机器。<page>没错！但远不止如此！想想他们贪婪吞食灵丝的模样，凡虫妄图永生引发的癫狂！再想想这持续了多少世代……<hpage>……他们的子嗣，后来的朝圣者……灵丝早已深植于这个王国的甲壳内，代代相传……<hpage>难怪纺络的虫子会轻易沦为丝咒的猎物，那些邪丝只需稍加引诱就能侵蚀他们。<page>哈！现在你算看透了！这些可怜虫生来就被束缚在这个世界的残酷体制里，如今又陷进新的诅咒之网。<page>至少你是自由的，自由得足以颠覆这一切……若这是你的选择。
translated_text: やったのか、ベル·リンガー？深く揺れる？この場所をそんなに低くしている執着の深さを発見したか。<hpage>この城と絹と警備員について話すなら、そうです。どこから始まったのかわかりました。<hpage>下の病室には、空洞化した貝殻や拷問器具がはっきりと見えました。機械はスレッドを使用してエラーを注入し、寿命を延ばします。<page>はい!はい!一部!!しかし、その規模はそれよりも大きかった。貪欲に絹を殻に詰め込み、必死に打ち負かすことを考えてください。そして、この状況がどのくらい続いているのか考えてみてください<hpage>...彼らが産んだ子供たち、そしてその後の巡礼者たち。絹はすでにこの王国の貝殻に深く根付いており、代々受け継がれている。<hpage>ファロの虫が幽霊の糸に簡単に食べられるのも不思議ではない。彼らに到達するためには自分自身を探すだけです。<page>えっ!!見たかな、ベル·リンガー!私たちの世界の残酷なシステムに縛られて生まれた哀れな巡礼者たちは、今、この新しい呪われたネットワークに閉じ込められています。<page>少なくともそれを取り除くことができます。それがあなたの選択であれば、すべてを自由に変えることができます。
secondary_translated_text: did you do it, belllinger? shaking deeply? Did you discover the depth of attachment that makes this place so low?<hpage>If you're talking about this castle and silk and guards, yes. Now I know where it all started.<hpage>In the lower ward, the hollowed-out shells and torture instruments could be clearly seen. The machine uses threads to inject errors and extend its life.<page>yes! yes! One part!! But the scale was greater than that. Think of cramming silk into a shell with greed and beating it out of desperation. And think about how long this situation has been going on.<hpage>... The children they bore, and the pilgrims who followed. Silk is already deeply rooted in the shell of this kingdom, and has been passed down from generation to generation.<hpage>No wonder Pharaoh's worms can easily be eaten by ghost threads. All you have to do is look for yourself to reach them.<page>what?! You see, Bel Linger! Poor pilgrims born bound to the cruel system of our world are now trapped in this new cursed network, and they are now in the same place.<page>At least we can get rid of it. If it is your choice, you are free to change everything.

original_en_text: Well, well, if it isn’t my very own shadow, the clever little red-cloak! You still following me around, trying to pinch away some of the goodies I sniff out?<hpage>You mistake my intent, ma’am, somewhat ungenerously. The pilgrims of the settlement below were worried by your long absence. It was on their behalf that I tracked you, again.<page>Is that so? What a worrying bunch of busybodies they are! I’m still able to fend for meself!<page>Hmph... and yet, perhaps ‘tis a warm thing that I remain in their thoughts so. I hadn’t expected that. And I can’t deny that you too have done me a good turn once more.<page>That awful flock almost had me, truth be told, and I still have to wonder at your intentions, dear one... but bless you, all the same!
original_zh_text: 啧啧，这不是小红斗篷嘛！还在惦记着老婆子我找到的的宝贝？<hpage>女士，你误会了。是庇护所的虫子们担心你的安危，我才再次前来找你。<page>是这样吗？瞎操心！老婆子我纵横圣堡的时候他们都还是虫卵呢！<page>不过……被惦记的感觉倒也不坏。这次算我又欠你一份情。<page>说实话，那群可怕的家伙差点就抓住我了，而你……不管怎样，还是要感谢你！
translated_text: まあ、まあ、それが私自身の影でなければ、賢明な赤いマント!あなたはまだ私を尾行して、私の匂いを嗅ぐ良いものを殺そうとしているの？<hpage>あなたは私の意図を誤解し、少し寛大ではない。下の集落の巡礼者はあなたの長期不在を心配している。私は再びあなたを追跡します。<page>そうですか？彼らは本当に干渉する人々のグループです!私はまだ自分自身を養う!<page>うーん...。しかし、このように彼らの思いの中にとどまることは、私にとっては温かいことかもしれません。こんなことになるとは思わなかった。私はあなたが私に好意を持っていることを否定できない。<page>正直に言うと、その恐ろしい羊はほとんど私を捕まえて、私はまだあなたの意図を知りたい、親愛なるしかし祝福してください!
secondary_translated_text: Well, well, if it's not my own shadow, a wise red cape! You're still stalking me and trying to kill the good thing that smells me?<hpage>You misunderstand my intentions and are not a bit generous. The pilgrims of the settlements below are worried about your long absence. I will follow you again. "<page>is that right? They are a group of people who really interfere! I still feed myself! "<page>um... But to stay in their thoughts in this way may be a warm thing for me, and I'm not sure what I'm doing. I didn't think this would happen. I cannot deny that you have a favour for me. "<page>To be honest, that dreadful sheep has almost caught me, I still want to know your intentions, dear but bless!

original_en_text: Looking for goodies of your own, dear one? You’d do well to avoid the dark vaults near here. They say the keepers inside were jealous hoarders even before the silken curse came down.<hpage>You have more familiarity with the Citadel than most, madam. How long have you spent here, surviving amongst the haunted corridors?<page>Oh, long enough. S’not such a bad lot, all told. The memories of my pilgrimage have all faded now, but a life spent in the Citadel’s golden halls was all I ever wished for.<page>And lo and behold, my humble wish was granted! Certainly, the place might be a bit past its prime, but it’d be churlish of me to complain now, wouldn’t it?
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，你也在找好东西吗？你最好避开这附近阴暗的书库。据说在丝咒降临之前，里面的管理员就已经是些抠门的守财奴了。<hpage>女士，你比大多数虫都更熟悉圣堡。这被诅咒的地方生存，肯定也不是件易事吧？你在这儿待了多久了？<page>唔，待了有够久了。总的来说，也不算太差。当初朝圣时的记忆如今已经模糊，但在这金色圣堡度过一生，这就是老婆子我的毕生所求。<page>你瞧啊，我这小小的愿望已经实现啦！当然，这地方或许已经过了鼎盛时期，但现在要是我还抱怨，那就太不识好歹了，不是吗？
translated_text: あなたは自分のために良いものを探していますか？近くの暗い金庫室は避けた方がいい。シルクの呪いが到来する前でさえ、中の飼育員は嫉妬深い貯蔵者だったと言われています。<hpage>あなたはほとんどの人より城の女性を知っている。このお化け屋敷にどのくらい住んでいますか？<page>ああ、もういいよ。一般的に、彼は悪い人ではない。巡礼の思い出はすべて消えてしまったが、城の黄金の間で過ごした人生こそが、私が望んだものだった。<page>小さな願いが叶いました!確かに、この場所は全盛期を過ぎたかもしれませんが、今文句を言うのは失礼ですよね。
secondary_translated_text: Are you looking for something good for yourself? Dark vault rooms nearby are better avoided. It is said that even before the curse of the silk arrived, the keeper inside was a jealous hoarder.<hpage>You know the woman in the castle better than most people. How long have you been living in this haunted house?<page>Oh, enough is enough. In general, he's not a bad guy. All the memories of the pilgrimage were gone, but it was the life I had spent in the golden rooms of the castle that I wanted.<page>A small wish was granted! Sure, this place may have been past its prime, but it's rude to complain now, isn't it?

original_en_text: Part of an ancient mask, or a fractured shard of someone’s visage? With the full thing, you’d be better able to protect your shell.
original_zh_text: 古老面甲的一部分？还是谁的面部残片？要是能凑齐整套，肯定能更好地保护你的甲壳。
translated_text: 古代の仮面の一部か、誰かの顔の断片か。完全なもので、シェルをより良く保護できます。
secondary_translated_text: Part of an ancient mask, or a fragment of someone's face. It is complete and can protect the shell better.

original_en_text: What a calamity has befallen our holy Citadel! I ain’t never seen anything like it in my long life.<page>Times like this, we must be sure to help each other. Dig deep, dear one, I’ll be needing a lot of rosaries to survive what’s comin’!
original_zh_text: 圣堡这次真是大难临头了！老婆子我活了这么久，这阵仗还是头回见！<page>这种时候，我们一定要相互帮助。帮帮忙，亲爱的，为了挺过即将到来的难关，我需要很多念珠！
translated_text: 神聖な城に何という災難があったのか!私の長い人生の中で、こんなものは見たことがない。<page>このような時には互いに助け合う必要があります。親愛なる皆さん、深く掘り下げてください。これから起こることを乗り越えるためにはロザリオがたくさん必要です!
secondary_translated_text: What calamity has befallen the holy castle! I have never seen anything like this in my long life.<page>At times like these, we need to help each other. Dear friends, please dig deep. We need a lot of rosaries to get through what's coming!

original_en_text: All your work, and look! They keep arrivin’. It’s bugs aplenty up here now. Hapless, weak, but alive they are!<hpage>More scared than weak, they seem to me. It is heartening knowing these few have survived safe for your care.<page>That’s your work, bellringer! Not mine. Ringin’ and helpin’! Hope they recognise your efforts, ‘cause I ain’t providing much, and I ain’t one for fighting if that Choir and their pins ever come callin’.
original_zh_text: 全是你折腾的后果！现在这儿挤满虫子了！又蠢又弱，畏畏缩缩地苟活！<hpage>更像是吓坏了，才显得羸弱。还得多亏有你在这儿照顾他们。<page>喂！别跟我扯上关系！这都是你干的好事，敲钟者！我可不会帮忙打架——要是圣咏团找上门，你自己扛！
translated_text: すべての作品を見てください!彼らは到着し続ける。今は虫が多い。彼らは弱くて弱いが、まだ生きている。<hpage>彼らは弱さよりも恐れているようです。彼らがあなたのケアの下で無事に生き残ったことを知って嬉しいです。<page>それはあなたの仕事です、ベル·リンガー!私の鐘と助けではない!私はあまり提供していないので、あなたの努力を認めてほしい。合唱団と彼らのバッジが呼ばれても、私は戦わない。"
secondary_translated_text: Look at all the works! They continue to arrive. There are many bugs now. They are weak and weak, but still alive.<hpage>They seem to be more afraid than weak. Glad to know that they survived safely under your care. "<page>That's your job, Bell Linger! Not my bell and help! I don't offer much, so I want you to acknowledge your efforts. Even if the choir and their badges are called, I will not fight. "

original_en_text: Stop and share some of your rosaries before you go scurrying off again, dear one. I’m sure to have something that’s to your liking!
original_zh_text: 亲爱的，先别走，用你的念珠跟我做点小生意再离开也不迟呀。我这儿有各式各样的好货，绝对物超所值！
translated_text: 親愛なる友人たち、再び急いで出発する前に、立ち止まってロザリオを共有してください。好きなものがあるはずです!
secondary_translated_text: Dear friends, please stop and share the Rosary before you set out in a hurry again. You should have something you like!

original_en_text: Half a spider’s spool. You’d just have to find its match. Them ol’ Weavers built some fine things alright. They’re all long dead, but their craftwork still gleams bright.
original_zh_text: 织者的半个灵丝轴，你只需要找到与之匹配的另一半。古织者的手艺真不赖，虫死了这么多年，其造物还锃光瓦亮。
translated_text: 半分の蜘蛛の巻。マッチを見つけるだけです。ウィーバーは良いことをした。彼らは長い間いなかったが、彼らの作品はまだ輝いている。
secondary_translated_text: A half-spider's scroll. You just need to find a match. Weaver did a good thing. They've been gone for a long time, but their work still shines.

original_en_text: A gleaming find for you climbing types. With this in your claw, you’ll be able to stick to walls for as long as you like!
original_zh_text: 对于你们这些攀爬爱好者来说，这可是个不可多得的宝贝。握在爪子里就能无限黏附峭壁——想挂多久挂多久！
translated_text: あなたの素晴らしい発見は登山タイプに適しています。爪にこれがあれば、いつまで壁にくっつけることができます!
secondary_translated_text: Your wonderful discovery is suitable for the climbing type. If you have this on your nails, how long can you stick it to the wall!

original_en_text: Down in the mosslands, still clinging to her failed chapel, my sister’ll part with her power, if asked kind enough.
original_zh_text: 去苔地找我那守着破教堂的姐姐，态度客气点，她或许会分给你力量。
translated_text: 苔の畑では、姉は失敗した教会にしがみついており、誰かが親切に私に尋ねれば権力を放棄するでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: In a field of moss, my sister is clinging to a failed church, and if someone asked me kindly, I would give up my power.

original_en_text: <hpage>Grant me your aid, sir. If your trap provides a path to freedom, both for myself and your land’s bugs, I may indeed choose to trigger it.<hpage>What work do you require of me now to see your service made?<page>It’s my family’s strength you’ll need be seeking, bellringer, us three ol’ bugs still alive, spread ‘cross this kingdom, and that sad soul you’re already carryin’ there, the last of my poor cousin, dead and drained in those rotten swamps.<page>Each of my family has power, raw, savage stuff. For you, they’ll give it, if for their fascination at the act, or the thrill of defiance... or because they have no choice at all.
original_zh_text: <hpage>请助我一臂之力，先生。若你的陷阱真能为这片土地的虫子和我带来自由，我愿成为那个安放它的猎手。<hpage>现在需要我做些什么？<page>去召集我家族成员的力量——三个苟活的老家伙，他们分散王国各处。还有一个正是你已找到的这悲惨灵魂的主人，他是我可怜的表弟，死在了腐臭的沼泽。<page>我的家人每个都带着野蛮原始的力量！他们会把力量交给你——或是出于对你这种勇气的欣赏，或是享受反抗带来的的亢奋……抑或是别无选择。
translated_text: <hpage>助けてください、サー。あなたの罠が私とあなたの土地の虫たちに自由への道を提供するなら、私はそれを引き起こすことを選ぶかもしれません。<hpage>あなたのサービスを見るために今何をしたいですか？<page>あなたは私の家族の強さを見つけなければなりません。鐘を鳴らす人、まだ生きている3匹の古い虫、そしてあなたがそこに連れてきた悲しい魂、乾いた腐った沼で死んだ私のかわいそうないとこの最後の一人。<page>私の家族には強く、原始的で、野蛮な何かがあります。あなたにとっては、彼らが演技に夢中になったり、反抗的な興奮があったりするなら、彼らはあなたに与えるだろうあるいは選択肢が全くないからです。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Please help me sir. If your trap offers me and the worms of your land a way to freedom, I may choose to cause it. "<hpage>What would you like to do now to see your service?<page>You have to find the strength in my family. The man who rings the bell, the three old worms still alive, and the sad soul you brought there, this poor and last one of me who died in a dry rotten swamp.<page>There is something strong, primitive and barbaric about my family. For you, it's because if they get into acting or have a rebellious excitement, they'll either give you or have no choice at all.

original_en_text: <hpage>Sir, I have opened the way above these halls, and bested the white knight that stood as guardian.<hpage>Child of the monarch, she claimed herself at the end, and her shell suggested it true, a being born purely from Silk woven tight. <hpage>That such a feat is possible... I have seen life woven from Silk before, but tiny, transient... Never like this...<page>Aye, bellringer! You’ve slain a marvel indeed... Well, flawed marvel, at least.<page>One to keep far from she was, least for us mortal sorts. Look of a child and a mind to match, but her’s been up wanderin’ this Citadel longer’n most. Even in its long silence, way ‘fore you came and roused its ire. <page>Might’a seen herself this place’s protector, keepin’ it clean and quiet as she did. Course quiet meant most crossin’ her path found a painful end from her pin.<page>I’d be sayin’ thanks for the slaying, but with all the other husks now awoken and enraged, a bug’s chances ain’t grown by much.
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生，我已打通上层通路，击败了守卫的白骑士。<hpage>她自称君主子嗣，其甲壳构造显示此言非虚——纯粹由致密灵丝编织。<hpage>如此造物真是超乎寻常……灵丝编织的生命我倒也见过，但都渺小且残缺。和她相比，简直天差地别……<page>哈！敲钟者，看来你宰了个神迹一般的家伙……好吧，至少是个有瑕疵的神迹。<page>一直以来，对于我们来说，都是离她远点为妙。她长得孩童模样，心智也相仿，却已徘徊在圣堡多年——早在你到来并激怒她之前。<page>她自诩圣堡守护者，清扫所有“不洁者”。凡是靠近的都成了其针下亡魂。<page>本该谢谢你除掉她，但现在其他空壳都被唤醒并激怒了……咱们的处境可没变好。
translated_text: <hpage>私はこれらのホールの上の道をクリアし、白い騎士を倒しました。<hpage>彼女は最終的に君主の子供であると主張し、彼女の貝殻はそれが真実であることを示し、密接に編まれた絹から純粋に生まれた生き物である。<hpage>そのような偉業は可能です。絹で織られた生命を見たことがあるが、それは小さくて短いこんなことはなかった。<page>そう、ベル·リンガー!君は確かに奇跡を殺したまあ、少なくとも欠陥のある奇跡だ。<page>少なくとも私たち人間にとっては、彼女から遠く離れている。彼女は子供のように見え、アイデアも一致していますが、彼女は長い間この城をさまよっています。その長い沈黙の中でさえ、あなたがそれを挑発する前に。<page>おそらく彼女は自分自身をこの場所の保護者と考えており、彼女と同じように清潔で静かに保っている。コースの沈黙は、彼女が出会ったほとんどの人々が悲惨な結末を迎えたことを意味した。<page>殺してくれてありがとうと言いたいのですが、他のすべての貝殻が目覚めて怒っているので、バグが現れる可能性はあまり増えていません。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I cleared the path above these halls and defeated the white knight.<hpage>She finally claims to be the child of the monarch, and her shell shows that it is true, and is a creature born purely from closely woven silk.<hpage>Such a feat is possible. I've seen life woven in silk, but it's never been so small and short.<page>Yes, Bell Linger! You have certainly killed a miracle, well, at least a flawed miracle.<page>At least for us humans, we are far from her. She looks like a child, and the ideas are in agreement, but she has wandered about this castle for a long time. Even in that long silence, before you provoked it.<page>Perhaps she considers herself the guardian of this place, and keeps herself as clean and quiet as she is. The silence of the course meant that most of the people she met a disastrous end.<page>I want to say thank you for killing it, but all the other shells are awake and angry, so the chances of bugs showing up aren't much higher.

original_en_text: Hello again, dear one. Looks like we both made it up here, safe as told. And what a shock to find you were speaking the truth about this place!<page>A settlement like this in the Citadel, nice and safe, cloistering so many bugs with minds intact! Never seen anything like it, nor even imagined such.<page>Makes trading away all of my nice bits and baubles much easier. After all, I want to take lots and lots of rosaries with me when my strength finally fails!
original_zh_text: 又见面啦，亲爱的。看来咱俩都如预想的那样平安到达这儿了。真没想到你说的这个地方居然是真的！<page>在这圣堡里有这么一处庇护所，既舒适又安全，还住着这么多心智健全的虫子！我从没见过这样的地方，连想都没想过会有。<page>在这儿做点小买卖可容易多啦！毕竟，等我老得不行的时候，我想带上好多好多念珠，风光下葬呢！
translated_text: また会いましょう、ダーリン。私たちはここで和解し、私たちが言ったように安全に見えます。あなたがこの場所について言ったことが本当だったことに驚きました!<page>城の中にはそのような集落があり、良くて安全で、多くの虫から離れており、心は無傷です!こんなものは見たことも想像したこともありません<page>すべての私の美しいガジェットを取引しやすくします。結局のところ、私の力が尽きたとき、私はたくさんのロザリオを持って行きたいです!
secondary_translated_text: See you again, darling. " We are reconciled here and look safe as we have said. I was amazed that what you said about this place was true!<page>There is such a settlement in the castle, good and safe, away from many bugs, and the heart is intact! I've never seen anything like this, I've never imagined it.<page>All my beautiful gadgets make it easy to trade. After all, when my strength runs out, I want to take a lot of Rosaries with me!
