Their brutish work continued, even with their shell claimed by cursed thread.<page>Incredible! A bug so devout, they could cook with mind expunged. This Citadel was far too hasty to expel such brilliance.
original_zh_text: 腌淤秽蛆！卢戈利的秘方居然没失传！<hpage>我从他本人手里抢的，那家伙变丝傀了还在做菜。<page>厉害！没脑子还能掌勺，圣堡当初就不该赶他走！
translated_text: キムチウジ虫!だから亡命シェフのレシピはそれらよりも長持ちします!<hpage>そうではない。私は調理師からウジ虫を奪った。彼らの野蛮な仕事は、殻が呪われた糸で覆われても続く。<page>信じられない!このような信心深い昆虫がいれば、何も考えずに料理ができる。要塞はそのような栄光を追い払うにはあまりにも急いだ。
secondary_translated_text: kimchi worm! That's why the Refugee Chef's recipes last longer than those!<hpage>It's not true. I snatched the worm from the cook. Their barbaric work continues even when the shells are covered with cursed threads.<page>This is unbelievable! With such a devout insect, they can cook without thinking about anything. The fort was too hasty to drive away such glory.

original_en_text: <hpage>I could track down any ingredient you desire, for a price. The oil you keep here may be of some use to me.<hpage>Promise it as reward, and your master shall have his meal.<page>Hrmph! Such a squalid bargain ill befits a holy servant... but so be it. Fetch me the ingredients and you shall have that pale condiment for yourself!
original_zh_text: <hpage>我不能白白替你跑腿，拿这瓶油当酬劳吧。<hpage>答应的话，你的主人说不定能如愿吃上大餐。<page>哼！卑劣的交易……罢了，找回食材，苍白油就归你！
translated_text: <hpage>価格に応じてお好きな食材を見つけることができます。あなたがここに持っている油は私に役立つかもしれない。<hpage>ご褒美として、ご主人様はご主人様にご褒美を差し上げます。<page>フン!こんな汚い取引は聖侍には向かないしかしそれだけだ。食材を渡して、軽い調味料を食べることができます!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Depending on the price, you can find your favorite ingredients. The oil you have here may be helpful to me.<hpage>As a reward, the owner will present the reward to the owner.<page>HUN! Such a dirty deal doesn't suit a samurai, but that's all. You can pass the ingredients and eat the light seasoning!

original_en_text: What an awful clattering! Would you kindly conduct yourself a little more carefully?<page>And why are you adorned in such an awful, livid red? By my oath, those above must make a sport of sending me the most wretched servants they can find!<hpage>I am no servant, sir, rather a guest of sorts, invited by the Citadel. Tell me, is this vial of oil on display your own?<page>Nothing here is my own, you impertinent young mite! This sacred hall, and all the food contained within, belong to my most exalted master.<page>The Great Gourmand! The finest connoisseur who has ever lived, the one whose tastes transcend the ages!<page>None are left now who venerate them as they deserve, save for the loyal, lonely bug who stands before you.<page>That oil is merely a small savoury to whet their appetite for the grand meal to come. A spectacular, Pharloom spanning dish that I have been planning for an age.<page>But alas, those above seem to have forsaken my poor master! And I have grown so old. Now I can never hope to gather the necessary ingredients. Blast their indolence!
original_zh_text: 叮叮咣咣吵死了！能安静点吗？<page>还有你为什么穿这身鲜红刺眼的装扮？上面那些混蛋专派些歪瓜裂枣来侍奉我！<hpage>我可不是仆从，算是圣堡的客人。这瓶油是你的藏品？<page>当然不是我的，你这没耐心的小虫！这里一切都属于我尊贵的主人——大胃王！<page>那是空前绝后的美食家！品味超越时代的存在！<page>如今只剩我忠心耿耿侍奉主人，其他虫早忘了本分。<page>那点油不过是开胃小菜，我筹备的可是横跨纺络的盛宴！<page>可恨上面那帮懒鬼断了供给，我这把老骨头哪凑得齐食材！
translated_text: なんて恐ろしいCMソングだ!気をつけてくれないか。<page>どうしてこんなひどい赤い服を着ているの？私は誓う、上の人々は彼らが見つけることができる最も悲惨な使用人を私に与える!<hpage>私は召使いではなく、城の招待者です。展示されているオイルボトルはあなたのものですか？<page>私のものは何もない、あなたの粗野な小さなダニ!この神聖なホールとそこにあるすべての食べ物は、私の最も高貴な主人のものです。<page>偉大なグルメ!時代を超越した味覚を持つ最高の目利き!<page>あなたの前に立っている忠実で孤独な虫を除いて、誰も彼らに値するほど尊敬していません。<page>油は、来るべき食事の食欲を刺激することができる少し塩辛い味です。長い間、私は壮大なファロ料理を計画していました。<page>しかし、ああ、上の人々は私のかわいそうな主人を見捨てたようです!年を取った。もう必要な食材を集めたくない。くそったれ怠惰!
secondary_translated_text: What an awesome CM song! Will you be careful? "<page>why are you wearing such a bad red dress? I swear, the people above will give me the most miserable servants they can find!<hpage>I am not a servant, but a castle inviter. Are the oil bottles on display yours?<page>Nothing of mine, you rough little tick! " This sacred hall and all the food in it belong to my most noble master.<page>Great gourmet! The ultimate eyewitness with a timeless taste!<page>No one has the respect they deserve, except for the loyal and lonely bugs standing before you.<page>The oil is a slightly salty taste that can stimulate the appetite for the upcoming meal. For a long time, I've been planning a grand Faroe dish.<page>But, oh, the people up there seem to have abandoned my poor master! I've grown old. I no longer want to collect the necessary ingredients. Fuck you lazy!

original_en_text: Horrid she! What fool dares strike a holy Vaultkeeper! It has knowledge! Insight! As much as any could possibly retain in our fallen age.<page>Would she cast it all aside just to create more death? If so, she is Weaver to the core!
original_zh_text: 疯婆子！竟敢袭击本管理员！本管理员可是掌握着末世最全的学识！<page>你要为了杀戮抛弃这些知识？果真是纯血织者！
translated_text: 彼女は恐ろしい!警備員を攻撃するなんて馬鹿だ!知識があります!洞察力!この退廃的な時代にできるだけ保存してください。<page>彼女はすべてをあきらめ、より多くの死を引き起こすでしょうか？もしそうなら、彼女は完全な織物職人です!
secondary_translated_text: She's terrible! attacking a security guard is stupid! I have knowledge! Insight! Save it as much as possible in this decadent time.<page>Will she give up everything and cause more deaths? If so, she is a complete weaver!

original_en_text: So be it, impudent louse! Deny our kingdom’s agony. Refuse its touch upon your fickle shell!<page>Carve your hapless path. Stalk, and strike, and fight, but know your foe is fate herself, and she has risen raging!
original_zh_text: 那就这样吧，狂妄的虱子！拒绝感受王国的苦痛。让你善变的甲壳隔绝这一切！<page>走你的死路吧。即便你能潜伏、突袭、战斗，但记住你的敌人是命运本身——而她已怒火滔天！
translated_text: それでは、恥知らずの顔!わが王国の苦しみを否定するあなたの気まぐれな殻に触れさせないで!<page>あなたの不幸の道を開く。追跡し、戦い、戦い、しかしあなたの敵は運命そのものであり、彼女は激怒して上昇しています!
secondary_translated_text: Then, the shameless face! Don't let me touch your capricious shell, which denies the suffering of my kingdom!<page>Open the way to your misfortune. Chase, fight, fight, but your enemy is fate itself, and she is rising in a rage!

original_en_text: Pain! Pain! Do you hear her cries, cursed spider-spawn!? Pharloom suffers for our pathetic, mortal ignorance! We fail it and it falls! <page>Knowledge is needed. More and more! It must be hoarded, sought! Strength to understand, to calm and quell.<hpage>It is action now that needs taking, Vaultkeeper, by myself and those left alive who would aid me.<hpage>Seek solutions in your texts and psalms as you may, but they alone will not be enough to heal a pain so great.
original_zh_text: 痛苦！痛苦！听见她的哀嚎了吗，该死的蜘蛛坏种！？纺络正因我们可悲的愚昧受苦！我们辜负了它，它要灭亡了！<page>需要知识。无穷无尽的知识！必须囤积，必须追寻！需要力量去理解，去安抚，去镇压。<hpage>现在需要的是行动，管理员。由我，以及其他愿意相助的生者来执行。<hpage>你尽管在经卷圣歌中寻求解法，但光靠这些不足以治愈如此深重的伤痛。
translated_text: 痛いですね!痛いですね!彼女の泣き声が聞こえたのか、呪われた蜘蛛の卵!ファロは我々の悲しみと人間の無知のために苦しんだ!失敗したら、倒れてしまいます!<page>知識が必要です。どんどん増えて!保存して検索する!理解、冷静さ、冷静さの力。<hpage>ガーディアン、これは私と私を助けるために生きている人々が今取る必要がある行動です。<hpage>聖書や詩篇で解決策を見つけるために最善を尽くしてくださいが、それだけではこのような大きな苦しみを癒すことはできません。
secondary_translated_text: It hurts! It hurts! Did you hear her crying, cursed spider eggs! " The Pharaoh suffered for our sorrow and human ignorance! If you fail, you fall!<page>Knowledge is required. more and more! Save and search! Understanding, calmness, the power of calm.<hpage>Guardian, this is an action that needs to be taken now to help me and those who are alive.<hpage>Do your best to find a solution in the Bible and in the Psalms, but that alone will not heal such great suffering.

original_en_text: Yessss! See them all! Its collection gleams complete. Such sacred understanding, stored safe.<page>You have performed your part, Weaver-spawn... The agreement is concluded. Knowledge and rosaries, all were passed fair. No more between us.<page>Leave this Keeper to its treasures and their insights. It has given its service. Now this Keeper wants its time alone!
original_zh_text: 好极了！看啊！藏品终于完整了。如此神圣的智慧，安然封存。<page>你完成了约定，织者坏种……交易结束。知识与念珠，两清。你我两不相欠。<page>让本管理员独享珍宝与真知吧。职责已尽。现在我只想独处！
translated_text: うん!みんな見てください!シリーズは素晴らしかった。そのような神聖な理解は安全に保たれます。<page>あなたがたの子孫よ、あなたがたは義務を果たした。合意に達した。知識とロザリオは公正に伝えられる。私たちの間には何もない。<page>この守護者を彼の宝物と洞察力に任せなさい。すでにサービスを提供している。今、この男は一人の時間が欲しい!
secondary_translated_text: yes! Everyone, please watch it! The series was wonderful. Such a sacred understanding is kept safe.<page>You have fulfilled your duty, O your descendants. We reached an agreement. Knowledge and the Rosary are fairly communicated. There is nothing between us.<page>Leave this Guardian to his treasure and insight. They already offer their services. Now, this guy wants some time to himself!

original_en_text: <hpage>Show me your collection, Vaultkeeper.<page>Grkt, Weaver-spawn! She is a bother! Nuisance! Bring more gifts. The collection still has gaps!
original_zh_text: <hpage>展示你的收藏，管理员。<page>咔！烦人的坏种！拿更多贡品来！本管理员的收藏还有空缺！
translated_text: <hpage>あなたのコレクションを見せてください、管理人。<page>さあ、ウィーバー!彼女はトラブルです!かわいいですね!もっとプレゼントを。コレクションにギャップがある!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Show me your collection, Administrator.<page>Come on, Weaver! She's in trouble! That's so cute! Give me more presents. There are gaps in the collection!

original_en_text: <hpage>Gilded one, what remained of the Citadel has been torn apart by the black threads. Still you keep to your duty?<page>While voices still fill the g-g-great chambers... the sacred task of the sentinels continues.<page>To defend... To p-p-protect.
original_zh_text: <hpage>金甲虫，圣堡残骸已被黑丝撕裂。还不放弃职责么？<page>只要圣、圣殿……仍存余音，哨卫之职……不止。<page>守、守卫……守护。
translated_text: <hpage>金色の砦の残骸は黒い線で引き裂かれた。まだ義務を果たしていますか？<page>声音がまだg-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g − g −-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g@g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g-G-G-G-<page>守るための防衛。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>The remains of the golden fort were torn by black lines. Are you still fulfilling your obligations?<page>The voice is still g-g-g-g-g-g-g-g I'm not going to be able to do that. g-g - -g − g g − g- --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------I'm not going to be able to do that. g-g@g-g-<page>A defense to protect.

original_en_text: You dally, still? If you wish to earn your reward, you should be hunting down those ingredients! Or do you need directions from a serving-bug with some experience?
original_zh_text: 还磨蹭什么？想要报酬就赶紧的！还是说要本大厨给你指点指点方向？
translated_text: まだぐずぐずしていますか？報酬が欲しければ、これらの食品を探すべきです!または、サービスエラーに関する経験豊富なガイダンスが必要ですか？
secondary_translated_text: Are you still whispering? If you want a reward, you should look for these foods! Or do you need expert guidance on service errors?

original_en_text: The Weaver-spawn, she has found it! Our pontiff’s sacred cylinder, stolen from the dark below...<page>Never! States our law. Never must our melody pass to a bug not Keeper! But you, fool Weaver, would shatter those tenants with reckless ease.<hpage>Your pontiff is gone, Vaultkeeper. Your fellows have fallen to husk or thread. What laws once bound these vaults died with them.<page>Ackk! Fine, cursed she. Claim the sacred song, and pain to you if we both are damned forever for it!
original_zh_text: 织者坏种，她得手了！她夺走主教的圣音筒……<page>休想！律法规定，圣歌绝不可外传！但你这坏种竟然轻易践踏戒律。<hpage>你的主教死了，管理员。同僚都化作空壳或丝偶，昔日的律法也随他们入土了。<page>咳！随你便，诅咒你。带走圣歌吧，愿我们永堕地狱！
translated_text: ウィーバー、見つけた!我々教皇の圣筒は、闇から盗まれた。<page>絶対にダメ!法律を説明します私たちのメロディーは虫にも守護者にも届かない!しかし、あなたの愚かなウィーバーは簡単にテナントを押しつぶすでしょう。<hpage>あなたの教皇はいなくなった、金庫の番人。あなたの仲間は貝殻かロープに落ちた。これらの財源を管理していた法律も消滅した。<page>アッコ!ああ、彼女を呪う。この聖なる歌を唱えなさい。もし私たちが永遠に呪われるなら、あなたは苦しむでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: Weaver, we found it! Our Pope's Ark was stolen from the darkness.<page>no way! Explain the law Our melodies do not reach the worms nor the guardians! But your stupid weaver will easily crush the tenant.<hpage>Your pope is gone, keeper of the treasury. Your companion has fallen on a shell or rope. The laws that governed these financial resources have also disappeared.<page>okay! Oh, curse her. Sing this holy song. " If we were to be cursed forever, you would suffer.

original_en_text: <hpage>I return, bug, and ask to hear your melody again, that I may lock it clear in my mind.<page>Very well, good pilgrim. For one so fiercely devout as yourself, gladly will I give this gift.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我回来了，请你再演奏一遍旋律，我要记牢。<page>好，虔信者。为了你这般赤诚，我很乐意演奏。
translated_text: <hpage>私は戻ってきた、バグ、あなたのメロディーをもう一度聞いてほしい、私の頭の中ではっきりとロックできるように。<page>非常に良い巡礼者。あなたのような敬虔な人に、私はあなたにこの贈り物を与えます。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I'm back, Bug, I want you to hear your melody one more time, so I can lock it in my head clearly.<page>A very good pilgrim. To a godly person like you, I give you this gift.

original_en_text: <hpage>Your master seems satisfied, sir. It is time you gave what was promised.<page>Yes. Yes! It has been done! Made and served. A dish to match my master’s refined desires.<page>The pale trifle is yours. Take it and leave! My master needs time to reflect, and I must ponder on flavours anew!
original_zh_text: <hpage>你的主人看来很满意，该兑现承诺了吧？<page>对，对！主人吃得很满意！<page>苍白油是你的了，拿走吧！主人还要好好回味，我也要构思新菜式了！
translated_text: <hpage>ご主人様は満足しているようですね。約束を守る時が来た。<page>はい、はい!終わった!ご主人様のご要望に応える料理が用意されています。<page>この小さな白いものはあなたのものです。持って行け!マスターは反省する時間が必要ですが、私は自分の好みを考え直す必要があります!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Your owner seems to be satisfied with it. It's time to keep our promises.<page>yes, yes! it's over! The dishes are prepared to meet the requests of the host.<page>This little white thing is yours. Take it with you! The master needs time to reflect, but I need to rethink my preferences!

original_en_text: <hpage>Vaultkeeper, I bring the psalm cylinder recovered from the dark chambers below here. I would learn its melody.<page>Kak! Then pass it, filthy Weaver-spawn! A cylinder so sacred should not remain a moment longer in your grubby claws!
original_zh_text: <hpage>管理员，我带来了下层密室的圣咏音筒，要学习其中旋律。<page>咔！交出来，肮脏的织者坏种！此等圣物岂能在你脏爪中多留一秒！
translated_text: <hpage>財務官下の暗い部屋で見つけた賛美歌のチューブを持ってきました私は彼のメロディーを学ぶ。<page>止めろ!それでは、Dirty Weaver!こんな神聖な円筒は、もう汚れた爪には入れない!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I have brought a tube of hymn I found in the dark room under the treasurer I learn his melody.<page>stop it! So, Dirty Weaver! " Such a sacred cylinder will no longer fit in your dirty nails!

original_en_text: Hold them, will she? Covet them? Can she not part with such a small prize?<page>Remain blind fool she. This Keeper’s understanding stays with itself.
original_zh_text: 她想私藏？如此贪婪？连这点小礼都吝啬？<page>她就继续当瞎子吧。本管理员的智慧自会保留。
translated_text: 捕まえてくれないか？欲しいのか？彼女はそのような賞を望まないか。<page>盲目的に彼女を騙し続けても、保護者の認識は変わらない。
secondary_translated_text: will you catch me? do you want it? Wouldn't she want such an award?<page>Even if you blindly continue to deceive her, the parents' perception will not change.

original_en_text: Weaver-thing! Does she hope to spy upon our treasured records?<page>Within our vast store, always more there is to know, the old methods of prayer, to this land, to its rulers, and to the strength at its heart.
original_zh_text: 织者坏种！她想窥探我们的珍贵典籍？<page>在我们的浩瀚典藏中，有古老祷文，有统治之术，还有……核心力量的秘辛。
translated_text: ジヌは我々の貴重な記録を盗み見たいのか？<page>私たちの巨大な店と古代の祈りの方法の中には、常に土地、その支配者、そして中心的な権力について学ぶべきことがあります。
secondary_translated_text: does geneu want to steal our precious records?<page>Among our huge shops and ancient ways of prayer there is always something to learn about the land, its rulers, and the central powers.

original_en_text: She carries a precious cylinder! She must give it! Share it! Claw to claw!<page>Pass it! And this Vaultkeeper shall grant their wisdom. Just a small taste! A trickle! A glimmer! Of our Citadel’s sacred understandings.
original_zh_text: 她带着圣咏音筒！必须交出来！分享！交出来！<page>递过来！本管理员便赐予智慧。只需浅尝！一滴！一缕！圣堡的至高真知！
translated_text: 貴重なボトルを持っています!彼女がやるべき!シェアしよう! Paw to Paw!<page>パス!財務官は知恵を与えます。ほんの少し!ビープ!光の一つ!城の神聖な理解。
secondary_translated_text: I have a precious bottle! She should do it! Let's share it! Paw to Paw!<page>Pass! The treasurer gives wisdom. Just a little! beep! One of the Lights! Sacred Understanding of the Castle.

original_en_text: Woken, is this sentinel. F-f-f-functional, is its shell.<page>Still devoted, is this s-s-sentinel, and awaiting your commandment.<hpage>You speak, gilded one? I’ve no command for you, but my curiosity is piqued.<hpage>You call yourself a sentinel. What is it you are charged with protecting?<page>Defence of the sacred C-c-citadel, and the voices that fill it-t-t, is our eternal duty.<hpage>I had assumed as much. Yet look around you, gilded one. During your slumber, the Citadel has fallen, and its voices lay silent. This place is dead, or very nearly.<hpage>Some would argue that standing guard over a kingdom’s corpse is a foolish task, empty of meaning. I wonder then, will you still hold true to your charge?
original_zh_text: 苏、苏醒，本哨卫。功、功能正常。<page>忠、忠诚依旧，静候指令。<hpage>金甲虫，你会说话？我无意下令，但很好奇。<hpage>你自称哨卫，是在守护何物？<page>保卫圣、圣堡，守护其中圣、圣音，是哨卫的永恒之职。<hpage>意料之中。但环顾四周吧，圣堡已然倾颓，圣音皆已沉寂。此地已是坟冢。<hpage>守卫已死的王国已没有意义，你依然要恪守职责么？
translated_text: 目覚めたのは警備員。F-f-f-functionalはそのシェルである。<page>この警備員は忠実で、あなたの命令を待っている。<hpage>ゴールドって言った？命令は受けていませんが、好奇心が高まりました。<hpage>自分を見張りと呼ぶ。何を守る義務があるのか。<page>神聖なC-C城とそれを満たす音を守ることは、私たちの永遠の義務です。<hpage>私もそう思いますが、周りを見てください。あなたが眠っている間に城は倒れ、音は聞こえません。この場所は死んでいるか、ほとんど死んでいる。<hpage>王国の体を守ることは愚かで無意味だと思う人もいるでしょう。あなたは自分の義務に忠実ですか？
secondary_translated_text: The security guard woke me up. The F-f - f-functional is its shell.<page>This guard is loyal, waiting for your orders.<hpage>did you say gold? I haven't received any orders, but my curiosity has increased.<hpage>They call themselves vigilants. What do you have to protect?<page>It is our eternal duty to preserve the sacred C-C castle and the sounds that fill it.<hpage>I think so too, but look around. The castle collapses while you are asleep and you cannot hear any sound. This place is dead or almost dead.<hpage>Some may think that defending the body of the kingdom is foolish and pointless. Are you faithful to your duty?

original_en_text: One must not wander idle between these sacred shelves! This is a holy place. Reverence! It is demanded.<page>If the fool she wishes to view this Keeper’s collection, head to the listening room below.
original_zh_text: 休要在圣架间闲逛！此处是圣地，需心怀敬畏！<page>想看本管理员的收藏？去下层聆听室。
translated_text: この神聖な棚の間を歩き回ることはできません!ここは神聖な場所です。敬意を払え!それは必要だ。<page>ガーディアンのコレクションを見たい愚か者は、下のリスニングルームに行ってください。
secondary_translated_text: You can't walk around among these sacred shelves! This is a sacred place. Respect me! It's necessary.<page>Fools who want to see the Guardian's collection, go to the listening room below.

original_en_text: <hpage>My choice is made. I cannot leave. I must descend again, and see Pharloom freed.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我意已决，不能就这样离开。必须重返地底，解放纺络。
translated_text: <hpage>私の選択はなされた。私は歩くことができず、ファロが解放されるのを見るために再び倒れた。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>My choice has been made. I could not walk and fell down again to see Faro be released.

original_en_text: <hpage>The signs of battle here are clear, gilded one. Is it your charge then to hunt the haunted, even if they be of the Citadel’s ruling castes?<page>Defence of the sacred Cit-t-tadel, and the voices that fill it, is the eternal d-duty of the sentinels.<page>Termination, is the n-n-necessary fate of all those enthralled by the whispering Silk.
original_zh_text: <hpage>此地战斗痕迹明显，金甲虫。你的职责包括猎杀圣堡贵族中的被蛊惑者？<page>保卫圣、圣堡，守护圣音……哨卫永恒之职。<page>清除受魂、魂丝蛊惑……...是必要使命。
translated_text: <hpage>戦闘の痕跡は鮮明で金色に見えます。城の支配カーストに属していても幽霊を追いかけるのがあなたの仕事ですか？<page>タデルの聖なる都市を守り、その音を満たすことは、歩哨の永遠の義務です。<page>結末は、ささやきの絹に魅了されたすべての人々の避けられない運命です。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>The traces of the battle are clear and golden. Even if you belong to the castle's ruling caste, is it your job to chase ghosts?<page>It is the eternal duty of the sentry to guard the holy city of Tadel and to satisfy its sound.<page>The end is the inevitable fate of all those who are captivated by the silk of the whisper.

original_en_text: <hpage>Out there lie the endless wastes... If I cross them now, Pharloom shall fall to a black fate of my making.<hpage>My choice is made. I will not abandon its bugs to that grim end. I must descend again, and cut them free.
original_zh_text: <hpage>若现在越过那片荒原，纺络将因我堕入黑暗……<hpage>我意已决，不能抛下纺络的虫民。必须折返，斩断丝缚。
translated_text: <hpage>無限の無駄があります。もし私が今彼らを超えたら、ファルは私が作り出した暗い運命に陥るでしょう。<hpage>私の選択はなされた。私はこの残酷な結末を導いた虫をあきらめません。私は再び彼らを救う必要があります。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>There is endless waste. If I surpass them now, the fal will fall into the dark fate I have created.<hpage>My choice has been made. I won't give up on the bugs that led to this cruel ending. I need to save them again, and I'm going to have to.

original_en_text: <hpage>Keep safe, Vaultkeeper. I may expect your service in future, and I’d not have you pass before that task is complete.<page>Gyak... No fool this Keeper. It has lived long, watched its fellows wither, but it shall not die, not yet, not while knowledge needs be sought.<page>This pact is made, Weaver-spawn, insight for us, both she and it.<page>This holy Citadel, in glory and fall, there are holes in its history, even to a Keeper’s knowledge, even to the vaults.<page>Seek the cylinders, she must, those objects of intricate insight. Bring more for this Keeper and only this Keeper, for in this Citadel none are left possessed of such sound, sharp mind as it.
original_zh_text: <hpage>好好活着，管理员。你还有用，别早早死去。<page>咔……本管理员不傻。活了很久，目睹同僚凋零。但只要尚有知识未明，就不会死。<page>契约成立，织者坏种。你我今后各取所需。<page>荣耀与衰落并存的圣堡，藏着连浩瀚书库都未记载的空白。<page>去找音筒吧，那些智慧的结晶。只献给本管理员，因圣堡再无这般敏锐之脑。
translated_text: <hpage>警備員への注意今後の任務を楽しみにしているかもしれません任務が完了するまでは通過させません<page>守護者は愚かではない。彼女は長い間生き、仲間が枯れていくのを見てきたが、知識を求める必要がある時、それは死なない。<page>ウィーバーの子孫にとって、この合意は我々のためであり、彼女とそれは洞察のためです。<page>栄光であろうと衰退であろうと、この神聖な城の歴史には穴があり、守護者たちが知っている限り、金庫にさえ穴があります。<page>複雑な洞察力を持つシリンダーを探す必要があります。この守護者にもっと、この守護者だけに、この城の誰もそのような声と鋭い心を持っていないので、より多くをもたらしなさい。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Attention to the guards, you may be looking forward to your next assignment, but we won't let you pass until the assignment is complete.<page>The Guardian is not stupid. She has lived a long time and watched her companions wither, but when it is necessary to seek knowledge, it does not die.<page>For Weaver's descendants, this agreement is for us, and for her and it for insight.<page>Glorious or in decline, the history of this sacred castle has holes, and as far as its guardians know, even its vaults have holes.<page>You need to look for cylinders with complex insights. Bring more to this Guardian, more to this Guardian only, because no one in this castle has such a voice and a sharp heart.

original_en_text: Pilgrim of Pharloom eternal, regale us with our Threefold song, that you may rise above and worship before our kingdom’s divine heart.
original_zh_text: 永恒纺络的朝圣者啊，献上三重圣歌，方可升华，觐见王国圣心。
translated_text: ファルムの永遠の巡礼者よ、私たちの王国の聖なる心を超越し崇拝するために、私たちの三重の歌で私たちを楽しませなさい。
secondary_translated_text: O eternal pilgrim of the Firm, entertain us with our triple song to transcend and adore the holy heart of our kingdom.

original_en_text: Still you tarry here, bug who calls herself a guest? If your idle claws need work, put them to service for our exalted Great Gourmand!<page>I must remain by my master, so you will need to leave the Citadel and gather the ingredients for their meal in my stead!
original_zh_text: 还杵在这呢？既然你闲着也是闲着，就帮我伟大的主人搜集食材吧！<page>我得守着主人，去圣堡外收集食材的任务就交给你了！
translated_text: あなたはまだここにいる、自称ゲストの虫ですか？あなたの怠惰な爪が仕事を必要とするなら、私たちの大切な友人のためにそれらを働かせてください!<page>私は主人と一緒に住まなければならないので、あなたは城を出て私のところに来て、彼らの食材を集める必要があります。
secondary_translated_text: Are you still here, self-proclaimed guest bug? If your lazy nails need a job, let them work for our precious friend!<page>I have to live with my master, so you must come out of the castle to me and gather their ingredients. "

original_en_text: A rusted statue of a pilgrim.
original_zh_text: 一尊朝圣者的锈蚀雕像。
translated_text: 錆びた巡礼者の像。
secondary_translated_text: A statue of a rusted pilgrim.

original_en_text: <hpage>To learn the melody upon this cylinder will require a working listening device. This one here has long ceased to function.<hpage>That last keeper still sane, in the vaults above... Their chambers hold just such a machine. I need only return.
original_zh_text: <hpage>播放音筒需要完好的设备，这台已经坏了。<hpage>之前在上层遇到的清醒管理员……他们的密室就有这种机器。我得回去一趟。
translated_text: <hpage>このコラムのメロディーを学ぶには、機能するリスニングデバイスが必要です。これは長い間機能しなくなった。<hpage>最後のゴールキーパーはまだ合理的であり、上の金庫には彼らの部屋にはそのような機械があった。戻ってくる必要があります
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>To learn the melodies in this column, you need a working listening device. This has not worked for a long time.<hpage>The last goalkeeper was still reasonable, and in the safe above there was such a machine in their room. They need to come back.

original_en_text: <hpage>Vaultkeeper, I recovered a psalm cylinder in the dark chambers below here. I believe it contains the melody unique to these vaults. I would have you play it for me now.<page>Kakrt! She has visited the pontiff’s depths and stolen the sacred song! Where is your respect, Weaver-spawn?! Our venerable dead deserve better than to have their chambers transgressed by your filthy foraging!<hpage>In this moment, Vaultkeeper, I’ve slim patience for your impudence. Either prepare the cylinder and stay silent, or ready yourself to learn regret.
original_zh_text: <hpage>管理员，我在下层密室找到了圣咏音筒。里面应存有此书库的专属旋律，我要你立即为我演奏。<page>咔！你擅闯主教密室窃取圣歌！织者坏种毫无敬畏！先贤安息之地岂能容你玷污！<hpage>管理员，我的耐心有限。要么闭嘴准备播放音筒，要么准备明白什么叫后悔。
translated_text: <hpage>金庫係、下の暗い部屋で賛美歌のパイプを見つけたこれらの宝物の独特なメロディーが含まれていると思います。今すぐ私のために演奏してほしいです。<page>カーク!彼女は教皇の深いところを訪れ、賛美歌を盗んだ!ウィーバー、あなたの尊敬はどこにある？私たちの立派な死者は、あなた方の汚い食料者を部屋に侵入させるよりも、より良い待遇に値する!<hpage>この時点では、財務官、私はあなたの無礼さにあまり忍耐力がありません。ガスボンベを用意して黙っているか、後悔することを学ぶ覚悟をしてください。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I think these treasures contain a unique melody, which the treasurer, the hymn pipe found in the dark room below. I want you to play it for me right now.<page>curk! She visited the depths of the pope and stole the hymn! Weaver, where's your respect? Our respectable dead deserve better treatment than to have your dirty foodie break into the room! "<hpage>At this point, Treasurer, I don't have much patience for your rudeness. Be prepared to keep your mouth shut with a gas cylinder ready, or learn to regret it.

original_en_text: Eggy, eggy! I want to lay a lot of pretty eggies! So tell the big ones, bring me more food!
original_zh_text: 蛋蛋！我要下漂亮蛋蛋！叫大个子们多送吃的来！
translated_text: 卵、卵!たくさんの卵を産みたい!もっと食べ物を持ってきてくれと言ってください!
secondary_translated_text: Eggs, eggs! I want to lay lots of eggs! Please tell me to bring you more food! "

original_en_text: <hpage>Your chambers are surely grand, sir bug, but it is plain to see you are no sovereign here.<page>Is our state so bare, pilgrim?... “By the will of the Conductors,” we once boomed, and this Citadel shook at our decree.<page>But the words... How hollow they echoed. The mantle of rule, claimed greedily from Pharloom’s fading first children, those bitter Weavers... it was yoke, not crown.<page>Now, in our Citadel’s silence, we share their truth. Only one monarch’s claws ever clutched this kingdom, though we raised our voices to cry otherwise.<page>Would you see her, pilgrim? Up there at our Citadel’s crown? Reach those heights we’d hoped to hide and bow before this land’s true ruler.<hpage>In time near, sir bug, I shall indeed climb to meet your monarch...
original_zh_text: <hpage>先生的居所虽大，却不像是贵族风格。<page>看着如此寒酸吗？当年我们高喊着"遵指挥家之命"，整座圣堡都为之震颤。<page>但激昂的呼喊现在也只剩空洞的回响。从垂死织者手中夺来的权柄，实际上却是枷锁。<page>如今在圣堡的寂静中，我们才真正明白……坐在王座上的从来只有那位。<page>想觐见她吗？登上圣堡之巅，向真王跪拜吧。<hpage>很快我就会登顶的，先生……
translated_text: <hpage>バグさん、あなたの部屋は本当に素晴らしいですが、あなたがここの君主ではないことは明らかです。<page>巡礼者よ、この国はこんなに裸なのか。“指揮官の意志によって、我々はかつて轟音を立て、城は我々の命令で揺れた。<page>しかし、この言葉。彼らのエコーは空虚です。ファラムの堕落した最初の子供、苦悩する織機は、貪欲に支配のマントを奪いました。それは王冠ではなく、鎖です。<page>そして今、城の静けさの中で、私たちは彼らの真実を共有します。私たちの叫びにもかかわらず、王の爪だけが王国を征服することができる。<page>彼女に会いたいですか、巡礼者？私たちの城の王冠？私たちが隠れたい高さに到達し、この国の真の支配者にお辞儀をしなさい。<hpage>すぐに、バグさん、私は確かにあなたの君主に会うために登るでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Mr. Bug, your room is truly wonderful, but it is clear that you are not the monarch here.<page>Pilgrim, is this country so naked? "By the commander's will, we once roared, and the castle shook at our command."<page>However, this word. Their echo is empty. " Pharam's fallen first child, the distressed loom, has been stripped of the mantle of domination by greed. It is not a crown, it is a chain.<page>And now, in the stillness of the castle, we will share their truth. In spite of our cries, only the King's claws can conquer the kingdom.<page>would you like to see her, pilgrim? the crown of our castle? Let us reach the heights we wish to hide and bow to the true rulers of this country.<hpage>Soon, Mr. Bug, I shall certainly climb to meet your monarch. "

original_en_text: Cleansed, is this place. Eternal, is the d-d-duty of the sentinels.
original_zh_text: 净、净化完成。哨卫之职……永存。
translated_text: 掃除、それがこの場所です。永遠は警備員の義務です。
secondary_translated_text: Cleaning up, that's this place. Eternity is the duty of the guard.

original_en_text: <hpage>Sir, I bring ingredients for the dish.<page>At last! My master is withering away from hunger! Let us see what gifts you bring.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我带食材来了。<page>终于！主人快饿扁了，快呈上来！
translated_text: <hpage>この料理の材料を持ってきました。<page>最後に!ご主人様は餓死!あなたが持っている贈り物を見てください。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I brought the ingredients for this dish.<page>Finally! Your master is starving! Look at the gifts you have.

original_en_text: <hpage>Will you tell me of those who guard this structure? They are servants of the Citadel, are they not?<page>Servants...? They too are penitents. In a past age, that caste committed their own sacrilege against the Citadel.<page>A sin long forgotten, but so grave that their offspring and the offspring of their offspring carry the guilt with them still. To serve here is their only hope of absolution.
original_zh_text: <hpage>可以说说这里的守卫么，他们是圣堡仆从？<page>仆从？不，都是赎罪者。祖辈犯下亵渎圣堡的重罪。<page>虽被遗忘，但其后代仍然在此服役，这是唯一的赎罪之道。
translated_text: <hpage>誰が建物を守っているのか教えてください。彼らは城の召使いですよね。<page>召使い...？彼らも悔い改めです。過去には、このカーストは城に対して独自の残虐行為を行っていました。<page>それは長い間忘れられていた罪ですが、将来の世代がまだ負うことができるほど深刻です。ここで奉仕することが恩赦を受ける唯一の希望です。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Tell me who is guarding the building. They are the servants of the castle, right?<page>a servant...? They are repentant too. In the past, this caste had committed atrocities of its own against the castle.<page>It is a sin that has long been forgotten, but it is so serious that future generations can still bear it. Serving here is the only hope of receiving pardon.

original_en_text: Pilgrim of Pharloom eternal, regale us with our Threefold song, that you may rise above and worship before our kingdom’s divine heart.
original_zh_text: 永恒纺络的朝圣者啊，献上三重圣歌，方可升华，觐见王国圣心。
translated_text: ファルムの永遠の巡礼者よ、私たちの王国の聖なる心を超越し崇拝するために、私たちの三重の歌で私たちを楽しませなさい。
secondary_translated_text: O eternal pilgrim of the Firm, entertain us with our triple song to transcend and adore the holy heart of our kingdom.

original_en_text: <hpage>If this place was holy once, no evidence remains. Even as a prison, it has been neglected.<hpage>If you wish, I can free you. You can descend through the caverns below until you find a settlement.<page>You... are asking me to leave this place? Wh-what a strange, fearful thought! Such a sin would never... no.<page>By the grace of the Citadel, I am here as a penitent. Here, I can hide from the shame of my sins until they are withered away by time.<page>Leave this place...? Please! Strike me down dead before you speak such blasphemy again!
original_zh_text: <hpage>若这里曾是圣地，如今也面目全非，连监狱都称不上。<hpage>想走的话，我可以放你下去，直到找到聚居地。<page>离……离开？多么可怕的想法！这等罪孽万万不可……<page>承蒙圣堡慈悲，我在此忏悔。直到时光洗刷罪孽。<page>求你了！再说这种渎神之言就杀了我吧！
translated_text: <hpage>この場所が神聖だったとしても、その証拠はありません。刑務所としても無視されている。<hpage>あなたが望むなら、私はあなたを解放します。集落を見つけるまで洞窟を通り抜けることができます。<page>あなたは..。この場所から出たいのか？なんと奇妙で恐ろしい考えでしょう!そのような犯罪は決して起こらない。号号は<page>城の恵みに感謝して、私は告白者としてここに来ました。ここで、私は自分の罪の恥を、時間によって枯れてしまうまで隠すことができます。<page>この場所から出て..。このような冒涜的なことを言う前に、私を殺してください。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Even if this place was sacred, there is no evidence of it. They are also ignored as prisons.<hpage>If you wish, I will release you. You can walk through the caves until you find a settlement.<page>You are a... do you want to get out of this place? What a strange and frightening thought! Such a crime would never happen. number is<page>Thanks to the grace of the castle, I have come here as a confessor. Here, I can hide the shame of my sins until they wither away with time. "<page>Get out of this place... Before you say such blasphemous things, please kill me. "

original_en_text: The mantle of conductor weighs heavy. Had I known the cost before its bearing, would I have accepted the duty?
original_zh_text: 指挥之职重若千钧。如果早知这份代价，我还会接过这担子吗？
translated_text: 運転手のマントは重い。費用を負担する前に知っていたら、その責任を受け入れますか？
secondary_translated_text: The driver 's coat is heavy. If you knew before you incurred the cost, would you accept the responsibility?

original_en_text: S... song, is it? You have brought song? You are of the Citadel, then? How... how many of you?<hpage>I am alone, sir. You needn’t fear, I am no servant of the Citadel. Are you a prisoner of theirs?<page>P... prisoner? I understand you not. There is no prison here.<page>This is a holy place of forgiveness. Please, speak with reverence.
original_zh_text: 歌……歌声？你带了歌？是圣堡的？来了……来了多少？<hpage>就我一个。别怕，我不是圣堡的走狗。你是他们的囚犯吗？<page>囚……囚犯？听不懂。<page>这儿是赎罪圣地，请怀着敬畏之心说话。
translated_text: それは..。歌ですよね。歌を持ってきた？お城から来たの？どうして..。何人いるの？<hpage>私は一人です。恐れるな俺は城の僕じゃないあなたは囚人ですか？<page>P..。囚人か？理解できないわ刑務所はない。<page>これは赦しの聖地です。丁寧に話してください。
secondary_translated_text: It's a... It's a song, right? did you bring a song? are you from the castle? Why is it... how many are there?<hpage>I'm alone. " don't be afraid. i'm not the castle's servant. are you a prisoner?<page>P... a prisoner? I don't understand. There's no jail.<page>This is the sanctuary of forgiveness. Please speak carefully.

original_en_text: As it was sung, our song sustains.<page>For Pharloom eternal, we shall build.
original_zh_text: 歌咏不息，圣域不堕。<page>为永恒纺络，我等筑造。
translated_text: それが終わっても、歌はまだ流れている。<page>永遠のファルのために、我々は構築する。
secondary_translated_text: Even when it's over, the song is still flowing.<page>For the eternal fal, we build.

original_en_text: We would hear the song of the Architects, at the core of our Citadel.<page>They who sustain our realm, its walls, its floors and its voice, even as others fall silent.
original_zh_text: 我等欲闻建筑匠团之歌，响彻圣堡核心。<page>他们维系疆域、高墙、楼宇与圣音，纵使万籁俱寂。
translated_text: 城の真ん中で建築家の歌声が聞こえてきます。<page>彼らは私たちの王国、その壁、その床、そしてその音を守っています。
secondary_translated_text: In the middle of the castle you can hear the architect singing.<page>They are guarding our kingdom, its walls, its floors, and its sound.

original_en_text: A Crustnut! Stale and dull, you’ll be thinking, yes? But ground to finest powder, that’s when its tart taste blooms!
original_zh_text: 硬壳果！你是不是觉得又干又不新鲜？得磨成粉才有酸香味！
translated_text: 狂った!古くて退屈だと思いますよね。しかし、それを最高の粉末に粉砕すると、その酸味が開花します!
secondary_translated_text: Crazy! You think it's old and boring. But when you grind it into the best powder, its sour taste will bloom!

original_en_text: <hpage>If I’m to learn the melody upon this cylinder, I’ll first need to find a working device to play it. This one here has long ceased to function.<hpage>The vaults above would surely hold another such device. I must search thoroughly.
original_zh_text: <hpage>要解读音筒旋律，先得找到能用的设备。这台早就坏了。<hpage>上层书库肯定还有，我得仔细寻找。
translated_text: <hpage>このシリンダーのメロディーを学ぶには、まずそれを演奏するための装置を見つける必要があります。これは長い間機能しなくなった。<hpage>上の金庫にはもう一つの装置があるはずです。徹底的に調べなければならない
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>To learn the melody of this cylinder, you must first find the equipment to play it. This has not worked for a long time.<hpage>There should be another device in the safe above. we have to look into it thoroughly.

original_en_text: You! Mite or mourner! Fell fated chosen left till last!<page>Relent! Submit! The fatal blow was struck. Fair Pharloom wails its end.<page>We woe befallen few remained, let us join here, at last, and show our fires fierce.<page>Together to share our kingdom’s pain, feel it scorch our shells, and know clear its suffering, its sorrow!
original_zh_text: 你！蝼蚁或悼亡者！最后的倒霉蛋！<page>认命吧！致命一击已出，纺络在哀嚎！<page>让我们这些余孽在此共赴末路！<page>共品王国的灼痛，让烈焰焚尽甲壳！
translated_text: お前だ!虫はまだ喪主です!運命は最後まで左を選ぶ!<page>寛容!降伏せよ!致命的な打撃が来る。フェア·ファールームはその終わりを嘆いた。<page>私たちの不幸は残りの少数に降り注ぎ、私たちはついにここに加わり、私たちの炎の激しさを示しました。<page>私たちの王国の痛みを分かち合い、私たちの殻を焦がすのを感じ、その痛みと悲しみを理解しなさい。
secondary_translated_text: it's you! The worm is still the mourner! Fate chooses the left to the end!<page>Tolerance! Surrender! A deadly blow is coming. Fair Farum lamented the end of it.<page>Our misfortunes have descended upon the remaining few, and we have at last joined here, and shown the intensity of our flame.<page>Share the pain of our kingdom, feel the scorching of our shells, and understand its pain and sorrow.

original_en_text: Our song upon a silken thread.... Such beautiful sound, so long absent from our halls.<page>Keep safe our melody, good pilgrim. You shall likely be the last to receive it.
original_zh_text: 丝弦上的旋律啊……殿堂久违的天籁。<page>请妥善保存我们的旋律，你怕是最后一位听到此曲的了。
translated_text: 歌はSilkにあります。この部屋にはもうこんな美しい音はない。<page>私たちのメロディーを守れ、良き巡礼者。あなたはそれを受け取る最後の人かもしれません。
secondary_translated_text: The song is in Silk. There is no such beautiful sound in this room anymore.<page>Guard our melody, good pilgrim. " You may be the last person to receive it.

original_en_text: We would hear the melody of the Conductors, high in their gleaming towers.<page>They bearing the heaviest mantle, who would guide our land ever on to greatness.
original_zh_text: 我等欲闻执政指挥之旋律，萦绕辉光尖塔。<page>他们肩负千钧权柄，引领王国永续辉煌。
translated_text: 輝く塔から指揮者のメロディーが聞こえてきます。<page>彼らは最も重いマントを肩に負い、われわれの地を大いなるものに導くであろう。
secondary_translated_text: From the shining tower you can hear the conductor's melody.<page>They will bear the heaviest mantle on their shoulders and lead our land to greatness.

original_en_text: A visitor? Now this is rare.<page>I must apologise for not rising to greet you. After an age spent sickly, I find myself unable to lift from this bedchamber.<page>I hope, good pilgrim, our Citadel has shown you the courtesy deserved of a bug devout.<hpage>I’ve borne its hospitality well enough, aged one...<page>Ahhh... My sympathies, pilgrim... We have fallen so far. And now, sadly, if you’ve come seeking aid or understanding, I fear I too shall disappoint. <page>Whatever you would ask, I have only my melody left to offer. It is a simple thing, the smallest of gifts, but perhaps more special now, for it has been rarely heard in these quietened times.
original_zh_text: 有访客？这倒是稀奇。<page>恕我不能起身相迎，卧于病榻多年，这把老骨头动不了啦。<page>朝圣者能到这里不容易，希望圣堡对你这虔信者有以礼相待。<hpage>已经领教过它的待客之道了，老人家……<page>唉……抱歉，圣堡已堕落至此。如果你想求助，怕是要让你失望了。<page>我能赠予你的只剩这首曲子。虽然微薄，但在这孤寂的时代也算珍品。
translated_text: 訪問者？今日ではめったにない。<page>立ち上がって歓迎しなかったことをお詫びします。末期の病気の後、私はこの部屋から出られませんでした。<page>親愛なる巡礼者、私たちの城が敬虔な昆虫の礼儀を示すことを願っています。<hpage>1歳の子供の頃、私はそのおもてなしにとても満足していました。<page>あっ...。私の同情は、巡礼者。ここまで落ちました。今、悲しいことに、もしあなたが助けや理解を求めに来たら、私もがっかりするでしょう。<page>何を求めても、私は私のメロディーだけを提供します。それはシンプルなことであり、最小の贈り物ですが、おそらく今はもっと特別です。なぜなら、静かな時間にそれを聞いたことがないからです。
secondary_translated_text: Visitors? It is rarely done today.<page>I apologize for not standing up and welcoming you. After a terminal illness, I could not leave this room.<page>Dear pilgrim, I hope that our castle will show the courtesy of a pious insect.<hpage>When I was a one-year - old, I was very satisfied with their hospitality.<page>ah... My sympathy, pilgrim. I have fallen so far. Now, sadly, if you come to me for help or understanding, I too will be disappointed.<page>No matter what you seek, I will only give you my melody. It's a simple thing, the smallest gift, but probably more special now. Because I've never heard it in a quiet hour.

original_en_text: If the weight of your sins bear down upon you, you may remain here with me in penitence, sister.
original_zh_text: 若你自觉罪孽深重，可留下与我一同忏悔。
translated_text: もしあなたの罪があなたに降りかかったなら、私と一緒に悔い改めることができます。
secondary_translated_text: If your sins have fallen upon you, you can repent with me. "

original_en_text: Ah.... your s-song. So long I’ve sat in silence. Tell me... are all songs played now as exquisite as this? Or has time made my hearing unrefined?<hpage>This art is new to me, and my skill is limited, but your appreciation is not unwelcome.<page>Ahh. The beauty of it. It is almost painful to my weary senses. Perhaps though, this pain is merely part of my penitence. <page>Play on, will you? I would join your tune. Just forgive me if my voice has become brutish.
original_zh_text: 啊……你的歌。沉寂太久，现在所有曲子都这般动听吗？还是我耳朵钝了？<hpage>我技艺粗浅，承蒙你不嫌弃。<page>这美感……刺痛我麻木的感官。或许这正是赎罪的一部分。<page>继续演奏，可以么？我想试着应和，尽管嗓音已经嘶哑。
translated_text: あっ...。君の歌だ私は長い間黙って座っていた。教えてください。今演奏されている曲はどれくらい美しい？時間は私の聴力を不完全にするか？<hpage>この芸術は私にとって新しく、私のスキルは限られていますが、あなたの評価は歓迎されません。<page>ああ...美しい。私の疲れた感覚にはほとんど痛みがあります。この痛みは後悔の一部かもしれません。<page>遊び続けてOK？あなたの曲を追加します。私の声が失礼になったら失礼します。
secondary_translated_text: ah... It's your song I sat in silence for a long time. Please tell me. How beautiful is the song being played right now? Does Time Make My Hearing Imperfect?<hpage>This art is new to me, and my skills are limited, but your evaluation is not welcome.<page>oh, yeah. Beautiful. There is almost pain in my tired feeling. This pain may be part of the regret.<page>Keep playing, okay? I will add your songs. If my voice is disrespectful, I'll apologize.

original_en_text: You refuse to play our sacred melody! Why pause, Weaver-thing? Do you cower at the truths it may illuminate? Surely you are not the lesser sort that bows to fear?<hpage>When the moment calls, Vaultkeeper, I shall listen. For now, your task remains to keep the cylinder safe. And know, you shall answer to my blade if you fail.
original_zh_text: 你拒绝演奏圣歌！在害怕吗，织者？畏惧被照亮的真相？原来你也是怯懦之辈？<hpage>时机到了自然会听。现在你的任务是保管好音筒，若出了纰漏，我的针刃可不认虫。
translated_text: 神聖なメロディーを演奏することを拒否する!なぜ止まるのか、ウィーバー？あなたはそれが明らかにするかもしれない真実に動揺するか。あなたは恐怖に屈するような小さな男ではないのですか？<hpage>財務部長、私はそれを聞きます。今のところ、あなたの仕事はガスボンベの安全を確保することです。あなたが失敗したら、私の剣の責任を負うことになります。
secondary_translated_text: Refuse to play the sacred melody! why are you stopping, weaver? Are you upset by the truth that it may reveal? Aren't you a little man who gives in to fear?<hpage>Chief Financial Officer, I listen to it. For now, your job is to ensure the safety of the gas cylinder. If you fail, you will be responsible for my sword. "

translated_text: この詩に祝福を？
secondary_translated_text: blessings on this poem?

original_en_text: For our base, we require the gelatinous Mossberry Stew. Its concoction is a druidic art, a jealously guarded secret of the moss-painted caverns deep below us.
original_zh_text: 基底需要苔莓浓汤。配方是沼地德鲁伊的不传之秘。
translated_text: 私たちのベースには、ゼラチン状のモスベリーシチューが必要です。その混合物はドルーズの芸術であり、私たちの下の深い苔の洞窟で守られた秘密です。
secondary_translated_text: For our base, we need a gelatinous mossberry stew. Its mixture is the art of the Druze, a secret guarded in the deep moss caves beneath us.

original_en_text: Sweet fruit that grows in moist environments. Its seeds are toxic to most creatures.
original_zh_text: 生长在潮湿环境中的甜味浆果，种子对大多数生物有毒。
translated_text: 湿った環境で育つ甘い果実。種子はほとんどの生物に有毒です。
secondary_translated_text: Sweet fruit that grows in humid environments. The seeds are toxic to most organisms.

translated_text: 放浪者のマント
secondary_translated_text: The Cloak of the Tramp

translated_text: Pollip Heartシングル
secondary_translated_text: by Pollip Heart

original_en_text: Report of the Memorium and its maintenance.<br><br>“Containment fails. Memory lost. Excise outer. Maintain inner.<br>Shellwood stasis sustained - Remember.<br>Marrowlands stasis critical - Remember.<br>Verdanian environment exceeded - Destined to forget.”
original_zh_text: 忆廊维缮报告。<br><br>“封存溃败。记忆遗失。切除外区。维持内区。<br>甲木林封存稳定——须铭记。<br>髓骨地封存危急——须铭记。<br>翠庭生态失控——注定遗忘。”
translated_text: 記念館とその維持管理について<br><br>“失敗を止める。記憶の喪失。外側を外す。家の中にいろ<br>貝殻や樹木の停滞は続く。<br>重度の骨髄停止-覚えてください。<br>まばゆい環境を超えて-忘れられる運命にあります。"
secondary_translated_text: About the Memorial and its Maintenance<br><br>"Stop the failure. Loss of memory. Remove the outside. Stay inside the house.<br>The shell and tree stagnation continues.<br>Severe bone marrow arrest - remember.<br>Beyond the dazzling environment - doomed to be forgotten. "

translated_text: 花粉のコア
secondary_translated_text: The pollen core

translated_text: 含む。{0}貝殻の破片。
secondary_translated_text: Includes.{0}Fragments of shell.

translated_text: 狭い。
secondary_translated_text: Narrow.

translated_text: ノミユートピアのお土産
secondary_translated_text: A souvenir from Nomi Utopia

original_en_text: Nest fashioned from an old bell. Once set up, young Craws will occasionally roost within, filling the bell with shell shards and rosaries.<br><br>The Crawbell can be installed on the exterior of a home.
original_zh_text: 由旧钟改造的虫巢。安装后，腐囊虫幼体会偶尔栖息其中，留下甲壳碎片与念珠。<br><br>腐囊钟巢可安装在钟居外部。
translated_text: 巣は古い時計で作られている。一度確立されると、若いカニが時折巣を作り、貝殻の破片やロザリオで鐘を満たします。<br><br>クローベルは家の外に設置することができる。
secondary_translated_text: The nest is made of an old clock. Once established, the young crabs occasionally make nests and fill the bells with shell fragments or rosaries.<br><br>Clover can be installed outside the home.

translated_text: 地図はこちら&クイルは
secondary_translated_text: Map is here&Quill said

translated_text: ローラー。
secondary_translated_text: Roller.

original_en_text: Gem-like organ taken from a Flintbeetle. Produces incendiary sparks when abraded, and may explode if cracked or dropped.
original_zh_text: 燧甲虫体内的晶状结构。摩擦生火，碰撞易爆。
translated_text: 黄金の宝石状の器官。着用すると火花が発生し、破損したり落下したりすると爆発することがある。
secondary_translated_text: A jewel-like organ of gold. When worn, a spark can be generated and can explode if damaged or dropped.

translated_text: サン=ハル
secondary_translated_text: San-Halle

translated_text: マスク·ピース
secondary_translated_text: Masked Piece

original_en_text: Keepsake containing a precious memory. Can be used to expand a Crest.<br><br>Expand Crests in the Crest pane of the Menu.
original_zh_text: 存储珍贵记忆的纪念盒，用于扩展纹章容量。<br><br>可在菜单的纹章界面扩展纹章容量。
translated_text: 大切な思い出を込めた記念品。Crestの拡張に使用できます。<br><br>メニューの“クラウン”パネルで“クラウン”を展開します。
secondary_translated_text: A souvenir with precious memories. You can use it to extend Crest.<br><br>In the "Crown" panel of the menu, expand "Crown."

original_en_text: Defeat foes to add their records to the Journal.
original_zh_text: 击败敌人后，其信息会被录入日志。
translated_text: 敵を倒し、日記に記録を追加します。
secondary_translated_text: Defeat enemies and add a record to your diary.

original_en_text: Review defeated foes in the Journal pane of the Menu.
original_zh_text: 在菜单的日志界面查看已击败敌人的信息。
translated_text: 敗北した敵はメニューの“日記”パネルで確認できます。
secondary_translated_text: Defeated enemies can be viewed in the "Diary" panel of the menu.

translated_text: 戻ってきた
secondary_translated_text: he's back.

original_en_text: Basic pouch designed for holding tools, traps and crafting materials.
original_zh_text: 基础工具袋，可收纳工具、陷阱与制作材料。
translated_text: 基本袋は工具、トラップ、加工材料を収納するように設計されています。
secondary_translated_text: The basic bag is designed to hold tools, traps and processing materials.

translated_text: Sprintmaster SwiftはPharloomで最速のバグに金色のトロフィーを授与した。
secondary_translated_text: Sprintmaster Swift awarded the fastest bug a gold trophy at Pharloom.

original_en_text: Reassembled cogwork heart, containing a fine array of wheels and regulators.
original_zh_text: 重组后的完整机心，内含精密的轮组阵列。
translated_text: 再組み立てられたギアセンターには、洗練されたホイールと調整装置が含まれます。
secondary_translated_text: The reassembled gear center will include sophisticated wheels and adjustment devices.

original_en_text: Enlivened heart of Skarrsinger Karmelita. Its beat is steady and strong.
original_zh_text: 斯卡尔歌后”卡梅莉塔复苏的心脏，跳动稳健有力。
translated_text: スカシンガ·カメリタの心を生き返らせようテンポは安定して強い。
secondary_translated_text: The tempo is steady and strong to bring the heart of Skaringa Camerita back to life.

translated_text: プロジェクトを維持する？
secondary_translated_text: Maintaining the project?

original_en_text: Filthy rag, marked with the scrawl of an Underworker.<br><br>“So much suffering. Are we truly chosen, or have we sinned unknowing, and now are punished for it?”
original_zh_text: 污损的破布，一名劳累的圣堡工人在上面留下了哀叹。<br><br>“如此痛苦。我们真是被选中的么，还是因不知名的罪过而遭此惩罚？”
translated_text: 汚れた布には労働者の落書きがあった。<br><br>“それはとても痛い。本当に選ばれたのか？それとも無意識のうちに罪を犯して罰を受けているのか。"
secondary_translated_text: The dirty cloth had a worker's doodle.<br><br>"It's so painful. are you really chosen? Or are you unconsciously guilty of a crime and being punished? "

original_en_text: Forgotten Weaver technique. Sew rending runes upon one’s enemies.
original_zh_text: 失传的织者技艺。在敌人身上缝上撕裂符文。
translated_text: 忘れられたウィーバーのテクニック敵の体に涙のルーンを縫う。
secondary_translated_text: The Forgotten Weaver Technique Sews a tear run into an enemy's body.

original_en_text: An ancient mask carved from cold, pale ore. The mask protects the wearer, guarding their shell against damage.
original_zh_text: 由寒苍矿石雕刻的古面甲，穿戴后可抵御外部伤害。
translated_text: 冷たい青白い鉱石から彫られた古代の仮面。マスクは着用者を保護し、損傷からシェルを保護します。
secondary_translated_text: An ancient mask carved from cold pale ore. The mask protects the wearer and protects the shell from damage.

original_en_text: Voices of the Choir, raised in sacred song.
translated_text: 聖歌隊の歌が賛美歌の中に響いた。
secondary_translated_text: The choir's song echoed in the hymn.

original_en_text: Finely forged bell made from a gleaming metal.
original_zh_text: 用闪亮金属锻造的精致铃铛。
translated_text: キラキラした金属製の精巧な時計。
secondary_translated_text: An exquisite watch made of sparkling metal.

translated_text: 損傷した機器
secondary_translated_text: Damaged equipment.

original_en_text: Garment gifted to pilgrims on admittance to the Citadel. Its thick weave offers additional protection against wind and cold.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者获准进入圣堡时所赠予的衣袍，其厚实的织法能提供极佳的防风御寒效果。
translated_text: 巡礼者が城に入るときに得た衣服。その重い織物は、余分な風と寒さから保護を提供します。
secondary_translated_text: The clothing the pilgrims got when they entered the castle. Its heavy fabric provides protection from extra wind and cold.

original_en_text: High quality nectar of a long-lived aphid, kept in storage over many lifetimes to allow a complex maturation.
original_zh_text: 一种寿命极长的蚜虫所产的高质量蜜露，经数代窖藏熟成，风味醇厚复合。
translated_text: 長寿命アブラムシの高品質な蜜は、複雑な成熟に達するために何年も保存できます。
secondary_translated_text: Long-lived apricot's high quality honey can be stored for many years to reach complex maturity.

original_en_text: Grub that lives within and feeds upon Pharloom’s lingering Silk, born with the ability to sense Silk over great distances.
original_zh_text: 栖居于纺络残存丝脉中的噬丝蛆虫，生来具备千里感应灵丝的能力。
translated_text: フラムの浮遊する絹の中に生息し、それを食べる爬虫類は、遠くから絹を感知する能力を持って生まれました。
secondary_translated_text: The reptiles that inhabit and eat the floating silk of the frams were born with the ability to sense silk from a distance.

translated_text: マシンが立ち往生。
secondary_translated_text: The machine is stuck.

secondary_translated_text: Belway said

secondary_translated_text: Belholm Key

original_en_text: Chunk of dense coral-shell. Not fit for crafting tools, but claimed to have various medicinal properties if correctly prepared.
original_zh_text: 结构紧密的块状珊瑚外壳。不适用于制作工具，经处理可入药。
translated_text: 巨大で密集した珊瑚の殻道具作りには不向きだが、適切に準備すれば様々な薬効があると主張している。

secondary_translated_text: Key to the plate cells and channels.

original_zh_text: 由其创造者的灵魂纺成的精细丝线，因其非凡的强度和神秘特性而备受珍视。可用于治愈伤口、延续生命，以及编织强力的符文。

secondary_translated_text: The Rosary of the Rosary

original_en_text: A frustrating fiend. They flee beneath the bone whenever I try to strike them down.
original_zh_text: 恼人的小恶魔，每当我挥针便钻入骸骨缝隙逃遁。

secondary_translated_text: He is a depressed demon. Every time I try to take them down, they hide under their bones.

translated_text: キャプテン·ポンド
secondary_translated_text: Captain pound

original_en_text: Is this abundance a sign of purity or greed? The way faith is measured in this land is curious indeed.
original_zh_text: 这般财富象征着虔信还是贪婪？多数虫肯定视此等囤积为罪孽。
translated_text: この豊かさは純粋さか貪欲さのしるしか。この地で信仰を測る方法は実に奇妙です。
secondary_translated_text: This wealth is only a sign of purity or greed. The way we measure faith in this land is indeed strange.

original_en_text: Once they summoned song from their subjects. Now they rise only to command an end to those unstrung.
original_zh_text: 昔日的乐章指挥者，如今只为剿灭清醒者而挥棒。
translated_text: テーマから曲を出している。今、彼らは終わらない人々を指揮するために立ち上がるだけです。
secondary_translated_text: He has a song on the theme. Now, they are only standing up to command those who are not finished.

translated_text: シェルキングカーン
secondary_translated_text: Sherking Kahn

original_en_text: Automatons of impeccable construction, welcoming entrants to their chamber with a display of deadly dance.
original_zh_text: 以致命舞姿迎接访客的精密自动机。
translated_text: ロボットの構造は完璧で、致命的なダンスで部屋に歓迎されます。
secondary_translated_text: The robot's structure is perfect, and you are welcomed into the room with a deadly dance.

original_en_text: Mad matriarch of the Slab rarely seen outside her warren. From her all jailers are born and bred.
original_zh_text: 罪石牢狱的癫狂主宰，所有狱卒皆由其孕育。
translated_text: スレートの狂気の女王は、彼女の領土外ではめったに見られません。すべての囚人は彼女の下で生まれ育った。
secondary_translated_text: The mad queen of slate is rarely seen outside her territory. All the prisoners were born and raised under her.

original_en_text: Flight it possesses, but only just. It may lift from the stone, but those sad wings would never carry it far.
original_zh_text: 那对萎缩的翅膀勉强能使它们离地数尺，但没法飞多远。
translated_text: 飛行能力はあるが、それだけだ。それは石から飛ぶかもしれないが、その悲しい翼は決して遠くに行かない。
secondary_translated_text: He has the ability to fly, but that's all. It may fly out of stones, but its sad wings never go far.

translated_text: 巡礼の手引き
secondary_translated_text: Pilgrimage Guides

translated_text: トロブビオ
secondary_translated_text: Trobbio

original_en_text: Mindless infant larva, coated in thick slime.
translated_text: 脳のない赤ちゃんの幼虫の体は厚い粘液で覆われています。
secondary_translated_text: The body of a baby larva without a brain is covered with thick mucus.

original_en_text: Chief and chaplain of the Stilkin, forever raging against the Citadel that chokes their caves and sees them suffer.
original_zh_text: 斯提金部族酋长兼祭司，对圣堡切齿痛恨——圣堡毁掉了斯提金部族的洞穴，令其族虫苦不堪言。
translated_text: スティルキンの酋長と司祭はいつも城に怒っており、城は彼らの洞窟を封鎖し、彼らが苦しむのを見ていた。
secondary_translated_text: The chieftains and priests of Stilkin were always angry with the castle, which had sealed off their caves and watched them suffer.

translated_text: サーヴァント·ボラン
secondary_translated_text: Servant Boran

translated_text: アリタ
secondary_translated_text: Alita

original_en_text: An essential bug if one ever hoped to navigate that dark maze of stacks and scrolls.
original_zh_text: 如果没有此虫引路，没有其他虫能在那个由书卷堆砌的黑暗迷宫中穿行。
translated_text: 人が本や巻物の山の暗い迷路を横断しようとするなら、それは必要不可欠な間違いです。
secondary_translated_text: If one tries to cross the dark labyrinth of a mountain of books and scrolls, it is a necessary mistake.

original_en_text: Child of Verdania, fully capable to fight despite its young age.
original_zh_text: 翠庭的幼童，虽年幼却战力完备。
translated_text: ヴィルダニアの子供たちは幼いにもかかわらず戦闘能力を持っていた。
secondary_translated_text: Vildania's children were capable of combat despite their young age.

original_en_text: Their thick shroud leaves them sightless, yet it seems to matter little. They have no care for their own safety, wishing only to charge at those they sense as sinful.
original_zh_text: 厚罩使其目不能视，却仍疯狂冲击周围感知到的“罪人”。
translated_text: 厚いシュラウドが目を覆っていたが、それは重要ではなかった。彼らは自分の安全を気にせず、有罪だと思う人々を告発したいだけです。
secondary_translated_text: A thick shroud covered his eyes, but that didn't matter. They don't care about their own safety, they just want to accuse people they think are guilty.

translated_text: タルクラウ
secondary_translated_text: Talclaw

original_en_text: Large, gelatinous drifter. Chases away threats by hurling its bulk around.
original_zh_text: 巨大的凝胶状漂浮生物。利用自己身体冲撞，驱赶威胁。
translated_text: 巨大なゲル状ドリフト。脅威の規模を広げることで脅威を軽減する。
secondary_translated_text: A huge gel-like drift. Reducing threats by expanding the size of the threat.

translated_text: 合唱団長老たち
secondary_translated_text: Elders of the choir

original_zh_text: 纺络低地区域的暴脾气飞蝇，善于使用骨质头甲冲撞猎物。
translated_text: ファレム低地の的なハエ。ハードマスクを使って狩りをする。
secondary_translated_text: A fly in the lowlands of Falaim. He uses a hard mask to hunt.

original_en_text: Blade maiden of a once renown warrior sect, survived long beyond the rest of her order.
original_zh_text: 纺络曾出现过一个赫赫有名的勇士宗派，而这位女针客就是其最后的幸存者。
translated_text: かつて悪名高かったサムライのレディ·ブレードは、彼女の他の宗派よりも長く生き残った。
secondary_translated_text: The once infamous samurai Lady Blade has survived longer than any of her other sects.

translated_text: サーヴァント·エガム
secondary_translated_text: Servant Egam

original_zh_text: 能从前肢发射尖刺的极速飞翼勇士。
translated_text: 翼のある戦士は、前腕から鋭い羽毛状の突起を驚くべきスピードで発射することができる。
secondary_translated_text: A winged warrior can fire sharp feather-like protrusions from his forearm at astonishing speeds.

translated_text: ジャッジ·ジャッジ
secondary_translated_text: Judge, Judge

translated_text: 最終審判員。
secondary_translated_text: The Final Judge.

translated_text: ペイリー·ウォーデン
secondary_translated_text: Paley Warden

original_en_text: Leaping hunter of a bygone age. The swiftest of their sect, deftly skilled with spinning foreblades.
original_zh_text: 善用旋转刀刃的传奇猎手，曾以速度称霸整个派系。
translated_text: 過去のジャンプハンター彼らの陣営の中で最も賢い者は、巧みに前剣を回した。
secondary_translated_text: Jump Hunters of the Past The cleverest in their camp skillfully turned their fore swords.

original_en_text: They seek to slay their only chance at survival. Alas, any words would fall useless. I have only my blade to offer response.
original_zh_text: 它们想要斩断族群最后的生机。我任何的言语劝解皆为徒劳，唯有利刃能终结这愚行。
translated_text: 生き残る唯一のチャンスを狙っている。ああ、何も働かない。私はナイフを持って答えた。
secondary_translated_text: They are aiming for their only chance to survive. Oh, nothing will work. I replied with a knife.

translated_text: 未亡人は
secondary_translated_text: The widow

original_en_text: They call out to warn their fellows at the smallest sense of threat. A successful hunt here means staying silent and hidden right up until the decisive strike.
original_zh_text: 稍有威胁迹象便会向同伴鸣叫示警。在此地成功捕猎的秘诀，在于无声潜行直至发动致命一击前的最后一刻。
translated_text: わずかな脅威感を感じると、仲間に警告を発します。ここでの狩りの成功は、決定的な打撃の前に沈黙して隠れることを意味する。
secondary_translated_text: When you feel the slightest sense of threat, you send a warning to your companion. Successful hunting here means hiding silently before the decisive blow.

translated_text: 救世主を呼ぶ。
secondary_translated_text: Calling for a Savior.

original_en_text: Though the Weavers have long passed from Pharloom, this servant still performs its function.
original_zh_text: 纺络的织者虽已绝迹，这位仆从仍恪守古老的职责。
translated_text: 織機はファロを去ったが、召使いは任務を果たした。
secondary_translated_text: The loom has left Pharaoh, but the servant has done his duty.

original_en_text: Hard-shelled bug with a climber’s pin. Their pin, once aid, has become a weapon, though the bug is unrefined in its use.
original_zh_text: 身负硬壳的朝圣者，将攀爬用的长针作为武器，尽管使用手法粗陋。
translated_text: つる針のついたトカゲの昆虫。彼らのピンはかつて助けであり、今では武器になっていますが、間違った使用は完璧ではありません。
secondary_translated_text: A lizard insect with a stinging needle. Their pin was once an aid, and now it's a weapon, but its misuse is not perfect.

original_en_text: Huge ant hunter tasked to protect the stores and passages of its tribe.
original_zh_text: 守护部族仓库及通道的重甲巨蚁。
translated_text: ジャイアント·アント·ハンターの使命は、部族の商店や回廊を守ることです。
secondary_translated_text: The mission of the Giant Ant Hunter is to protect the shops and corridors of the tribe.

original_en_text: Staunch and skilled bladebug of a once flourishing land lost to time.
original_zh_text: 失落王朝的精锐刀虫，双刃技法堪称艺术。
translated_text: かつて繁栄していたこの地で、強くて熟練したブレッドボーは時間の経過とともに姿を消してしまった。
secondary_translated_text: In this once-prosperous land, the strong and skilled Breadboys have disappeared over time.

original_en_text: Aged pilgrim, overgrown with lichen and moss.
original_zh_text: 浑身覆满地衣苔藓的老迈信徒，会从胃囊喷射苔藓团块攻击。
translated_text: 年配の巡礼者は地衣類や苔で覆われていた。
secondary_translated_text: The elderly pilgrims were covered in lichen and moss.

original_en_text: There is no finesse in its use of Silk. It consumes its slim supply only to amplify its force.
original_zh_text: 它对灵丝的运用毫无精妙可言，只是消耗那本就稀少的灵丝储备来增强自身的力量。
translated_text: 絹の技術は使わない。その力を増幅するためにわずかな供給を消費する。
secondary_translated_text: No silk technology is used. Consume a small supply to amplify its power.

original_en_text: Steel horned floater, able to defend itself and its companions.
original_zh_text: 长有螺旋犄角的浮空甲虫，能够有效保卫自身与同伴。
translated_text: スチールホーンブイは自分自身と仲間を守ります。
secondary_translated_text: The Steel Horn Buoy protects itself and its companions.

original_en_text: Tormented will of countless husks made manifest in a pit of Silk dregs.
original_zh_text: 灵丝残渣深坑中凝聚无数空壳的怨念集合体。
translated_text: 無数の貝殻の苦悩の意志が廃墟に現れた。
secondary_translated_text: Countless shells of anguished wills appeared in the ruins.

original_en_text: That they ever hoped to keep their domain clean... What futility.
original_zh_text: 妄图维持这片土地的洁净……何等徒劳。
translated_text: 領土を清潔に保ちたかったのですなんと無駄なこと。
secondary_translated_text: What a waste of time it was to keep the territory clean.

translated_text: ファリード·ダイバー
secondary_translated_text: Fared Diver

original_en_text: I would very much like to feel their soft fur, if only they weren’t so hostile.
original_zh_text: 要不是它们现在对谁都充满敌意，我真想摸摸这身柔软的绒毛。
translated_text: 敵対的でなければ、彼らの柔らかい毛皮を本当に感じたいです。
secondary_translated_text: If you're not hostile, you really want to feel their soft fur.

original_en_text: This kingdom appears more advanced in metalwork than my own ever was, in great part due to the natural heat source at its base. Working in such an environment is an impressive feat.
original_zh_text: 此地的冶金技术远超我的故国，全因地下天然热源的优势。能在如此高温环境中劳作生存，实为壮举。
translated_text: この王国は金属加工に関しては私の王国よりも進んでいるように見えますが、これは主にその底にある自然の熱源によるものです。このような環境で働くことは印象的な偉業です。
secondary_translated_text: This kingdom of nature seems to be more advanced than mine when it comes to metalworking, but this is mainly due to the heat source at its bottom. To work in such an environment is an impressive feat.

original_en_text: Aerial worker lost to Pharloom’s Haunting. Bears a pouch full with flintstone which they will fling at intruders.
original_zh_text: 被丝咒侵蚀的空中劳工，随身携带一个装满燧石的袋子，投掷燧石攻击入侵者。
translated_text: 乗たちはファレムの苦しみのために死亡した。熊は砥石でいっぱいの袋を持っていて、侵入者にそれを投げつける。
secondary_translated_text: The passengers died because of the suffering of Phalém. The bear has a bag full of grinding stones and throws it at the intruder.

original_en_text: Haughty thespian convinced that only dazzling performance can raise Pharloom from the throes of death.
original_zh_text: 坚信华丽演出能拯救纺络的傲慢演员。
translated_text: 傲慢な俳優は、まばゆい演技だけがファロを死の苦しみから救うと信じていた。
secondary_translated_text: The arrogant actor believed that only dazzling acting would save Faro from the agony of death.

translated_text: スカヴィン
secondary_translated_text: Scavenger

translated_text: リーフグライダー
secondary_translated_text: Leaf glider

translated_text: クローヴィスの塔
secondary_translated_text: Clovis Tower

translated_text: 第四の合唱団
secondary_translated_text: The Fourth Choir

original_en_text: Hard-shelled insect common upon the surface of Shellwood Pond. Once a staple food for passing pilgrims.
original_zh_text: 甲木林池沼的硬壳水栖虫，曾是朝圣者途中的主要食物。
translated_text: 貝殻プールの表面に見られる一般的な硬い皮の昆虫。かつては巡礼者の主食だった。
secondary_translated_text: A common hard-skinned insect found on the surface of a shell pool. It was once a staple food for pilgrims.

original_en_text: Old knight consumed by black thread.
translated_text: 古い騎士は黒い線に飲み込まれた。
secondary_translated_text: The old knight was swallowed up in the black line.

original_en_text: I would not have guessed so large and marvelous a flea existed. I am pleased it saw sense before I had to strike a killing blow.
original_zh_text: 我未曾料想竟存在如此巨大的跳蚤。幸好它在最后关头恢复理智，免于我下杀手。
translated_text: こんなに大きなノミがいるとは思いませんでした私は彼に致命的な打撃を与える前に真実を見てよかった。
secondary_translated_text: I didn't think there was such a big flea I was glad to see the truth before I gave him a fatal blow.

original_en_text: A terrifying achievement of Pharloom, to build a construct so large and yet so nimble.
original_zh_text: 竟能建造出如此庞大却又灵巧非凡的构造，实乃纺络工造技艺巅峰之作。
translated_text: ファロにとって、このような大きな柔軟な建物を建設することは恐ろしい成果でした。
secondary_translated_text: For Faro, the construction of such a large, flexible building was a formidable achievement.

translated_text: バンドBaggerman
secondary_translated_text: Band Baggerman

translated_text: マエストロさん。
secondary_translated_text: Mr. Maestro.

translated_text: クソ野郎
secondary_translated_text: Fuck you.

original_en_text: Their rough, ridged shell grips tight to any surface. Even walls and roofs become pathways for these nimble bugs.
original_zh_text: 粗糙的带棱甲壳可攀附任何表面。峭壁和洞顶对它们来说都是畅通无阻的道路。
translated_text: その粗い隆起殻はあらゆる表面にしっかりと付着します。壁や屋根でさえ、これらの機敏な虫の通路になります。
secondary_translated_text: Its coarse, bulging shell adheres firmly to any surface. Even walls and roofs can be a passageway for these agile insects.

translated_text: 装備の警備員
secondary_translated_text: Equipment security guard

translated_text: 失われたガモン
secondary_translated_text: The Lost Chamomile

original_en_text: Nature distorted... This bug was born tiny and mild. The Citadel deformed it in futile hope it may sustain.
original_zh_text: 自然天性惨遭扭曲..……此虫原本小巧温顺，却被圣堡强行改造。它的改造者竟然妄想它能承受这种畸变……
translated_text: 自然は歪んでいる。これらの細菌は本質的に小さく穏やかです。城はそれを歪め、それが続くことを無駄に望んだ。
secondary_translated_text: Nature is distorted. These bacteria are small and gentle in nature. The castle twisted it, and hoped in vain that it would continue.

translated_text: スケルトン·スクーター
secondary_translated_text: Skeleton scooter

original_en_text: They would make effective hunting companions, though even without the Haunting I suspect their loyalty would always remain to their clan.
original_zh_text: 它们是优秀的狩猎伙伴。就算没有丝咒作祟，我相信它们也会永远忠于自己的部族。
translated_text: 彼らは効果的な狩猟仲間になるでしょうが、たとえ幽霊がいなくても、彼らの忠誠心は部族に永遠に残るとは思えません。
secondary_translated_text: They will be effective hunting companions, but even without the ghosts, their loyalty to the tribe is unlikely to remain forever.

translated_text: 馬たち。
secondary_translated_text: The horses.

original_en_text: Shell plated worm that lives beneath pools of shifting sand.
original_zh_text: 潜伏流沙之底的板甲蠕虫，突袭吞噬猎物。
translated_text: 流砂の池の下に生息する有殻虫。
secondary_translated_text: A shellworm that inhabits a pond of quicksand.

translated_text: 巨大なコケ
secondary_translated_text: Huge cock

original_en_text: Large male Driznit, ferocious and territorial. Fires its heavy coral mask at intruders.
original_zh_text: 领地意识强烈的雄性掷面虫，投掷其沉重的珊瑚面甲御敌。
translated_text: 大型のオスのデズニットは獰猛で輪郭がはっきりしている。侵略者に重いサンゴマスクを発射する。
secondary_translated_text: The large male Desnit is fierce and has a clear outline. Shoot heavy coral masks at invaders.

original_en_text: With its wranglers long dead, the Moorwing stalked the towers of Greymoor, feasting on passing pilgrims and tenders alike.
original_zh_text: 自从其驯兽师死后，荒沼翼主常年盘踞在灰沼的众多高塔，猎食过往的朝圣者和居民。
translated_text: レンジャーが死んだので、沼地の翼はグレイモアの塔をさまよい、通り過ぎる巡礼者や優しい者を餌にした。
secondary_translated_text: With the ranger dead, the swamp wings roamed the towers of Graymore, feeding the passing pilgrims and gentlemen.

original_en_text: Hiding its tongue amongst fronds so similar... There is impressive style to this one’s trickery.
original_zh_text: 将捕食舌伪装在相似钟乳石间的策略，展现惊人的欺诈美学。
translated_text: 舌をこんな葉に隠しておく。この男のトリックスタイルは印象的です。
secondary_translated_text: Keep your tongue covered in such a leaf. This guy's trick style is impressive.

original_en_text: Scissor-wielding bug charged to cut and spool fallen dregs of Silk for return to the Citadel above.
original_zh_text: 挥舞剪刀处理灵丝碎屑的工匠虫，处理好的灵丝会被送回圣堡。
translated_text: ハサミを振り回す昆虫は、落ちた絹の破片を切り取って巻き上げ、上の城に戻す。
secondary_translated_text: The insect, wielding the scissors, cuts the fallen piece of silk, winds it up and returns it to the upper castle.

translated_text: Cogwork Underfly
secondary_translated_text: Cogwork underfly

original_en_text: What seems at first a purely defensive mechanism may also be necessary to rid this creature of excess heat.
original_zh_text: 看似防御的行为，实为排出过量热量的必要生理机制。
translated_text: 一見純粋に見える防御機構も、この生物学的過剰熱を除去するために必要かもしれない。
secondary_translated_text: A seemingly pure defense mechanism may also be necessary to remove this biological excess heat.

translated_text: スラグ殻
secondary_translated_text: Slag shell

original_en_text: For his stern stewardship his legions seemed utterly loyal. For less combative bugs his would have been a hard rule.
original_zh_text: 其铁腕统治赢得了军团的绝对忠诚，但对非战斗种群来说则是暴政。
translated_text: 彼の厳格な管理のため、彼の軍団は完全に忠実に見えた。彼の規則は攻撃性の低い細菌にとっては難しい規則である。
secondary_translated_text: Because of his strict management, his legion seemed completely loyal. His rules are difficult rules for less aggressive bacteria.

translated_text: クラスター·クレイグ
secondary_translated_text: cluster craig

original_en_text: Remains of a Citadel bug possessed by Silk dregs. The husk will lash out wildly with the many sharp pins caught inside its thread.
original_zh_text: 被灵丝残渣控制的圣堡残躯，用丝线中缠绕的尖针发动无序攻击。
translated_text: 絹の残渣に憑依された城ワームの遺骨。貝殻は猛烈に発射され、多くの鋭い針がそのラインに引っかかります。
secondary_translated_text: The remains of a castle worm possessed by silk remnants. The shell is fired violently, and many sharp needles snag into its line.

original_en_text: Altered servant of the Citadel’s Whiteward, responsible for the cremation of husks and the recycling of Silk from their shells.
original_zh_text: 白愈厅改造仆从，负责火化躯壳并回收灵丝。
translated_text: ホワイトワード城の召使いは貝殻を燃やし、絹をリサイクルした。
secondary_translated_text: The servants of Whiteward Castle burned the shells and recycled the silk.

original_en_text: Short elder crawbug eagerly serving in their court.
original_zh_text: 热衷审判的矮小腐囊虫长老。
translated_text: 小さな老いたザリガニが宮廷で熱心に奉仕した。
secondary_translated_text: A small old crab served diligently at the court.

translated_text: スティルギン
secondary_translated_text: Stirgin

original_en_text: Theirs is the perfect shell for their duty, a wall of a warrior and an adept fighter. If I hope to claim their treasures, I must bring my best.
original_zh_text: 它们拥有攻防兼备的重型甲壳，能完美适配其守卫的差事。想要取得它们看守的宝物，必须做好全力以赴战斗的准备。
translated_text: 彼らの盾は職務遂行のための完璧なシェルであり、兵士や熟練した兵士のための高い壁です。彼らの宝が欲しければ、私は自分の最高のものを捨てなければならない。
secondary_translated_text: Their shields are the perfect shell for the performance of their duties, and a high wall for soldiers and skilled soldiers. If I want their treasure, I have to throw away my best. "

translated_text: 水の水
secondary_translated_text: Water of Water

translated_text: ゴールデン·リーフ
secondary_translated_text: The Golden Reef

original_en_text: Their bells would once have rung with hope and mirth, lifting the spirits of any climbing companions. Sadly, those instruments have turned purely to combative use.
original_zh_text: 这些钟曾为众多朝圣者奏响希望与欢乐的乐章。而今却成了投向清醒者的凶器——仿佛要砸碎最后一丝未被腐蚀的理智。
translated_text: 彼らの鐘はかつて希望と喜びに満ちており、登山家の精神を高揚させた。残念ながら、これらのツールは純粋に戦闘に使用されます。
secondary_translated_text: Their bells were once full of hope and joy, and lifted the spirits of mountaineers. Unfortunately, these tools are purely used in combat.

translated_text: 空隙の品質
secondary_translated_text: Quality of voids

translated_text: 漂流森の森
secondary_translated_text: Drifting Forest

translated_text: メモリシン
secondary_translated_text: Memorisin

translated_text: ラ·ヴァラガ
secondary_translated_text: La Vallaga

original_en_text: The way they skate along the water’s surface is so elegant. Surely it is a skill that can be learned? When time permits, I should attempt the task.
original_zh_text: 如此优雅的水面滑行技艺，或许可以通过练习掌握？待战事稍歇，我定要试试这 "凌波微步"。
translated_text: 水に沿って滑り落ちる方法はとても優雅です。これは習得できるスキルですよね。時間が許せば、この仕事をしてみたい。
secondary_translated_text: The way you slide down along the water is so graceful. This is a skill you can learn, right? If time permits, I would like to do this job.

original_en_text: A creature long familiar to me. I suspect that no matter how far I travel, if I descend deep enough they will always be there.
original_zh_text: 这种生物于我而言早已熟悉。无论我跋涉多远，只要深入足够的地底，它们必会如影随形。
translated_text: 昔から知っている生き物です。どんなに遠くまで行っても、深く掘り下げていけば、彼らは永遠にそこにいると思います。
secondary_translated_text: It is a creature we have known for a long time. No matter how far you go, if you dig deep, I think they'll be there forever.

original_en_text: When defeated, it splits into many smaller forms. Yet another remarkable creature of this land before the monarch.
original_zh_text: 击败后分裂为多个小型个体。圣堡崛起前，纺络土地上又一奇异而非凡的生灵。
translated_text: 敗北すると、多くの小さな形に分裂します。君主の前では、この土地は別の並外れた生き物です。
secondary_translated_text: When defeated, it splits into many smaller shapes. Before the monarch, this land is another extraordinary creature.

translated_text: 翼を持つ巡礼者の鐘
secondary_translated_text: Pilgrim's Bell With Wings

original_en_text: Winged insect with a flaky shell that perfectly mimics its environment.
original_zh_text: 拥有一副古怪甲壳的飞虫，能完美拟态周围环境。
translated_text: 翼を持つ昆虫で、殻は環境を完璧に模倣している。
secondary_translated_text: They are winged insects whose shells perfectly mimic their environment.

translated_text: ダニは
secondary_translated_text: and the ticks

original_en_text: Unnaturally overgrown Mossgrub, bred within the Citadel’s Memorium.
original_zh_text: 圣堡忆廊培育的变异苔原蠕虫。
translated_text: 城記念館は不自然な苔で覆われている。
secondary_translated_text: The castle memorial is covered with unnatural moss.

original_en_text: While these bothersome bugs are left free to forage, no loose rosary or trinket is safe.
original_zh_text: 只要这些可恶的虫子尚存，任何散落的念珠与宝物皆不得安宁。
translated_text: これらの迷惑な虫は自由に餌を食べることができますが、緩いロザリオや装飾品がなければ安全です。
secondary_translated_text: These annoying bugs are free to eat their food, but they are safe without loose rosaries and ornaments.

original_en_text: Younger form of a Muckroach. Attacks prey by leaping from the water and snapping with its flexible jaws.
original_zh_text: 淤泥蟑螂的近亲变种，形态更类似于蛆虫。
translated_text: ゴキブリの幼年期。水面から飛び出し、柔軟な顎で顎を折ることで獲物を攻撃する。
secondary_translated_text: Childhood of cockroaches. They jump out of the water and attack their prey by flexing their jaws with their flexible jaws.

original_en_text: Elite former hunter acting as the final line of defence before their mother.
original_zh_text: 精锐的猎手，曾作为最后防线守卫它们的母亲。
translated_text: エリートの元ハンターは、母親の前の最後の防衛線です。
secondary_translated_text: An elite ex-hunter is the last line of defense before his mother.

original_en_text: All are haunted here, the jailers and the jailed. Do they realise they will never leave this place? Or how long they have stayed already?
original_zh_text: 此处的狱卒与囚徒皆被丝咒侵蚀。它们可曾意识到自己将永远无法逃离此地？是否知道已经在这地方困了多久？
translated_text: 囚人や看守を問わず、誰もが幽霊になっている。彼らは決してこの場所を離れないことを知っているか。彼らはどのくらいここにいるか。
secondary_translated_text: Everyone, prisoners and guards alike, has become a ghost. Do you know that they will never leave this place? How long are they here?

translated_text: ミニーノ
secondary_translated_text: Minino

original_en_text: Such feeble creatures could only survive thanks to the rarity of predators in these super-heated caverns.
original_zh_text: 唯有在这缺乏天敌的高温洞穴中，如此脆弱的生物方能幸存。
translated_text: この脆弱な生き物は、これらの超高温洞窟で捕食者が少ないため、生き残ることができます。
secondary_translated_text: This fragile creature is able to survive because there are few predators in these ultra-high temperature caves.

original_en_text: Fully grown mollusc able to unleash a gushing torrent of burning fluid from its back.
original_zh_text: 成年软体生物，能从背部喷射灼热流体洪流
translated_text: 成熟した軟体動物は背中から燃える液体を噴出することができる。
secondary_translated_text: Mature molluscs can spit a burning liquid from their backs.

original_en_text: By this swooping menace, a simple bug could be easily overcome. More dangerous still, they rarely attack alone.
original_zh_text: 对于其单个个体，尚可周旋，但它们鲜少单独行动。成群俯冲时，普通虫类极易被瞬间击溃。
translated_text: このダイビングの脅威では、単純な間違いを簡単に克服できます。さらに危険なのは、めったに単独で攻撃しないことです。
secondary_translated_text: With this diving threat, simple mistakes can be easily overcome. Even more dangerous is the fact that they rarely attack alone.

original_en_text: A common enough bug, though not to be underestimated. The acuteness of their other senses more than makes up for their lack of vision.
original_zh_text: 一种相当常见的虫子，但不可小觑——它们其他感官的敏锐完全弥补了视觉的缺陷。
translated_text: これはよくある間違いですが、過小評価できません。他の感覚の鋭さは視力の欠如を補うのに十分である。
secondary_translated_text: This is a common mistake, but it cannot be underestimated. The sharpness of other senses is sufficient to compensate for the lack of vision.

original_en_text: Darting predator that clings fast to roofs and outcrops, often summoned to aid its larger companions.
original_zh_text: 擅长攀附在岩顶或峭壁的飞镖猎手，常被其大型同伴叫来支援。
translated_text: 屋根や露頭にしっかりと付着した素早い捕食者は、しばしば大きな仲間を助けるために呼び出される。
secondary_translated_text: Fast predators, firmly attached to roofs and outcrops, are often called in to help their larger companions.

original_en_text: Is it the Haunting that drove them to cackling madness, or was their unending toil the cause even before that?
original_zh_text: 究竟是丝咒导致了疯癫，还是在无尽苦役中早已精神失常？答案已无从考据。
translated_text: 幽霊は彼らを狂わせるのか、それとも彼らの無限の努力の原因か。
secondary_translated_text: Does the ghost drive them mad, or is it the cause of their endless efforts?

original_en_text: Short, nimble bug who uses barbed bolas to keep beasts corralled and caged.
original_zh_text: 矮小敏捷的饲育者，擅于使用带刺流星索圈养腐汁蟑螂。
translated_text: 小さくて機敏な昆虫で、短い刺し虫を使って野生動物を檻に閉じ込める。
secondary_translated_text: A small, agile insect that uses short stings to encase wild animals in cages.

translated_text: グルムサック
secondary_translated_text: Grumsack

original_en_text: Despite their youth, they are impressive opponents. It seems likely their tribe were trained for combat from birth.
original_zh_text: 虽然年轻却训练有素，显然它们从出生开始就被部族作为战士培养。
translated_text: 彼らは若いにもかかわらず、印象的な対戦相手です。彼らの部族は生まれた時から戦闘訓練を受けていたようだ。
secondary_translated_text: They are an impressive opponent despite their youth. Their tribe seems to have been training in combat from the time they were born.

translated_text: ビーグル·ビーグル
secondary_translated_text: Beagle, Beagle

original_en_text: Disciple of the Whispering Vaults, tasked to navigate its dim recesses to retrieve old scrolls.
original_zh_text: 低语书库的信徒，负责在幽暗的书库中搜寻古籍。
translated_text: 男爵が宝物庫でささやく使命は、闇の奥で古代の巻物を探すことだった。
secondary_translated_text: The baron whispers in the treasure vault that his mission was to search for ancient scrolls in the depths of darkness.

original_en_text: This one’s strength was much enhanced by stolen soul. They are not the first who tried to hoard it, or to mould it towards such violent ends.
original_zh_text: 靠着窃取灵魂强化自己的力量，他并非第一个妄图驾驭此力的施暴者。
translated_text: この男の力は盗まれた魂によって大いに強化された。彼らはそれを貯蔵したり、そのような暴力的な目的に押し込もうとした最初の人ではない。
secondary_translated_text: This man's strength was greatly enhanced by his stolen soul. They are not the first to try to hoard it or push it into such violent ends.

original_en_text: With all the refuse collapsing throughout their domain, the worker’s stiff shell would be essential if they held any hope to survive.
original_zh_text: 在废墟持续崩塌的领域，硬化甲壳成为他们最后的生存保障。
translated_text: 地域のゴミがすべて崩壊している中、労働者の殻は彼らの生存の希望にとって不可欠です。
secondary_translated_text: With all the rubbish in the area crumbling, the workers' shells are vital to their hope of survival.

original_en_text: Civilisation encroaches from this kingdom’s crown, but the lowlands are still ruled by great beasts. Its roar stirs something deep within me, some primal instinct.
original_zh_text: 文明从王冠之地蔓延开来，但低地区域仍是野兽的疆域。它的咆哮唤醒了我血脉深处的某种原始悸动。
translated_text: 文明は王国の王冠に侵入したが、低地はまだ獣に支配されている。そのうなり声は私の中の何かを引き起こしました原始的な本能です
secondary_translated_text: Civilization has invaded the crown of the kingdom, but the lowlands are still ruled by beasts. And that growl triggered something in me, a primitive instinct.

original_en_text: The poor creature has lived a life too calm and coddled. It would not fare well in the world beyond its walls.
original_zh_text: 这可怜虫一生过于安逸，若离开高墙庇护必难存活。
