translated_text: 信じられないほど..。あなたの性質は、人間のワームの性質とは全く異なります。あなたのは可塑的で短い。これは私の長い人生の中で見る価値のある素晴らしいことです。<page>私の力があれば、もっと助けられるかもしれません。
secondary_translated_text: It's incredible how... Your nature is quite different from the nature of a human worm. Yours is plastic and short. This is a great thing worth seeing in my long life.<page>If I had my strength, I might be able to help you more.

original_en_text: <hpage>Eva, I am seeking a tool, told to be somewhere in this structure. It is a snare device of Weaver make. Do you know of it?<page>I may, lady. Search over from here, on side where the moss meets the nest. There, my mothers built their tools, all traps and bindings. Small things, but tests for larger forms.<page>I still remember their thoughts as they worked, their desperation, and their hunger. Another hopeless attempt to wrest their freedom. All ended in failure, of course.
original_zh_text: <hpage>伊娃，我在寻找织者制造的陷阱装置。你知道在哪么？<page>有点印象。您可以去青苔与巢穴交界处搜寻，母亲们曾在那制造工具。虽是些小玩意，却是为了更大的图谋。<page>我还记得她们制作时的思绪，那份绝望与饥渴，又一次争夺自由的徒劳尝试。当然，终归失败。
translated_text: <hpage>エヴァ、この構造のどこかにあるように言われたツールを探しています。これはウィーバー製の罠です知ってるか？<page>できますよ、奥様。ここを見てくださいコケと巣の交差点ですそこで母は道具や罠や制約を作りました小さな問題ですが、大きな形でテストされます。<page>私は今でも彼らの仕事の考え、絶望と飢えを覚えています。彼らの自由を奪おうとする無駄な試み。もちろん、すべては失敗に終わります。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Eva, I'm looking for a tool that was told to be somewhere in this structure. this is a weaver trap, you know?<page>I can do it, ma 'am. Look here at the intersection of cockroaches and nests, where mothers have made tools and traps and constraints - small problems, but they are tested in large ways.<page>I still remember the thought of their work, the despair and the hunger. A futile attempt to take away their freedom. Of course, everything ends in failure.

original_en_text: Ain’t you come a long way, bellringer! Granting wishes, saving bugs, even rousing my sullen family to act!<page>The snare is set above, our power bound along its thread. To your sight it may seem a crude thing, but there’s fair strength to it... enough to quell a god.<hpage>You and your family have done me well, sir. I shall prove your faith in the meeting ahead.<page>Aye. Bring your best, bellringer. Call forth our great pale god. Cut her weak, then drive the beast down atop the snare.<page>Contact made will stir the snare alight, but only your needle’s song will awaken the spell in full. When that moment arrives, you’ll see it clear.
original_zh_text: 敲钟者，你这一路可够折腾！祈愿、救虫，连我那些沉默的同族都让你说动了！<page>陷阱已在上方布好，我们的力量都缠在丝线上。看着简陋，但威力足够……连神都能制住。<hpage>你们一族对我多次相助，我必将不负所托。<page>那就好，敲钟者，拿出真本事。把那苍白之神引出来，先削弱她，再逼到陷阱上方。<page>触碰陷阱就会激活丝线，但只有你的织针之乐能彻底唤醒术式。时机一到，你自然明白。
translated_text: あなたは長い道のりを歩んできた、ベル·リンガー!願いを叶え、間違いを避け、不幸な家族を目覚めさせて行動を起こす!<page>罠はその上にあり、我々の力はそれに縛られている。これはあなたには失礼なことかもしれませんが、かなりの力があります。神を倒すには<hpage>あなたとあなたの家族は私にとても親切でした。今後の会議で自信を示していきます。<page>あなたの最高のものを持参してください、ベル·リンガー。偉大なる神を呼びなさい。彼女の力を弱め、獣を罠に追い込む。<page>タッチするとトラップが発火するが、針の歌だけが呪文を完全に覚醒させる。その時が来たら、はっきりと見えるでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: You've come a long way, Bel Linger! Make your wishes come true, avoid mistakes, and wake up your unhappy family to take action!<page>The trap is upon it, and our power is bound to it. This may be rude to you, but it has considerable power. to defeat God.<hpage>You and your family have been very kind to me. We will show our confidence in the upcoming meetings.<page>Bring the best of you, Bel Linger. " Call upon the Great God. Weaken her power and drive the beast into the trap.<page>The trap fires upon touch, but only the song of the needle will fully awaken the spell. When that time comes, you will see it clearly.

original_en_text: <page>Lady, please. Permit me to look upon your nature, that I may offer clarity...
original_zh_text: <page>女士，请允许我深入感知，才好仔细说明……
translated_text: <page>マダム、お願い。私がそれを明確にするために、あなたの性質を調べさせてください。
secondary_translated_text: <page>Madam, please. Let me examine your nature so that I may clarify it.

original_en_text: Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bug’s. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing, worth my long life to behold.<page>If in your travels you are able to further evolve, return to me. With what power I possess, I may be able to aid you further.<hpage>Thank you, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 不可思议……你的本质异于凡虫。流动，嬗变，真是奇妙，是我前所未见的存在。<page>如果旅途中你再度进化，请回来找我。以我的力量，或许可以助你更上一层。<hpage>多谢，伊娃。若我本质确实再度进化，我会回来找你。
translated_text: 信じられないほど..。あなたの本性は人間の本性とは全く違う。あなたのは可塑的で短い。これは私の長い人生を観察する価値のある素晴らしいことです。<page>あなたの旅でさらに進歩することができれば、私に戻ってきてください。私の力で、私はあなたを助けることができる。<hpage>ありがとう、エヴァ。あなたが言うように私の性質が拡大すれば、私は戻ってくるでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: It's incredible how... Your nature is completely different from human nature. Yours is plastic and short. This is a wonderful thing worth observing in my long life.<page>If you can make further progress in your journey, come back to me. With my strength, I can help you.<hpage>Thank you, Eva. If my nature expands, as you say, I will come back.

original_en_text: <hpage>I have known your kind before, sir. Yours is a tribe that works and trades in power, and I am about to extinguish its prime source.<hpage>Once this is done, will you truly delight in a land so bereft?<page>Aye, well... My family’s marks are all over that trap. And we’ve spent a hard age avoiding the gaze of our god.<page>If we earned it now, after such open opposition... that’s a bleak conclusion none of us’d care for.<page>Now! My job’s done. S’time your grand business began! We’ll be wishin’ victory to you, bellringer, for all our sakes!
original_zh_text: <hpage>我曾见过你的同族。你们一族专门兜售力量，而我正要掐灭这力量的源头。<hpage>事成之后，这力量真空的世界真能让你们感到高兴？<page>哈……陷阱上现在全是家族徽记，我们也躲那苍白之神半辈子了。<page>要是现在因为公然反抗栽了……这种憋屈结局谁受得了？<page>好了！我活儿干完了。该你大显身手了！敲钟者，你可一定要赢啊，都指望着你呢！
translated_text: <hpage>あなたのような人を知っています。あなた方の部族は仕事と権力交渉に満ちた部族であり、私はその主な原因を取り除こうとしています。<hpage>これが終わったら、本当に愛する人を失った土地を喜ぶでしょうか。<page>私の家の目印はその罠にかかっています。神の目を避けるのは難しい。<page>もし我々が今勝利すれば、すべての国民の反対の後に。これは誰も気にしない悲しい結論です。<page>今だ!私の仕事は終わったあなたの素晴らしいキャリアをスタートさせる時です!私たち全員のために、鐘を鳴らす、私たちはあなたの勝利を望む!
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I know people like you, and I know you. Your tribe is a tribe full of work and power negotiations, and I am trying to remove the main cause of it.<hpage>When this is over, will you truly rejoice in the land that has lost someone you love?<page>The landmark of my house is hanging on that trap. It's hard to avoid God's eyes.<page>If we win now, after the opposition of all the people. This is a sad conclusion that nobody cares about.<page>now! My finished job is time to start your amazing career! For all of us, ring the bell, we wish you victory!

original_en_text: <hpage>You see one’s nature, Eva? It is a skill far beyond bugs.<page>One not without cost. My sight perceives a bug only through the imprint upon their soul. <hpage>You speak of their crest? That signifier of a bug’s essence and their invisible yoke born through a lifetime.<page>Crest? Yes, the old Weaver term. A simple word to attempt description of something so profound.<page>But wait. Your own nature... Is it?...<page>Lady, permit me to look deeper still, that I may offer clarity...
original_zh_text: <hpage>伊娃，你能洞见本质？这等技艺远超虫类。<page>自然是有代价的。我需透过灵魂印记窥视生灵。<hpage>你是指纹章？那象征虫民全部存在与无形枷锁的标记？<page>纹章？对，织者用的古称，试图以简单词汇描述深邃之物。<page>等等，你的本质……莫非……<page>女士，请允许我深入感知，才好仔细说明……
translated_text: <hpage>エヴァ、人間の本性を見たことがあるのか？それは間違いをはるかに超えたスキルです。<page>コストがないわけではない私の目は昆虫の魂の痕跡を通してしか知覚できません。<hpage>バッジの話ですか？昆虫の本質と生命の中で生まれた目に見えない鎖の象徴。<page>クリスティ？そう、ウィーバーの古い用語です。そんな深遠なことを一言で表現する。<page>あなたの性質を待っている。本当に？..。<page>女性、私はより深く理解し、明確な情報を提供できます。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>eva, have you ever seen the nature of human beings? It's a skill that goes far beyond mistakes.<page>Not without cost My eyes can perceive only through the traces of the insect's soul.<hpage>are you talking about the badge? Symbol of the insect's essence and the invisible chains born in life.<page>christy? Yes, that's an old term in Weaver. I can express such a profound thing in one word.<page>You are waiting for your nature. i really...<page>Women, I can provide you with a deeper understanding and clear information.

translated_text: 洞察力は？
secondary_translated_text: the insight?

original_en_text: Lady, Pharloom’s time grows short. If you are able to further expand your nature, I urge you return to me.<page>Any power I possess, I shall grant it for your aid.<hpage>My thanks, Eva. If my nature expands as you say, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 女士，纺络时日无多。若你能进一步突破自身极限，请务必回到我身边。<page>我拥有的任何力量，都将为你所用。<hpage>感激不尽，伊娃。若真如你所言突破极限，我定会回来。
translated_text: ファローの時間は短くなっているあなたの性質をさらに広げることができるなら、私に戻ることをお勧めします。<page>どんな力があっても、あなたを助けるために使います。<hpage>ありがとう、エヴァ。あなたが言うように私の性質が拡大すれば、私は戻ってくるでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: If you can further expand your nature, which is shortening the time of the Faroe, I suggest you come back to me.<page>Whatever power you have, I will use it to help you.<hpage>Thank you, Eva. If my nature expands, as you say, I will come back.

translated_text: エヴァを縛る。
secondary_translated_text: Binding Eve.

original_en_text: Stay back, twisted leech! Even lodged within another’s shell, your ravenous nature shines clear.<page>You shall not defoul this chamber, nor claim my soul. Begone!
original_zh_text: 退后，扭曲的寄生物！即便寄居他者躯壳也藏不住贪婪本性。<page>休想玷污此地，更别妄图吞噬我的灵魂。滚开！
translated_text: 後ろに下がって、歪んだネギ!他人の殻の中でも、貪欲な性質ははっきりと輝きます。<page>この部屋を破壊することも魂を奪うこともできない。逃げろ!
secondary_translated_text: Back up, twisted onion! Even in the shells of others, the greedy nature shines clearly.<page>You can't destroy this room, you can't take away your soul. run!

original_en_text: Lady... Incredible... Your nature is so unlike a mortal bugs. Yours is malleable, transitory. It is a marvelous thing. Worth my long life to behold.<page>Unbound one, though we know each other little, permit me to ask a selfish request.<hpage>Your talent has provided a great benefit, Eva. What is it you desire of me?<page>Only to have my own soul, my own memories, bound within your shell... As you have done with those others throughout these lands.<page>I would not define as a crest within you, but my small strength may still grant a final boon.<hpage>You ask to be subsumed? Know your mind would cease to be, in any independent sense.<page>To be united with one unbound... This is the kind of escape I once prayed for, though the weight of ages had almost made me forget.<page>Lady, would you grant me this request?
original_zh_text: 女士……不可思议……你的本质异于凡虫。流动，嬗变，真是奇妙，是我前所未见的存在。<page>无羁者啊，虽然相交尚浅，但我仍想提出一个自私请求。<hpage>你帮了我很多，伊娃。你想要什么？<page>请您将我的灵魂与记忆缚于您的壳中，就像您其他生物所做的那样。<page>虽然称不上是纹章，但或许能为您献上最后一份微薄馈赠。<hpage>你想被我吞噬？你要知道，那意味着独立意识将不复存在。<page>我明白，但自愿如此。能与无羁者合而为一……是我昔日渴求的解脱，尽管岁月让我几乎遗忘。<page>亲爱的女士，您愿意成全我吗？
translated_text: マダム·..。信じられないほど..。あなたの性質は人間の昆虫とは全く違います。あなたのは可塑的で短い。これは素晴らしいことです。私の長い人生に感謝する価値があります。<page>自由な人々よ、私たちはよく知らないが、利己的な要求をさせてください。<hpage>エヴァ、あなたの才能は私たちに大きな利益をもたらしました。私に何を求めているの？<page>私自身の魂、私自身の記憶を持つために、あなたの殻の中に縛られています-あなたがこの土地の他の人たちにしたように。<page>私はそれをあなた方の魂のバッジとは定義しませんが、私の小さな力はまだ最後の祝福をもたらすことができます。<hpage>入会したいですか？あなたの心は、独立した意味ではもはや存在しないことを知ってください。<page>制約のない人々とのパートナーシップ。時間の重さで忘れそうになったにもかかわらず、これは私が祈った脱出でした。<page>この要求に同意していただけますか、奥様。
secondary_translated_text: Madam... It's incredible how... Your nature is quite different from that of human insects. Yours is plastic and short. This is a great thing. I am worthy to be thankful for my long life.<page>Free people, let us make some selfish demands that we do not know well.<hpage>Eva, your talents have brought us great benefits. what do you want from me?<page>I am bound in your shell to have my own soul, my own memory - as you have done to the rest of this land.<page>I don't define it as a badge of your soul, but my little power can still bring you the last blessing.<hpage>Do you want to join? Know that your mind no longer exists, in an independent sense, and that you are not in the same place.<page>Partnership with people without constraints. This was the escape I prayed for, even though I was almost forgotten by the weight of time.<page>Would you consent to this request, Madam? "

original_en_text: Lady, you are a multitude within a single shell. A being truly unbound. To aid your growth has proved a grand task, even for one as limited as me.<page>As my last act, permit me to ask a final, selfish request.<hpage>Your talents have provided great benefit, Eva. What is it you desire of me?<page>Only to have my own soul, my own memories, bound within your shell... As you have done with those others throughout these lands.<page>I would not define as a crest within you, but my small strength may still grant a final boon.<hpage>You ask to be subsumed? Know your mind would cease to be, in any independent sense.<page>I know. And still I seek it, gladly. To be united with one unbound... This is the kind of escape I once prayed for, though the weight of ages had almost made me forget.<page>Dear Lady, would you grant me this request?
original_zh_text: 女士，您这具躯壳中存在万千可能，是真正无拘无束的存在。能助您成长，是我的荣幸。<page>最后，请允许我提出自私的请求。<hpage>你帮了我很多，伊娃。你想要什么？<page>请您将我的灵魂与记忆缚于您的壳中，就像您其他生物所做的那样。<page>虽然称不上是纹章，但或许能为您献上最后一份微薄馈赠。<hpage>你想被我吞噬？你要知道，那意味着独立意识将不复存在。<page>我明白，但自愿如此。能与无羁者合而为一……是我昔日渴求的解脱，尽管岁月让我几乎遗忘。<page>亲爱的女士，您愿意成全我吗？
translated_text: 1つの殻にはたくさんの人がいます。本当に自由な人々。あなたの成長を助けることは、私のような限られた人間にとっても困難な作業です。<page>最後のシーンとして、最後に自分勝手なお願いをさせてください。<hpage>エヴァ、あなたの才能は大きな恩恵をもたらしました。私に何を求めているの？<page>私自身の魂、私自身の記憶を持つために、あなたの殻の中に縛られています-あなたがこの土地の他の人たちにしたように。<page>私はそれをあなた方の魂のバッジとは定義しませんが、私の小さな力はまだ最後の祝福をもたらすことができます。<hpage>入会したいですか？あなたの心は、独立した意味ではもはや存在しないことを知ってください。<page>私はまだそれを探して幸せです。束縛されない人々とのつながり。時間の重さで忘れそうになったにもかかわらず、これは私が祈った脱出でした。<page>親愛なる女性、あなたはこの要求に同意しますか？
secondary_translated_text: There are many people in one shell. Really free people. Helping you grow can be a difficult task for a limited human being like me, too.<page>As a final scene, let me make a wish for myself at the end.<hpage>Eva, your talent has brought great benefits. what are you asking me for?<page>I am bound in your shell to have my own soul, my own memory - as you have done to the rest of this land.<page>I don't define it as a badge of your soul, but my little power can still bring you the last blessing.<hpage>Do you want to join? Know that your mind no longer exists, in an independent sense, and that you are not in the same place.<page>I'm still happy to look for it. Connecting with those who are not bound. This was the escape I prayed for, even though I was almost forgotten by the weight of time.<page>Dear lady, do you agree with this request?

original_en_text: Who’s there? Has someone come to free me? Or are you here to bring my end? <hpage>I am Hornet, prisoner, only a traveller and not here to slay you.<hpage>What cause sees you caged in these ruins of Weavers past? Were you their enemy?
original_zh_text: 谁在那儿？是来解救我的？还是来取我性命的？<hpage>我名为大黄蜂，只是一名旅者，无意取你性命。<hpage>你为何被囚于织者遗迹？你曾是他们的敌人？
translated_text: 誰がいるの？誰か助けに来たの？それとも私を終わらせるのか。<hpage>私はマルハナバチであり、囚人であり、ただの旅人であり、あなたを殺すために来たのではない。<hpage>何があなたをウィーバーの廃墟に閉じ込めたの？あなたは彼らの敵ですか？
secondary_translated_text: who's there? did someone come to help? Or do you end me? "<hpage>I am a marmalade, a prisoner, a mere traveler, and I have not come to kill you. "<hpage>what trapped you in the ruins of weaver? are you their enemy?

original_en_text: Lady, my senses resound. You have grown further beyond the bounds of a bug.<page>Permit me to gaze again upon your nature, that I may offer clarity.
original_zh_text: 女士，我的感知在震颤。你已远超凡虫界限。<page>请允许我再次深入感知，才好仔细说明……
translated_text: 私の感覚は反響する。あなたの成長は間違った境界を越えている。<page>あなたの性質をもう一度見て、私は明確な答えを与えることができます。
secondary_translated_text: My feelings echo. Your growth is crossing the wrong boundary.<page>Look at your nature once more, and I can give you a definite answer.

original_en_text: <hpage>How did you come to be sealed here, Eva? <page>Lady, you mistake. What seems a cage is as much my shell as the form inside.<page>I was born within this space. To leave would be my death, an uninspired end, though one I’ve sometimes wished would come.<page>I am unique, you see. My mothers shared the curse of their tribe, to conceive a child is a painful, near impossible task. <hpage>I know the curse well, Eva, for I am also its victim, and spawn of one who managed to overcome its limits. <hpage>Are you too an attempt to defy that cruel constraint?<page>A flawed attempt. A life spun from rune and shell, sustained only by its cage. My thoughts may mimic a Weavers, but my senses are my own.<page>Over time, that difference brought only distance between us.
original_zh_text: <hpage>伊娃，你为何会被困在这里？<page>女士误会了。这囚笼也是我的躯壳，与其中的形体并无差异。<page>我诞生于这里，离开意味着消亡，虽然有时也渴求这平淡结局。<page>我很特殊，母亲们承受着族群诅咒，生育子嗣近乎不可能。<hpage>我很了解这诅咒，伊娃。因为我也是受害者，更是突破禁忌的产物。<hpage>想必你也是对抗这残酷枷锁的尝试？<page>是失败的尝试。符文与甲壳铸就的生命，只能靠囚笼维系。我虽能模仿织者，但终究不是织者。<page>久而久之，这份差异使我们渐行渐远。
translated_text: <hpage>エヴァどうやってここに封印されたの？<page>ミス、あなたは間違っている。檻のように見えるものは、私の殻であり、私の内側の形です。<page>私はこの空間で生まれました。去ることは私の死であり、インスピレーションのない終わりですが、時々それが来ることを願っています。<page>私はユニークです、ご覧ください。私の母は部族と同じように妊娠は痛みを伴いほとんど不可能な仕事だと呪いました<hpage>エヴァ、私はこの呪いをよく知っています。なぜなら、私もその犠牲者であり、その限界を克服することができた人の子孫だからです。<hpage>あなたもこの残酷な制限に抵抗していますか？<page>欠陥のある試み。ルーンと貝殻でできた生命は、檻でしか維持できません。私の心は織物職人を真似るかもしれませんが、私の感情は私自身です。<page>時間が経つにつれて、この違いは私たちを近づけるだけです。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>eva, how did you get sealed up here?<page>Miss, you are wrong. What looks like a cage is my shell, my inner shape.<page>I was born in this space. Leaving is my death, an uninspiring end, but sometimes I hope it will come.<page>I am unique, see. My mother cursed that, like her tribe, pregnancy was a painful, almost impossible task.<hpage>Eva, I know this curse very well. Because I am also a victim of it, and I am the descendant of a man who was able to overcome its limitations.<hpage>Do you resist this cruel restriction?<page>A flawed attempt. Life made of runes and shells can only be maintained in a cage. My mind may imitate a weaver, but my emotions are my own.<page>Over time, this difference will only bring us closer together.

original_en_text: By your grace, I am at last broken from my fate.<hpage>Gladly I accept your union, Eva. No longer shall you suffer eternity alone.
original_zh_text: 蒙您恩典，我终于能挣脱宿命。<hpage>我欣然接受与你的联结，伊娃。你不必再承受永恒的孤寂。
translated_text: あなたのおかげで、私はついに運命から逃れました。<hpage>結婚してよかったよ、エヴァ。永遠に一人では生きられません。
secondary_translated_text: Thanks to you, I have finally escaped my fate.<hpage>Glad you're married, Eva. You cannot live alone forever.

original_en_text: Come no closer! I sense the forbidden blood coursing through you, that which grows and reshapes the world in its own vulgar image.<page>Whether it was imbibed willingly or not, none shall be allowed into this chamber while so afflicted. Begone!
original_zh_text: 站住！我能感知到你体内流淌的禁忌之血，那以粗鄙之形生长并重塑世界的秽物。<page>无论你是否自愿沾染此血，凡受其侵蚀者皆不得踏入这里。速速离开！
translated_text: 逃げろ!タブーの血があなたの体を流れ、下品なイメージに成長し、世界を再構築するのを感じます。<page>自発的であろうと非自発的であろうと、この苦痛の期間中、誰もこの部屋に入ることはできません。逃げろ!
secondary_translated_text: run! You can feel the blood of taboos flowing through your body, growing into a vulgar image, and rebuilding the world.<page>Whether voluntarily or involuntarily, no one can enter this chamber during this period of agony. run!

original_en_text: Lady, if in your travels you are able to further expand your nature, return to me. With what power I possess, I may be able to aid you further.<hpage>If my nature expands as you say, Eva, I shall return.
original_zh_text: 女士，如果你的本质再度进化，请回来找我。以我的力量，或许能助你更上一层。<hpage>若我本质确实再度进化，我会回来找你。
translated_text: 女性、あなたの旅の中であなたの性質をさらに拡張することができれば、私に戻ってください。私の力で、さらに助けられるかもしれません。<hpage>エヴァ、あなたが言うように私の性質が拡大したら、私は戻ってくるでしょう。
secondary_translated_text: Woman, if you can further expand your nature in your journey, please come back to me. With my strength, I may be able to help you even more.<hpage>Eva, when my nature expands, as you say, I will come back.

original_en_text: Lady, would you think again upon my last request? To be bound amidst your shimmering soul?<page>I understand it is a selfish thing to ask, and I will hold no ill will if you reject.
original_zh_text: 女士，可愿重新考虑我的请求？让我融入你璀璨魂灵？<page>我明白这是个自私的请求，若您拒绝我也绝无怨言。
translated_text: 私の最後の要求を再考していただけますか？あなたの輝く魂に閉じ込められた？<page>私はそれが利己的なことであることを理解し、あなたが拒否しても悪意はありません。
secondary_translated_text: Can you reconsider my last request? trapped in your glowing soul?<page>I understand that it is a selfish thing to do, and there is no malice in your refusal.

original_en_text: <hpage>I am sorry, Eva. I cannot grant you this. At least, not yet.<hpage>Yours is a mind strong and strange. That union could prove dangerous to my identity.<page>I understand, Lady. I will be here, if ever you reconsider.
original_zh_text: <hpage>抱歉，伊娃。我不能答应你，至少现在不行。<hpage>你的心智强大而奇异，联结恐怕会危及我的存在。<page>我明白，女士。希望您能改变心意，我会永远在此等候。
translated_text: <hpage>ごめんなさい、エヴァ、それは保証できません。少なくともまだです。<hpage>あなたの心は強くて奇妙です。この組み合わせは私のアイデンティティに危険をもたらします。<page>わかりました奥様。考え直していただければ、私はここにいます。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>I'm sorry, Eva, I can't guarantee that. Or at least not yet.<hpage>Your mind is strong and strange. This combination poses a danger to my identity.<page>I understand, ma 'am. If you'll reconsider, I'm here.

original_en_text: Thank you for playing the demo.
original_zh_text: 试玩版体验结束，感谢您的游玩！
translated_text: プレゼンテーションをありがとうございました。
secondary_translated_text: Thank you for the presentation.

original_en_text: They see your peace, woven of faith and toil,
original_zh_text: 赞美你以信仰与劳役编织的片刻安宁，
translated_text: あなたがたの平和は信仰と努力によって織り込まれ、
secondary_translated_text: Your peace is woven by faith and hard work,

translated_text: 第3幕の
secondary_translated_text: in the third act.

translated_text: ワスプ
secondary_translated_text: WASP

original_zh_text: 强烈建议使用游戏手柄
translated_text: 強く推奨されるコントローラー

original_en_text: - From ‘Pharloom’s Folly’ by the Conductor Romino
original_zh_text: ——摘自《纺络谬世录》 指挥家罗米诺 著
translated_text: - 指揮者ロミーノの“ファロの愚かさ”
secondary_translated_text: - "The Stupidity of Faro" by conductor Romino

translated_text: 第1幕。
secondary_translated_text: Act one.

original_en_text: They forget your heart, bound in slumber and servitude,
original_zh_text: 谁又记得你沉睡于桎梏中的野兽之心？
translated_text: 彼らはあなたの心を忘れ、眠り、奴隷になる運命にある。
secondary_translated_text: They are destined to forget your heart, sleep and become slaves.

original_en_text: They see your beauty, so frail and fine,
original_zh_text: 虫豸皆敬仰你纤弱的神迹之美，
translated_text: 彼らはあなたの美しさを見て、とてももろく、美しい。
secondary_translated_text: They see your beauty, so fragile and beautiful.

translated_text: 薬局は
secondary_translated_text: The pharmacy

translated_text: 深淵は
secondary_translated_text: The abyss

original_en_text: When you wake they shall see your truth,
original_zh_text: 待你醒来，挣裂千丝缠茧——
translated_text: あなたが目覚めた時、彼らはあなたの真実を見る。
secondary_translated_text: When you wake up, they will see your truth.

original_en_text: A beast’s nature bare to all.
translated_text: 獣の本性は誰にでも裸である。
secondary_translated_text: The nature of the beast is naked to everyone.

translated_text: 鍵のかかった時計の家
secondary_translated_text: The house with the clock locked.

translated_text: 建築ツール？
secondary_translated_text: Building tools?

original_en_text: Lift your voices. Know our grace.
translated_text: 声を上げなさい。私たちの恵みを知る
secondary_translated_text: Raise your voice. to know our grace.

original_en_text: Bug born of Pharloom. You have been chosen.<br> May our Citadel’s holy gilding harden your soft shell.<page>Stand eternal as our arbiter, that no bug bearing sin shall step within our sacred halls.
original_zh_text: 纺络的虫民，你们已被选中，<br>愿圣堡的鎏金淬硬你们的软壳。<page>作为审判官永远伫立，使罪孽之徒永不得踏入圣殿。
translated_text: ファロで生まれた細菌です。あなたは選ばれた。<br>私たちの城の神聖な金メッキがあなたの柔らかい殻を硬化させますように。<page>私たちの永遠の仲裁人として、邪悪な昆虫は私たちの聖なる神殿に足を踏み入れません。
secondary_translated_text: It is a bacterium born in Faro. You have been chosen.<br>Let the sacred gold plating of our castle harden your soft shell.<page>As our eternal arbitrators, the evil insect will not set foot in our holy temple.

original_en_text: A rune-scroll depicting void given form.
original_zh_text: 描绘虚空化形的符文卷轴
translated_text: 虚空を描くルーンの巻物。
secondary_translated_text: A scroll of runes depicting a void.

original_en_text: Sisters, spiders, watch these waters flow,<br>Cleansing, Binding, as Silk from shell,<br>Memories of our kingdom calm.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，观此净水长流。<br>涤荡，缠缚，如壳中抽丝，<br>抚平王国的记忆褶皱。
translated_text: 姉妹たち、クモたち、水を見てください。<br>清潔で縛られていて殻から取り出された絹のように<br>私たちの王国の記憶は穏やかです。
secondary_translated_text: Sisters, spiders, look at the water.<br>clean and bound, like silk taken out of a shell.<br>The memories of our kingdom are serene.

original_en_text: At the seventh bell toll, send:<br>Thirty measures, four beats Smokerock,<br>Eight beats Sweetsmelt,<br>Mark of fealty, all workers.<page>At the ninth bell toll, send:<br>Twenty measures, two beats Smokerock,<br>Seven beats Sweetsmelt,<br>Mark of fealty, all workers.<page>
original_zh_text: 七钟响时运送：<br>三十节又四奏烟岩，<br>及八奏甜熔渣。<br>全体劳工需示忠诚。<page>九钟响时运送：<br>二十节又两奏烟岩，<br>及七奏甜熔渣。<br>全体劳工需示忠诚。<page>
translated_text: 第7回ストライキのお知らせ：<br>30人のうち4人がスモックロックを破った。<br>8人を殴り、<br>すべての従業員の忠誠心の象徴。<page>9回目のストライキでは、<br>20の措置のうち2つはスモロックを破った。<br>7人が甘いスイカを打ち負かす。<br>すべての労働者の忠誠心の象徴。<page>
secondary_translated_text: Notice of the 7th Strike:<br>Four of the thirty broke the Smoke Lock.<br>He beat eight people,<br>Symbol of all employee loyalty.<page>On the 9th strike,<br>Two of the 20 measures broke Smlock.<br>Seven people beat the sweet watermelon.<br>Symbol of all workers' loyalty.<page>

translated_text: 講堂の地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of Auditorium

translated_text: ヴィダーニャの地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of Vidanya

translated_text: 地下の地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of the underground

original_en_text: When three fonts weep, our sacred shrine shall rise.
original_zh_text: 三眼泪泉涌流，圣坛自当升起。
translated_text: 3つの言葉が泣くと、聖なる神殿が立ち上がる。
secondary_translated_text: When three words cry, the holy temple rises up.

original_en_text: Damned are we! The lingered few bound still to suffer. Cursed thrice by Pharloom, to wait, to watch, to cry our anguish.<page>No more! We say! No more! We cry! We all have wailed and wept. Fair Pharloom’s fall has come at last. Its end we now accept.
original_zh_text: 万众受难！幸存者仍受折磨。纺络三度诅咒加身——苦候，守望，哀哭不休，<page>到此为止！我在此宣言！到此为止！我在此高呼！我们已流尽血泪。荣光纺络终将陨落，我们应接受终局。
translated_text: くそったれ!残りの少数派は苦しむ運命にある。ファルによって三度呪われ、待って、見て、私たちの苦しみのために泣いた。<page>もうだめだ!話をしよう!もうだめだ!泣いてた!みんな泣いて泣いた。フェア·ファールームの崩壊がついにやってきた。私たちは今、その終わりを受け入れる。
secondary_translated_text: fuck you! The remaining minority is doomed to suffer. Cursed three times by the fal, we waited, looked, wept for our suffering.<page>not anymore! Let's talk! not anymore! I was crying! We all cried and cried. The collapse of the Fair Farm has finally arrived. We now accept that end.

original_en_text: Litany of the Worker<br>May we catch the dregs and never tire,<br>May we clean the dregs and never hunger,<br>May we spool the dregs and never falter.
original_zh_text: 劳工祷词<br>愿我们滤渣不倦。<br>愿我们清秽不饥。<br>愿我们纺线不怠。
translated_text: 労働者は読み続ける<br>私たちは汚れに飽きることがない。<br>泥を取り除き、決して飢えることはない。<br>私たちは泥を巻き上げ、決して動揺しない。
secondary_translated_text: The workers continue to read<br>We can never get tired of dirt.<br>Remove the mud and never go hungry.<br>We roll up the mud and never get upset.

original_en_text: Oath of the Whiteward<br>While song must be sung, none may falter.<br>Infirmity. Sickness. Death.<br>All are banished from our Citadel.
original_zh_text: 白愈厅誓言<br>歌不可辍，虫不可怠。<br>孱弱、病痛、死亡——皆逐出圣堡。
translated_text: 白い誓い。<br>歌は歌わなければならないが、誰も動揺しない。<br>弱い。病気による死<br>全員が城から追い出された。
secondary_translated_text: The White Oath.<br>The song must be sung, but no one is upset.<br>Weakness. Death due to disease<br>They were all driven out of the castle.

original_en_text: Penitent, Fourth of the Fourth.<br>Guilty of the sins of infirmity, sickness.<br>Penance by swallowing.<br>Absolution granted after death.<page>Penitent, Twelfth of the First.<br>Guilty of an unnamed sin.<br>Penance by casting.<br>Absolution not granted.
original_zh_text: 罪者，第四组第四号。<br>犯孱弱、病痛之罪。<br>处以吞刑。<br>死后得赦。<page>罪人，第一组第十二号。<br>犯未名之罪。<br>处以流放。<br>不予赦免。
translated_text: 告白者、4位。<br>弱さと病気のせいです。<br>唾を吐く。<br>死後の恩赦。<page>告白者、12。<br>無名の犯罪が発生した。<br>キャスティングで有罪を誓う。<br>恩赦なし。
secondary_translated_text: The Confessor, 4.<br>Because of weakness and illness.<br>Spit out.<br>The pardon after death.<page>The Confessor, 12.<br>An unnamed crime has occurred.<br>I swear to be guilty of casting.<br>Without forgiveness.

original_en_text: Penitent, Eighth of the Twelfth.<br>Guilty of the sin of irreverence.<br>Penance by chaining.<br>Absolution granted after death.<page>Penitent, Second of the Fourth.<br>Guilty of the sin of dissonance.<br>Penance by silencing.<br>Absolution granted after death.
original_zh_text: 罪者，第十二组第八号。<br>犯不敬之罪。<br>处以锁刑。<br>死后得赦。<page>罪者，第四组第二号。<br>犯杂音之罪。<br>处以禁言。<br>死后得赦。
translated_text: 12月8日の告白<br>他人を尊重しない罪。<br>チェーンで説明します。<br>死後の恩赦。<page>^『告白』第4巻第2巻。<br>不協和音を犯した。<br>沈黙の告白。<br>死後の恩赦。
secondary_translated_text: Confession of December 8<br>The sin of not respecting others.<br>Explain it in the chain.<br>The pardon after death.<page>"Confession," Volume 4.<br>I made a discordance.<br>A silent confession.<br>Pardon after death.

original_en_text: Remains of a Muckroach crushed by falling rock.
original_zh_text: 蟑螂被落石碾压后的残渣。
translated_text: ゴキブリの遺体は落下した石で粉砕された。
secondary_translated_text: The cockroach's body was crushed by a falling stone.

original_en_text: Anguished Aura<br>Eight masks hard, swirled soul enraged.<br>Twelve aknids flat, all juices strained.<page>Six pilgrims living, hung long to drain.
original_zh_text: 苦痛灵氛<br>八具硬质旋魂怒面。<br>十二只阿克尼，榨尽汁液。<page>六名活祭朝圣者，悬吊沥干。
translated_text: 痛みのオーラ。<br>8つの仮面は硬く、魂は怒っている。<br>12個のaknidsを平らにし、すべてのジュースを濾過する。<page>6人の巡礼者はまだ生きていて、吸い取られるのを待つ。
secondary_translated_text: The aura of pain.<br>8 The masks are hard, and the soul is angry.<br>Flatten the 12 aknids and filter all the juice.<page>The six pilgrims are still alive, waiting to be sucked in.

original_en_text: A white lock bearing a surgical symbol.
original_zh_text: 带有外科标志的苍白锁具。
translated_text: 手術マークの付いた白い鍵。
secondary_translated_text: A white key with a surgical mark.

translated_text: 最も多くの織物を描いたシンボル。
secondary_translated_text: The symbols that depicted the most fabrics.

translated_text: パラグラフ図
secondary_translated_text: Paragraph chart

translated_text: Whisper Vaultマップ
secondary_translated_text: Whisper Vault Map

original_en_text: Their shells are ours. Their souls are ours.<br>Our hate is forever.
original_zh_text: 他们的躯壳是我们的，他们的灵魂是我们的。<br>我们的恨意永世不灭。
translated_text: 殻は私たちのものです彼らの魂は私たちのもの。<br>憎しみは永遠です。
secondary_translated_text: The shells are ours, and their souls are ours.<br>Hate is eternal.

original_en_text: Containment fails. Memory lost. Excise outer. Maintain inner.<br>Shellwood stasis sustained - Remember.<br>Marrowlands stasis critical - Remember.<br>Verdanian environment exceeded - Destined to forget.
original_zh_text: 封存溃败。记忆遗失。切除外区。维持内区。<br>甲木林封存稳定——须铭记。<br>髓骨地封存危急——须铭记。<br>翠庭生态失控——注定遗忘。
translated_text: 失敗を防ぐ。記憶の喪失。外側を外す。家の中にいろ<br>貝殻や樹木の停滞は続く。<br>重度の骨髄停止-覚えてください。<br>まばゆい環境を超えて-忘れられる運命にあります。
secondary_translated_text: Preventing failure. Loss of memory. Remove the outside. Stay inside the house.<br>The shell and tree stagnation continues.<br>Severe bone marrow arrest - remember.<br>Beyond the dazzling environment - doomed to be forgotten.

original_en_text: Here is established, by holy consent of the Conductors,<br>The Memorium of Pharloom.<br><br>What Is Remembered Is Never Lost.
original_zh_text: 经指挥家神圣授权，<br>于此建立纺络忆廊。<br><br>铭记者永存不灭。
translated_text: ここでは、ドライバーの神聖な同意を得て、<br>ファルーム記念館<br><br>覚えているものは決して失われない。
secondary_translated_text: Here, with the driver's sacred consent,<br>The Farroom Memorial<br><br>What we remember is never lost.

original_en_text: A rune depicting paths away from Pharloom.
original_zh_text: 描绘离开纺络通路的符文。
translated_text: ファウルから出る道を描いたルーン。
secondary_translated_text: Roon painted a way out of the foul.

translated_text: 壊れた道具の修理？
secondary_translated_text: repair broken tools?

translated_text: ドアの地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of the Door

original_en_text: Due to unacceptably high injury and unsanctioned deaths, Ventrica travel shall henceforth be denied to all.<br> For Pharloom eternal, a bug who serves must never die.
original_zh_text: 鉴于伤亡过甚并且非授命死亡，即日起禁止所有虫民使用圣脉枢管。<br>永恒纺络需要活着的仆从。
translated_text: 容認できないほど多くの負傷者と無許可の死亡者がいるため、マダガスカルへの渡航は拒否されます。<br>ファロにとって、永遠のサービスエラーは決して消えません。
secondary_translated_text: Travel to Madagascar will be refused because of the unacceptable number of injuries and unauthorized deaths.<br>For Faro, the perpetual service error will never go away.

translated_text: アトラの最弱地図
secondary_translated_text: The weakest map of Atlas

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>Spare a song for those who lay here silent.<br>By strength abandoned, they fell before the final ascent.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>为长眠于此的无声者歌一曲罢。<br>力竭而堕，未竟登攀。
translated_text: 巡礼者のこと<br>静かに横たわる人々のために歌を残しなさい。<br>彼らは力を失い、最後の登りをする前に倒れた。
secondary_translated_text: about the pilgrims.<br>Leave a song for those who lie down quietly.<br>They lost their strength and collapsed before they could make their final climb.

translated_text: Abyssマップ
secondary_translated_text: Abyss Map

original_en_text: <hpage>I understand now... The steel child’s servant grew bold...<hpage>I know what the fleeing bug seeks to call, and their etchings here suggest clear clues to where. <hpage>What they attempt is dangerous, stupid. It can only end badly. I must hurry if I’m to stop this.
original_zh_text: <hpage>我现在明白了……钢铁之子的手下越来越大胆……<hpage>也知道那只逃亡的虫子想召唤什么，这些刻痕明确指出了地点。<hpage>愚蠢又危险的做法，不会有好下场。得赶紧阻止。
translated_text: <hpage>今はわかった鋼鉄の少年の召使いは大胆になって。<hpage>逃げる虫が何と呼ぶのか分かっていますここでのエッチングは明確な手がかりを与えてくれます<hpage>彼らの試みは危険で愚かです。結果は悪いだけです。これを止めるなら、急がなければならない。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>Now I know the steel boy's servant has become bold.<hpage>We know what we call the fleeing bugs, and the etching here gives us a clear clue.<hpage>Their attempts are dangerous and stupid. The result is only bad. If you want to stop this, you have to hurry.

original_en_text: An old rune displaying the design for a Weaver weapon.
original_zh_text: 残破的织者武器设计图。
translated_text: 織機の武器のデザインを示す古代のルーン。
secondary_translated_text: An ancient run showing the design of a loom weapon.

translated_text: 深淵のルーンを描く。
secondary_translated_text: Draw the Rune of the Abyss.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, sat between salt and stone,<br>Build those tools of brilliant mind imagined,<br>Aid us when our Silk has waned.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，坐于盐石之间，<br>铸造智械奇器，<br>助我们于灵丝枯竭之时。
translated_text: シスター·スパイダーは塩と石の間に座る。<br>想像上の脳のためのツールを作るには<br>シルクが落ちたとき、助けてください。
secondary_translated_text: Sister Spider sits between salt and stone.<br>to create tools for an imaginary brain.<br>When the silk falls, please help.

original_en_text: An old stone gate with a simple keyhole.
original_zh_text: 带有简易锁孔的古石门。
translated_text: シンプルな鍵穴がある古い石門。
secondary_translated_text: An old stone gate with a simple keyhole.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, husk bound to branch,<br>Watch over these bugs, passing safe,<br>Warded by fear,<br>No longer your meal.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，缚枝之壳，<br>庇佑这些过客安然。<br>以恐惧为甲，<br>不再化作食粮。
translated_text: 姉妹、クモ、枝に縛られた貝殻、<br>これらのエラーに注意し、安全に通過し、<br>恐怖を抱いて、<br>それはもはやあなたの食べ物ではない。
secondary_translated_text: Sisters, spiders, shells tied to branches,<br>Be aware of these errors and pass them safely,<br>Embrace the fear,<br>It is no longer your food.

original_en_text: Bug born of Pharloom. You have been chosen.<br> May our Citadel’s holy gilding harden your soft shell.<page>Stand eternal as our arbiter, that no bug bearing sin shall ever step within our sacred halls.
original_zh_text: 纺络的虫民，你们已被选中，<br>愿圣堡的鎏金淬硬你们的软壳。<page>作为审判官永远伫立，使罪孽之徒永不得踏入圣殿。
translated_text: ファロで生まれた細菌です。あなたは選ばれた。<br>私たちの城の神聖な金メッキがあなたの柔らかい殻を硬化させますように。<page>私たちの仲裁人として、私たちは常に私たちの聖なる神殿に立ち、いかなる虫も罪もありません。
secondary_translated_text: It is a bacterium born in Faro. You have been chosen.<br>Let the sacred gold plating of our castle harden your soft shell.<page>As our arbitrators, we stand in our holy temple at all times, without any worm or sin.

original_en_text: I have departed to pay my respects at the graves within the great wood.<br>- Pinmaster Plinney
original_zh_text: 我去密林深处的墓园祭拜先灵<br>——针匠普林尼
translated_text: 森の中の墓を見に行きました。<br>- ピンマイスター·プリニウス
secondary_translated_text: I went to see the tomb in the forest.<br>- Pinmeister Prinius

translated_text: 地図はありますか。
secondary_translated_text: Do you have a map?

original_en_text: Penitent, First of the First.<br>Guilty of the sin of apostasy.<br>Penance by constriction.<br>Absolution denied.
original_zh_text: 罪人，第一组第一号。<br>犯背信之罪。<br>处以束刑。<br>永不赦免。
translated_text: 告白者、最初に。<br>不服従の罪。<br>限界を認識する。<br>恩赦は拒否される。
secondary_translated_text: The confessor, first.<br>The sin of disobedience.<br>Recognize the limitations.<br>The pardon is rejected.

original_en_text: Weaver, in eighth part, last of their line, frail with age.<br>Tracked and taken in Sandsea Waste.<br>Seven Choristors, nine Envoys lost to task.
original_zh_text: 第八代织者，末裔，年迈体衰。<br>于沙海荒原追捕擒获。<br>折损七名圣咏使徒，九名特使。
translated_text: 第8部では、ウィーバーは家族の最後の一員であり、年を取るにつれて体が弱くなっていく。<br>Sandy Creek Wildernessの撮影<br>七戒九使は使命に失敗した。
secondary_translated_text: In Part 8, Weaver is the last member of the family, and as he grows older, his body grows weaker.<br>Photo of Sandy Creek Wilderness<br>The Seven Commandments and Nine Envoys failed their mission.

translated_text: 磁鉄鉱の露頭。
secondary_translated_text: The outcrop of magnetite.

original_en_text: Cloth and materials that could be fashioned into additional pockets.
original_zh_text: 可缝制附加口袋的布料。
translated_text: 余分なポケットを作ることができる生地と素材。
secondary_translated_text: Fabrics and materials that can make extra pockets.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, husk bound to moss,<br>Watch over these bugs born low,<br>Raised up by fervour fostered,<br>Born and caught within our web unknowing.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，蛛族，缚苔之壳。<br>庇佑这些卑微生物。<br>养育于狂热之中，<br>生于罗网而不自知。
translated_text: 姉妹、蜘蛛、苔に縛られた貝殻、<br>この謙虚な昆虫に注目し、<br>情熱に成長し、<br>無意識のうちに生まれ、ネットワークに閉じ込められています。
secondary_translated_text: sisters, spiders, shells tied to moss,<br>Pay attention to this humble insect,<br>Growing with passion,<br>We are born unconsciously and trapped in a network.

original_en_text: Sister, spider, if seeking commune with the creature atop this mount, take the climb above as test, a challenge beyond even our setting.<page>Upon that summit gained, and creature hailed, know it shall choose what gift to grant, with death as likely as insight.
original_zh_text: 姊妹，若欲觐见此山巅之物，须攀登试炼之径，其险犹胜我等所设。<page>登顶谒见之时，须知其所赐或为顿悟，或为死期。
translated_text: シスター、クモ、この山の生き物とコミュニケーションを取りたければ、上の生き物を試してみてください。これは環境を超えた挑戦です。<page>それが頂点に達し、生き物が歓声を上げ、どんな贈り物を与えるかを知ると、死は洞察力と同じくらい可能になります。
secondary_translated_text: Sisters, spiders, if you want to communicate with this mountain creature, try the creature above. This is a challenge that goes beyond the environment.<page>When it reaches its peak, and the living creature cheers and knows what gifts to give, death becomes as possible as insight.

original_en_text: Hate for their light. Hate for their pins. For their waste poured thick and endless.<page>Fill your hearts with hate, for power has now been claimed, and with it we shall punish.
original_zh_text: 憎其光辉，恨其刺针。怒其秽流无尽<br>以恨意填膺，因权柄已夺，吾等将施以惩戒。
translated_text: 光が嫌い。Pinが大嫌い。彼らの糞は絶えず出てくる。<page>憎しみであなたの心を満たしなさい。権力は奪われ、私たちはそれを罰するからです。
secondary_translated_text: I hate the light. I hated the pin. Their shit comes out constantly.<page>Fill your heart with hatred. Because the power is taken away and we will punish it.

original_en_text: Here we honour the seed that sprung the wood. <page>By her grace may all bugs pass safe to join us and our song.
original_zh_text: 此地敬奉孕育森林的种子。<page>承其恩泽，万虫皆可安然穿行，共奏圣歌。
translated_text: ここでは、発芽した種に敬意を表します。<page>彼女の恵みに感謝し、すべてのバグが安全に戻ってきて、私たちと私たちの歌に加わりますように。
secondary_translated_text: Here, we pay homage to the seed that has sprouted.<page>Thank you for her grace and may all the bugs come back safely and join us and our songs.

translated_text: Rotten Pipesマップ
secondary_translated_text: Map of Rotten Pipes

translated_text: 火山岩の硬化露頭。
secondary_translated_text: A hardened outcrop of volcanic rock.

translated_text: ホワイトマップ。
secondary_translated_text: The white map.

original_en_text: Daughter of a distant land...<br>We who remained have waited long...<br>Bind our strength to yours...<br>Reclaim the future of our haunted kingdom...
original_zh_text: 远疆之女啊……<br>我们残存者久候……<br>愿以残力附汝身……<br>夺回这缠魂国度的未来……
translated_text: 遠い国の娘。<br>残っていた私たちは長い間待っていた。<br>私たちの力とあなたの力を結びつけなさい。<br>我々の幽霊王国の未来を夺还する。
secondary_translated_text: Daughter of a far country.<br>We who were left had waited a long time.<br>Join our strength with your strength.<br>Take back the future of our ghost kingdom.

original_en_text: If the haunted continue their work, leave them be! Only those who frustrate production shall be removed.
original_zh_text: 受丝咒侵蚀者若仍旧劳作，勿扰！唯怠工者当除。
translated_text: 幽霊が働き続けるなら、放してください!生産を妨げるものだけが排除されます。
secondary_translated_text: If the ghost continues to work, let it go! Only what hinders production will be eliminated.

original_en_text: An inert automaton with an empty chest.
original_zh_text: 胸腔空置的休眠自动机。
translated_text: 空の箱の中のアイドルオートマトン
secondary_translated_text: Idle automaton in an empty box

original_en_text: On the eighth harvest, send:<br>Fifty measures, nine beats dregthread, spooled,<br>Fourteen measures dregthread, twined,<br>Oath of fealty, all workers.<page>On the twelfth harvest, send:<br>Forty measures dregthread, spooled,<br>Two beats fine thread, twined,<br>Oath of fealty, all workers.<page>
original_zh_text: 第八次收成时运送：<br>五十节又九奏卷线渣，<br>十四节编线渣。<br>全体劳工需立忠誓。<page>第十二次收成时运送：<br>四十节卷线渣，<br>两奏精编丝线。<br>全体劳工需立忠誓。<page>
translated_text: 第八の収穫では、以下を送る。<br>50小節、9拍子のドレグスレッド<br>14の措置dregthread、tem、<br>従業員全員が忠誠を誓う。<page>第12回収穫期には、以下を送る。<br>40措置スレッド、リール、<br>2つの細い線、<br>従業員は全員忠誠を誓う。<page>
secondary_translated_text: In the eighth harvest, send the following:<br>Dregg threads in 50 bars, 9 tempo<br>14 measures, dregthread, tem,<br>Every employee is sworn to be loyal.<page>For the 12th harvest season, send the following:<br>40 Measures Thread, Reel,<br>Two thin lines,<br>Every employee pledges their loyalty.<page>

original_en_text: In the air. The water. Everywhere.<br>Inside their shells. Twisted inside. Guts.<page>Tightest around heart. Pulsing rhythm.<br>Sick. Alive. Dead?<br>Something worse.<page>Deeper. Must look deeper.
original_zh_text: 空气中，水流中，无处不在。<br>甲壳内，脏器间，扭曲盘踞。<page>紧缚心脏，搏动如歌。<br>病态，鲜活，死寂？<br>某种更糟的存在。<page>需深究……再深究……
translated_text: 空気中は水が至る所にある<br>殻の中で。内側は歪んでいる。勇気、勇気。<page>心臓の周りにティファナがある。脈動するリズム。<br>病気なのか死んだのか。<br>もっと悪いことに<page>詳細な研究が必要です。
secondary_translated_text: in the air, there's water everywhere.<br>Inside the shell. The inside is distorted. Courage, courage.<page>There is a tiffana around the heart. The pulsating rhythm.<br>Is he sick or dead?<br>and worse.<page>Detailed research is required.

original_en_text: A bucket overflowing with smouldering Flintstone.
translated_text: フリント原始人のバケツ
secondary_translated_text: Flint Primitive Bucket

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>This settlement welcomes all who step the holy path.<br>May you ease your shell within, that your strength renewed can carry you higher.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>此镇欢迎任何踏入圣途者。<br>愿您在此养精蓄锐，登攀更高处。
translated_text: 巡礼者のこと<br>神の道を歩むすべての人を歓迎します。<br>あなたの心をリラックスさせ、あなたの新しい力があなたをより高く導きますように。
secondary_translated_text: about the pilgrims.<br>We welcome all who walk in God's path.<br>Let your mind relax and may your new power lead you higher.

original_en_text: Weaver of Pharloom.<br>By grace you warded. By thread you healed.<br>For your favour, eternal, we offer our song.
original_zh_text: 纺络的织者啊<br>您以恩赐庇护，以丝线疗愈。我们献永恒之歌，报答您的垂青。
translated_text: ファロのウィーバー。<br>神はあなたを祝福し、あなたは癒されます。<br>あなたの愛と永遠のために、私たちは歌を捧げます。
secondary_translated_text: Weaver of the Faro.<br>God bless you, and you will be healed.<br>For your love and eternity, we dedicate a song.

translated_text: キットを拡張する？
secondary_translated_text: Expand the kit?

original_en_text: A crude map of the Underworks.
translated_text: 地下作業の地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of Underground Work

translated_text: 古代のチューニングメカニズムです。
secondary_translated_text: It is an ancient tuning mechanism.

original_en_text: O, great land whose flame doth falter!<br>Whose choir, conductors, all doth fail,<page>Observe! Take heart! That spark still burning,<br>Yon butterfly of crimson grace,<page>All bells shall peal, and voices raise,<br>When brave Trobbio steps, at last, upon the stage!
original_zh_text: 啊，辽阔疆土，其焰渐熄！<br>圣咏团与指挥皆已倾颓。<page>且看！且振作！星火犹存——<br>那优雅的绯红蝶影，<page>万钟齐鸣，众声高亢。<br>待勇者特罗比奥终登台！
translated_text: おお、大いなる大地よ、その炎は震える。<br>合唱団や指揮者が失敗し、<page>見て!元気を出せ!火花はまだ燃えている。<br>深紅色の優雅な蝶<page>すべての鐘が鳴り、すべての音が鳴る。<br>勇敢なトロビオがついに舞台に立つとき!
secondary_translated_text: O great earth, its flame trembles!<br>The choir and the conductor failed,<page>Look at me! Get your hands on me! The sparks are still burning.<br>Elegant butterflies of deep red<page>Every bell rings, every sound rings.<br>When the brave Tróbio finally takes the stage!

original_en_text: Erase our fear,<br>Eliminate our desire,<page>To suffer no more,<br>Void, cleanse us.
original_zh_text: 抹除恐惧，<br>涤净欲念，<page>苦难终止，<br>虚空啊，净化吾等。
translated_text: 恐怖が増大し、<br>私たちの欲望を取り除き、<page>苦しみをやめ、<br>空虚は浄化する。
secondary_translated_text: The fear increases,<br>To remove our desires,<page>stop suffering,<br>Emptiness is cleansing.

original_en_text: I have departed to scale Pharloom’s frigid mount. If any bug exists brave enough to match my pin’s fatal resolve, then climb and face me upon its stormward side.<br>- Pinstress
original_zh_text: 我将攀登纺络寒峰。若有虫愿意成全遗志，持针之决意者，请至风暴面峰顶相会。<br>——针姬
translated_text: 私はファロの寒い山に登り始めましたもし私の致命的な決意に果敢にマッチするバグがあれば、嵐の側に登って私と対峙してください。<br>- プリンセス·プリンセス
secondary_translated_text: I began to climb the cold mountains of the Faro If there is a bug that will boldly match my fatal resolve, climb the side of the storm and confront me.<br>- Princess, Princess

original_en_text: Flickering Flame<br>Five masks swirled soul, brought and broiled.<br>Four stones rage-baked, crushed powder coarse.<page>Three shells fresh from pilgrims fallen, to contain and age.
original_zh_text: 摇曳焰方<br>五具旋魂面甲，炙烤研磨。<br>四枚怒火焙石，碾作粗粉。<page>三副朝圣鲜壳，用以封存陈化。
translated_text: フラッシュ·ファイア<br>5つの仮面は魂を回転させ、持参し、焼く。<br>4つの石を焼き、粗い粉を砕く。<page>ピルグリムの手から落ちたばかりの3発の砲弾は封印され老朽化していた。
secondary_translated_text: Flash fire<br>The five masks rotate, carry, and burn the soul.<br>Burn the four stones and crush the coarse powder.<page>The three shells, which had just fallen from the hands of the Pilgrims, were sealed and decayed.

original_en_text: Weaver, in eighth part, last of their line, mortally wounded.<br>Tracked and taken in the Blackbarrens.<br>Four Choristors, one Reed lost to task.
original_zh_text: 第八代织者，末裔，重伤濒死。<br>于黑荒原追捕擒获。<br>折损四名圣咏者，一名战士。
translated_text: ウィーバーは第8回で最下位に終わり、致命傷を負った。<br>黒い沼で撮影して撮影。<br>リードを含む4人の指揮官が任務中に死亡した。
secondary_translated_text: Weaver finished bottom in the eighth round and was fatally injured.<br>Photographed in a black swamp.<br>Four commanders, including Reid, were killed in the line of duty.

original_en_text: A machine displaying a model of the Citadel.
original_zh_text: 展示圣堡结构的机械模型。
translated_text: 城の模型を展示する機械。
secondary_translated_text: Machines to display models of castles.

original_en_text: <hpage>The second spot marked by the child of steel. This camp too was used by their vassal, and another rite was conducted here, this one incomplete. <hpage>The action was clearly taken in haste. Did they believe themself pursued? The etchings here are crude, but the words are disturbing... and desperate.
original_zh_text: <hpage>钢铁之子标记的第二处地点。他们的仆从也在这里进行过仪式，但没完成。<hpage>行动如此匆忙，难道是怕被追杀？刻的字歪歪扭扭，内容让人不安……且绝望。
translated_text: <hpage>2番目の場所は鋼鉄の息子。家臣たちもこのキャンプを利用し、別の儀式が行われたが、今回は完全ではなかった。<hpage>この行動は明らかに性急だった。追われていると思いますか？ここのエッチングは粗いが、は不安でそして的である。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>The second place is the son of steel. Vassals also used the camp, and another ceremony was held, but this time it was not complete.<hpage>This action was clearly impetuous. do you think they're being chased? The etching here is rough, but is uneasy and is.

original_en_text: Cloth and incendiary materials that could be fashioned into an explosive weapon.
original_zh_text: 可制成爆燃武器的布料与易燃物。
translated_text: 爆発兵器にすることができる布と焼夷弾。
secondary_translated_text: Clothes and incendiary bombs that can be used as explosive weapons.

original_en_text: Shellplates and cogs that could be fashioned into a flying automaton.
original_zh_text: 可组装飞行自动机的壳板与齿轮。
translated_text: 薬莢とギアは飛行ロボットにすることができる。
secondary_translated_text: Drugs and gear can be used to make a flying robot.

original_en_text: In silence your voice,<br>In darkness your form,<page>We higher who see you seeking,<br>Our shells yearn for your embrace.
original_zh_text: 静默即汝声，<br>晦暗即汝形。<page>吾等高瞻汝之追寻，<br>甲壳渴求汝之怀抱。
translated_text: 静かに心の中で、<br>暗闇の中で、あなたの形は、<page>背の高い人が見ているのを見て、<br>あなたの抱擁に飢えている。
secondary_translated_text: Quietly in my heart,<br>In the darkness, your form,<page>When you see a tall man looking at you,<br>I am hungry for your embrace.

original_en_text: -ilgrim<br>You who have held tight to faith have been carried far.<br>This station shall offer brief rest to those devout.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>虔信之虫方能抵达此远境。<br>此站给予诚心者片刻安歇。
translated_text: - イグリン<br>あなたがたの中で信仰に忠実な者は連れ去られた。<br>駅は敬虔な人々のための短い休憩を提供します。
secondary_translated_text: - Inglin.<br>Those among you who are faithful to the faith have been taken away.<br>The station provides a short break for the godly people.

original_en_text: Half-spawn of a distant land...<br>Within this cage I have waited...<br>Let my strength be bound to yours...<br>Reclaim the future of our accursed kingdom...
original_zh_text: 异乡的半血之子啊……<br>我在此笼中久候……<br>愿以残力附汝身……<br>夺回这诅咒国度的未来……
translated_text: 半分は遠い国の子孫です。<br>この檻の中で待っていた。<br>わたしの力とあなたの力を合わせ、<br>我々の呪われた王国の未来を夺还する。
secondary_translated_text: Half are descendants of distant countries.<br>I waited in this cage.<br>With my strength and your strength,<br>To reclaim the future of our cursed kingdom.

original_en_text: Child, I have answered the call to climb. I rise to join our elders in that holy place far above. May you, in time, grow strong enough to meet us there.
original_zh_text: 孩子，我已应召攀登，将赴上方圣地与前辈们相聚。愿你成长强健，来日同聚。
translated_text: 私は登山の呼びかけに答えました。私は立ち上がり、長老たちと遠くの聖地に行きました。皆さんも強くなって参加してください。
secondary_translated_text: I answered the call to climb the mountain. I got up and went to a distant sanctuary with the elders. Please all of you get stronger and join us.

original_en_text: An old map of the Putrified Ducts.
translated_text: 腐ったパイプの古い地図です
secondary_translated_text: old map of rotten pipes.

original_en_text: This low, her gaze escaped.<br>Prepare, sisters. Weave hope anew.<br>That we might break free this accursed web born of our naive foundation.
original_zh_text: 此处卑微隐秘，逃出她的视线。<br>准备吧，姊妹。重织希望。撕破这由我等天真所结的诅咒之网。
translated_text: それはあまりにも低く、彼女の目は滑った。<br>準備をして、姉妹たち。希望の再編成。<br>無邪気な基盤から生まれた呪われたネットワークから抜け出すことができます。
secondary_translated_text: It was too low, and her eyes slipped.<br>Get ready, sisters. Reorganization of hope.<br>You can get out of the cursed network that was born out of an innocent foundation.

original_en_text: An ornate door closed with a simple lock.
translated_text: 豪華なドアはシンプルなロックで閉じられています。
secondary_translated_text: The sumptuous door is closed with a simple lock.

translated_text: Cogwork Heartとは？
secondary_translated_text: What is CogWork Heart?

original_en_text: Pilgrim<br>Accept the judgment of the rise beyond,<br>That all who stand at Pharloom’s holy crest prove pure of will and want.
original_zh_text: 朝圣者<br>接受至高审判的洗礼。<br>凡欲立于纺络之巅者，当证心志纯净。
translated_text: 巡礼者のこと<br>上昇を超えた判断を受け入れる。<br>ファウルの王冠の上に立つすべての者は、純粋な意志と欲望を表しています。
secondary_translated_text: about the pilgrims.<br>Accept judgments that go beyond the rise.<br>Everyone who stands on the crown of foul represents a pure will and desire.

translated_text: 地図はありますか。
secondary_translated_text: Do you have a map?

original_en_text: Two children born entwined, apart,<br>Two children marked to rule,<page>They danced, they sang, proved blades beyond,<br>But none forgot their birth,<br>For lovers born on beat exact shall be forever cursed.
original_zh_text: 双子缠绕共生，命运连结，<br>双子共掌权柄，注定称王，<page>舞若惊鸿，歌撼四座，剑技超群，<br>但出身不可磨灭，<br>同卵双生之爱侣，诅咒永世缠身。
translated_text: 2人の子供は生まれた時につながっていて、<br>二人の子供が判決を受け、<page>彼らは踊り、歌い、ブレードが超えていることを証明する。<br>誰も自分の誕生を忘れない。<br>リズムで生まれた恋人にとって、正確さは常に呪われています。
secondary_translated_text: The two children are connected when they are born.<br>The two children were sentenced,<page>They dance, they sing, they prove that the blade is beyond.<br>No one ever forgets his birth.<br>For lovers born in rhythm, accuracy is always cursed.

translated_text: 記念館の地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of the Memorial

original_en_text: Great bugs! You who weep as your kingdom fades,<br>join me upon the Stage.<br> Together, we shall enflame the passion of Pharloom!
original_zh_text: 伟大的虫民！为王国衰颓而泣者。<br>请至剧台与我相会。<br>共燃纺络之激情！
translated_text: 大きな間違いだ!あなたの王国は衰え、あなたは泣く。<br>私と一緒にステージへ。<br>一緒にファロの情熱を燃やしましょう!
secondary_translated_text: Big mistake! Your kingdom is declining, and you will weep.<br>Come to the stage with me.<br>Let's ignite the passion of Faro together!

translated_text: Cradleマップ
secondary_translated_text: Cradle map

original_en_text: <hpage>This location was marked by the steel child. This camp is old, but still shows clear evidence of an attempt at a rite.<hpage>Whatever the vassal hoped to achieve here seems to have failed. The other marked locations may provide more clues to its intent.
original_zh_text: <hpage>这是钢铁之子标记的地点。营地虽然老旧，但明显有试图举行仪式的痕迹。<hpage>无论仆从想做什么，似乎是失败了。其他标记点或许会有更多线索。
translated_text: <hpage>この場所は鋼鉄の少年によってマークされた。収容所は古いが、儀式を行おうとした明確な証拠が残っている。<hpage>家臣がここで望んだことはすべて失敗したようだ。他のマーカーの位置は、その意図に関するより多くの手がかりを提供するかもしれません。
secondary_translated_text: <hpage>This place was marked by the Boy of Steel. The camp is old, but there remains clear evidence of attempts to perform rituals.<hpage>Everything that the vassals hoped for here seems to have failed. The location of other markers may provide more clues as to its intent.

original_en_text: Weaver, in quarter part, last of their line, staked to service.<br>Tracked and taken beneath the City of Steel.<br>Eight Choristors, twelve Envoys lost to task.
original_zh_text: 第四代织者，末裔，强制服役。<br>于钢铁之城地下追捕擒获。<br>折损八名圣咏使徒，十二名特使。
translated_text: ウィーバーは4分の1セクション（彼らの最後の行）で奉仕します。<br>鉄の街の下で撮影してください。<br>八環十二使が使命に失敗した。
secondary_translated_text: Weaver serves in a quarter section (their last line).<br>Take a photo under the Iron City.<br>The eight-ring twelve messengers failed in their mission.

translated_text: Cogworkコアマップ
secondary_translated_text: CogworkCoreMap

original_en_text: By our Citadel’s glory, you treasured devout may bask brief in its holy light.
original_zh_text: 沐浴圣堡荣光，虔信者可暂享圣辉。
translated_text: 私たちの城の栄光によって、あなたの大切な敬虔な人々は、その聖なる光を浴びることができます。
secondary_translated_text: By the glory of our precious castle, your godly people can be bathed in its holy light.

translated_text: 合唱室の地図
secondary_translated_text: Map of the choir room

original_en_text: A husk with a map of the Slab etched upon its shell.
original_zh_text: 一具甲壳刻有罪石牢狱地图的尸骸
translated_text: 貝殻に石の地図が刻まれた貝殻。
secondary_translated_text: A shell with a stone map engraved on it.
